There are numerous locations that you have no reason to visit because no missions take you there and there's no activities or anything to do.Flying is trash because even with a skill level of 100 you're constantly being hit with absurd and unreal amounts of turbulence.The sheer amount of waves everywhere means you'll be in the air half the time while using any watercraft which makes it a to control.FPS mode is a blast but the pathetic FOV slider makes driving in FPS an absolute pain.Your characters change clothes and their hair styles if you don't switch back to them constantly which makes customization a pain. Your clothing inventory does not allow you to save an outfit you've mixed and matched so every time a character decides to change their clothes you have to go back home and put on your preferred clothing again. Often you'll find your character has thrown on some sunglasses which dims everything if you're in FPS mode and can't be disabled until you go home and remove the glasses.Controls are restrictive if using a controller as all the profiles are pretty much the same and not very customizable.There is some fun to be had but factoring in major launch issues control issues stability issues and everything else I just can't recommend it until the price drops and they fix the damn game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: First of all let me say that GTA V is one heck of a port on PC.It makes GTA IV look like garbage atleast for what it was during the first few days during launch.Secondly I'd like to point out that the PC version of GTA V is most definitly a considerably huge upgrade over the Xbox one/ PS4 version. The story is quite excellent actually some people might say GTA IV story was better. Which might be the case but I personally think GTA V has a pretty good story by itself. The ability to switch between the 3 characters in game is pretty sweet. I personally hope they might consdier building upon this for future games but we'll see. Gorgeous open world you can see they put quite some extra work into the PC version it was worth every penny to me. Unless you're a heavy completionist reloading save after save to get every nick and dime out of the first playthrough this game will offer countless hours of replay value.One of the things that I though personally could've been done better was You can literally go through the entire game without upgrading anything at all. It felt like it was kind of obsolete even bothering upgrading the weapons or cars at all. Some of the side missions started to feel a bit generic after a while while it took a heck of a time before that happened it could use some work as well.I'd personally give the game a 9 / 10 and it's a must buy for any GTA fan out there.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is an absolutely fun game where unlike the previous Grand Theft Auto games everything about it screams of satirical elements. Out of the three (not counting MP) characters you can play Franklin an ex gangbanger and Michael a heister who faked his own death want out of their previous lives yet keep getting sucked back into them one way or another. The third one Trevor is a psychopath through and through and wants to free one of his and Michael's former crewmates from prison as well as run an industry based on illegal weapons and other substances.It's been a while since I last played the story though so let's focus on the better half of the game.Online.The biggest differences between SP and MP besides the obvious multiplayer element are as follows 1) In single player when you shoot the legs of an enemy they lay on the ground shooting you if you don't finish them off. In multiplayer they decide to say f*** bullet wounds that would normally cripple me I'm getting back up and running for cover.2) Multiplayer has the ability to buy your own properties.3) The not so obvious repercussions with a moddable game and multiplayer Script kiddies. Some of them present interesting challenges such as filling a downtown street with UFOs and a legion of rocket slinging Lesters others will ruin servers and oftentimes the game itself for everyone playing with them. As it seems so far Rockstar has been doing nothing to cull this issue as of yet ever since they rescinded their modding ban and it has gotten out of control.Other than those differences here's pro cons. Everyone likes those.PROS +Great graphics*+Benchmark tests+Shooting and hitboxes work well together+Bipolar community+Driving works great+Wanted system works great+Balance between pay to win and effort to win online.*With one small issueCONS Graphics are built for 4K resolutions anything smaller will randomly see odd shapes on surfaces every so often like Michael's house's doorway. GTA Online has an aforementioned "hacker" problem Bipolar communityUNDECIDED/EQUAL Very strange TV shows in game. Most radio stations are rap or some sort of techno/dubstep stations. There's 1 rock station 1 pop and 1 country. The rest is rap or techno/dubstep. REDICULOUSLY stupid NPCs. I can't tell you how many times I've fired a gun and seen civilians run into freaking out high speed roads like dodos of a cliff... And not to mention driving NPCs are even more of a pain especially if traffic is enabled during a race. These sheeple doo make fun memories though.All in all it is a great game but with a few minor issues.And to all of the bad reviews based on a raise in price for a sale The game itself is not on sale but the bundles are for the price of the game. GTAV is a big game that recently came out for PC you will not get your 25 50% off on it. You're all lucky that it is on sale the way it is.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Good game poor end game. Play through the storyline of this game and leave it at that. It's a great game and lots of fun to play. I really enjoyed the storyline. The big point on this game was really the multiplayer. Long awaited and asked for by millions for many years. We finally got what we wanted too bad it wasn't done right. Yes you can do multiplayer and have a ton of fun if you do a private game with a friend but I recommend staying off the public servers with a lot of people. No I'm not salty because my super expensive car got destroyed that's a part of the game. I did find it rather annoying that if you attack another player in the game you are charge a lot of money for it. You can assign bounties but the player that collects the bounty is charged for having killed the player with the bounty and usually charged and insane amount for insurance for having blown up their vehicle in the process. It's a flawed system that forces you to run usually boring missions to grind for cash just to have fun in PVP around San Andres. Remove the fines for doing PVP and it would be great fun.I'm not going to recommend this game simply because the big feature of the game the multiplayer isn't all that good. If you really enjoyed playing the other games then get this just for the single player mode alone. Was good fun.

review: Offline game is very very good.Online is ing Terrible. Typical Online session 5 6 minutes to get into the game from the desktop 60 seconds of wandering around trying to find something interesting to do then while you're looking at your phone some high ranked driving a custom Pagani murders you in a drive by and taunts in the chat. Respawn in the same area and get killed by the same before you can get off the street. Repeat until rage quit.If you do actually get into some activity the load times are awful. I just spent 30 minutes in the game only 7 of which were actually playing! 7 damn minutes! There are 3 or 4 different screens to go through before starting each race event or job each of which has to load in and then you have to wait for everyone to ready up at EACH screen. Even quitting a race or job takes forever because you basically can't. You are stuck in the activity until its finished then you have to select 'return to free mode' and then wait AGAIN for everyone else to decide what they're going to do. ARGHHHHHHH!By all means play the single player. It is very good. Just set your expectations VERY low for the online.

review: This is a very good game overall the graphics are absolutely stunning the little details are everywhere and the gameplay and story mode are both amazing. The first person mode adds even more in depth gameplay to it. The only problem with this is the abundance of hackers in gta online. they spawn in people on your back they can give you free money which seems like a good thing but it can get you banned so if you see it dont take it. The mods made by the community are good as well look around on the internet for some of those. I have transferred my account over from xbox and it is very simple to do if you have played this on console. you just have to do the prologue. It has violence and vulgar language etc in it but if i had to give this a rating i would give it a 8/10. the only negatives are hackers and the language and violence. But if you are 17 or older there is nothing wrong with those two things well there shouldnt be. Must Buy game 8/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It's vast wide and fun. Variety of activities Fun missions sometimes challenging to the point of actually wanting to retry instead of just going "I wish they havn't put this mission in the game". The main characters are unique wonderful voice acting. Gameplay is great both in terms of combat and driving (although some times vehicles feel like bouncy slippery hot boiled eggs on wheels) and it just feels great to do anything and that's without even going online once which I am sure will deliver as well.At the time of writing this review I am using a computer below minimum requirements and magically I can run this game on steady framerate unlike some other games that have much lower requirements and can barely run (*cough* STARGORGE *cough*).Verdict Buy.

review: Grand Theft Auto Online is an impressively fun experience and a great time filler. With so many activities to choose from it's hard to ever feel like you don't have something to work towards. Free roam with friends can be just as fun as playing missions gained via cell phone calls death match modes found in various areas of the map or custom user created race tracks throughout the world. There's an impressive amount of customization options for your character vehicles and apartments. With regular updates Rockstar is doing a great job of keeping the Online portion active and evolving not to mention the impressive video editor helpful for YouTube creators. With or without friends this is definitely an experience you have to try.

review: Pros Graphics Gameplay mechanics Lots of little things to doCons Story line is weak. Basicly if you have watched any great crime movie or tv show then this game won't surprise you. Characters are boring and nonmemorable (depends on your tastes). Remember CJ? OG Loc? Big Smoke? Tenpenny? Now those were memorable characters. I could not connect or sympathize to any of the main or side characters at all. It just felt like watchin a freakin soap opera of WHO GIVES A . Heists (main focus of the game) are boring and unsatisfying but this just depends on your personal tastes. I had more fun recruiting gang members and doing drive bys in SA. Overall this game was disappoiting. Maybe my expectations were too high maybe I'm still hung up on the nostalgic greatness of San Andreas maybe I expected this to be better than SA but whatever the reason...this game aint for me. You might like it though

review: GTA V the day i learnt a lesson. GTA V is a good game.Has a decent but not a great story.Singeplayer is very fun although online isn't as fun as it seems.The crappy money block is terrible.I literally can't even go do a decent heist without an 11 year old saying that i am the noob or give me all the money or im leaving the heist.Pathetic.Once i even asked a person if he knows how to do a mission.No response.Ends up failing miserably and leaves heist.And then matchmaking doesn't get you any players at all.So you are left with the missions that give you small amounts of cash.Which gives barely any money.Like the store you rob gives u 2k right?And when i went to the hat shop i saw that one of the hats costed 25K.WTF.IS THIS SOME SORT OF JOKE??!?!?!?! And there are those annoying hackers.I confront one and he starts killing me all the time.Im speechless.

review: Having put 150 hours into the 360 version of this game I can say this is a vast improvement. Not only visually but in the playstyle as well. I see that a lot of people are having issues with the game and all I can say is that I haven't had any issues and I'm running on 8 gb of RAM and a 750 TI 2GB SC. Getting a solid 60 frames on some mid range settings. The technical issues are a big problem but will surely be fixed within a week of release. Rockstar isn't known for their stelar releases but they usually fix them pretty quick. To those coming from console versions you will notice better graphics provided you have a capable PC. To those who have never played the game oh boy are you in for a treat with this one. This is simply a game you must own regardless on what platform you play it on. The constant online updates that the devs give adds a nice flare to an already mouthwatering and addictive multiplayer. I give this a 9/10 only off by 1 point because of current technical issues.

review: I love GTA. I've played through almost all of them since 3 and gone back to play them again in most cases. V was a breath of fresh air after the grittiness and focus on story over mechanics from IV. Having 3 characters work together through the campaign keeps things interesting and makes for a varied experience as you play through. I think most people think of themselves as a Michael but in reality play like Trevor. Trevor is the epitome of the GTA type player. He says what he thinks he'll kill you for looking at him funny and he has no moral bones in his entire body.The online is great for passing time. You can log in and actually earn some money doing races/missions/heists. Or you can just drive around stealing cars and shooting at people. The one warning I'd give for anyone playing this game. Don't waste your money on the shark cards. Yes it'll get you into end game online content instantly without the grind. But there are so many hackers in this game it's always a 50/50 risk when you log in online you might get blown up from across the map banned or repeatedly shot and blown up for no reason whatsoever. It doesn't take away from the fun of playing GTA. But it does make you regret spending real cash.Also the load time for online is ridiculous. Sometimes you'll sit there for 5 10 min before even getting in game. Once you do though... I've probably spent 20 hours just trying to break into the secret military base and steal a Jet. Something that is infinitely easier once you can buy a hangar for your smuggling operations in the base. But it's still a great feeling to break into the base steal a jet and fly around shooting things and launching missiles. This game could have been even better but it's still pretty amazingly fun.

review: Having external accounts to link is a pain in the and should not be approved by steam. Story wise game seems interesting. Scripted events make your life harder instead of easier is pretty stupid. There are memorable worth while story missions that will certainly make you smile but theyre not without their glitches and prepare for tons of stupid to kill you.Single player good but has its glitches had some crashing issues too. Its a very beautiful game landscape wise combat is a bit lack luster as it is mostly hide behind something peak out kill a guy hide again rinse until all are dead. They did go a good job on some missions with limited guards and very hand holding linear kill this guy now move sort of play. Like any GTA most people I think play for the story and this one so far has made me smile and was pretty good. For 60 dollars the game is far better than most of the crap out there.Multiplayer is total aids gta online is absolutely worthless and stupid. Loading screens are up more than the game. Its awful single player is worth it but sadly gta online was a flop. Used to be great but now not so much.Crashes I have had numerous random crashes usually during loads one of which green screened me and forced a hard restart. It might be bugs not really sure whats causing all of the weird things but beyond these unusual crashes/freezes the game seems pretty well optimized.

review: Im going to be very clear because i dont want to lie to myself. I have never once bought a gta game with the intent of playing the story. I know crazy right?The thing about gta back in the day was that it had a special unique style of gameplay with an openworld that was truley a sandbox. My favorite gta is GTAIV. The city felt alive and the amount of interaction the player had with the world was some of my most cherished and well regaurded moments of my gaming history........AND THIS GAME THREW IT ALL OUT THE ING WINDOW!Gtav does not deserve the title of "sandbox game." More like bare bones by the books nonsense that has been done better by other companys and previous installments. Like seriously what the hell happend? If you compare the sandbox openworld content of gta4 and 5 you reveal how pityful and laughable 5 is. Npcs have 2 personallitys traits run away and fight back. The cops are completly stupid in how they persue and engage the target gunplay is arguably worse and the reactions to being shot are non existant. The parkour system was taking out so for all i care the city could be as beautiful as it wants but it adds nothing to gameplay. Gta4's new york felt like a real place with places and setpieces that added to gameplay. In gtav it all seems unnesasary and forced. The subway was a part of new york that had people and cops but everyplace underground in los santos makes the cops scratch their damn heads. There is nothing to do! any semblence of a interesting locations are reserved for the singeplayer and almost all the buildings are completly unaccesable in multiplayer.Ok so we established the open world in general is vastly inferior to gta4 right?So what about the multiplayer? they advertised it as the best fuggin thing ever made. it will blow your socks off.... no... its stupid.... I firmly believe there is nothing redeeming about gta online besides the fact you can play with friends.If you enjoy pvp gamemodes and lackluster racing that is better in other titles try the multiplayer!If you are one of those loser kids that gets beaten by dad so the only way to get revenge on the world is by killing random players WITH XP LOCKED AND MONEY LOCKED GUNS. play the multiplayer!IF YOU WANA BUY A IN IN GAME VEHICLE THAT WITH MICROTRANSACTIONS COSTS MORE THAN THE ING GAME HOLY GUACOMOLY YOU GOT URSELF A DEAL LADIES AND GENTS. NOT TO MENTION THE CONTENT THEY PUMP OUT FOR MULTIPLAYER IS JUST CARS AND FREE MODE PVP AND THE FREE MODE GETS WORSE WITH EACH UPDATE I DONT KNOW WHAT TO SAY.This game is just sickening to think about how the mighty have fallen to such lows.....................but hey i heard the singeplayer story is good so theres that

review: Before i get to anything....To all the negative reviewers saying that modding the game gets you banned. Let me just say Rockstar IS NOT responsible for all the bad luck that has been thrown on you for Installing mods. Mods means modifying the game. Which also means the game is no longer vanilla. You have changed the coding of the game. This is why you should wait before installing any mods early in the game. all games are meant to be played the way it is even with its own cheats implemented in the game. not add new ones which would possibly break the game. Now that i made myself clear back to the Positive review of this game*not that good of a reviewer btw just a disclaimer* c Grand Theft Auto V Single player is just amazing. PC Capabilities of holding these massive graphics made the game so beautiful. The 3 characters each with their own unique traits and backstories brings you closer to wanting to know the character. Especially Franklin because ****spoiler alert*** he will be the one that makes the final decision. And finally. the Heist Missions in the game are so well done. The performance the crew does depends on the person you hire for the job. Whether he is good or not will impact the heist.GTA Online.Been Playing online for a bit. and tbh there are its quirkyness in here. For example when you try to join a job and it dosent let you Getting out of the job takes a very long time. This is pretty painful for us because apparently when a "session is full" you will have to go to another session to play something else and not the session you are playing in now.the Heists in GTAO are very well done still. Requiring full teamwork with your friends with each of them set with their own role in the heist. Customization is much better than Last Gen and you are able to fine tune your characters more. Even tho you still have to choose your heritage. Customization for females however. Certain hats seem like that they are too big to fit on the females head and looks like its floating instead. Hopefully Rockstar will retweak this.Well i try to do the best i can to get you guys to buy this game. Tho if you want to mod the game i wouldnt recommend doing that so early.

review: So i've only played 20 hours on pc since I bought this but I had GTAV twice on PS4 and put quite a few hours in.I'll play the single player mode again soon this single player is probably the best offline campaign of any game i've played. Variety of characters great story line just a lot of fun!Online. I don't understand why everyone thinks its P2W everyone wants the game to be easy and for them to get all the perks and all the additional vehicles and such from minimum game time.If it was this easy then every player would have everything and it would be absolute madness nothing would be special. It should be an achievement if you manage to save up enough money for something mad saying this i've only put in 20 hours on this version but have earnt &gt GTA$ 700 000 half my time has been spent roaming around too. (I have played a lot of bunker series which is 2x $ &amp XP though to be fair)The developers have been constantly updating this game with free DLC since it has been released no other game does this! Each dlc has brought so much extra to the game.In regards to hackers I havn't run into one yet so this every single server has a hacker bs is a lie peeps are just butthurt. I'm sure i'll be annoyed when it happens but EVERY SINGLE GAME HAS HACKERS.The ammount of negative reviews on steam just because of hackers is ing ridiculous cheats and hacks evolve all the time to avoid anti cheat. It's going to happen!11/10 would battle axe granny again.

review: It's a pretty good Single Player experience but Online play is an utter disappointment and the primary reason I won't be buying RDR2. The microtransactions are virtually mandatory unless you're willing to hack or grind for hundreds of hours. Finding a solid group to do heists with is virtually impossible. The PVP is the biggest joke I've ever seen I don't know anyone who has ever had an enjoyable experience playing it. The racing is KINDA fun but it's often ruined by lag and connection issues.Rockstar really just went full moneygrub on this one they realized they could charge for in game currency so they took advantage of it as much as possible. The amount of money required to buy in game vehicles is comical. For a regular person not willing to spend money on this dumb garbage I'd honestly recommend just hacking. You're probably not going to get caught unless you're blatant and you'll save yourself hundreds of hours of grinding. In exchange you'll probably only have fun for about 10 20 hours with your newfound wealth which just shows you how it wasn't worth it at all.

review: These days people blame EA for lootboxes and microtransactions on the other hand GTA is a pinnacle of it!. Aside from what the game actually is (which is truly awesome including both single and multiplayer) the huge cost of buying equipment and business is the ultimate downside of this game. Unfortunately the cost of shark cards is more than double the cost of entire game right now which is quite embarassing tbh. Rockstar could have been manage this by significantly reducing the price of old dlc items so that the newcomers and regular players could get some benefit out of it but that never seem to happen.Even if you are considering to buy it right now you may get it at the discounted price but do keep this in your mind that GTA online is gonna take a lot of grinding.PS I wont be bias towards the game because of microtransactions.There is still a lot in this game which you could play and enjoy without even buying every single dlc item.

review: GTA V Pretty fantastic story got great actors here and a royal mix of action and humour. It's worth playing but don't really see the need for a replay.GTA Online There's a significent hacker/cheater presence I've been robbed from all my in game money once due to a hacker emptying my in game bank account. No idea how this process works but there it is. Also GTA Online does update regulary with new content but the problem is that everytime something new comes the old doesn't become better so in the end you have a lot of small extensions instead of a few large pieces of content. They could just choose to expand on what they have for instance the CEO business and lately the Doomsday Heist update why can't it simply be an extension of the Bunker? Or the casino and real estate updates that may happen in the future be an extension of the Executives and Other Criminals? It makes sense to me to go to my office and do administration and the regular odd job to keep business flowing.Well if you wanna have fun in GTA Online play with at least one friend not with random players. Because most fun content are for 2+ players. Often the content is too difficult for random players and they keep messing up the mission with futile attempts. But for all the bad points GTA Online has some good points too and is semi soloable for those who just want to play in the GTA V world with Online content but not be disturbed by random players or hackers. With some firewall settings you can prevent other people from being in the same server as you. Useful for vehicle outsourcing without getting your prize vehicle get blown to bits by some triggerhappy player in a Hydra.As a conclusion I'd say it's worth buying should be in any true gamer's arsenal in my opinion.

review: This game is good. However I will not recomend it for you. There is usually two reasons people buy their games on PC it is your main platform and/or you like modding. Rockstar or Take Two has quite litteraly broken modding on PC which makes the PC version viable only if you have not played the game before. Seing GTA V sold 80 000 000 copies there is a big chance you got a copy of the game on some console be it PS3 PS4 or any of the Xboxes. Hence there is no point to buying the game for PC. I really hope Rockstar can see that modders are not the same as hackers and unban OpevIV. I hope Rockstar gets scared and supports mods in a better way in the future. Maybe they will allow Online moding not the kind that gives you infinite ranks and money but the kind that gives you a different experience.

review: Hey Guys &amp GirlsWell what can I say. I was a GTA fan from the time GTA first came out. What I think of GTA V is that the single player was fun and I lovr the fact that you control 3 different characters but for me personally I would make the game a bit longer and give more freedom to when it come to planning a heist. I am currently busy playing GTA V Online. I am only about 2 weeks busy online now and one of the firts things I picked up that I would have added toe the online version is that you have the ability toe do a atm transfer of money from your bank account to one of your friends of crew members. I would also loved if you had the ability to buy vehicles and clothing that you can give to your friends and crew or even just for thr people helping you run your businesses. For me personally I love GTA V Online a lot and would like to invite everyone to join us online.Best wishes to allG Man signing off

review: A great game and very much improved from the original game on the Last generation consoles. The story mode is content filled and the introduction of First Person and improved graphics is always a plus. Story mode remains mostly the same since the release and though it is very enjoyable and worth the price GTA Online is where it's at. Recieving new and content filled updates ( if you're willing to get the money to enjoy it ).However it's plagued by modders and it simply ruins your gameplay. The only times you will wanna play is if you have friends and you play on an invite only session. To join a public server is the same as asking to get banned. As many other reviewers have written you may join a game suddenly and a modder simply spawn in money for you. Rockstar's system detects this and will ban you. I've been banned twice for joining a public server and at your third strike I am at risk of being banned for 30 years. The point being at this current state of the game you will never want to go online in a public server. Inconclusion unless you have friends you'll have to risk getting banned constantly ( and eventually permanently ) to even hopefully get the enjoyment out of the Online portion of the game you are missing out on a huge part of what this game offers. Even though I love this game at it's current state I would not recommend it for any buyers unless they simply want the singleplayer option.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The publisher of this game Take Two removed support for most mods by giving the mod team behind OpenIV a Cease and Desist letter. The mod team couldn't deal with the legality of things and gave up ending support for their tool for modding. This was a bad decision. Unless this is somehow overturned such hostile actions towards fair use and freedom can only compel me to give this game a negative review to show my dissatisfaction with the publisher. Rockstar could make this right I'm sure.See comment "Rockstar has rescinded the Cease and Desist letter to the OpenIV crew and OpenIV is back. I have changed my recommendation accordingly."

review: If you have ever enjoyed ANY GTA game GET THIS! I've waited a long time for this game I waited for the console peasants to finish beta testing it for us PC gamers ) Then i had to upgrade my pc to play it as its meant to be ( and then finally i got to play it properly just wow!! It is just pure gaming fun distilled to 1000% proof! The way you switch between three very different characters keeps it interesting and at times hilarious (Trevor!) and the whole place just feels so alive like no game ive seen even down to getting flipped off by npc drivers when you prang their car! There is so much depth to the game the random people you come across asking for help and starting a mini mission and your options as to wether to help or.. well.. no no spoilers here ) The vehicles and their upgrades the sports the heists!! the stock market the properties and businesses available to buy and run the friends and families of each character and of course what would GTA be without the strippers and ladies of the night! I was a HUGE fan of GTA vice city and that game took the franchise to another level for me. Although I've loved all the subsequent GTA's to some degree i think this is the first time rockstar have really topped vice city with style. (plz plz plz do a vice city remake with the gta v engine though!!!) To me this is what gaming is about being dropped into another living breathing world where you can do whatever you want. Drive carefully and wait for the green light... or get out and waste everyone in sight (except the puppydogs ofc!) with sniper rifle/sawn off shotgun/stinger missiles or knuckle dusters and try to outrun the law on land sea and air! oh.. and now and then actually play the amazing storyline out... Thankyou to rockstar for keeping this franchise going! as long as you keep making them Ill keep buying them! TL DR JUST GET IT! FOR REAL THO!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: FOREWARNING AMD/Intel switchable graphics users You WILL have trouble getting this game to run because of issues that Rockstar has neglected to address.After spending hours trying to get the game to run it looks beautiful. I don't mind playing the entire game again. The NPC's are so likeable (and unlikeable) and you can actually have a fun time from just walking on the sidewalk. I'm not kidding.I was even able to transfer my online character from console onto here. Neat.Story is compelling and keeps you playing. Online can be pretty fun but still needs some work as it did when I played on console.Writing a detailed review is pretty pointless. Chances are you've seen PLENTY of the game already. It's a great port aside from the issues as far as crashing and not being able to run for some people all of which I'm sure will be fixed eventually.

review: Used to be a good game back when it came out. Now GTAV has been forgotten and GTAOnline has been utterly ruined by R*. Get it if you like paying sh*t tons of money (irl) to get anything cool in game cause it's all stupidly over priced or if you like spending every waking second grinding. Graphics are pretty unimpressive now too honestly. Glitches and Bugs and R* doesn't care at all all they care about is selling Shark Cards. GTAOnline should have literally been a new an improved version of the old SA MP (San Andreas Multiplayer) not a half as*ed 'pay to win' turd sh*t out by a company who's glory days have long since passed. One Lowrider cost me 4Mil$ an it wasn't even fully customized luckily I didn't waste 49.99$ on that sh*t (thanks to modders dropping money lol). Get it if you have money to waste. If not download it for free online and play Story Mode once then delete it cause the replay value is pretty low nowadays. Sad that this game was murdered it could have been so great. Should have saved my 60$ for Just Cause 3...or anything else.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: They've destroyed their own game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is the game that could have been and it'll always remain like that until R* and/or Taken decide to open up custom servers. Until then the game will be limited by the poor choices the dev and publisher made.What I liked Optimized game. this game runs smoothly on a 4y/o PC (Phenom 2 x6 8GB RAM R9 270X) when this game released for PC and it ran above 40FPS. Lots of things to do with friends. Just whatch N&amp B's videos in YouTube to get a glimpse of that. The editor. You can now make your own machinima! The story. It's amazing it's deep and gets to you in a deep level and takes you on a long trip. The added features. The weapon roundel/selector tool the first person view these really change how the gameplay flows.What I didn't like GTA ONLINE The grindfest. The online mode is fun the first few times you try the same missions but when you really want to get something new (like a car a condo etc) the missions become repetitive because they deliver so little money each time you'll have to repeat them 8+ times to get something good. GTA ONLINE you stole it... But not quite. Luxury cars you stole you don't get to keep them their excuse (a fair one) is that they have a tracking device and that's why you can't own it unless you purchase it. Which brings you back to previous point. SHARKCARDS the greed. So if you don't want to spend days or weeks grinding for that awesome sports car or condo you have the choice to spend real money to get it faster. It's not my thing but be my guest. Aggresive citizens. Remember how in GTA IV the citizens didn't start a gift just for looking at them? How cars stopped when you were in the middle of the road? This is LS baby Lossantonios have no time for your bullpoop. Also cops shoot you if you stay near them long enough. Non enterable buildings. It's 2017 (I know it was released earlier) and seriously... We can't have enterable buildings on free roam mode?! GTA IV HAD THEM!!! C'mon R*! GTA ONLINE THE PARTY POOPERS. You want to rule your own server? For some reason you want to challenge your friends in a chicken race? You want to shoot cars out of your gun? Too bad R* doesn't like any of that. No private/rental servers No mods no workshop only the poop they want you to have.So yeah for those and many more reasons GTA V will remain as the game that it could be. Think of the GTA version of PokemonGO. My tip buy it on sale and play the story it's still worth it.

review: At first I had extreme issues with the game crashing. My rig has an i5 4590 GTX 760 OC $GB Edition 8GB RAM and a 1 TB HDD. I was getting really frustrated but I found how to get it not to crashing. In the graphics settings change DirectX 11 back to DirectX 10.1 and turn MSAA off! This will eat up a lot more RAM but crashing will be gone.

review: Gameplay The Gameplay itself is great! This game allows you to do so much but it asks for you to use a good PC. Now there's one thing I have to say if you can't afford a good PC that can at least run this game it will be useless to you unless you watch some video to teach you how to make your FPS better which I don't recommend because the whole part of the game is it's beautiful graphics. It makes the gameplay a whole new experience. There's more than sitting around and trying to level up there's racing to gain money missions from the storyline or multiplayer and more! Some write reviews about modders in the multiplayer but really if you see one and despise them leave the session join a new one to enjoy Grand Theft Auto 5! If that doesn't work go make yourself a private session for your friends and enjoy hanging out without stupid people online that ruin the fun. Pros Amazing Graphics! Good Gameplay Good Storyline Helpful Community (Depends on your session) Controller Compatibility (I don't use one) Cons Needs A Good Computer Modders (I already gave you the solution to that) Nothing Else I Guess...I would give this game a solid 9/10 all games has its flaws but there's always a method to get around them.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: If you compare GTA San Andreas with GTA V you will notice that the older one had much more enjoyable content and is a way better game than any sequels (other than the fact that is is heavily outdated).Now with GTA V/Online you have a washed out story a horribly empty map with only 1/3 of San Andreas and a ed up Multiplayer that purely relies on the few people that actually do spend money on "micro" transactions because Pay to win OBVIOUSLY makes a great game.You will have to spend months on repetitive grinding on the already repetitive content to actually achieve or buy something and when it comes to the world itself... its just stupid... the world of GTA SA was interesting believable immersive and you could do so much fun things. Pumping yourself up betting on horse races spending time in casinos shooting up burger shops cheating (oh man i loved the cheat codes) flying jetpacks having girlfriends and maaany many more. And if you got bored the modding community got your back.With GTA V you will experience a useless 60+ Gb download no fun cheats in the singleplayer but a lot of cheaters in the multiplayer (except yourself) stupid childish humor and unimmersive content repetitive "missions" a bad story no modding support a worse than usual MMO feeling without sense and while Rockstar s its own game with stupid 7 year old content WE as players arent allowed to.GTA is/was fun because YOU and ONLY YOU were the thing interrupting this living breathing world. Something that tries to be something and you just come up with a rocket launcher and up. A world that becomes your personal playground a world in which you can rob people and literally destroy their lives. With GTA V Rockstar is robbing you destroying your life/experience.Nowadays you will be left alone with an empty singleplayer and a terrifying Multiplayer which is not worth a single penny because it only tries to keep up the playtime while ripping you off with microtransactions. In this case the playerbase becomes Rockstars playground. While your actions are prohibited (cheating/modding) and other actions simply can't be achieved without money (yes ACTUAL money) Rockstar is focusing on stupid things for stupid people. Rockstar does literally NOT listen a single tiny bit to the actual community. Otherwise we would have a lot more secrets/mysteries in the World a Jetpack more buildings to go into more places to go (like the restaurants in SA) more stuff to do more cities more features a good mod support fun cheats better gameplay cheaper and immersive content and an overall enjoyable experience instead of this... well... THIS!I regret buying this game so much. All the fun multiplayer stuff you see on Youtube only works if you have a lot of friends that follow your ideas but a game shouldnt rely on people with money and friends to be fun. (Also It attracts people with no money and no friends which will be let down.) And when it comes to the singleplayer... you can watch a simple story walkthrough and get the FULL experience because it has nothing else to offer.

review: I can't say much more about this game that has not already been said. This review is only on the story mode and not at all about the online mode. Fun Addictive and the most important of them all is funny. It seemed the more and more I played the game i noticied that the devlopers put a joke in every second of gameplay that they could. I really enjoyed that! I loved how there was so much to do on the side with all the fun short side quest random encounters and customization of weapons and cars that I got lost for hours not doing the main missions. I felt that a lot of work was put in to the characters and the back story's they had. I loved how every time the game got serious there was a joke thrown in to lighten up the mood and kept it ridiculous. I really did not encounter many bugs the game has been out for awhile so it is pretty polished and the first person mode is amazing and very fun! My only gripe about this game is that when you start the story mode it really forces a lot of the side quest on you and would somewtimes just automatically start them. This made them seem more like a chore because I was being forced to do them at that time. However in the developers defence they did make the side missions pretty weird and fun so....ya. The story was rich with vibrant characters and this game is definetly worth as buy if you got some moving room in your wallet and definitly if its on sale. As you drive throught the city of los santos I can assure you that you can not be bored with all the content that the developers have given us. Thanks for reading! Keep on playing as always.

review: Value Worth $20 cdn? Scale 1 10... give it a 5. Overall Game play The game play gets a 5 out 10. It's the exact same as previous version. Boring. Story Board Mode 6/10. You're either are too busy reading which buttons to press or addressing issues which quickly become mechanical. Fun stuff like pressing the right key to breathe correctly while doing yoga to driving and escaping cops. It's hard to figure out if you've missed stuff or not. Did I complete it? Do I have to do the real stupid stuff? Yoga? Really? Are you kidding? Who came up with this?On line You can play with friends. +1. New player experience. 10/10. As you start off with nothing you will be blown up repetitively by cheaters. Or two players will just blow you up non stop as you re spawn. If you're not with friends it's quite boring and many of the boring tasks require two or more people. This on line play is so pathetically bad and full of jerks that overall I'm going to give it the overall score of 0/10.OVERALL 5/10. It would quickly drop had I paid any more. The storyboard mode was worth that. And on top of it the money paid hopefully keeps these cesspool on line servers open. They are doing a great public service in containing many of the toxic jerks that might end up playing other on line games you could enjoy.

review: OK so I have a good enough amount of hours on this game to know that it changed to science fiction it is an endless grind show unless of course you buy in game money worth another 60 euro game you will spend most of the time grinding and buying stuff to ease your grind with. Lets say you buy a nightclub all cool you need to do some missions for it the usuall grind its ok right? NO cos the game keeps encouraging other players to kill you and you bet people do that not cos of the money but cos its an option and they want to show off their 5 milion OP helicopters and similar. The time you dont spend grinding you will spend on the varius loading screens at least 25% of my time spent in game is actually just loading also the servers are badly maintained often crashes bugs and glitches occur which will waste even more of your time. Also you need NASAs computer to run on 60 FPS but that is personal prefrence. So did I have fun with all the time spent in this game? No untill my friends bought it to which leads me to one more thing it is practicly impossible to efficiently do missions with random players it does not have voice chat if you dont have at least one friend that owns or will own this game then buying it is pointless. The time I spent with my friends was still a grind show but we had fun moments and the game was 60 euros so we didnt have a choice but to squezze all the fun out of it we could. Buy it if you like or have money but know that if you want to see all the "cool" stuff that they add (I have to say they do it regularly and that is nice) you can just go on youtube.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Definitely a very fun game the single player is still great fun even after so many years. Multiple characters gives you multiple viewpoints of the story which helps reduce the repetitiveness you see in most long single player games. The heists are a great fun setting up for and even more fun executing. There are ways to exploit the game and make unlimited money but in offline after having beaten the story mode it doesn't really matter all that much.Online however is a grind. There's a lot of fun in driving around with friends getting into fights with cops and maybe even other players doing missions and heists but it takes a good while to earn money. A very long while. You have to have made around 3 000 000 dollars in in game money to even get to the point where you can start making money back and by that point you're already a bunch of hours into the game. Speaking as a returning player from PS4 I have no energy or motivation to complete the grinds of this online mode again after already having done them on the console.Despite that big issue the game really is excellent and has aged terrificly. Rockstar continues to support the online mode for free with a bunch of new crazy vehicles and weapons new properties to buy new missions and so on. Buying this game for the single player experience especially with the modding capabilities of a PC version is definitely worth the buy.I would rate the whole package an 8/10 definitely worth the price and a most buy for GTA veterans.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Note for 4/15 regarding current state of game (Game still has issues for a lot of people I would wait until these issues have been sorted out before buying)*REVIEW*So I am no GTA fan boy or even Rockstar games and to be honest I didn't think I would care for this game so much.I bought to play with a friend online and figured. Why not game probably OK and has a lot of things to do from what I see.Well after playing for a few hours I was pretty hooked. There's a lot to do Now I do imagine I will get bored little later once it gets very competitive. But I think I will get my monies worth till then. However My friend was unable to launch the game as of yet he is experiencing a lot of issues where currently they have not found a workaround from what I can see. So that is kind of lame.I do recommend this game though however I would be skeptical about buying at the moment. If you have a friend that has the game and you are sure you are going to buy it if it works. Create new user meeting workaround standards have GTA5 on external and put in steamapp/common folder (reason 60gig install). Delete temp steam data (google search on how to restore backup games to library). Then test launch on your computer and see if its a fixable work around or un fixable. Either that or wait till fix notes appear. PROS +Good optimized graphics+4K possibility+smooth frame rate+excellent voice acting+First person mode *for a excellent immersion experience*+Third person mode +fun offline and online game play elements+Many many actives+Singing in the shower+Own your own place and garage with perks.+Funny shows to watch on TV+Mouse steering option+Lots of music/radio station content+Customer music library if desired+Online progression+Tesla car clone. "The D's clone" +Land vehicles (cycles motorcycles trucks haulers cars SUV's tanks APC Monster trucks)+Aerodynamic Vehicles (jets heli's assorted planes)+Sea vehicles (jetskis assorted boats)+Submersed vehicles (subs/scuba)+Many weapons!*NEGS* Game currently has lot of launch/running issues for bout 20% of who bought the game. Very big install long loading times (unless very good internet / high end gaming comp) Possible time out issues at any time. If session is lost to MP loads single player instead of going back to main menu (may be a option for this) Can encounter some serious laggers who are playing then troll you. Sometimes difficult to get groups for certain events. Can encounter griefers but not as bad as APB for anyone who knows about that... First person car mirrors don't work right. (very low rez reflection and only shows environment) Cars can have that touchy turn and accelerate on keyboards (either no throttle or full throttle... or full steering a direction) Would hope for a little more immersion. Such as blinkers and a throttle/gas control option. Mouse steering can be really touching/ difficult to use as a primary method. All females are transvestites I suppose... Strippers don't strip.. Specially when invited to apartment. Some features missing for good immersion/ ease of use (cant remember the main one that slipped my mind) Conclusion if the game works. Worth it still. However would invest into controller for driving races/flying on MP. (not sure if you can switch back and forth actively have not tested) 9/10

review: I cannot recommend this game. The dictatorship of Rockstar has gone too far. The fact I can get banned for using mods in single player for a game I paid $60 (again) for this game even though I had it on Xbox and bought it again. The "freedom" Rockstar once gave to the players with the GTA series is taken away from the community. It used to be easy to make money online when it originally came out on consoles but now they reduced payment you get from doing in missions online in half and even less money the 2nd time to replay a mission. Emblems were once custom to make online due to a site glitch but I was going to get banned as well as everyone who did the glitch to have custom pictures if that isn't corporate dictatorship I don't know what is. Fix your game of today this review will remain negative Rockstar. Also don't expect any feature support or potential buys from this customer I don't tolerate or give any respect to developers who pull these shady deals.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The Storymode is pretty good so if you haven't played GTA V before go ahead.But WHATEVER YOU DO DO NOT TRY THE ONLINE MODE. It would just make your gameplay experience so much worse.The Online Mode is a Hackfest when you're not being crushed by raining tanks having a campfire inside you or just get blown up for no apparent reason you're in a loading screen.Every loading screen takes a couple of minutes you want into Freemode? Loading Screen? You're trying to join a mission? Loading Screen? You don't actually want to join the mission because the Lobby is full? Let me load Freemode again for you.On the Plus side though if you beg long enough a hacker will give you more money than any shard card ever could (if you're into that sort of thing) and don't you worry about finding one because every Session has one! )

review: Played the game for a day now did a few missions drove and messed around a bit. I was loving GTA 3 was seriously hyping on Vice City (cause I love the era) haven't played San Andreas at all (computer not powerfull enough at the time) and was okay with GTA 4. So far I am having a blast. The performance is great even on my sub par Computer. It even manages to look good on lowest settings (which are called 'normal' instead of 'low' or some such thing nice touch!). It's the first full priced game I have bought in a long time and I am pretty sure I won't regret it.Full recommendation for fans of the genre!There are a few glitches like Massive FPS drop now and again for a second or four but it's manageable and it never happened in a mission so far. Some cutscenes were a bit off sync. Have to stop writing now and resume playng )

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is great. The game was amazing for X360/PS3then it moved to the next gen consoles whoch only improved it more by adding first person and little gameplay changes. Now it's out for PC and the game is outstanding. The gameplay controls well with a keyboard and mouse but if you don't like keyboard and mouse this offers full controller support. The game is improved massively just by adding better graphics and 60 FPS. This version also has everything the X360/PS3/XBONE/PS4 had and more. You also get bonuses if you are coming back from the console versions. This game has been so improved I can't cover everything.List Pros 1. Keyboard and mouse feels fluid2. Full controller support3. Graphics are nice4. Community is much better5. Gameplay is improvedCons 1. Needs optimisation 2. Lags for no reason at points (I.E. In garage in online and in the desert)3. You need at least 1.5 gigs of video memory to make the game look normal4. You need 3 4 gigs of memory to make the game look as nice as possible5. You need a great computer to run thisSo 9/10

review: Long Answer Where do I even start when reviewing this absolute perfected art as a game? Rockstar absolutely made this game the best I have ever played. The story mode is so fun so rich with character and main story but also has a bunch of fun side missions to complete if you ever want to take a break from the main story. The online is not a gamemode I explore too often but from around the 10 hours I have spent in GTA 5 online it has been an absolute BLAST to play. So many different modes to play with other enthusiatic fans of the GTA series. Contrary to what some other people have said you wont get banned for "no reason" and not once have I came across a cheater.Short Answer This game ing rocks.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: SinglePlayer Stories really nice nice to play from 3 different characters that all have different perspectives on everything. Once you beat the story there are a few thigns that you can do after that but to be honest I got kinda bored on it and moved onto multiplayer. TL DR if you only want it for the story it's worth it.MultiPlayer Kinda a mixed bag. Like anything best with friends so get a few buddies or make some friends on the Community Hub and you'll have a great time playing the missions and heists or just goofing off in online multiplayer sessions. Without friends though it may be a bit harder to have fun as when I'm alone I often just wander around until someone with an armored tank and a much higher level comes along and continuously blows me up for no reason. And if that's not annoying enough you will occasionally run across a hacker. Now since the last update I heard they vamped their anti cheat so I haven't noticed that many running around or at least they haven't been ruining my fun in any way which is ok so long as they're not being major $$holes. Overall with a few friends you'll have a good time with this game.

review: If you want to review the multiplayer game with a few words Loading ScreenIt feels like I've spent at least 200 hours of my 250 in loading screens. Join a job? At least 30 seconds waiting oh the job was full but the game couldn't just let you jump back into your session? 3 minute loading screen. Oh the game couldn't put you into another session? Jump back into GTA V and then back to Online at least 5 minute loading screen. This is how it is CONSTANTLY. Mind this game is five years old if R* really cared they would've fixed all these issues already.A gamebreaking bug or constant crashes? Let it be. Someone dropping money to circumvent the grind wall? Call the national guard and put this man before a firing squad.Singleplayer is good however taking into account that Online is the more active part of the game this is just not worth your money.

review: I've put around 600 hours into this with PC/PS3. Overall the game is great. Gameplay is spot on vehicles are somewhat diverse and fun to drive. After a while each weapon seems like a carbon copy of others within its class. The character switching is there but you'll find yourself prioritizing one over the others. However the story falls flat in comparison to past Rock* titles with Franklin being some black sheep. After the story the enviroment basically dies. From there you can pick up on the cluster known as GTA Online.Avoid GTA Online unless you want a massive grind.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Initially I was really unhappy with Rockstar over this game.. the performance of it was terrible but that's changed for the good a fair bit since those dark days. (not that it's amazingly better now but it is definitely good enough I can start recommending it to other people).THE GOOD * Open World Heaps to do (more on this later)* Interactive and enguaging city (you feel like another citizen and people respond to your actions in a "normal" way.. except police who replaced their stock of handcuffs with 9mm ammo.. least their prison is fairly empty p)* Single Player is lots of fun and provides enough mini games that you could technically enjoy it for a VERY long time before getting bored.. some mini games feel formulated "Talk to NPC kill target get paid" whilst others are very much unique to this.* Multiplayer is really starting to come into its stride now where players can headline their own faction within the city as a VIP. Players can own a large variety of awesome properties including a customisable Yacht!* There are plenty of missions a player can do in GTA Online (GTA O) which will not require them to enter a special context menu and load up a private mini session which means NO MORE LOADING SCREENS if you prefer to enjoy the in session ones.* Mouse and Keyboard input has been improved significantly to the point where you can actually play this game competitively .. it really does feel more like playing Battlefield inside a huge city at times with all the cover tactics etc. 3rd person takes away from this a little but also is nice that players have options.. your play style won't feel limited by input variety and camera options )I could go on there are tons more good but that'll do for now the rest would just be more details on specific things such as exploring and finding cool hide out areas etc. THE BAD * There are still some memory issues when running this game from non SSD harddrives where you get loading FPS lock ups and the progressive downward spiral of memory leaking that eventually (day or 2 of off and on gaming) will require a computer restart. But ... you should probably be restarting your pc around that often normally if you want to maintain healthy levels of updates and a nice clean cache etc.* There are still a fair few missions that take place within these Mini Sessions (a session inside a session). These Private Session missions impose loading screens and also have Minimum/maximum player requirements.. trying to get 4 players to do the same heist as you and not leave mid way through because of something as fickle such as .." you didn't let me drive so i'm out". which means you have 3/4 of the required players and the mission auto fails.They need to get rid of minimum and maximum player requirements for heists and missions if they want people to even consider doing them as a way to earn cash because it's sooo painful having missions auto fail due to a poor connection on one of the squad members or them just having a hissy fit.. or worse trolls that join and then leave right before the objective completes.* GTA Online (GTA O) is not hosted by Rockstar they use P2P technology so you might actually wind up the host of your GTA O session lol.. lag can be a problem at times due to this when you get guys from Russia joining an Aussie hosted server with a few Americans in there.* There is no way to store weapons in your apartments so when you buy any weapons .. you are stuck with them for life in GTA O which means that after some time playing.. testing out new arrivals .. you start to carry the entire stock of Ammunation in your back pocket.. which is fine until you get a guy who is attacking from a long range and you're on the wrong assault rifle so you have to toggle through till you reach the one that has good long range etc.It would be good if they let you select what weapons to carry and what to keep in your apartment.* Unable to buy and sell on the Stock Market at the moment (I believe this is meant to be coming to GTA O along with Casinos)* GTA O appears to encourage the purchase of Shark Cards for in game cash so players can avoid the painful Heists which were meant to be the big way to earn cash in game. If you don't have 3 friends willing to do heists with you .. prepare for a world of pain because trying to get 3 randoms to stay who can actually play.. and speak the same language .. it's rare. NEUTRAL POINTS TO NOTE * As mentioned the game tries to direct players into buying Shark Cards for real money to gain GTA O currency without working for it. Hackers also have a habbit of joining sessions and dropping money bags on your head which provide in game currency without working for it. Since both achieve the same goal and Rockstar are comfortable with handing out In Game Cash that requires no mission completion or skill work to obtain it in game.. I see no difference to hackers doing something that has the same end result.Rockstar are not taking money from Shark Cards and using it to provide Dedicated Hosting they are not fully addressing all of the Memory Leak issues that have been with the game since launch on PC they are not porting the game over to MAC for those unfortunate few who own a macintosh (may you rest in peace) but heck they deserve to at least play the game too right... owning a MAC should be punishment enough. Rockstar are still focussing a lot on trying to find new money sinkholes in game so players with cash run out and have to start buying Shark Cards.. that's the only motivation for new and hyper expensive things like the Yachts but I can't fault them there.. and the content is nice.. IF you can afford it.The Heists and other negative points I listed are indicators that this is a game where you shouldn't be buying Shark Cards to support the continuation of previously listed negative points.* Hackers.. well yeah sooo the Hacker Giveth and the Hacker Taketh away... Not all hackers are friendly and give you all guns raining money on you and inventing new gamemodes such as Armageddon (we had a hacker shooting jumbo jets from a minnigun over the city and we had to try survive .. it was so much fun) You do get a few who will attach a UFO to your head Mass Kill the entire Session using different players to commit the act on their behalf forcibly.. it will say that PLAYER X (coul be you) killed.. and then the entire session list rolls up the screen. Newer players then think YOU are the hacker. until it says they killed everyone too at which point it becomes obvious you will not know who the hacker is.I say hackers are neutral because yeah there is good .. heaps of good .. but there is the bad were you get some who want to ruin the fun and troll. The worst hackers are the ones who hack HP etc and pretend that they're just too good until they Face Tank Rockets (plural) and you call them on their $#!t... haven't seen too many like that recently though which is nice )* Voice Chat It's great when you want to chat with other players in your faction/friends list etc.. but the default setting is Everyone soooo lot of nooobs talking over public channel .. can get pretty uncomfortable at times or just plain annoying.. luckily you can mute individual players if you so desire.. or you can switch your Chat mode from Everyone to another more suitable setting... it just takes knowing how.well that's a fairly good coverage of main points good bad and neutral so hopefully that helps explain why I think the game is worth buying now.

review: Ok let's just start with a note this game is rubbish on PC not that the game is bad that it takes a loooooong time to load. Now that's out of the way GTA V is a great game now really that note earlier was a little true but bear with me it was the same on the PS3 and Xbox 360 so I shouldn't be complaining. I bought this when it was $19 at a sale and I was stoked since I never owned the game before I installed it and I had a blast! But rewind before the first mission I was sitting in my office chair in my room for about let's say 12 minutes when I was about to call quits the game loaded. And lo behold the greatest game I ever played on Steam (aside from CoD Black Ops 3) Side note GTA V was the first game I played for over 10 hours straight yeah I have no damn life.10/10

review: The story mode is okay though pretty boring with stale and generic characters. But by far the worst part about the game is online. If you're lucky enough to get a server without a modder ruining everything it's still incredibly irritating. the entire online mode is pay to win or pay to have fun. Every server is dominated by people that spent there own money for the fake in game money. If you try to play this game without buying shark cards than you are in for a terrible experience. You'd have to grind for hours to even afford a crappy car as everything in game is insanely expensive. Then anything you try to do on a server with more than ten people with be near impossible because players show up on the flying missile shooting cars that they paid real money for and just blow you up. If you are willing to pay over 15 20 extra dollars plus the games base cost then you are probably going to have a good time. But if not than definetly do not get this game the story mode and online are not worth it at all.

review: The single player campaign is quite a fresh approach with you playing as three main characters.Story 4/5It's the cliche one last job story line of one man's mid life crisis.Design 5/5Vehicles clothes npcs and most of all world design. All of these things on such a massive scale really shows us why "triple A" open world games are only produced by massive studios. It is something people will use as a reference for years to come.Mechanics 4/5Weapons are satisfying to use and vehicles are nice to operate. The most infuriating thing is just the sluggish character movements during combat. However overall it is quite refined.Online servers 0/5Servers are p2p. Yes. Hosted by one of the idiots in the session. Yes. ing so many latency problems caused by bad connections. Widespread hacking with no effective anti cheat in place because original game doesn't have one and obviously server side anti cheat can't be implemented.Oh and this is what causes the endless cloud simulator situations. Complete and utter garbage network connections to the host.Online gameplay 1/5Grindfest. Heists and set ups will wipe constantly because of some ing idiot dying for the nth time in a row or some leaves. This prevents you from getting any cash at all to get to the better cash farming methods which then prevents you from really enjoying the unlockable content.You could waste hours of your life grinding or just pay some guy 2 usd to get a billion in game cash.Overall 3/5TL DR The entire game is propped up on an amazing single player experience. If you have 3 other friends that want to play online as much as you do this game becomes a 5/5 for you.I will not recommend this game because rockstar and take2 are Shark cards are priced at insane rates and heist payouts are really low because they want to sell them. Not to mention the vehicles are damn expensive too all because they want people to buy shark cards.Suing openinv doesn't really help either.They never ing learn.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

It s everything you can hope for and more and the absolute pinnacle of the open world genre.

review: Not recommended. GTA V was a good story great voice acting and solid gameplay and progression. GTA Online throws most of that out. EXTREMELY biased towards selling Shark Cards with microtransactions to the point where they diminished mission and job rewards if you happen to beat it any amount of time under 15 minutes. Yes the faster you manage to beat a mission the less you get paid. And you get constant un ignorable phone calls for million dollar warehouses and bunkers that you can't afford and emails about said items.Outside of that newer players have to rely exclusively on the generocity and skill of other players in order to earn any reliable money. Selling cars and holding up stores gives you minimal money. Heists can be failed by a single player messing up one aspect of the mission or dying. Working for CEO's and MC owners could result in NO PAYMENT WHATSOEVER and you have no way of knowing until after you complete the work for them. And all of this is while you're dodging players flying around on missle equipped rocket bikes in near indestructible APC's or gunships while their icons are hidden from the map so you have no idea where they are or when you'll die to the next rocket attack.This game has turned into nothing but a cold cash grab at the expense of anyone who wants to enjoy the game but doesn't have the expendable cash to throw at Rockstar for doing nothing other than rigging the system in this way.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: (single player only review haven't touched Online yet)I can say it was worth waiting for a sub 20 sale. GTAV is a really good game from almost every aspect. This is the most polished a streamlined GTA ever well this shouldn't be a surprise because it's also the newest one so have to be up to the current AAA game standards. It's also well optimized running perfectly on my PC (i7 7700 GTX 1070). I had to disable the RivaTuner overlay because it crashed the Social Club but whatever that should be our smallest problem!I will honestly recommend it to everyone to play it you won't regret it. There is an incredible amount of content apart from the main story line and w/o even touching the Online mode.Last but not least two things I didn't like that much or more like two things why I think San Andreas is still a better game than this. First of all there is no progression at all. Like almost from the beginning you have everything. House cars weapons etc. There is no incentive to do side quests for money to get that something you really want. San Andreas and even Vice City solved this much better. The other thing is the 3 character setup. Hard to talk about it w/o spoilers but I've felt like the game is about one guy and his relationship with everyone else (including one of the guys from the remaining two) and the last guy is "just there". Ok he is more than that but obviously less flashed out there is less story about him and his past the world around him etc. In the end it's not bad but I think having one main protagonist is much better for a game like this.Can't wait for the next GTA game. Until then?... Just relaxin'https //www.youtube.com/watch?v 1hdAAZzgCuk

review: I'll just give this game a regular pros n cons review.PROS Be a criminal from the comfort of your PC and without really getting arrested! Story is fun and interesting though once you finish all the missions there's nothing to do really... except GTA online but we'll talk about that later. Cars. Cars! It's always fun to drive your chromed Zentorno on the highway flipping the finger to everyone you overtake. I'm pretty sure I've spent atleast 10% of my time in this game in a car. Very well developed characters each one is interesting in it's own way. Missions are very diverse though most of them involve harming people it isn't like some games where every mission is Go Here Shoot Everything Win. Missions are mostly all unique and have their own objectives. Devs commonly push out small content updates. And they don't charge for them it's like getting free DLC.NEUTRAL Weapons. You have access to a vast arsenal of something over 20 or 30 weapons which you can modify to make cooler looking and perform better. That might sound fun but you'll have no reason to use most of them. Why use an average silenced pistol or sniper when you can just slap a silencer extended clip grip and scope on a Carbine and still wreck anyone at any distance with a short burst of bullets? And why do that when you can just rev your minigun and clear 15 police officers 4 of their cars and 2 choppers in the span of a minute? Most of the game you'll just be using the same 4 or 5 guns and nothing else. Also there isn't a point in ammo when you can just waste a few thousand dollars to have enough bullets for each weapon to supply an entire army regiment. Freeroam. For a reason it just feels... empty. Yes there's all those cars. Yes there's pedestrians walking on the streets or hanging around. Yes you'll occasionally see a police chase that isn't protagonizing you for once. But really the game doesn't try too hard to convince you that these aren't AI. It's oftenly boring.CONS Online. 2 things One it's a grindfest. If I wanted to grind missions several times to level up get more cash and finally be able to afford a shiny new car I'd go and play an RPG like Skyrim or something. Second hackers. They shouldn't even be called hackers since they just download a little script to get a mod menu to annoy people the vermin are usually Russians that enjoy ruining the game for some reason or spoiled 12 year olds that have no sense of reward or patience in order to get past level 10 and at the same time like to feel superior to everyone else by exploding them. Story mode replayability. The first time you finish the story is a magical experience the next time just feels like a chore.Overall even with it's small flaws this game is amazing. Buy it you're buying a piece of history
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Don't get me wrong this game can be fun Fun when there isn't a person flying around in an oppressor mkII and armed with a thermal scoped explosive rounded sniper. PVP in this game has gone down the drain it isn't fun anymore unbalanced as vehicles make trolling and griefing such an ease. Well why don't you go passive mode you say? These trolls have probably equipped themselves with mods and now look THEY are throwing cars at you or blowing and caging you like colombus caged up them people down south and then somehow dropping you money so you get banned the next day. People may say to leave the lobby But can you really? Yes you can but who wants to wait another 5 minutes in a loading screen of death just to find another lobby with another hacker / griefer / troller? Why just not play the game at all? Not to mention the crap anti cheat that will ban you instead of the modders dropping you the $$$. Sounds fun right? if you're here for the offline mode and you don't wanna partake in online knock urself out otherwise I can't really recommend it since out of my 250 ish hours about 45 hours have been full of monkeys griefing in some sort of way either it be a flying car or a flying motorcycle or just god mode cheaters in general and some 30 hours of my gameplay where just loading screens ... And hey it's really not up to me if you buy the game or not it's your money so I couldn't care less still You've been warned friend buddy guy.Pro's Games fun with buds Can be hilarious at times (with buds strangers alike) Good Vehicle driving/flying mechanics fun physics RoBoT PrInCeS BuBbLeGuM Large detailed map Amazing single player Mods they make offline so much better Easy to learn hard to masterNegatives HACKERS EVERYWHERE PvP is trash with broken items/vehicles Loading screens ... Grindy as Trash Anti Cheat system Overpriced for a 2013 game buy it on sale just in case Pretty baddly optimized to this day P2W microtransactions get you the good items BMG Sniper with explosive bullets and thermal scope Flying death motorcycle with a rocket booster and infinite rocket spam flying death car with infinite rockets I can keep going here but well there's a lot of broken A 10 Warthog is absolute trash why you do dis to me.

review: I bought GTA5 years ago on a steam summer sale and was a major fan of the online take of things. GTA5 Story Mode Story mode has an in depth storyline with highly likeable protagonists although not long the game offers a different approach to missions than most games... Story mode will leave you begging for more and wanting to uncover the protagonists backstories.GTA Online GTA Online is one of the most enjoyable multiplayer based games but can often leave saying "What is next? And that displays the amount of content there is to explore in this game. Also to mention that Rockstar still updates it as of early 2019.Some cons and major annoyances must also be taken into account. This game is really grindy grindy as in you need to make money to buy assests businesses etc. There is a lot of griefers that there is no way of enforcing. They WILL destroy your things especially when you sell your product in your businesses. A lot of modders which carelessly mess around with people.GTA5 is an outstanding game and can still compete with Today's AAA titles.8/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: "When GTA V was first released two years ago the gaming press heralded it's triumphant arrival with 10's across the board. It was on everyone's GOTY lists won tons of awards and accolades and won over the hearts of gamers worldwide. But it isn't until now two years after the fact that I feel Grand Theft Auto V finally earned that praise. Rockstar has crafted a masterpiece in this PC version of their latest title and in a time where most big budget games come preloaded with bugs and issues it's refreshing to see a product look run and play so flawlessly right out of the box."https //www.youtube.com/watch?v ZRU9t2ShEI4
