review: After playing for gta online for more than 250 hours I can say that it was a huge waste of time. I can't believe a huge game like gta online would have so many modders that just want to ruin your game. They will chain kill you they will trap you in a cage and etc. Worst of all is the fact that you have to grind so hard to get a single thing in this game but modders get billions of gta dollars by just clicking a button. Grinding is not a problem for me but it becomes a problem when I know some people dont have to go through it. Rockstar seems to not care about modders at all. I added a level 8000 that i knew was a modder to my friends list. He accepted it and after 2 months he is still not banned. He has been playing the game for more than 6 months and rockstar did nothing. He had about 5 billion dollars by just clicking a button. If you want to buy gta only buy it for the single player and if you really want to play gta online the only fun thing are adversary modes and races. Accept those nothing else in gta online is going to fun.

review: So I got this game on Xbox 360 for the Christmas that it came out played through the campaign then played the online (Which at the time was amazing although became stagnant after a year or so) with my mates did all the DNS glitches got everything had a lot of fun till the Xbox one version came out I went out and bought that was not disappointed got me back into GTA played through the campaign again and played the online for a further year or two then once again it got boring. Now its been nearly a year since i last played. Was scrolling through steam and found the game on steam and despite having the boxes for ther game on both xbox one and 360 a few feet away bought it again. And now i'm playing the campaign and online again. So I bought the game 3 times played the campaign 4 times and on my third online character the only game to have ever done this to me and i imagine the only one that will ever do this to me. Honestly if it wasn't for the lack of singleplayer DLC and the micro transactions and how the general in game purchasing is structurred to force you to buy a shark card this game would be perfect. Annoyingly the online community is just full of who blow up your car for no reason etc. but i guess this is online gaming and i do it to....... Overall great game. Wish there was a singleplayer DLC.

review: The singleplayer is decent yes with good writing and storytelling.It's multiplayer that absolutely kills this game. Rockstar will not do anything about the hackers that plague the servers it is impossible to go it alone and other players are ridiculously unreliable and pointlessly aggressive murdering you just for kicks. (Because why not? The only reward for *not* murdering everybody is $2 000 for about 4 hours of game time.)The kicker is that the game will actively and maliciously work against you. The final straw for me was trying to solo a sell mission making airdrops in a plane with no weapons. The game spawned an attack helicopter on me for no reason and with no way to fight back. I was blown up along with $300 000 worth of stock which I would've had to grind for at least 2 hours to replace. (And $300 000 is a pittance compared to the insane pricing on businesses you buy for the opportunity *to spend even more money on them*.) Simply put the game will not let you succeed if you try to play fairly or try to handle things by yourself.I am done with that level of shit.

review: Amazing game. If you liked any of the other titles in the series you'll love this as well. The story is a bit cliche which pours over into the missions which are repetitive and lackluster on their own. But the graphics and sheer amount of content in the game more than makes up for it. Runs great on ultra settings on my G1 gaming gtx 970 i7 4.0 ghz 16 gb of RAM. There is a bit of a memory leak (see forums) and some nasty bugs doing the story missions (character switch/freezes). But the game is awesome and you won't be disappointed. 9/10 (missions get redundant)UPDATE Rockstar is banning people for modding their single player game.

review: Ok my names is Zedd im a gamer currently age 15 I sit at home some days and play games but thats not the point of this review I was banned a month and 2 days ago my charcter I have had since intial release from console(ps3)and I transfered the character Now I have to say I did mod Was not the best idea But yet Everything in the game is overpriced by a "truck size" meaning you want money either waste a fulltime job worth of time to earn basicly around a total guess But many would agree 4.5 mill or small X amount of money And yes in real life that is a lot But in the GtaV world its like 20 bucks Yes you may be able to buy something ranging in lowrider/Zentorno/T20 but what the time it took to grind and not buy the games "cheap" disgusting way for microtransactions "SharkCards" is what they call them you really dont have as much fun And yes I know you dont need cars/planes/boats/helicopters ect. vehicles or weapons of that matter to have fun in online freemode with or without friends or family if you have that type of family even then the online mode is kinda boring Without these extra vehicles and other stuff it just gets boring I have noticed And played with/been like all along A summary is that GtaV Online As many would like it to be fun not exasuting like IRL The truth is it takes more time really grinding then it would IRL yet again this is my personal experince with GtaV Online since its release Anything after the "High Life" Dlc is just overpriced And a waste of time and IRL money This has been Zedds most indepth as a 15 yr old can do with his type of attention span so Have fun Remember that GtaV Online is for some And for people like me It is not fun it is just a waste of time I consider it as Peace. review: I'm not okay too with Take Two removing the mods from the game. And sure everyone had a right to be upset once that happened but now that it's back people are still downvoting this game for that same reason?What's more not only this game got heavily downvoted (which I can understand) but the other GTA games too? What's gotten into you guys?Downvoting a game as a form of protest is quite debatable itself but downvoting all of the other games as well is straight out stupid (no offense intended).With that being said don't let yourself be fooled this game is quite fun itself. It can give you some good time with both single player and multiplayer (this one turns out to be rather funny if you've got friends to play with).Sure mods had been declared as illegal and that was a dumb move but now that they made up for it this game definitely deserves a second chance.A well deserved second chance imo

review: Alright I wont speak about the Story Line cause I didn't play it for awhile. My review will mostly be based on the Xbox One version considering when I play on PC I just play modded Solo (With LSPDFR etc).I have played GTA V since the first day of it's release which was on Xbox 360. In the first days you couldn't play the Online mode. When it opened it was totally crazy very hard to find a non full server. When you found one it was pretty cool. Seemed like real life had struggle to get money for an appartment most of players had only a garage for a car etc. After that the first glitches arrived. Mostly the Sell and Respawn your car one. Most of players used it to get more money but it was still cool. "Cheaters" only used that to get a better appartment or a better car. Even if they were rich they had a low level. And then the lobby cheat arrived. Guys with Billions of Dollars buying tanks biggest appartments yachts best cars helis etc. They literally had everything. When you join a server you just get rekt by everyone. There is guys with flying bikes who can shoot you with rockets. (This is not a glitch the bike is really apart of the game) And some good things like guys shooting you with a Big Helicopter that will take you 10 15 RPG Rockets to destroy. I'm Level 60 and got some good like a Tank and still I get ed by the whole map with their flying bikes and 2050 Tanks.This is honnestly the biggest problem of the game. Beside that it is pretty good a lot of updates with DLC which are free. Amazing Graphics Voice Actors Maniability etc etc. Your hardest struggle is to progress in the online mode.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Crime... Crime never pays... is what I would say if I played by the rules and chose not to earn my fortune. Whether you're Franklin Michael Trevor or a highly dangerous mute you're wisked away into a life of crime where there's no true consequence for your actions. However to survive you can't play fair with the rest of the dogs. Always get the upper hand always think about how to invest always remember to be faster than the other guys.

review: While the gameplay itself is fun and the singleplayer story is fun the online mode has become increasingly more and more of a price gouge. They are constantly releasing new content and vehicles (normally a good thing). But they make them prohibitively expensive so that due to the low amount of money you can make through playing the only realistic way to get the newer stuff is to buy it with real money. And I am talking in the hundreds of dollars. Add this to the fact that at any time your account could get banned with no warning or explanation just because some hacker came into your session and did something to/with your character.So... fun gameplay ruined by heavy price gouging and a near requirement to spend a lot of real money to get in game vehicles

review: SINGLE PLAYER MODE REVIEW ONLY I have not nor will I ever play the multiplayer.Can be a pretty fun game. The mechanics are spot on and the visuals are beautiful.The world is vibrant and active. The sandbox map is massive with tons to explore.I wish more buildings could be entered however. When you start to realize most of them are just empty set dressing the world seems more hollow and artifical breaking immersion.The main characters can be quite unlikable at times. Franklin the well meaning but ultimately stupid thug lite.Michael the self absorbed WASP who moans about his life while sitting in his mansion.Trevor the "LOL SO RANDUMB" 4.chan washout psychopath wanna be that only appeals to kids under the age of twelve. Less of a character and more of a walking cringe factory.Seriously I like the game but hate having to play these three. I wish there were better choices.

review: It's a great game and really addicting but there are some things that are bad about this game.The singleplay (although i haven't played it on pc yet) is still.. the same? No DLC nothing. It's basically abandoned.A singleplayer dlc like a new mission or something would be great! But really the core of GTA 5 is the online mode.I LOVE the online mode cool cars fun missions heists all kinds of stuff! But... everything is SO EXPENSIVE! You have to either buy sharkcards get a modder to give you money (not recommended) or grind for days to get a cool car or bike like the opressor! That is really the main thing i dislike about online everything else is pretty great!If you are willing to spend alot of time or money on a game sure go ahead buy this game.But if you are impatient (like me) don't buy this game.Also way to many modders which make this game unplayable. You sometimes get lucky and find a modder free lobby.I would rate this game a terrible 3/10

review: I think this game its a great game with friends to play but allone its not that great tbh. If you play with friends you always have a backup and you guys can do stuff online and you have great fun all the time. You need to grind or cheat to get stuff like cars and jets . So this is a friend based game and needs to be played with friends. If you dont have friends you need to wait for hours and hours long (I have spend over 40 hours just waiting for people to join my lobbys or people who are loading in) if you have friends with good internet then its no problem of course. There are many missions and even more mini games to play. You will never be done with all missions and minigames unless you no live it for 500 hours but i think you want to make fun to instead of only missions right?

review: I'm an only child that grew up in a well settled middle classed family home and as a 90's kid I remember when one of my older pals came over with the original Grand Theft Auto which we played on the Play Station for hours on end. Everyday I take some time to myself to thank for introducing this game into my life. With GTA V comes a greater experience than ever previously understood within the series and holy bejesus IT'S SO MUCH FUN!! The times have changed and Los Santos is ripe for the taking. It is time for us to take notice of the fact that we can accomplish a lot with a smile and in Los Santos you can accomplish a lot more with a smile and a gun. The world is yours. Players get to involve themselves with the underground and get to expeience what it would be like to start and build up their own criminal empire and the action leads to a non stop flow of dopamine and serotonin goodness and delight. It is by far the most fun you're gonna have apart from getting to sleep with two or three of your high school crushes... at once! It's a ing maginificent game I you not. Kudos to Rockstar for pulling this off! Now let me take a hit of that bong and plot a bank heist. Peace out.

review: I'm torn. The game itself is amazing. tons of detail loads of fun in many ways you can expect. i particularly love to customize and collect certain cars. it's a ton of fun and if it's on sale i'd say grab it.That being said the online community has the both of the extremes. A lot of absolutely idiotic childish and just plain mean spirited people being that way just for the sake of it. (not to mention the commonality of hackers and modders that just love to ruin everyone's fun because of some sort of superiority complex). But i've met some solid dudes online and they make the game a thousand times more fun.It is absolutely a grind but I can always find things to entertain me and I don't really care about making the most profit.

review: The game has a great world and charcters. However the multiplayer or Grand Theft Auto Online I found somewhat lacking control wise on mouse and keyboard (strange default mapping inaccuracies etc.). The real problem lies within the players movement as online carries over the same movement from the story which fails when it comes to competitve on foot online games. The Expansions that they release have been fun so far keeping players coming back and still having fun. The main pull for this game has got to be the vehicle gameplay. The racing games are very fun to play as well as challenging. It is arguably the best part of the game. I'd hate to end on a sorrow note but there is two extreme downsides to the game. One is the cash gap. Without a leveling system to unlock things cash becomes top priority. This a huge blackade for newcomers due to how it even more enforces their microtransaction cash grab. The solution to this however is even worse. In order to get the most fun out of the game hacking money in is regular occurence. I do not blame the hackers though due to Rockstars pay to win format I believe they are justified in their actions. Overall I would give the game an 8/10 million dollars that were to difficult to get.

review: I found myself getting completely lost in the story mode of this game. Couldn't put the game down. Honestly a really great experience untill I ran out of space. The saves for the game and such took up all my space in my documents. But it was great while it lasted. However I could still play the online mode. Which is where most of my hours were. Messing around with my friends who had hours and hours and the best stuff in the game was awesome. Going around in avengers and such messing with others was great.9/10 great story great online mode.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Take Two and Rockstar have ruined their community For 10 years I've been an avid supporter of Rockstar and Take Two products overall I've played almost every GTA game Red Dead Redemption you name it i've played it. Never have I seen this stupid ing t. you Take Two you've ruined what left there was to ruin.For backstory Take Two has sent out a cease and desist letter to OpenIV GTA's largest single player modding platform. Seriously everything runs through here. This scares me MAJORLY because who knows... What if they take down FiveM next? They've also now taken away money from LEGITIMATE PLAYERS for "being modders"...I've spent over 1000hrs combined in this game from PS3 to Xbox One to PC. No more will that happen.The online was already cancerous with overpriced in game items in online lack of online to singleplayer content and overall garbage business practices since the game released in 2013 but this is taking it WAY too far. This is straight up thievery and multiple other reviewers have proof. you Take Two I'd suggest every single one of you who have bought the game to boycott it and for those who haven't to hold off on the purchase at least until they get their together.Take Two is performing to the community the equivalent of having a beautiful baby nurturing it for 2 3 years and then ing drowning it in a lake because it's "causing them too much trouble". "They don't want to take care of it". off.Sincerely a mother ing off fan. . UPDATE 6/25/17 R* has sent out a newsletter basically saying "we ed up". However someone on Reddit who is an actual lawyer debunked their jargin and basically summed up all those complex words to "we aren't doing and we can still remove mods if we want lolololol". Still boycotting Rockstar Take Two until we get official confirmation that they'll back off and quit ing over their fans. OpenIV's site is back but nothing is still available for installation yet and the Liberty City converter has been canceled to my knowledge. UPDATE 9/3/17 So the dust has settled and OpenIV is back. My recommendation will stay at a negative and it's purely because of R*'s business practices. They're getting WAY too greedy about the Online portion of their game and as a result are ruining what little fan base they still had. The Bikers' update is a less effective version of the Finance &amp Felony update. The Import/Export is an add on to Finance &amp Felony with just different ways to make money and break your keyboard. The Gunrunning update is literally a reskin of Biker update but with some new polish. It also pays cash so bunkers are useless. The Smuggling update is a reskin of the Import/Export update an expansion to the Gunrunning update and once again pays less. UPDATE 9/10/17 Aaaaaand Rockstar has done it again. Multiple legitimate players have had their hard earned in game cash stripped from them. Thousands of hours were lost because of the at Rockstar. I'm not ever buying a Take Two product again and you should do the same. This is straight up thievery no exaggeration. They. Are. Stealing. From. Their. Fans.In conclusion Buy for Singleplayer Don't buy for Online.Buy it for the modding communityand for FiveM not because ofR*'s terrible business decisions.It'd be a lot less complicated to just not buy it at all though. Actually just don't buy anything with the label "Rockstar".

review: There is no better storymode in any game. Online is pretty awesome at first but the grind itself is medium heavy. Add to it the fact that there is no light killing. If you try to pvp between mission cooldowns (which are absurdly pointless as far as i can tell) you'll respawn right next to them or they'll respawn right next to you and it'll take much more time than you wanted it to. This is a vehicle sandbox first and foremost but they're trying to make it an rpg. Even working the highest paying solo profession (CEO possible 75 80k every 40 mins) you wont be able to afford the cool stuff for a fairly laborous grind mixed with loading screens that take a good chunk of your experience hackers that pop in and make you swap servers and endure another (5 10 min) loading screen and causing you to abandon your current mission that you just spent 35 mins on and now have to abandon your meager reward. Weird NPC's that yell "You're boring!" and "You're not creative!" which isnt so much a problem as just strange. It can work on low end systems with still very good graphics but all in all I havent gotten much enjoyment or fulfillment for my time. I give the thumbs up to those who havent played yet. I think you'll enjoy the entire story and a good start into online at least. And that to me is worth buying a game. However if you're buying for online alone I would say that the work and wait isnt worth the next vehicle.

review: I'm up to over 1000 hours in this game so I figured it's about time I write a review. Overal it's a great game and definetly worth buying in my opinion. It's got great graphics story mode is always fun and playing online is great when you've got a couple friends you can do anything with. While it's a great game such a well known game attracts a lot of people and unfortunatly most sessions I've joined have had at least one modder in them. Not all modders are pschotic killers or random banners some actually mod to get rid of the modders who do but it's still a bit of a pain to be flying down a busy road and sudenly be ejected from your car. If you're thinking about getting it I'd suggest it (although sales happen often so you may want to wait)... but if you're going to play online make sure you find a few people who are reliable friends.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The story is amazing and the story version of the game is fantastic. Aside from a couple of incredibly painful missions with no connection to the narritive (Yoga why?) The story was incredible.The online version isn't worth playing. At all. For any reason. It seems like anyone can take control of the menu (since almost every game I've joined has immediately gone into a loading screen) and they can trap you in very long games which aren't explained in any way you just kinda have to hope they're easy to figure out or that you're on a team with someone who has done it before. There are way too many missions which 'seem' available yet are actually just places where you can 'start' an event. Having these out in the world probably seemed like a good idea but in practise a menu would be much simpler for those have more functionality be faster take up less loading time etc etc. The UI takes ages to load and doesn't feel intuitive to use there are lots of random keys across the keyboard that control these features. The 4 or 5 different mission types aren't exciting they're all the same damn thing in different places whoopy de do da. Its laggy as hell players constantly glitch out and reappear bullets dont hit their mark explosives dont go off missiles and RPG's swerve or vanish for no reason.When you do finally find something that looks semi decent or something that you can do solo without waiting for players you can't communicate with (can't get any kind of voice cumminication to work just fragments of audio playing randomely) It feels much harder than it needs to be. I did a mission about a dozen times before I came to accept that there was simply no way to succeed without playing with others why was solo play even a damn option if it makes completeing the mission impossible?If you accidentally sign up for something you don't want to do you get punished for it. You either have to complete the 'job' whatever it is or bail and get called a 'bad sport' or something which gives you some kind of stigma in game. This wouldn't be so bad if the UI was in any way user friendly which it isn't. The way the game loads you into a 'free roam mode' then after you select any mission it holds you in some extra menu you can't seem to access any other way is extremely annoying. It takes a very long time to load anything you have to pay close attention to the bottom right corner of the screen because sometimes it loads a window with only a couple of seconds to make a selection sometimes it gives you 2 minutes and there seems to be absolutely no indidcation which mission will have which delay before starting.Completely dissapointed with the online experience. If the main story missions hadn't given me 30 40 hours of amazng gameplay (which they did nothing to complain about with the campaign) I'd want a refund and I probably wouldn't be buying anymore Rockstar games. So many things need to be either completely reworked for the Online game to be considered an actually game. ATM it's just crappy free roam version of the story without the story coupled with some really annoying menu's and sloooow load times.I really wish I could make two reviews here one for the online experience and one for the story. One was amazing and one was completely worthless.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Вы готовы встретиться с ГТА? Тогда Вас ожидают постоянные перестрелки уникальные погони с применением самых разных крутых тачек а главное это полное беззаконие которое царит везде на всех улицах. Твоя роль проста придётся быть гражданином не имеющим совести которому можно делать всё ведь нарушение любых законов здесь приветствуется. Тем самым будет идти постепенное погружение в преступный мир. Но игровой процесс не прост как может показаться от начала игры. Особенно интересна и сложна последняя версия ГТА 5.В новейшей версии этой игры придётся выполнять квесты справляться с угнанными автомобилями а главное постоянно думать как укрыться от представителей полиции. Кроме обычных версий легковых моделей можно будет угнать большую фуру моторную лодку и вертолёт! Можно будет развлечься с помощью захвата полицейской или машины скорой помощи чтобы ощутить вкус роли полицейского или работникам медицинской службы. Уже нравится? Начали думать а когда же появится эта новая часть об этом можно узнать на Нашем сайте. Здесь же Вы можете узнать где и собственно как её скачивать а также и новые системные требования для ГТА 5.Игра не будет скучной так как разработчики создают соответствующее музыкальное сопровождение которое создано под стиль города и текущей ситуации Вашего персонажа. Отличный плюс игры представлен её озвучиванием которое улучшает общее качество игры. Этот плюс игры появляется только в её третьей части. А до этого внедрения использовали текстовые описания выводимые на экран. В новой версии GTA V предлагается реалистичная отработка всех элементов каждая мелочь удивляет уровнем отработки. Созданы общие текстуры города можно видеть живую атмосферу в виде свободных передвижений других персонажей которые как бы живут своей жизнью и занимаются своими делами. Такой стиль игры позволит Тебе полностью погрузиться в атмосферу этого придуманного города где Тебе даётся шанс создания карьеры в среде криминального мира который впоследствии не захочется покидать.Собственно и главная задача на основе сценария этой игры ГТА 5 строится на цели постепенного продвижения и задуманного карьерного роста от обычного бандита с улиц до местного главаря. Для продвижения предлагаются различные квесты но помимо этого допустимо свободное исследования этого мира. Город предлагает наличие заведений которые можно посещать. Спортзал поможет в повышении физических характеристик а в баре можно будет как бы расслабится.Под каждую из игр GTA 5 создавали уникальный город. Иногда предлагали реальные города типа Лос Анджелеса Лондона а также и Манчестера но были и вымышленные. Вымышленная версия города Вайс Сити создаётся на основе города Майами а версия Сан Фиерро была создана с применением основы от города Сан Франциско. Собственно были и прочие города. Каждый из предложенных проектов получает свой уникальный индивидуальный сценарий на основе отлично проработанной сюжетной линии. За счёт всех этих качеств и качественной работы команды делающей игры из серии GTA пять они смогли достичь таких показателей успешности и признания. Теперь игры из серии ГТА 5 известны во всём мире и уже мало кто не пробовал играть в них.Интересно то что в ГТА 5 создатели предусмотрели возможность игры на основе телефона или планшета. Дата появления игры на ПК ещё не открыта но данная игра уже появилась для Xbox и также Sony Playstation 4. Собственно на Нашем сайте уже есть прохождение пятой части этой игры grand theft auto 5 а также и всевозможные читы к ней. Желаем Вам поскорее окунутся в мир преступности этой игры чтобы получить возможность собственного видения управления предложенным городом.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Everyone in the reviews section are pis'd off over the hack protection in GTA Online and give negative reviews. I mean yeah even I'd be angry if they ban the victim from Online permanently but that being said I didn't understand why no one recommends the game for the story mode.First of all I agree that the price is rather high... which is the reason I bought the game when it was on sale at 50% off (give or take a few %). For the sale price the game was well worth the cost. I absolutely enjoyed the story mode and if you're a perfectionist kind of guy you can get a lot of hours from this game.On a side note the graphics optimization is AMAZING. Sleeping Dogs (not Definitive Edition) lags at medium settings on my PC but this game works without any lag at all. If you have an NVidia GeForce GPU I recommend you download the GeForce Experience to optimize the graphics settings for the game for maximum FPS.GTA Online is something fun as well. Though it depends on your attitude with regards to online games in general. One of the hardest things to do in online is to go for a slow relaxing stroll without getting killed. Passive mode helps but it restricts many things. But you'll get used to it eventually. However Online is quite a bit of a grind. The process is literally do something get money spend money do something again because you don't have enough money to even spend it properly get more money finally spend it and then realize you don't have enough to use it on something actually nice and end up spending it on something ugly.Overall I'd say the game is well worth it. You can squeeze hundreds of hours from the game until (if you don't) you get banned anyway so I'd say it's worth it. If it's on sale then even better.

review: GTA V is perhaps one of the best single player experiences of all time. The only thing that ruins that is microtransactions in the multiplayer. This means that the single player is unquestionably lessened by the lack of essential components of the GTA experience. Some people added some of this content to the single player through mods. In order to combat this horrible threat that is stopping Take Two interactive from nickel and diming every customer they have sent a cease and desist to the creators of the Open IV mod framework the basis of nearly every GTA mod. Modding has always been an important thing for the GTA series and this move by Take Two not only destroys many innovative and creative mods for GTA V which in no way infringe on multiplayer content but also effectively destroys the GTA IV modding scene as well due to all Open IV content being included under the cease and desist. Effectively a good game that was already ruined by multiplayer exclusive content has just signed it's own death sentence by destroying a key part of the single player replayability and arguably the only reason people who own the console versions would ever buy the PC version. If this behavior is indicative of future actions by Take Two I worry for the future of Kerbal Space Program.

review: GTA V I could still remember the teaser about this game during the later years of GTA IV. It was so beautiful I was worried if my measly GTX 670 could play it. But GTA V runs smoothly with decent settings on my card and I'm nearly finished with the game. It was a great adventure and I'm already looking forward to the next one. Hopefully I can finally upgrade my rig so that I can replay this game again on Ultra and to be ready for the next one. Oh Rockstar please tell us there's a next one!But before all that I'd be spending time playing GTA Online. I've heard multiple horror stories about hackers but I think Rockstar is doing all they can to sort the problem out and leave legit players to enjoy the game.I recommend this game to everyone that enjoys mayhem especially if you enjoy it's predecessors. It has a pretty mediocre storyline length but with all the extra activities to do in the game you won't feel that at all.

review: Over 200 Hours in this game and I havent wrote a review already!Well then I shall do it todayGTA V(Grand Theft Auto V) is an open world game that takes place in the fictional city of Los Santos(Based off of Los Angeles) and San Andreas(California) and claims to be on the West Coast of the United States even though its an island(You can find that out on some radio stations where they mention "West Coast is the Best Coast")Story Mode Is it even worth it? Shall I even start this?Well before we start yes I have completed the story so I did not spoil anything for myself!Anyways It starts off in North Yankton with Michael and Trevor robbing a bank and then Michael fakes his death then it starts getting repetitive after that.Why I say its repetitive is because here is how the story works ProlougeFranklin MissionMichael MissionHeistTrevor MissionHeistRandom MissionHeistAnother Random MissionHeistYou Guessed ItHeistGranted Again"BIG" HeistWhat ever ending you chooseThe story is a little of the same which could sound bad to you but I really like the way it is played!What I mean by that is when you play Story Mode missions it feels like a movie to you and a plus to that is Los Santos and San Andreas(Mostly Los Santos) is heavily based off of its real counter parts.What I don't like about the story is that Michael and Trevor ALWAYS ARGUE together and Franklin has to ALWAYS break them up and I find that really annoying. You'll see what I mean when you play the game.I also think they tried too hard on making a short story on Franklin before the heist missions take place.Lets keep it short Franklin wants to get out of the Hood Life &lt They already did that with CJ from GTA San Andreas(Another Great Game BTW) but with Franklin it only lasts like two missions unlike CJ where you go small than go big!Thats another think I like/hate about Story ModeDepending on the Player you ethier want everything to be easy or you want to feel like you've done something in your life while getting a BIG reward at the same time.Me? Well I could really care less since I just like to enjoy a nice story/gaming experience so its your personal preference!Freeroam(Both GTAV/GTAOnline) There are a bunch of things that you can do during freemode but ill list some that could be fun and the most common Cop chases on the Highways(Probably best to do it on the I 2 or Los Santos Freeway since that leads to the desert)Doing the Skyfall cheat(Single Player Only)Getting together with friends(Online)There are endless possibilities but do what you want!Conclusion If you want a good online gaming experience with friends then get this gameIf you want a good modding experience with nice cars get this gameIf you want a ok racing experience packed with others than this is a recommendationIf you want to play a game with action movie like content than get this gameIf you want to make animated movies this game makes that easyIf you want to like to drive cars around get this gameif your like nice cars in general get this gameIf you want a story where you go big get GTA San AndreasIf you want a diverse gmod online experience get GTA San AndreasIf you want to cheat and use hacks online get MinecraftIf you want to play as a black man and get arested at the beginning of the game and eat fried chicken to heal yourself get GTA San AndreasIn the end its up to you!

review: GTA V is still a really good game but it's online component is absolutely ruined by and insane grind and microtransactions. This whole review I'm only going to talk about GTAO so take note of that.GTA Online is a really good idea that works pretty well for the most part and gets content constantly so where does it fall apart? It's a utterly massive grind at this point. When the game was first released there wasn't much to do or buy and with a good amount of play time you'd be able to buy anything you wanted. Slowly more content started getting released and all that content came with new vehicles that had huge price tags. More and more vehicles were over the $1 Million mark which took a decent amount of playing to earn. The problem is that Heists still paid the same and they don't pay well in the current GTAO "economy."In order to make larger sums of money you have to invest in expensive buildings and their payout is slow and tedious though more than what Heists will give you in the same amount of time. You can also upgrade these buildings to net you more profit but the prices on the upgrades will cost you several times more than the initial investment on the property. It's absurd.It's great that Rockstar keeps adding content but most of it is entirely inaccessible to new players and the stuff that is (missions and new Heists) get really boring after a couple times. For instance the newest hottest car is the versatile "Deluxo" which is modelled after the Delorian from Back to the Future with the ability to fly and shoot missiles it's a really cool piece of kit. The problem is that the pricetag at over $3 million unless you've been grinding since the beginning or buy Shark Cards and new player won't be enjoying it for a long time. That doesn't even include it's ridiculously priced upgrades.Now we move to the Shark Cards Rockstar's bread and butter. The reason everything is so overpriced is because they want you to buy their Shark Cards to skip most of the grind and get in game money via microtransactions. It's a disgusting business practice but here we are. The Shark Cards also aren't even worth the money $20 will net you $1.250 Million in game so if you want that Deluxo and you don't have much? I'll cost you over $40. $40 real world dollars for a SINGLE vehicle without any upgrades. The sad part is that it's working as Rockstar's revenue is mostly powered by these Shark Card purchases.My complaints also extend into normal gameplay XP it trickle fed and a lot of clothes upgrades and items are barred behind your player level and you won't get to access everything in the game until you hit 120. At 145 hours of gameplay (all in multiplayer mind you) I'm in the mid 60s because gaining XP is a slow process.There you have it the base game is really fun but Rockstar ruined what this game had going for it. Earning money is a super tedious process because they want you to just buy it. I wouldn't mind if earning money was faster and more enjoyable (seriously doing the same Heists and missions over and over is incredibly boring) or that if you just got money from messing around with your friends and blowing stuff up in the freeroam (which is the only reason I keep playing) but that'll net you absolutely nothing. If you just want to mess around with friends it's a blast but just don't look at the cool weapons and vehicles that you could be enjoying unless you like blowing a lot of money.

Single player is amazing and worth it for that alone.Multiplayer is amazing too but requires patience practice and friends to get the most out of it.Modders can be a hassle but there are ways around dealing with them. Randoms can be incompetent or hostile but friendly crews are always recruiting and hosting non adversarial lobbies. Lots of the goodies are in game money expensive but there's no shortage of ways to make cash if you've got the time.Doesn't take anything to jump into. Rank &amp Cash don't provide a massive advantage to veteran players.I love it and if you've loved any of the other gta games you'll probably love this one too.

review: If you are looking for building an empire online good luck. You can't turn off PvP in the open story online mode. Not if you want to be a CEO or owner of property. However if you liked getting killed repeatedly by the children in this game then go right ahead and go get killed over and over.If you are looking for a solo story game then maybe you'll like it. The missions are tricky sometimes and might take 2 6 tries. The controls... don't get me started. Each button on the controller is mapped to two different things. Have fun with that. It's okay for very casual playing but the controls seem overly complicated. Rockstar look into have a button open a menu of choices.Overall the story line in single player is pretty good. I don't mind a swear word every sentence. Not sure how they don't get in trouble with the thousands of times saying the N word. Anyways the story is good idea is good no open game play if you don't like getting ganked.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

The online aspect of this game is a breaht of fresh air as it allows u to race and have fun with your friends in an open world it also allows u to live a lavish lifestyle whilst having fun. Problem 1 if u have no firends to play with (me) the game will soon become stale if u sit on it all day.

review: Sonic 3D Blast also known as Sonic 3D Flickies' Island in Europe is isometric take on a mix of Sonic platforming serving as a spinoff to the franchise and Flicky collecting'n'leading hot action. It was developed by Travellers Tales and Sonic Team former doing main programmer job while latter came with game design ideas and some more. Well they did want Sonic 3 to be isometric to begin with. Also riding on whole pre rendered trend that went hip with Donkey Kong Country. Published by Sega in 1996 in the West only. 32 Megabit ROM the biggest that Sega Genesis can see at a single time.There also were Saturn and PC versions made near the end of development of this supposed Genesis swan song replacing the cancelled Sonic X Treme. Saturn had improved graphics redbook soundtrack different actual 3D special stages analog input. It's technically the best version. PC version was similar but lacked few graphics and had 2D parody of special stages yet had autosave feature.Sonic Blast on Game Gear is a different game despite fitting in marketing wise.The game that you have here is nothing more than emulation of Sega Genesis version.I don't usually talk about mods but Director's Cut exists and it was made by game's main programmer so it's sorta semi official. None the less back to what Sega gives us there.Now technical part about Sega's emulation here The Sega Classic games that you purchase on Steam count as DLCs for "Sega Mega Drive &amp Genesis Classics" game that should appear in your library.It has Bedroom HUB which is the one with many features yet lags for many and Simply Launcher which lacks Workshop and Online but at least it works just fine for everybody.However Simple Launcher has it's fair share of glitches as well. It can crash. And it does the second time you go to main menu so always quit after saving there so it doesn't crash when you want to save next time!Emulation itself mostly sound isn't that good but it does it's job. Also yes emulator supports quick saves.As alternative you can use external emulator to run games that you purchased. Sega kindly placed in all games that you purchased in "uncompressed ROMs" folder that program itself doesn't use just change file extension to ".bin" or so. The file for this one being "SONIC3D_UE.68K".I also demand you to read digital manual of this game first. You can find it here on store page or go to "manuals" folder of game root and open "S3DB_MG_EFIGS_US.pdf".Robotnik has discovered that Flickies on Flickies's Island can actually travel between dimensions by using huge rings. So he trapped them all in Badnik robots to search for Chaos Emeralds. These robots aren't any different no dimension travel there. Sonic is back here and ready to save em all while his two gang members chill around.The core gameplay keeps the Sonic formula going. You can run around and you can jump. Seeing how it's isometric it has a separate button that you can roll with. Or spindash if standing still. You still defeating enemies by either jumping or rolling. Albeit using slopes by rolling doesn't play a big role here at all these are weak slopes. The controls have some inertia to it pleasently. Too bad Sonic can't immediately turn 180 degrees around he does a small circle. Still uses rings health system where as long as you have any rings you will survive a hit but then you have to recover all the scattered rings.It's a rather forgiving pleasant take on isometric style. You can run in all 8 directions. It hides nothing important behind walls. There are shadows for everything. The floor always has checkered tiles so you can measure borders are clearly defined. While Sonic is a bit too fast the game doesn't require much precision platforming. Well there are few but you can cheese most of them by using nearby spring pad or so. The levels are varied as well some having sorta puzzle elements. Spinning pads are great on the second zone.Protip You can break ice spikes in Diamond Dust by rolling into them.Powerups are back through breakable monitors. Invincibility extra life speed up so on. By the way Sonic icons that aren't in monitors aren't extra lives by medals. Collect 10 of them and you will get a continue. There are shields each giving you extra hit against normal stuff. Blue one is immune electricity red shields protects from fire golden one gives you active ability where you do Protip Get a red shield in a Volcano Valley or die.Each zone has two acts along with a boss one. The first two acts are divided into two three stages. And in each stage you have to save five flickies. That means there are only five badniks in a stage and most of them are static non threats. Not too exciting. At least game somewhat makes up with stage hazards. But the game is still too easy. Then you break those robots and have to grab birds. This is where Flicky inspiration comes in. The birds will follow you in a line and they can be broken off with projectiles after which they scatter around. It worked in Flicky which was a tight 2D game where you constantly get chased by cats you would die if they touch you and simply scatted lines of flickies if they touch those. With risk reward applied as you got score by bringing in bigger lines and that would lead to getting extra lives in a tough game. Here? Not a tight design it's just there. Projectiles may throw birds off but that just happens not something you pay attention to. Collecting birds over lava is pain. There is too much space nothing chasing you. Yea. It's just there just making you spend a bit more time in levels and thus isn't exciting.There is usual optional quest for 7 Chaos Emeralds. Actually they look like Halls candies which would explain why Sonic can't turn into Super Sonic. Super makes games too easy anyway. You do get an extra final boss and good ending however that's good. To get an emerald you must find Tails or Knuckles first just chilling. Both of them appear in each act hiding or appearing somewhere in previous stage once you progress feel free to backtrack. Last appearing in Volcano Valley. It does mean you can get two emeralds per act one from each. You get extra life on repeat. Just give these fams 50 rings. Though they will take and store any amount so don't bump into them.After that you get into a special stage. You run over bridge collect rings and avoid bombs. It looks incredibly smooth the best on Mega Drive. Albeit gameplay is a bit plain and is too easy. Still fun.There are usual bosses. Robotnik every time. Most often you just wait for him to get down and hit him then avoid his stuff repeat. Varied health. Not bad but not too cool.Protip For Volcano Valley boss instead of trying to get into pipes first you should curve your jump off side floor to hit Robotnik then you will be bounced backward onto pipes.Not much options. Just sound test and controls. Bare minimum!As for graphics. Well. They tried to do DKC thing with prerendered sprites because it was still cool albeit 1996 was somewhat late. Which isn't the smartest thing to do on Genesis as compared to SNES it has low amount of colors. Still devs deserve some love for managing to create smooth vibrant world. And fitting intro FMV into Genesis cartridge is just awesome. Too bad that ending is just a bunch of images with text.Music is great too. Chiptune goodness the best from few composers on the project.Overall eh. Mixing Flicky and Sonic is a nice idea as evidenced by game like Wiz'n'Liz albeit that one was only somewhat Flicky. But this isometric execution of it is weak. I still wouldn't call it a bad game. Pick only if you want some chill isometric platformer.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: How can I be writing a bad review yet have bothered to play the game for 35 hours on PC after playing 100s on the PS3 simple they borked the online quite badly for this version.So far we have heists that fall apart if one person quits (happens a lot) can drop out due to poor network conditions if someone hosting has a terrible net setup and fails if one player does badly on their part of the mission.We also have issues with game hacks and missions that have completely skewed out the value of money in the game (saw my nephew run one player mission that awarded 2mil for a simple knife fight).Add to this that I have had ghost vehicle duplication in my garage and lost a tricked out motorbike worth $250k plus other vehicles when their game has not updated the garage correctly.Also first person mode nice idea but the car dashboard views in quite a few vehicles could have been designed far better and make driving arkward and the interior detail is not that good (plus its handling is a bit poor) plus I also get to see some of their low res textures up even closer really? theres some pretty poor texturing in many parts of the game not bad for a 60gb download.Finally they mentioned enhancements in the online features for the next gen and PC versions of which many have not appeared.I have hung onto the game hoping they would fix this stuff but instead on my last contact to rockstar support after vehicle loss all I get is a response 10 days later asking me to try more things that I already tried when it happened and sending them in some videos of me doing it. Ok rockstar provide me with a tardis to go back and take these vids and I will gladly do it I have played a fair bit since then and my garages have changed around (I was about to give up on support making any contact it was all wishful thinking anyway on my part).This game could have been so much better than it is its just a 60fps port with some graphic tweaks and some new glitches.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The amount of greed Rockstar/Taketwo demonstrates here makes EA seem like Buddha in comparison. title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Finished the game as a proud owner Worth it. 1000% and more haven't even started properly doing side hobbies This world is unique and worth any price you're willing to pay. Highly recommended It's a great single player story. Gigantic open world with many different things to do. IF you don't know San Andreas or Los Santos start at GTA San Andreas &gt it's old but the background story is good ol' fun for the build up to how wonderful GTA V Is today.Online.. is a different story. You are bombarded with things to do people to kill opportunities to make a buck. What's even better is Rockstar sponsoring you money after multiple log in to help you find a place to live buy occupy run a business from turn into a night club. Have your own freaks &amp geeks events.The world is literally yours. Don't buy money boosters etc. You can earn a lot early on just get to level 15 to kick off joining the motorcycle club I haven't come across 'hackers' yet maybe im too new but I have definitely found those people that harrass you till you leave the server. It's difficult to make friends with people that launch RPG's from their hover bikes at you. Car insurance is a must. hahah.i pirated this game years ago and it was time to support the Rockstart team. Thanks. It's a wonderfully immersive escape from reality game. Even single player.My top tip for quickest load into Online. Load into Single PLayer and then go online from the in game menu. Not the menu screen when you start the game.

review: I am late to the party but I finally got a GPU in my PC allowing me to play all these games from the past couple of years that have caught my interest. GTA V being one of them it has not disappointed so far! I have played about 10 hours and it is just incredible. The last GTA experience I had was Vice City (which was excellent for its time imo) but there is just no comparison. The huge open world of GTA V the freedom and different choices to make along with excellent voice overs and story make this game a must play. After I complete the story mode I will be interested in checking out online. So far so good though! Next up is Witcher 3!

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Rockstar Games presents G R A N D T H E F T A U T O VI bought total of 3 same games. One for PS3 when game first came out and later one for PC and I thought it would activate on my steam but nope. Turns out for Rockstar Social Club... So I bought this here on steam. 270+ dollars worth of these games and you know what? It's worth every penny of it. Back in 2013 when GTA V first released that was a mistake. WHY ON SEPTEMBER?? Back to school that's why. So when I bought that game I used to spend all the night playing on it and used to fake sick on school to play it. I used to work at a printing workshop and I made myself a huge poster of GTA V cover on my room and it's still there. Its story is glorious. There are some people whining SA is better they're total dumbasses. But to me compared to SA the only thing I loved about SA that did better than V is one thing The locations. There are no dams or those arches or even Las Venturas. That was a perfect opportunity to do it to make the game feel more like the real world and perfect photography and gameplay. PROS It's on Steam now! I never thought Rockstar gave a crap on Steam but thank God the game is on steam. It's impossible I didn't believe it.On PC!! Yup I'd rather have GTA on PC rather than Red Dead series. It's so much better and so SO much beautiful.One of the best written storyline gamesFirst person view!!! Finally I can replay the game in first person!Dynamic loading technology. Holy This is one of the most best video game tech I have ever seen in my existence. For example. During the game it has slightly no loading. Like when you're on a mission and go there and head there. The animations play without loading at all. Or loading screens. Holy crap.Well chosen musics / SoundtracksGood multiplayer &amp co op. Multiplayer was added from an update within a month since the game's release and it came out with the boom. I forgive them for not adding a heist stated from the online trailer it was added a year later. And many things like shark cards and grind... I don't really play much online but do replayed lots and lots of storymode multiple times.Very well optimized. This game can even run on old computers! WTFFFFF... Seriously no matter what Rockstar do I will still support them until the end. I never knew this is possible. The game looks graphically stunning and is extremely well optimized. Unlike IV. That damn game is about 10+ years old and run by today's most powerful video cards and cpus and the game still runs like poop even with the new update.ENHANCED EDITION!! It's soo much better than previous versions (consoles)InteractionsComedy. I spent many time ing around with the protagonists' life and family and they have really funny dialogues. The radio too and the shows."Web sites"Customization. For the first time Rockstar finally added costumization for guns and for cars after years. The last time they had a game with car costumization was 2004's GTA San Andreas. No wonder why didn't they add it on IV.Support &amp updatesBad assery / Memorable scenesMods!DLCs are all free expect microtransactionsCONS Death of legendary OG characters (etc Johnny)Franklin is a lame character. I loved T and M but to be honest Franklin is boring. He doesn't like fun no personality and is too serious. Michael and Trevor does everything for him and at the end he betrayed one of them optionally at the end. (no point off taken)No offline mode. WTF WHY NOT!? NOT EVERYONE HAVE INTERNET GOD DAMNIT!The cops make the game unplayable.No huge dams! and beautiful arches. Why! The dams that look gigantic and have lights on them is really beautiful. They dont' have them. And the natural arches... damn.The cars in the game are a joke. I hate the models of it. Look at any other games like Watch Dogs they're so much better.No Las Venturas.. casinos..No weight or muscle features from GTA SA so when they added 3 unique characters it means they'll sacrifice your costumization. Because these 3 characters change their clothes for example all the time. Your character in Online does but... it's online.Every single GTAO characters look exactly the same. The same body weight the same head the same.. everything. It's just the skin color and hair features... Why? Maintenance. EVERY single time I start play online IT ALWAYS ends with maintenance error within a day. First mission. Yeah sure busting out doing heist is fun but when you do it for the 10000th time you're ing done. There's no way to skip this.9.5/10Literally one of the most popular most favorite game and the third the best selling game of all time.I can only hope Rockstar make another good GTA game soon. And get released on PC WITH the release. otherwise I'll be mad (

review: So I decided to get this game cause it was half off pretty good deal I thought. Upon downloading the 62GB game I get about 10 minutes into the prologue and it crashes. At first I thought it was the graphics I was running the game at so I toned down the settings a tad get back into prologue CRASH. I then spend the next hour and a half researching why this POS game wont work. Tried MULTIPLE things to make the crashes and fail loads stop NOTHING WORKED. I thought to myself well maybe I can get a refund atleast since I only played about maybe 3 hours at that point? Sent a refund request. DENIED. Now I'm stuck with a game that crashes every in 10 20 mins and I'm also out 35 dollars. I do NOT recommend this game at all. Biggest waste of money I've probably ever spent on a game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: After nagging my parents for weeks to let me buy this game despite the matrue themes of it (I was 14 at the time) they finally let me buy Grand Theft Auto V in May of 2014. After I first installed the game on my Xbox 360 me and my friends played the Online Mode for the rest of the day. I was absolutely entrigued by how innovative it was for the time it came out. Mass multiplayer huge open world gameplay etc. By the end of summer 2014 I had clocked in an unhealthy 350 HOURS into the online mode. It was ridiculous looking back on it now but at the time it was the most fun I've had in a long time. It was so insane and breathtakingly fun that I was unable to put it down and I had the best time with my friends in jobs and in open play. It was and still is the best game I have ever played barnone.When I got the PC version just last year I was ready to enjoy the new features of next gen and improved graphics compared to the Xbox 360. I clocked in about 50 hours or so in the last year that I've had it. And I can tell you it is not worth the $60. Unless you have never played this game before or you are brand new to the open world game I just don't see the reason why you would really need it. If you've already played it on prior consoles like I have (not the next gen consoles) there really isn't a point in buying the game. Not too much has been added to it that really imporved it that much. The only thing that I would argue is worth it is the Heists but that's only fun for about three hours until you quit because no one wants to join the lobby. The players are still d*ckweeds the community is still trash and Rockstar hasn't done much to fix annoying things like this. As far as I know the issue where people are being banned for absolutely no reason at all is still present which has been an issue since this game was released for the PC in 2015. Rockstar hasn't fixed this issue in TWO YEARS! There is no excuse for ignorance over issues like that. Another thing that has upset me is that Rockstar continues to implement extremely expensive items like $10 million yachts and planes. Are you serious? I know that they are luxury items but unless you either play the missions for YEARS or spend $500 on Shark Cards you will never be able to afford an item like that. I've put in about 400 total hours or so and I have amounted about $4 million. 2/5 off of even a decent yacht. It's absolutely ridiculous. I have not had enough experience in the campaign mode to recommend it to you. I really didn't want to play it as the Online was too much fun to quit. As far as I have heard it is quite a bit of fun but most people who buy the game immediatley play the Online once done with the campaign. Now as I mentioned before this game is fantastic for people who haven't played it before but for anyone looking for an upgrade from Xbox 360 or PS4 they should sadly avoid it. It is sad to say but it is too disappointing to buy. There is no reason to buy this game unless you want to experience it for the first time.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So yeah I've got about 300+ hours in GTA V. About 10 15 hours of it I want to say was put into the Campaign on my PS3 then my PC. I loved the Online in this game when I could play it That didn't really last all that long though when I started up the connection was poor like real poor That got fixed somewhat at some point even with decent internet. Not that I really complained as I had substandard internet then.The Story itself is fun even if it is horridly underwhelming with the lack of content put into the Singleplayer once they worked out they could milk us for all our worth with Shark Cards online Many things in the story were essentially left open only like 5 Heists tops be the end to "Level up" our crews in the game.The Online community at best was trash You can't explore the map or do things like armored trucks without at least 8 people on a server Same with all of the other random events unless you can get a server of friends together you're not gonna get to do much short of mill around doing the jobs that pay about $0*0 Things in the game are expensive as hell that need you to get a Party of 4 people together so you can do the Heists YOU NEED Friends to play this game for anything fun.The variety of vehicles is great as I said BUT Again you cant get all the features in the Singleplayer experience Something I got relegated to after a Permanent Ban I know how I got the Ban Not going to argue it because the games really not worth the effort anymore I have no friends to play it and the community still has a tonne of hackers that can strip you of your weapons for being a big enough problem for them after they come at you in a car they also have the means to mass flag you for a Nice and quick ban. Are all the people who get banned guilty? Not really is the game worth getting unbanned on? hell no.I just pray Red Dead Redemption 2 isn't as Cancer as this ended up being.Rating Literally don't buy this game if you don't own it it's not worth it./10 Vindictator1972

review: There are a few problems to be Ironed out. I'd prefer to be able to save at any point in the game but waddya gonna do? Graphics are better than just acceptable They are EXCELLENT! I'm getting 60fps using both of my GTX650TI SLI. It see's all 4096mb of VRAM and the game is using about 3gb total. The cards are running about 80 85C and both fans are HOWLING. I just realize I've been playing this game for about 9 hours today. Not sorry I spent the money!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game needs no review by now... All I can say is Rockstar did it well! I'm not even a little bit sorry of the 60 I payed for it. The action the driving the humor and the world and all the live tha comes with it... All the explorations... al the little touches like wet clothes... All the interesting and beautifull locations... The World is actually bigger than I expacted at first... At 62 hours spent in game I havent even tried out the Movie editor and I spent maybe 1h in online... I think there has not yet been a game with such great price/content ratio... no monthly fees no t micro transactions... Just good old GTA )Oh another thing that amazed me... I was expecting for the game to be well optimized since I read that this is taken care of by the same team that did it in Max Payne 3. But to have most of the stuff on High Very High some on Ultra even and still run the game on 1080p with no problems on my 5 years old PC (I5 750 8GB DDR3 1333 HD7870)! The only the investment that I did on my PC since 2009 was 1 year ago with getting a HD7870 for 90 and additional 4GB DDR3 1333 for 30... I'm still blown away sometimes how beautifull it can look and that this is running smoothly on my PC ) Just for comparasement Sleeping dogs for example looked worse the world was smaller and alot more boring and for sure it did not felt so real the gameplay got repetitive really quick I had to run that game on Mendium and not even sure if I was able to run it normally on 1080p.GTAV is a game that belongs into every gamers library. 9/10 at minimum!

review: Although playing online can be a pain either just full of russians screaming down their mic or you get in with hackers but however when you get in a decent session it is a really great time. Money making can be difficult so you may have to grind some missions or heists. Now you could buy shark cards for real money or just find a hacker that gives out money not saying the second one won't get you banned. Rockstar did just add a transaction tracker that stops you picking up money off the floor after you have picked up a lot. They may be able to take that money back or even ban you for having modded in money.Single player however is a lot of fun i haven't completed it on PC but i did on the xbox 360 so the improvements in graphics and the abilitiy of first person will improve the experience. The story of all 3 characters are different as you know there is Michael Trevor and Franklin. My favourite is the loonatic Trevor the first time you get to play as him after the prologue you realise that he is a total nutter. Even getting the game for story will give you many hours of play time. Yes they did say they were going to release some story DLC but the demand is more in GTAOnline so thats where they have spent their time. This game deffinetly deserves 10/10.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: "As far back as I can remember I always wanted to be a gangster. To me being a gangster was better than being President of the United States. To me it meant being somebody in a neighborhood that was full of nobodies. They weren't like anybody else. I mean they did whatever they wanted. They double parked in front of a hydrant and nobody ever gave them a ticket. In the summer when they played cards all night nobody ever called the cops."GTA V allows me to be my own gangster amass wealth and influence for myself GTA Online has to get my first bit of this review I think it's awesome I have enjoyed all the content thus far the only reason I would want to pester Rockstar for more heists is because of how much I enjoy the ones they have given me.The whole online atmosphere though the ability to foster your own style of criminal enterpriser is flat out fun.The story holy crap have I enjoyed the story Michael Franklin and Trevor all have elements of what I've loved from the past GTA's and I don't think I've enjoyed a story line like this from GTA since the first chapter of GTA III. The story kept me wanting more and after playing with the classic gangster the gangsta and the hill billy wrecking ball ( I say that lovingly) It really helped me mold my own style when I persued my own efforts in GTA online.These guys had me literally laughing out loud had me playing continuously for hours because I wanted to see what came next all the cut scenes are good and the in game dialouge from the characters kept me chuckling and attentive. Attention to detail for this game +++++I dont know I feel like im blathering a bit really at this point I want to go play more. This game is easily worth $60. Thank you Rockstar.

review: Grant THeft Auto V. The cherry on the cake. The pinnacle of free roam full of crimes and cars games. It's awesome. Even though it will eat 64 GB of your (pretty precious) memory. It's jam packed with action midnight races idiots weirdos and drugs. It's a showcase of how real the problems in our world are.Anyways let's talk about the game.The First Person View is interesting as long as you don't enter a car. If you do you will notice that there are only about five interiors shrinked or enlarged so that they would look like they're all different.Yes you can go up to 8K (if you have a nice monitor and you computer stands both the resoultion and the stress (heat).Except for all of those there's nothing new. It's just an updated version of the 2013 or 2014 GTAV versions.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is a fantastic game whether you just want to chill and ride motorbikes up buildings run a heist or just go rampaging and kill everyone! The story line was enjoyable and I felt the characters had good development and twists. My rating 8.5/10 Great! If a few bugs are fixed I'll upgrade the rating. The loading is terrible though and I would hope that they fix the black screen of waiting forever at the end of heists allow you to pickup new members or finish the heist with less as it's terrible considering the loading involved in heists and people leaving all the time!The online community is mostly pretty awesome! There is a troll here or there but in general I find it to be a great community with one major exemption to it God mode script kiddies they aren't about all the time but they can really ruin a good server or ruin fights for people by making it impossible to win. Other than that and the loading time/being able to pick up new members when one drops from heists and a few other little things are a tad annoying but usually I'm having too much fun to care! I had a blast in the single player and online with over 500 hours I still quite enjoy coming on to try to figure out the Mt. Chiliad mystery or any other silly things I come up with.

review: All you'll find in this game is a amazing 10 hour singleplayer and a dull soulcrushing repetitious grind in the addition of GTA Online Where you'll spend hours a week grinding 5 to 10 thousand GTA$ a 30 minute mission to pay a 4 thousand hospital bill each time you die in hopes of chasing the all new DLC car priced at 30 hours game time I mean 2/3 million and the million dollar garage to store it if even that. Worst part all 50+ of the DLC cars can't be used in singleplayer. yep That new rocket car? gotta grind the whole weekend for that one or of course pay R* $20 for it by buying a shark card. Because that's their game now and business model now. To push as many people towards buying a $20/40/$100 dollar online currency pack to buy the latest overpriced novelity they've come up with. I say this as a player who OWNS all that novelity t and who has never been through "video game financial hardships" I hop on each update blow another 40 million on all there is and play with it for a few hours until I see what a in joke this game as become for the average player who grinds countless hours for only a few moments of fun in the new specialized vehicle.Rockstar has changed. GTA V has been the most successful title they have ever launched and it's ruined them. The they've done to Online isn't even the worst of it. Since the beginning of the Online money Cow Singleplayer has been excluded from patches updates DLC.Now they want to further penalize and destroy the modding community that helped the issues they never cared to fix. By banning players with edited files and just now by legally strong arming the mod devs in attempt to kill their community.Rockstar is anti consumer and anti creative freedom. I hate to not recommend what was once the best game I've ever experienced but rockstar has become a souless bastard of a company. do not support them with shark cards. PC is riddled with script kiddies who drop insane money anyway #GTAGIVERS. Rockstar doesn't care about that though.

review: I am slightly embarrassed to admit that this was the first GTA game I had ever played... but I'm certainly not embarrassed to admit that I bought this one and consider it worth every penny spent.The dictionary definition of 'open world' ought to have this game high on its list just amazing how you can do whatever you want go wherever you want generally mess around and have one heck of a lot of fun doing it...And then the missions and story I expected as a first time player that I would be struggling but nope they seem to be set at some ideal dificulty level where it's completely possible to succeed even without being an expert gets a big thumbs up from me.And then the fantastic ability of this game to run smoothly on even my three year old laptop with the sort of graphic settings that make other games freeze up and sulk.I could say lots but I won't just go and buy it even at the full price it's so worth it. More hours of entertainment than you can shake a violent stick at.

review: Starting off Campaign 8/10. This campaign is clearly one of the best I have ever played although i stopped playing it around 8 hours in. Charismatic characters fresh fun mission etc.Online I believe this is where the core experience of the game is. Buying cars houses boats partaking in heists doing car stealing missions and further more all are extremely fun and make you feel like a total badass. There are also races but i dont do those much although they are pretty fun. 9.5/10Verdict 9/10 GTA V is a must buy for any gamer who likes guns cars or just feeling like a badass.Side note Don't get disturbed by those saying they were banned for no reason. They either willing picked up cash from a modder or they are a modder which is cheating. I personally haven't done those and im still playing the game having a blast.

review: When this game came out it wasn't the best with the physics and irritating unrealisticness. But at least in the beginning it was still playable.Now? You can't go into Online without being griefed the whole time you play by people in vehicles that literally anyone with no skill can use. Flying motorcycles with rockets that can't be shot down even with aimbot practically invincible tanks that reload in less than 5 seconds jets that swoop in from above you where you can't aim sniper rifles that can kill you from miles away with explosive rounds and the list goes on. If you couldn't already tell by my hours on this game I have played this more than any game in my life besides Halo 1 2 Reach and Gmod. Car Customization The variety of cars and customization is great but the "upgrades" are absolutely . For the offroad vehicles you can only LOWER them not lift them. The Sultan RS (which can be upgraded to have a full rally body kit) has maybe 4 inches of clearance WITH STOCK SUSPENSION. You can install turbos on cars that already have twin turbos according to the badging. Supercharged cars have no difference in engine sound from a naturally aspirated car with the same base engine sound. You can put lowrider rims with white walls on armored trucks and supercars completely ruining the look of half the cars in Online since there are so many kids that throw them on thinking they look nice for whatever reason. Lowriders Update You wouldn't believe how hyped I was when I first heard they were releasing one for this game. One of my dream cars is a '69 El Camino lowrider. When they added lowriders to the game I was extremely disappointed. You can't 3 wheel (one of the most common things people do with lowriders ) you can't use the hydraulics without it scratching your whole bumper when it doesn't touch anything but the underbody when you land you can't remotely control the hydraulics which pretty much ruins lowrider competitions you can't keep them in one position when you get out of the car and you can't change the travel for when you hop. Economy Rockstar why the would you make a 1980's M3 (which costs no more than 50k IRL) $800 000? Maybe like that is the reason everyone is modding and doing money drops. If you want to overcharge people for everything then no one is going to want to waste their time grinding for something that isn't worth hours of grinding your off. Rockstar keeps adding new buildings/buisnesses that get you the exact same amount of money. You can't run all of them at once because you would have to constantly refill the 10 buildings non stop. They keep making new special vehicles but you know what the only way get them is? Buying the new buisness they included in the update. Conclusion There is plenty of other illogical BS they ruined this game with that I could've talked about but this review would take up more space than the game's store page. I just hope to god Rockstar doesn't ruin GTA VI by doing the same they did with GTA V. The cons of this game outweigh the pros. If you asked me back when this game came out before they ruined online I would be telling you this is the best game that ever existed.GTA VI has so much potential. Don't ruin it Rockstar.
title: Grand Theft Auto V
