review: Update With the threat to legal action to users doing nothing illegal this has put the final nail in the coffin for GTAV for me.I highly recommend against buying this game.First they don't do about hackers stealing money and will ban you if hackers give you money. Now they make modding "illegal" or at least threaten legal action to it's users. I am hoping that Steam takes action like they did with other games which has threatened legal action against it's users and removes the game from the Steam store. Original review The graphics are nice and the gameplay is pretty good but multiplayer is riddled with people constantly using hacks Rockstar fails to implement a working anti cheat so multiplayer is mostly "Get tons of money that will be removed later" or "Lose tons of money that might not be added back later" or get killed a lot. Users randomly disconnect from the lobby due to it being "peer to peer" so instead of doing the reliable thing and hosting servers they leech off clients that can send untrusted packets to each other and the master cloud server which goes down often.Along with that the game slugs down often and crashes(By crashes I mean hangs the entire computer) at least 3 times within 5 hours in both multiplayer and single player yet Rockstar wants people to pay for "Sharkcards"(In game instant currency).Unlike other games in the Grand Theft Auto series you can't just store any old car in your garage especially police cars utility vehicles and a wide variety of vehicles. If you are lucky you can "Buy" these cars with in game currency.However the support on their site is friendly/helpful and the overall visuals/story is great but the game needs some serious work before it can get my recommend.I will continue to play the game but only because I already have it. I will not be buying sharkcards at least until they fix most of the issues.

review: So I bought this game during the winter sale and like many other mainly single player games I own I assumed that I would play for a couple hours and then put the game down because I didn't want to grind my way through the story. Tomb Raider was different. This campaign is one of the most exciting campaigns I have played in years and that puts this game on my all time favorites list with great games like Star Wars Battlefront (2004) and Halo Reach. I could not put this game down. Around every corner there is something to fine. Unfortunately I grinded the games story and managed to complete the story with an overall game completion of 68% but there is no doubt in my mind that I will not play this game again soon. I played the game on the hardest dificulty and although I died a couple times seven times to be exact The game was so much fun that I didn't care about me dying when I got rushed by 20 autoaiming enemies. Overall I love this game. I found everything about it great the story the graphics and gameplay. It isn't often that I find a game like this where I want to come back and keep playing day after day and not put it down at all. This game is amazing.

review: Without a doubt GTA V Is a "Visual Feast" providing you have a decent laptop.If not it will "crush" your graphics card.NVIDIA 960 Ideal Intel core I7 a load of RAM and your good to go.Before beginning the game experiment with both graphics and advanced graphics in the settings menu.Try to keep the "Yellow Bar" below maximum.There are a mass of videos on You Tube to help you get your rig up to its max potential but even with my Asus Zenbook pro i still had to make compromises.By experimenting my game looks absolutely "Stunning".The game is a "Riot" in single player.(I"m not into multyplayer).Some of the sidequests can be frustrating especially if you have a time frame.But this is without doubt the best game ever released of this gendre.Brutal language sexual themes torture extreme violence make this NOT a game for young kids !!!.5 Stars and will keep you playing for weeks on end )

review: Word of warning. If you are transferring a character from an Xbox 360 or PS3 account make sure to log into GTA V Online on the console BEFORE transferring your character on PC! review: So many people complaining about this game and it's community. Single player is great so let's put that aside. Online however is where the negative reviews come from. I understand the issues people have with the grinding and the cheaters but understand that rock star doesn't give a . Plain and simple. They make money on dlcs by making things so expensive to the point where the grind to get what you want is impossible. What I'm saying is that's how they are making money at this point so they don't care if people are complaining because for every one person that complains 10 thousand buy shark cards. As for the cheater situation tough Hate to break it to you but gta online runs a p2p connection. In other words it is literally impossible for them to stop cheaters. To even attempt to stop the cheaters they would have to rework the entire thing shut down online revamp the code open dedicated servers and basically spend a load of money. Needless to say that's just not even a realistic possibility. Point being if you buy this game to play online find good protection mods and money mods or you honestly just wasted your money on this and guaranteed will have a bad time.

review: What is my perfect crime? I break into Tiffany's at midnight. Do I go for the vault? No I go for the chandelier. It's priceless. As I'm taking it down a woman catches me. She tells me to stop. It's her father's business. She's Tiffany. I say no. We make love all night. In the morning the cops come and I escape in one of their uniforms. I tell her to meet me in Mexico but I go to Canada. I don't trust her. Besides I like the cold. Thirty years later I get a postcard. I have a son and he's the chief of police. This is where the story gets interesting. I tell Tiffany to meet me in Paris by the Trocadero. She's been waiting for me all these years. She's never taken another lover. I don't care. I don't show up. I go to Berlin. That's where I stashed the chandelier.10/10 Heists

review: Ignore the people ing about hackers. Would have used the word complaining but it just doesnt fit. The singleplayer was both funny and exciting in more than a few parts and will give you at least a few fun hours. Even after completeing the main story the game itself still feels worth playingNow onto online. Yes there are hackers. No they will never be gone. That being said there are multiple ways to play without them having the ability to affect you. You can create an instance where you personally have the power to choose to play solo with selected people be it friends or crew members.I think fairly highly of the entire singleplayer campaign but that being said i absolutely think they could put more work into the online missions and heists. They are uninspired and just flat out boring only worth doing for the money no other reason.7/10

review: Review from a PVE player.DONT BUY it if you like PVE gameplay you either get killed by players alot so you cant make any money without being in a sort of PVP mode or if you finnally can play in peace you need other players to help you with dropping off your hard earned cocaine and if you start that mission the whole server is being alerted that you are doing a drop and everyone gets in their tanks and gunships to kill you.Also NPC s are all well trained snipers even the ones with just a sidearm/handgun from miles away.Selling cars you can only sell 1 car every 45 min and you normally only get around 3.5k a car with a max of 5k sometimes.Community the community can be good at sometimes and helpfull (if you can find a nice crew to help you) but most of the time its toxic as hell especially those hacking russians.So if you like the previous GTA series and like PVE and dont like PVP then dont waste your money and time with this game.So MY verdict is 3/10ps. Rockstar is all out to sell those shark cash cards so everything is expensive and you dont get much money at all ingame all this to increase the chance you buy those cards so in my opinion this game is P2W Cash cow all the way.

review: If you want to play GTA V for its single player only then I totally recommend picking this up however if you are buying it for GTA Online its a different story. title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I don't know what I can say about GTA V that most people already said It's a great game that has one of the best open worlds I've ever seen filled with completely crazy characters. The vehicles all feel really realistic and I think the physics also look quite realistic. The story is great and there is loads of side missions that also have amazing characters. When it comes to GTA Online I am not so sure. For anything cool added in to GTA Online you'll either have to grind for weeks if not months or pay real money. Still there is some fun to be had in GTA Online if you drive around San Andreas with a few friends and do the stuff you might do alone in Singleplayer.In conclusion I would definitely recommend GTA V but think you should reconsider buying it for GTA Online.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This version of GTA V is borderline unplayable for me. I already owned and beat it on PS3 saw it was on sale for $20 on steam so though I would give it another go. Played a hour or so of single player. Camera keep shifting to NPC characters during missions and I would lose control of my playable character forcing me to fail or restart the mission. This happened several times. Ok bad start mabye try some GTA online. Played two missions and now stuck in an infinite loading screen! Maybe its my computer "ASUS ROG Laptop I7 cpu 8gb ram and 2gb nvidia GPU" but it happens on low med and max settings. I loved this game and really wanted to experance it in 1st person but I guess not

Heists are so incredibly unforgiving that they are not even fun to play public. And once someone fail they leave and you're back to watching clouds. Same with every single mission in the entire game. review: Yes it's a great f***ing game we all know that.GTA Online though while fun for the first 20 50 hours incredibly boring and annoying with all the loading screens and clunky interfaces it has. I mean why the hell does it take 5 minutes to find a single deathmatch game? AND when you get in a game you'll find you got matched up with like 2 or 3 players. Ridiculous. Loading screens upon loading screens. Oh did I mention if the game fails to find a match for you it will RELOAD the entire free roam thing? I had times where the game just completely hung up on the sky view thing.Rockstar needs to completely revamp the whole thing. If I want to just play a quick deathmatch or mission or whatever anything that's not free roam let me choose that BEFORE the game loads!Yes get this game you won't regret buying it because what is there is great I just want to point out these annoyances with Online you should beware.

Buy cars modd them and race!The gamephysics are amazing and the car handling is superb. A lot of diffrent cars (supercars sportcars minis normalcars lowriders trucks and special veicles like firetruck forklift dumper etc etc).Buy a highend appartment and start heists buy a yatch with your own helipad boats and jetskis!This game is so much game for your money and u can spend so many hours just yoloing around!Buy Buy!!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: For me this gets a 7/10 for all next gen platforms. The reason im not giving the PC a higher rating is because I have a stupid bug when I launch the game. For some reason the launcher doesn't want to launch as the Social Club startup seems to go on infinetly (I even let it go all night...go ahead and guess what happened). I had to make a new Windows user in order to be able to play it and Rockstar still hasn't fixed this yet. Ranting aside this game is such a step up from GTA IV especially the driving. GTA IV's driving felt like you were constantly on an ice rink. The first person works phenomenally and the graphics from last gen to next gen are so much better though I don't like how on PC you have a limit on how good your graphics can be based on how many gigs your GPU has. The new adversary modes in Online are very addictive and fun to play and the free DLCs add a lot of good stuff to the game. All in all definitely get this game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This isn't what it was on 360. This is art in games. I hope your system can handle its demanding load (giggity). It puts mine through the wringers but it gets done.Now closer to 60 hrs in I've found my niche. I was able to download my previous Rock Star Social Club profile that I had used on XBOX 360. I jumped back in where I'd left off with my luxury apartment in the sky a garage full of wild and exotic vehicles to choose from and the added bonus of the $1 300 000 I received for having pre ordered the game.It surprises me that the game received a solid 80% approval rating on Steam but then it's been in my experience that some of the best games ever flew or even drove in under the radar.There is no online experience more fun to me than being in a lobby full of gamers using mics or better yet friends with mics. This is the pinnacle.If you liked the PAYDAY series then online heists should be to your liking. Everybody has their role to play in online heists. Crowd control safe cracking even a getaway driver. Each heist proves that the strongest player is four players working together harmoniously and RSSC rewards this by giving you huge XP and cash bonuses for working together closely and as a team.If you're the sort of gamer who likes racing games GTA V Online hosts races with up to 16 players in any number of environments. Breakneck down a busy street full of traffic in exotics? It's got it. Mudders buggies trucks and dirt bikes for an off road rally race? It's got it. Feel like piloting one of the many planes and helicopters the game has to offer and doing a point to point around the skies of the Los Santos? No problem. It's got it.Stand offs? It's got it. Submarine exploration? You guessed it. Can my avatar smoke marijuana and then hallucinate the appearance of aliens and clown? You bet your you can. How about a rousing game of golf? Billiards? Bowling? Yoga? Arm wrestling? Yes yes yes yes and yes.So if you've got the ability to do anything you'd like to occupy your time alongside your friends why wouldn't you enjoy playing this game?I can't fathom a reason.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Graphics You forget what reality is Beautiful Good Decent Bad Don t look too long at it Paint.exe Gameplay Very good Good It s just gameplay Mehh Starring at walls is better Just don t Audio Eargasm Very good Good Not too bad Bad Earrape Audience Kids Teens Adults Human PC Requirements Check if you can run paint Potato Decent Fast Rich boiiiiii Ask NASA if they have a spare computer Difficulity Just press A Easy Significant brain usage Easy to learn / Hard to master Difficult Dark Souls Grind Nothing to grind Only if you care about leaderboards/ranks Isn't necessary to progress Average grind level Too much grind You ll need a second life for grinding Story Story? Text or Audio floating around Average Good Lovely It ll replace your life Game Time Long enough for a cup of coffee Short Average Long To infinity and beyond Price It s free! Worth the price If u have some spare money left Not recommended You could also just burn your money Bugs Never heard of Minor bugs Can get annoying ARK Survival Evolved The game itself is a big terrarium for bugsActual review Ok so I have yet to play story mode to completion so this is mostly a review on GTA Online. This game is fun especially with your friends. My big issues with it are the modders the loading times and the grind. You can't pick which server you go on and I'd say you have a 60% chance of running into modders who 95% of the time are just out to ruin the game for everybody else. With Rockstar cracking down on these guys you dont wanna be anywhere near them when they get banned or you could be banned too. But here's the thing entering/exiting Online servers takes an age to do. The loading times are ridiculous. I can literally go and prepare dinner in the time it takes for me to join a server. I'd say 1/4 of your time in this game will just be looking at loading screens. My other problem is the grind. You need to keep playing jobs to earn ridiculous amounts of money before being able to buy the fun stuff. This put newer players at a huge disadvantage especially when you take into account that a large portion of the community doesn't know how to treat other human beings. Honestly I would recommend this game but not for its listed price. Get it on sale if you value your money.

review: Hackers aren't a problem if you have friends.If you want to play singleplayer consult another review.If you want to play online but without anyone you know consult another review.If you have friends the heists are amazing to do and so rewarding when you finally finish. Freeroam is great robbing convenience stores with your mate as the getaway driver is amazing or destroying cop cars in a technical with air support from an attack helicopter. Then there's the jobs races are hilarious especially if you all suck and crash often and the missions are good fun especially if you bring a long a turreted Pegasus vehicle with you.If you want to min/max or buy everything or be the highest level sure I could see how this game could get tiring and grindy but if you just want to screw around and shoot your friends or the cops this game is the best out there and I haven't seen a co op open world game that is more in depth or fun than this. Forget public servers if you're afraid of hackers or getting banned you miss out on some features sure but then nobody bothers you when you set up that 43 bus jump that you've always dreamed of doing.The game is fun the community is questionable but the random things that you can think up in this game and execute make it incredible and very memorable. Convince your friends to buy this with you and the game is beautiful.

review: Grand Theft Auto V so many things to do/experience... First off you do not have to play the other GTA games before playing this one although I have played every GTA game in order it may help with some references in the game if you are really following the story (Which you should because its amazing.) This game takes place in San Andreas which is split into two different counties Los Santos and Blaine County which is a huge map which sets you up for various things to do whether is be shopping drinking smoking racing anything you can think of you can probs do in GTA 5. So if you are thinking of buying GTA 5 DO IT!!!!!! The story is great very fun and extensive story mode which takes over 40 hours to complete. I haven't really touched GTA Online in a while heard great things though except for all the modders on PC if you really wanna play some Online head on console.If you have already played GTA 5 or want to play other GTA Games I can highly recommend the following1. GTA San Andreas (Use the enhanced graphics mod this will make the game look very good... This game takes place in San Andreas.)2. GTA Vice City (A classic first GTA I ever purchased and played and one of my favorites. Very fun and interesting storyline that takes place in Miami)3. GTA 4 (Great game highly suggest getting the story mode DLC after beating the game. This one takes place in NYC aka Liberty city.)

(Let's talk about the story mode) If you play the game casually you won't really find any bugs but as you try to look closely or try to mess with it bugs do pop up nothing much serious that might harm your gameplay tho.The story has no proper base and is actually quite boring for my taste.The ending looks lazy like Rockstar just wanted to end the game anyway possible by dumping EX_MACHINA choices on the player. (Where did the time go where the game world is first and we were just playing a part in it?) Now it seems we are controlling the game world.GTA 5 (offline) is a respectable game and looks modern clearly there has been some research done. The game is playable and is quite enjoyable..(Now let's talk about GTA online)husshh hushh husshh..... Where should I even start it's utter garbage with way more *BUGS!!* then it needs to. ROCKSTAR should fix their damn game first then adding more DLC content.Though content wise there is a lot most things are quite buggy especially HIEST AND DOOMSDAY. (which are the vital parts for a GTAO player)Rockstar with it's cash cow strategy won't let you take a rest. YOU JUST NEED TO GRIND&lt GRIND&lt GRIND! I won't complain much about the grinding fact as for now most online game are built this way so that players will stick their for longer. If you have this part is actually fun but if you are alone AND a loner. You don't have much chance here. Seriously get with someone this game is not meant for loners. I would recommend this game because it's actually quite better than their old titles and is actually proper hardware supported. PLAY AT YOUR OWN RISK D

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It finally happened. I beat a GTA game. I've been playing this franchise including the handheld versions since GTA1 on PS1 and none of these titles have been able to hold my interest long enough to complete one. GTA5 did. I chalk it up to 3 factors It embraced it's insanity with the storyline (mainly with Trevor).They put out a pretty good PC port.They gave you a wide variety of tasks to do. More than escort and kill.But then there's the online mode. Rockstar seemingly jealous that the genius modders beat them to the punch way back with GTA San Andreas Rockstar decides to try their best. While I'm only rank 15 right now and expect to play for a while longer this mode....is a complete cluster . Its a mess. It's a bucket of random ideas they just threw at the wall and left it to the players to decide what sticks. The netcode and matchmaking is god awful. Hackers are everywhere forcing you to matchmake into new sessions. Performance randomly drops to 20fps. I am matched with non USA players 90% of the time who can only type in moonspeak. The community is toxic to all new players and will do everything they can to grief you into giving up and uninstalling. Be prepared to just get stuck in locations where you cant do anything but be instantly killed a hundred times until they grow tired. And if you try to crew up for missions just assume everyone you're co oping with has literally never intereracted with a video game before and they were born with only one arm.I'm just shocked this is the portion of the game that has been printing money for Rockstar for years and allowed them to not put out an actual video game in all this time. If you have at least 3 very reliable friends who intent to play with you on the same schedule for the long term then GTAOnline is a safe bet for you. Otherwise holy hell be warned....

review: GTA 5 PC ReviewAlso available on Xbox One PS4 Xbox 360 and PS3The long wait has been worth it. If you re a PC gamer who s spent the last eighteen months envying the console crowd while they all got stuck into the latest greatest GTA then rest assured that you can now play the definitive version. Sure the Xbox One and PS4 versions were amazing delivering GTA 5 at higher resolutions with more detailed textures smoother surfaces better lighting and cool depth of field effects (see our full review below) but the PC version offers even more enhancements plus a couple of additional features that play to the PC s strengths. In doing so it adds a few more metres to one of gaming s towering achievements.Having covered the game twice already we won t go too far into the detail of what makes GTA 5 so good. Partly it s a question of experience. With four previous 3D GTAs under its belt plus Red Dead Redemption Bully and assorted DLC packs Rockstar has had time to refine its vision for open world gameplay and its systems and GTA 5 has the best driving the best shooting and some of the best mission design of the series.It s also a question of structure. Dividing the action amongst three protagonists with three interlocking storylines and three distinctive flavours means you nearly always have the option to flick from Michael s ageing career criminal saga to Franklin s ambitious hoodlum story to Trevor s crazed amoral brand of mayhem where the dumb cathartic slapstick violence we all deep down love GTA for finds its natural home. With repeated play it only becomes clearer how well all three tales mesh thematically with Rockstar s savage satirical take on the Californian dream.And the budget definitely helps. The more time you put into GTA 5 the more you come to appreciate what a large and intensely detailed creation Los Santos is and just how much is packed into the surrounding Blaine County. That s because Rockstar had the ambition and the money to put in all the golf and tennis mini games all the stunt challenges all the bizarre side missions and all the weird hidden stuff that probably 90% of players will never see. The amazing thing about GTA 5 is that you can spend hour after hour playing it yet still be struck by all the stuff you haven t done yet. No other open world feels this coherent. No other open world has so much to do.TrustedReviews Awards 2015 Winners announcedSo what does playing on PC bring to the experience? Well for a start there s the most visually impressive and immersive version yet. Those lucky enough to have a 1440p or 4K monitor and the rig to run it will have ample cause for amazement and the rest of us who have to struggle along at 1080p won t go short. GTA 5 PC benefits from the new lighting model post processing effects day to night cycle and added vegetation of the next gen console versions but also additional levels for textures shader effects reflections and shadow detail that affect everything from the way characters faces look close up to depth of field effects water and grass.It s open to a huge amount of tinkering but then it needs to be. Basic gaming systems like a budget Core i3 with an old GTX 660 will struggle to run GTA 5 at a decent frame rate unless you reduce the resolution and start pulling settings down from high. Our test system with a Core i5 and a Radeon R9 285 still wouldn t run smoothly with settings above high at 1080p.What s more GTA 5 is really tough on video memory. Try to set Texture Quality to High with a 2GB graphics card and you ll be warned that you re exceeding the limits. Ignore the warnings and you may be gobsmacked by the detail on skin background textures and particularly clothing but the frame rate will stutter all the time. It might just about be bearable when you re walking around but get in a car and try a driving heavy mission and you re in for a nasty shock.GTA 5 scales up beautifully if you re rocking a Core i7/GTX 970 or Radeon R9 290 but if you have a lesser system then you re going to have to make some compromises. It s also worth noting that we ve experienced the odd collision detection bug and some weird texture drop outs occasionally affecting whole scenes at a time. It s early days with early GPU drivers though so we suspect these issues will be nailed down with time.Beyond this we get support for mouse and keyboard gameplay a definite plus if you play in first person view and some new options for background music. Not only is there a new radio station to listen to The Lab FM but a rather ingenious way of adding custom soundtracks to the game. Drag your own music files into a subfolder called User Music and they ll play through a new Self Radio station while you re in the game. It s a shame that Rockstar didn t make this a little more obvious or accessible but playing GTA 5 with your own background tunes is a blast.GTA Online comes bundled in of course bringing Rockstar s online multiplayer crime sim to the PC for the first time. It s due a reappraisal now that the new Heist missions have been dropped in but it s still a slightly odd combination of open world exploration and ad hoc PvP larceny and murder (all good) and more straightforward shooter and racer events which don t really play to GTA s strengths. It s fun but not Battlefield Hardline.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I wouldn't recommend it for GTA Online. But singleplayer is where the game shines and one might call it the greatest game of all time. The amount of detail in this game is simply incredible. The story is generic and predictable but still a lot of fun and the character writing is a benchmark in gaming in my opinion. Almost all characters deliver perfectly and their actors did an incredible job. Trevor might be one of the most interesting video game characters in recent years. The improvement over older GTA titles is apparent. There are 0 loading screens in the game (singleplayer) which makes you feel much more connected to the world than in previous games where each mission had a loading screen.The graphics and attention to detail are outstanding. The game has a level of polish and optimization I haven't seen in any other game before. I reccomend watching a 5 part series on youtube called "GTA V Attention to Detail" which illustrates a lot the smaller details most people don't notice or mention anywhere. It's like as if Rockstar really have thought about everything. Even tiny details nobody would have cared about like flip flop shoes actually do their flip flop. Different shows produce a different sound when walking. The amount of detail put into the game is unrivaled and it makes the world so believable. There isn't as much detail put into GTA Online though. Many things are missing due optimization to make the game run fluid in online. No animals in online much less traffic and pedestrians some scenery items in the world are completely missing as well no random encounters and your online persona is basically a mute not producing a single sound not even when falling or being hit. The rich and detailed world loses a lot of its flair in GTA Online not just due to all the missing details but also because of plenty of loading screens. Anytime you want to do missions or participate in races or whatever you are welcomed by a long loading screen. When the mission is finished you are welcomed by another long loading screen to connect you to an open world lobby.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I was also one of the false ban victims.I had never exploited the game or been dropped money by the unavoidable "modders". (Though I knew for a fact that in nearly every public session I have been in someone turns out to be a cheater.)In fact I have never cheated in any online game because cheating takes away all the fun from being able to compete and goof around with equally capable players.Still I got a notification stating that I have been suspended for a month and that my character has been reset after hours and hours of work. In short Rockstar stated that I was evidently the wrongdoer and there was literally nothing I could do about the situation.Still people tried to get Rockstar's attention.Still I was hopeful that Rockstar would remove at least the majority of the false bans and suspensions soon.And when that happened I changed my review to positive and edited this text to past tense. BTW I hate all the flying "now u ded" stuff

review: I am having a problem with Grand Theft Auto Online. So I was racing with my friend in Grand Theft Auto online. There's one player on my car. But when I was revving my car suddenly I fell off from the World and teleported to a hill and SUDDENLY MONEY DROPPED OUT OF NOWHERE FROM MY HEAD. I had no money left but suddenly it increased to $ 119k and it kept falling off from my head. I immediately leave the session as I thought it was hacker who did this to me. Please remove the money from my account. I DID NOT use any hack tools. Thank you.UPDATE REVIEW 16/12/2016The multiplayer is full of hackers like seriously sudden teleport dropping money etc. Seriously rockstar this game's anti cheat needs to be fixed or else people will start to leave GTA online.UPDATE REVIEW 19/12/2016Rockstar replied to my e mail and has removed the money. Although the response is a little bit slow rockstar support still responded to my e mail.To all of those folks who got ignored by steam support Talk to them politely. Don't use any words like f**k a** sh*t. Do that and you will be completely ignored.P.SThe players in public session are cancerous. You WILL get killed non stop if you don't enable passive mode.

review: If it wasn't for the arcadey physics (which are a step back and not forward from GTA4) and lacking the volume of activities that were in GTA San Andreas it would be a near perfect. Graphics are great gameplay is good. The story is ok despite lacking immersion due to having 3 characters to work with through the game. The Online is ok with many missions to do but without the activities such as gambling etc. in San Andreas you just cant have as much fun as you perhaps would have hoped.There is still a good amount of depth and enjoyment to be found in the game perhaps next time around they will finally beat GTA San Andreas still well worth every penny spent.

review: Overall I really enjoyed the whole experience that GTA V offers. It feels like you are in a huge open city and the world is your oyster.Yea there are things I can complain about. There are definitely a good number of immersion killers particularly the repetitive feeling of the heat level works. But I think I can forgive most of that for the fun story the utter scale and detail of the world and the great gameplay. It's a little derivative for sure and the story isn't mindblowing by any stretch but it is just such a blast to play that I find it hard to criticize it. Bravo to the devs for pulling off something with the sheer magnitude of this game.

review: People who downvote this game do it because GTA Online can be a cancer fest. And downvoting a game for it's BONUS Online feature is ridiculous. GTAV basegame is AMAZING and no one can argue that it's so much fun to play from start to finish and well worth the money so the game is an immediate thumbs up.I won't go into detail why so many out there thumb this game down because they keep getting wrecked in Online FREE MODE. The Free Mode is cancer and here's the kicker you never have to even be there. SO downvoting the game not only for the Online bonus mode but for the free mode mode within that bonus ONline mode is a move. Waaaah!!! Waaaahhh!! Rockstar made a awesome game but the ONline Free Mode is out of control! Waaaahhh Waaaahh!! Get real you little .99.99999999999% of the downvotes is because of the Online issues these mongoloids out there that thumbs this game down are so utterly piece of snowflakey entitled they don't even think of giving Rockstar props for making one of the best open world sandbox games in recent history.Alright so Online. I have sunk maybe 500+ hours into Online mode myself and I've barely touched Free Mode maybe 40 minutes in total. So over 400 hours I'm only a litlte over rank 100. I've never done a single heist neither except for the "tutorial" one. Nope not one. So what do I do? What makes GTA Online so great? Well creatively you can make your own movies which is ing awesome! You can race play golf play tennis do missions join events you name it.I just find it hilarious that ANYONE can give this game thumbs down based exclusively on their own butthurt little feelings because Online Free Mode is cancer. Online Free Mode is the public lobby sessions btw it's not even 20% of the online content yet here some of you are downvoting GTAV? Holy bags I can rant all day about this Game's awesome. 10/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So it's about time I write a review about Grand theft Auto V.I didn't have high expectations about the optimization of the game but I was blown away since day one.I had GTX 970 &amp i5 3570 and I could run the game on almost max settings above 60 FPS.But that's not what all this review is all about I spent over 333 hours played Grand Theft Auto V very littoe of it went into singleplayer (I've finished singleplayer and not playing it anymore)I am mostly playing multiplayer and it's been a blast playing it buying apartments cars planes and much more!Rockstar regularly updates the game &amp adds DLC that are completely free. (Casino I am waiting for you)There is not much else to say about it. 10/10 would spend another 333 hours (HL3 Confirmed)

review: Product received for free. There are times when I look at Los Santos and think 'why would you even think to build that?' This is appropriately a thought that I often have about Los Angeles. In GTA 5's case the tone is different baffled wonderment as opposed to baffled y'know despair. Rockstar have created one of the most extraordinary game environments you will ever visit. I look at it and I wonder at the vast expense of effort required to render every trash bag in every back alley just so. I marvel at the care evident in San Andreas' gorgeous sunsets in the way that sunglasses subtly alter the colour balance of the world in the artfully chosen selection of licensed music designed to accompany your experience. Everything about Los Santos demonstrates the extraordinary amount of thought and love poured into it by hundreds of developers over many years. The abiding irony of Grand Theft Auto 5 is that everybody who actually lives in Los Santos hates it there.This is the most beautiful expansive and generous GTA game and also by some distance the nastiest and most nihilistic. Rockstar went through a phase in Bully Grand Theft Auto IV and the sadly console bound Red Dead Redemption of framing their protagonists as anti heroes. GTA 4's Niko Bellic did some terrible things but he had a downtrodden charm that helped you like him as you piloted him through the underworld. He was surrounded by people who were larger than life but ultimately beneath the surface people. Among those people were some of Rockstar's better female characters Kate McReary Mallorie Bardas The Lost and Damned's Ash Butler.Grand Theft Auto 5 does away with all of that deliberately but to its detriment. Its trio of protagonists occupy a city full of vapid two dimensional caricatures and they flirt with that boundary themselves. Michael is a middle aged former bankrobber unhappily married and on the edge of a breakdown. Franklin is a young hood purportedly principled but willing to do almost anything for money. Trevor is a desert dwelling meth dealing psychopath with a homebrew morality that sits uneasily alongside his capacity for violent cruelty and sexual aggression. The campaign explores their relationship through a series of heists and misadventures as they clash with every L.A. stereotype you might imagine the bored Beverly Hills housewife the corrupt fed the bottom rung fraudster the smug technology exec and so on.Against this backdrop it's only Michael Franklin and Trevor that appear to have any kind of internal life. I get the impression that this is deliberate part of the game's relentless skewering of southern California and indicative of Rockstar's waning interest in romantic anti heroes. Trevor's introduction in particular amounts to a particularly explicit ' you' to the characters and themes of Grand Theft Auto IV. GTA 5 is heartless in that way and as a result I found the narrative difficult to care about. It is ambitious well performed and the production values are extraordinary but it is also derivative and brutishly adolescent set in a world where the line between criminality and the rule of law is blurry but where it is always hilarious that somebody might be gay.It's an R rated episode of The A Team where the 'A' stands for ' '. The campaign's best moments come when your cigar chomping master strategist insane former military pilot and talented driver come together and when you're given the power to choose how to use each of them. These heists are set piece missions where you pick an approach and perform set up tasks in the open world before setting out on the job itself. In the best of them which occur later in the campaign it really does evoke the satisfaction of having a plan come together. Perhaps you position Trevor on the high ground with a rocket launcher Michael on foot with a stealth approach and Franklin in an armoured ram raider. With a button press you can flick between the three dynamically orchestrating a crime caper on your own terms.It is also in these moments that Rockstar's most ambitious storytelling takes place. Your choice of character crew and even certain in game actions have subtle effects on the dialogue. In an early heist a crewmember dropped part of the score but as Franklin I was able to retrieve it a side objective that I'd set for myself but that was subsequently reflected in a later conversation between him and Michael. This is another example of Rockstar's extraordinary attention to detail and if the rest of the campaign respected your agency in this way it might overcome its weaker moments.As it is this is a very long game with a lot of filler. There's much driving from A to B a lot of conversations in cars a lot of gunfights with hordes of goons who show up just to run into your gunsights over and over. It's far richer in set piece moments than its predecessor drug trips aerial heists dramatic chases and many of these look incredible even if they're light on actual interaction. In the best examples you soak in the atmosphere and happily ignore the fact that you're only really being asked to follow the on screen instructions. In the worst examples insta fail stealth sequences sniper missions and so on it's harder to ignore the shackles that are placed on the player in order to preserve the game's cinematic look and feel.I spent a lot of my time with the campaign frustrated along these lines bored of the same mission templates that I've been playing through since GTA III and making the most of the scant opportunities to play my own way like Franklin's refreshingly open assassination missions. Then inevitably I'd be doing one of those rote activities a heavily scripted freeway chase perhaps when the magic of that extraordinary world would creep up on me again. It'd hit me I'm doing 150 km/h along the Pacific Coast Highway at sunset. The rock station is playing 30 Days In The Hole by Humble Pie. It feels incredible a collision of pop culture atmosphere music and play that is unique to GTA.

review: What can I say about this game that other people haven't said already?It is aboslutely one of the best and most detailed games on the market today. I have had my fair share of single player and multi player gameplay and I can say for sure that you won't really have much fun in online unless you have a few friends to rope in to help out.The story is silly but funny. The characters seem to be well established and somewhat likeable. The world feels almost real with all the tiny details that Rockstar have added into the game.The online is 100% a grind fest and that is what it was designed to be. The only real way to be good quickly is to spend the money and buy in game currency. It isn't half as fun as the single player which is basically designed as a free for all paradise. I have major issue with the large amount of hackers in the online. They have always been present in the online but especially so on the PC version. One of my friends actually had money hacked into his account and got banned for about 24 hours before someone looked into it. The hackers are only sorted out when they hack money in which is what loses Rockstar money but ones who get 0.0002 second runs on races are just making the game less fun for others.Overall solid and well made game with a massive modding community but it falls down quite a bit when it comes to the multi player side of things.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Singleplayer This game has one of the greatest single player stories i've ever played. It is not as long as some of the previous games which really dragged on for me but it is a good lenght and there a barley any boring missions. The characters are great especially Micheal. Trevor is straight crasy and Franklin is cool. I love how you get to control 3 different characters and the have their own stories and supporting characters. The heist are great driving is great the combat is great the missions are fast paced and it is truly a great story. 9/10.Multiplayer GTA Online is very fun to play with a group of friends. It is good that Rockstar is consistantly updating the game and adding lots of missions and things to do. The heists MC and CEO work and Doomsday missions are mostly really good and the small little things you can do are awesome. The main problem I have is that you need to grind this game alot to be able to buy most of the things you need. Online is a great concept and Rockstar has almost nailed it. 7.5/10.

review: Before I write this review I want to point out that I've been playing the game since the day it was released on consoles such as xbox 360 and ps4.When this game came out I would have almost nothing but positives to say about both the online and singleplayer games. Unfortunately online has become overrun with hackers that will likely get YOU banned for not even doing anything. On the other hand if you can avoid said people the online mode is very addicting and you will CONSTANTLY have FREE updates thrown in your face despite how old the game is already. When the game came out Rockstar agreed that they would give free updates to the game but would have "Shark Cards" in game which you can buy for in game money. They've stayed true to their word leaving GTA online a very addicting and exciting game to play.On the single player side absolutely no complaints. I highly recommend this game solely for the SP.PROS Constant updatesGreat Single PlayerHighly addictingEndless stuff to doAbility to join a lobby with just your friends to avoid the horse c*ckeryCONS Hackers in almost every lobbyLoading screen simulatorRandom bans from RockstarShark Cards are expensive a'f now considering the price tag they put on all the new vehicles etc.Singleplayer 10/10Online 8.5/10Regardless of the Online flaws I guarantee you will have tons of fun and end up hating the game in the end. )
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Hi It feels hard to write a review for such a large game !Offline story It's great you need to really get into the world story and characters of GTA. I didn't do it at first because I wasn't thrilled to be a bad guy but it eventually sinked in and now I regret to not have payed attention to all the details you see when playing the story. I think the game is really worth it just with the story.Online mode I am new to online gaming in fact GTA is the first time I stay online for so long.PRO Lots of content vehicules missions assets you will have fun trying them.Even if you don't have the money to buy them you can use them in differents mission that provide the best place to try them (unless you really like to kill helpless random player).You can join crew in advanced missions even if you are low level.You still level your character and see it going stronger and accessing more stuff.Did I say a lot of content ? )CONS Lots of cheaters/modders/hackers I guess it's hard to remove them all and I don't have experience with other games. It feels like they are pretty free from getting banned.I would love to be able to do everything in private sessions but some missions/jobs requires you to be in public sessions.It won't be long before you explode or be turned into a christmas tree for no reasons.Of course missions with small number of player is less risky to turn into a hackfest.Monetization I understand Rockstar needs money to keep making stuff (that is free btw)but content seems a bit overpriced. It feels hard to save just to buy a simple weaponized chopper. I think missions should get you a little more money.What is making the matter worse is character calling you every minutes to ask you to buy this facility or this operation center and it feels like you are swamped in disguised ads to buy stuff with real money. And of course you can't turn these calls off. Check how many forum threads there is on that.Overall I'd say try to have fun in missions with trusted people and don't try to own lots of vehicules or assets.Because if you get into this you either grind money all of the time or purchase (with real money) shark cards to have money in game.I understand that players who bought shark cards keeps Rockstar making free DLC so I thanks them but we should make sure they don't overprofits from this.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The only thing I can say to describe my experience with this game is this Playing Frogger at 5 in the morning in a four lane freeway as a block headed man in a blue suit with an orange bowtie with my friend who looks like an old Eminem.Frogger somehow leads into every car on the highway exploding.All this exploding leading to the whole server getting kicked except for my friend and I.My lungs dying from laughter and me waking my roommate in real life.This game is fun however I rarely ever play it without friends. It can be fun without them (like in the campaign for example) but playing with your friends in Online is an experience that not many games can match. It seems as though many people though have been getting screwed over by Rockstar without so much as a simple explanation. So should I recommend this game?I enjoy it but I know that people who put in a lot of time and effort just to get it wiped for no reason would think differently. I am just a simple casual.Overall I do recommend the game. Campaign is fun. Online is a blast however do not get too attached to your Online account because Rockstar likes to ban people for no reason and gives no mercy on the matter.

review: I apologise but I DO NOT recommend you to buy this game due to several reasons 1. Online play demands frequent purchases of shark cards. Prices of stuff are way extreme and your cash drains fast. My Megalodon which added up to 12 Million dollars ended up draining fast down to 2 Million. They do this on purpose so you continuosly buy cards stealing your IRL money.2. Jobs Online Some missions are tough to complete alone. The Nightclub setup where you have to bring in the equipment truck (steal it from a festival) requires you to go far out in the desert and take the long route back in under an exagerated 4 minute timer driving a very slow truck...Really?! 4 mins for a distance of more then 10km away!!!3. Erratic AI behaviour You fix your car AI drivers destroy it for you again.4. Possibility of griefers online that ruin your game experience and destroy your cargo and supplies....and one last thing. There is no GTA VI yet! Don't go to clickbait Youtube videos!Thanks Kindest Regards Retired Los Santos Gangster

review: Would recommend the game for the game itself because I think it's awesome.However I think I am not alone when I say the greatest plus of the PC version could have been the moddability. Well that's down the drain as I saw in other people's reviews. Now I just don't dare to download a single mod because who knows I might want to play GTA Online. Actually I did play got killed by some a hole quick then switched to passive mode (which will disable any physical interactions between players also you can't use your weapons on the 'big' map) and enjoyed a few mission. Hey there are missions that can be played alone! You'll get whacked a few times by the tougher than in single player enemies but using cover and bringing extra body armors (when you are high level enough to have more than one) can do the trick. I'm level 16 just by doing missions alone. But I'm off the track here. What I wanted to say Would not recommend for actively discouraging the use of mods even in single player. That's why I'm giving a thumbs down should R* change their policy on this I'd change the rating to thumbs up. Here's hoping.***After thinking it over and seeing (have not tried out though) that mods in SP seem to not interfere with GTAO I'm changing the final verdict to thumbs up even if I lose the rating of this review. Hey "101 of 130 people (78%) found this review helpful". Maybe my most successful review. Eh what must be done must be done.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game is amazingly fun don't get me wrong. I had LOADS of fun online however with the latest patch they fudged up. Basically they don't want you modding their game. Online OR SINGLE PLAYER cheating or (what I did) using a harmless pov mod or player model changer will get you the ban hammer.So until they get their crap together and stop this autobanning crap (They say they aren't but its 100% obvious they are and they don't even bother looking into any reports or activity. You have ANY mod on multiplayer or single player you're banned.) DO NO BUY THIS GAME (YET)!*EDIT*The game is a lot better now and has been for quite some time. You'll still see modders and you'll often hear in chat people asking said modders for money (DON'T TAKE IT!) Though unlikely it's possible to get banned from taking the money even if you're not the one modding. Plus it's not hard to make money in the game what with the new VIP/Bodyguard jobs and the heists you could do. Every now and then you'll see a modder who uses mods to win fights (mad cuz bad) but it's rare ish. I love this game and would gladly reccomend it to anyone! Buy a home a car and a minigun and go to town!

review: I know i only have around 15 hours on this game but it is honeslty my favorite video to this date. Ive owned this game on my ps3 and ps4 and ive had easily over 1000 hours on it. On the console its an amazing experience and you can overall have a great time. But then it comes to the PC version of the game. You can have just as much as fun on singleplayer as you would on the ps3/ ps4. You could even do more awesome things that would potentially set you hardrive on fire by dowloading over the top mods that will give you tons of fun for many hours. The singleplayer is unlike any other (which is a good thing). But then you hop into the land of 7 year olds that think they are the and 35 year old hackers and modders known as the wonderful world of Grand Theft Auto Online. Listen. If you want to buy this $60 game just for specificaly playing online get it on a console. The moment you step into the world you are placed in a lobby filled with about 10 hackers and modders that will do anything to ruin your day just so they can get a quick evil feel of satisfaction. If you want to do anything on online i strongly reccomend to find a group of nice people and make a "invite only session". Once you do this you can have just as much fun and you would on the consoles. The only downside of this is that you wont be able to do any CEO missions or any thing of that sort. This game is easily one of my favorite games i have ever played but Rockstar needs to do something about the online side of things.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Pretty fun game I have almost 600 hours on it and I'll probably have much more over time. However I wouldn't recommend this game because of how much it pushes for you to buy Shark Cards in Online over priced microtransactions that provide you with in game currency. This wouldn't be a problem if you didn't mind constantly and I mean CONSTANTLY grinding to buy the things you can use in freemode. Hell you have to grind just to buy things you use to grind even more. At one point I caved in and bought a shark card because grinding in this game is awful and I just wanted to get this one vehicle. I wouldn't make that mistake again because it only further encourages Rockstar to add microtransactions to future games. Story mode doesn't have that great of a story and you can't do much so if that's what you want I'd buy IV San Andreas or Vice City instead. Also if you're wondering what grinding entails it means doing the same heists over and over (they get boring after playing through them a few times) doing missions and races that pay and doing freemode missions for your business MC or soon enough nightclub that pay pretty well but are so horribly boring and leave you at the mercy of griefers.

review: I love this game yet it is not one that I can play for too long. I got like a day in the game within the first week of having it then I took a month break. Played it to death for another week after that took a month break. I find myself getting tired of it really quickly. Also the game is not as fun if you do not have money. The game is way more fun when you can buy every vehicle gun etc. At the start I found this game really boring because all I did was grind missions for money. After I got money I had a really fun time with this game. Me and my friends just mess around in special vehicles and have a good time. If you want to have some fun with friends you need to grind missions or find other ways to get money. I would definitely not buy this game full price I do not think it is worth the 60$. I would wait until the game goes on at least a 50% discount. I would say it is worth 30$.

review: I've been waiting this game for a long time.. since the day one the PS3 and X360 era i've never played this game because i'm sure one day this game will come to PC.and that day finally come.. from performance review to be honest i'm very satisfied with this game it's optimized to run in PC. not like WD lol.but there's only one major issue stuttering but that issue often come out when you're using graphic setting that exceeded limit of your graphic card. i'm using GTX 670 and 8GB Ram and i can run this game in very high setting with MSAA turned off (i know the staircase effect is very imminent lol) it's steady 45 60 but i'll always turn Vsnyc off and i'm getting highest FPS 85. story review it's unique 3 playable main character each have their own mission and part and own uniqueness.. Michael with his charisma and mastermind planning Franklin with his loyalty and spirit and Finally Trevor with his Unpredictable Capabilities. i will not spoil anything about the plot but it's useless i guess you guys already know huh? Gameplay i think this is a very complete open world experience you can use 1st person camera it feels like you're playing far cry game you can customize your car and participate in a street race like in that EA game (you know what) you can run and gun or run and punch every single person in the game you really have access to any place in the game the movement animation is awesome flip flop is really flop lol.. gun play gameplay is very engaging driving mechanic feels simplified not like GTA IV and i like it there's so many things to do like golf tennis shooting range or just driving around. i have no complain about the gameplay. but i'm not to satisfied with the wanted system maybe it's because in gta without cheat you can get bullied by the cop easily and the second thing is there is no 6 star wanted level.. i miss being chased by National Guard.. lol Control i'm using keyboard and mouse and it feels flawless.. every single function is customizable and i'm not having a problem to get to use to.. but sometimes it feels like the mouse responsiveness is not that responsive idk maybe it's just my imagination.. ) Sound it's good but not too awesome.. maybe if the gun sound is more maximized it will be awesome.. the ambience too not too stand out. the voice acting makes the story more interesting like watching a movie. Graphic i think this GTAV PC edition will make WatchDogs Cry lol. but i'm noticing it doesn't matter if you crank up the population density setting the population isn't too improved not so many. but then i never played GTAV on Last gen console before so idk the difference. shadow and AO is look so good the lighting awwww it's ing perfect the glory of GTA V is on the lighting system lol.. the weather effect it's top notch. vehicle damage system is amazing it's a joy to play this game on 1080p 60 fps i'm curious what will be like when play this game on 4k Resolution? ) Online Multiplayer this is the masterpiece of Rockstar the GTAO is the ultimate experience from playing GTA V it's where all the fun are. it's a whole diferrent world in GTAO it's anarchy. but it's fun trust nobody shoot first ask question never kinda thing. the more you have friend that play this game the more you enjoy you play the game. it's just very fun and all the good things are here.. safehouse customization plane tank etc...Overall it satisfied me Long await finally end thank you stuttering problem no 6 star wanted level sound is average good story make me losing my real life make me hard to sleep Online is very very very very engaging and addicting. NOT a waste of money if you haven't own and play this game before GOOD Optimization for PC. Eye Candy Graphic Nice narrative and dialogue the voice acting makes the story more interesting like watching a movie.10/10 for me..thanks R*EDIT NO MODS SUPPORT. USING MOD MAKE YOU GET BANNED. ROCKSTAR IS SUCK I'M EDITING AGAIN MY REVIEW.. AND I'M NOT RECCOMENDED YOU GUYS ALL TO BUY THIS GAME...!!! UNTIL IT's SUPPORT MODS.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Why I rewrite this review I was only looking into the part of GTA online not the whole game including storymode.I would recommend buying the game to enjoy the storymode franchise and the online mode.GTA V is a very detailed game quite easy to run very funny for example When you spawn as Trevor he says to a vegan woman "How could you suck and not eat meat it don't make any sense to me!"The game is hilarious! You might also not find the online mode too fun but if you want to buy GTA V to play storymode it is okay but people might ask "Why should I buy GTA V to play storymode when I can simply download it for free?" The answer is simple to support the game you might also change your mind and start playing online.You can meet new friends have fun race challenge and much more you didn't even know about.Grand theft Auto V has a lot what to offer us not considering there are also hidden missions eastereggs hidden places and rooms.I think that for 30 or 60 dollars you can have much more beyond playing the game.Ok now that I've convinced you to buy the game please make sure your computer is capable of running the game enjoy the game and don't cheat.

The singleplayer storyline is amazing and lots of fun and I recommend this game to anyone looking to have a fun time.

review: Haven't seen any hackers yet other then the people who modded their level to be 6666. I'm on a budget build and I run this like a champ on medium settings too bad the game won't even let me try to run it on ultra. Some people like to just downright troll and ruin heists so watch who you play with. I can surprisingly have Chrome open and the game open at the same time and receive no lag. Don't let the "random bans" discourage you from buying. Their not random and only happen when you're actually cheating or when you have a third party game overlay enabled. Discord In Game Overlay MSI Afterburner and any thing that can be considered an overlay will get you banned. I haven't tried modding yet and don't plan on it. If you're new there are plenty of people your level and are just as poor as you. I'm not saying it's a bad game or anything but I would try to buy this on sale if I was you. I just don't feel like it's worth 60$ 35 to 40 dollars should be good. The one thing that annoys me during gameplay however is the HUD all those popup missions and I don't know I just don't like it judge me. Update 10/15/16EVERY I N G HEIST I JOIN I GET KICKED DISCONNECTED OR THE HOST JUST LEAVES. I AM SO TIRED AND I NEED MONEY. HOW THE AM I SUPPOSE TO PLAY THIS GAME IF ALL I CAN DO IS ROB STORES SELL A CAR FOR 8K EVERY HOUR OR SO AND DO S H I T RACES THAT ONLY PAY YOU 1K?!?!?!?! THIS GAME IS A I N G SHAM!!!! I'M NOT BUYING YOUR D A M N SHARK CARDS ROCKSTAR!!!!!!!!! REEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE Update 11/23/16I haven't been banned yet so I think it's okay hackers are pretty common but most of the time they're not bad and give you money and modded vehicles. However don't deposit that money into your bank account because you will be banned for hacking. Keep it on your person and deposit like 10k every time after a heist or something. Also if you experience unexpected crashing make sure to check the chat every once in a while because there are hackers that can instantly crash everyone in the session's game. It's rare and has only happened to me once so far. With all the hate that this game is getting though it is still in the Top 10 on steamcharts sooo yeah... Also if you have a HDD and not a SSD(Digital Drive) the loading times will be absolute cancer (about 3 minutes). But I'm used to it because I played Battlefield 4 and it was even longer. Overall it's fun but don't slap sixty dollars on it unless your well off financial wise I paid sixty dollars because I didn't think it was ever gonna go on sale and at the time I'm making this review it's 50% off FML. Thirty bucks should be a sufficient price for this game. Don't pay for the shark cards unless again your well off. There's a grinding element to it but it doesn't take too long also be sure to play with friends when doing Heists because people are really stupid and will ruin heists therefore wasting your time. Update 6/13/17 you rockstar for taking away mods kill yourselves.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Personally I haven't played the campaign yet and I'll udate this review when I do.If you are here for a multiplayer racing/bank robbing/blowing up friends kind of game you came to the right place. Plus every single DLC ever released for this game was FREE. And that's good they're about every 1 4 months. Highly reccomended plus... Since this game came out in 2013 it's estimated the next GTA title won't be until 2018. So even if you're a bit late to the party It's okay! Hop in! You're sure to enjoy it.BTW...If you played on the XBOX 360 or PS3 CONVERT YOUR SOCIAL CLUB ACCOUNT! You'll get a sick armored car only last gen players can get )EDIT I no longer reccomend this game. At this point every single "free" DLC releases content so expensive with in game cash you have to either grind for hours a day to get the money or spend real cash to get the stuff which is total BS. Also Rockstar games officially ended support for mods which was one of the greatest things about this game. Do not buy it even if it is on sale waste of time and money!

review: After over 300 hours I decided to review this game.Rockstar is really overpricing their stuff. Their marketing strategy is that they discount vehicles before the new update comes so that people will be spending in game money on the discounted vehicles and then they want the DLC vehicles so they are forced to buy an expensive as hell shark card.Paying a modder is cheaper than buying shark cards I could pay a modder i don't know 5 bucks and get myself 50 milion as if in shark cards for 36 euro you get 3 6 million.Rockstar is banning innocent people when they're bored and NO ONE will believe you if you write about that on the discussion page and since I have a VAC ban whatever I say people will always reply with "this dude is lying because he has vac" like seriously people don't judge the book by its cover.This is probably my longest review yet but GTA is absolutely NOT worth it for full price.Buy this game on a sale but be ready for grinding though it's not the same level of grinding as in Warframe.

review: Saw this amazing Pie Recipe and thought I should share it!Ingredients 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples peeled cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double crust pie Directions 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter white sugar brown sugar water cinnamon and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10 inch circle. Cut into 8 (1 inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips one at a time into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter sugar mixture over top of pie coating the lattice and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the crust is golden brown the caramel on the top crust is set and the apple filling is bubbling 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I don't want to recommend this game because Rockstar doesn't actually own Rockstar energy drinks and that makes me sad.That being said this game is a blast. I'm not a big fan of the story mode as I feel like it's the hardest and most ridiculous one to make money in and that money can be easily lost thanks to the stock market glitch in game that sometimes randomly deletes all your stock market shares. I played about 40 45% of the way through the story and only made money off the first heist I did. Not a single one of the other missions I've done have earned me so much as a dime which I found to be incredibly offputting. It's why I eventually stopped playing the story mode without finishing it. The missions were just your standard GTA style "go steal something or kill some people and get away from the cops in different vehicles" kind of missions that they've always done and without any sort of payout from it I didn't see the point in continuing to do them. And the only side mission I unlocked that paid money was with Trevor to make either $5K or $7K smuggling guns by car or plane and I couldn't even repeat them as much as I wanted to quickly make cash there was a lengthy waiting period before it would refresh and I could do them again. Given that most properties cost more than a million bucks making $12K every day or so would have been a long tedious grind to buy some decent properties. I find it so much harder to make money in this GTA than it's been in any other perhaps because it's the most restrictive and one of the methods is bugged and can lose all your money if you try it.This brings me to the online aspect of the game. I'm not sure why they gave us GTA Online if they were going to structure the system to actively penalize players who want to PLAY GTA. By that I mean the more crimes you commit (stealing cars shooting people killing people causing mahyem basic GTA fun) the higher your "mental state" gets and when it gets too high the other online player get incentives to come and kill you. Yeah that's right if you're just looking to goof around online with your own character and just cause some chaotic fun you'd better either bring 15 friends to fill the session or hope you don't get stuck with players who like killing other players or you're gonna be spending a few hours each session just getting killed again and again every time you get a one star police bounty on you for commiting any crime. And since the game respawns you near where you died the player who just killed you with their armored weaponized vehicle is also nearby and will be there in approx. 10 seconds to kill you again and again until one of you gets bored. Did I also mention that you also get incentivised to do nothing a.k.a. having "good behavior" for a certain period of time? That's right you just get cash given to you by the game if you go long enough without breaking the law that's what we all expect from GTA right? Rewarding players who don't break the law? Hahaha right. Also I get that it's the online mode but there doesn't seem to be any solo activities that can be done to earn rep points to rank up and unlock the better guns armor etc. I don't want to have to play/compete with the other players in the session to get RP and rank up. I want the option of course I just don't like being/feeling forced to. Sometimes I just wanna do a mission or 2 on my own if they didn't want to allow us to do our own separate things in the same online world what was the point of adding multiplayer? I'm not forced to stick around the other players so I was expecting to also be able to go off and do a stunt series or any activity on my own.So with all these complaints why do I recommend this game? Simple it does the main thing I wanted out of another GTA let me drive around real fast on motorcycles and murder people. Adding first person makes it so much more fun and engaging. It's such a fun challenge to try and drive 60 100mph through the city or on the highway and try to shoot tires or people at those speeds without wrecking. And GTA Online adds other real people who might come and try to put a stop to my mayhem and murderous rampage. Trying to outrun real players and/or kill them on the run is much more exciting than running from any NPC or AI cops no matter how many there are. The only downside is that the human players usually don't give up once the heat is cleared and it's harder to find motorcycles in GTA Online than in story mode. Not sure WHY that is I just am sure THAT it is.Anyway if you too wanna just drive around and shoot people and practice getting better at both or even just cruise around really fast in different environments I recommend getting this game. I think it's still $60 so just wait for a Steam sale and get it at a discount like everyone else who doesn't already own it then pick it up jump in and try to put a stop to my mayhem if you think you can. Please don't though.

review: As you might have already heard this brand new 2 year old game is just freakin fantastic!+ Great story (although a bit short if you ask me) with loads of mission variety shooting driving flying diving boating parachuting stealth... you name it GTA V has it. Also there are a ton of cutscenes that have great dialogue writing voice acting and are always entertaining and fun to watch.+ Great main characters never mind what crazy people say Trevor is the man! He's pretty much the only GTA character that acts like a psycho both in cutscenes and in game (you know when you're making him murder innocent people with a rocket launcher as you do). Michael is pretty great too a lot of his missions are wacky in a sitcom/soap opera mashup kinda way. Franklin is a bit too average in my opinion but he has his moments (and a puppy!).+ Amazing graphics never knew 360 and ps3 games looked so damn good. )+ This game is so full of small teeny tiny details. For example when you're playing in third person and you pull out your phone it shows it in the bottom right corner of your screen and while you're navigating the phone menu you can see the tiny phone screen in your character's hand actually displaying the same stuff you see on your bottom right and when your character receives a call and answers it the phone lights up his face as he puts it up to his ear. It's small details like these that make GTA V's version of Los Santos come alive.+ Car sounds! Sit in GTA's version of a Lamborghini or Ferrari switch to first person view and enjoy the engine sounds.+ Danger zone Fortunate Son Danger zone Carry On Wayward Son Danger zone Gimme All Your Lovin' DANGER ZONE!!1!+/ Runs fine on average poor man's gaming hardware 660ti i7 920 3Ghz 8gb of ram can squeeze close to an average of 60 fps with everything turned up to high/very high IF! you turn the grass down to normal. If not lock your fps to 30 turn up the grass and enjoy your ps4 game). That is of course if you don't get struck by the stuttering bug which they may or may not fix who knows... or you know if your game doesn't start (these problems are plaguing a lot of people so keep that in mind before throwing money at rockstar).Online is a thing I'm not a big fan of online games unless they are proper mmo's (this game is not an mmo) but I wouldn't recommend playing GTA online alone (as in with random people) cause it just might bore you to death.It may not really be a perfect game by any standards but it gave me everything I wanted out of it and more. It's just a fantastic open world game and instantly one of my favorite games ever 10/10.

review: Unlike a lot of my fellow gamers I was lucky enought to access the game without a lot of problems just creating a new session on windows for it to work because of the bug concerning letters used in your windows name.But I still can't really play it. And why is that ? Because as a lot of other gamers I've got terrible stuttering problems.Fact is that when the game is launched it seems to have a memory leak problem for a lot of us that makes your RAM usage build up and up and up...Until it's full and your hard drive has to take up the role of "Virtual RAM". So there you are. 100% HDD usage CPU and GPU are just useless cause they're waiting for their partners (RAM and HDD) to do the job. Wich they CAN'T do because the game is metaphorically a boat leaking from all other the place for them and that they have to get the water off to let the CPU and GPU drive the boat as they want. And they can't do that cause the game keep sending damn tsunamis in their faces and don't even give them buckets to throw the water off. Short story The game is a great game. It has a lot of improval other console versions and it is very very enjoyable. BUT as it is today you have 1/2 chance for it NOT to work as it can not even launch or give you this stuttering problem that ruins the game after a couple of minutes. It is then not a lottery ticket worth 60 for me and I totally regret spending that much money for pre load and playing quickly for a game that doesn't seems to be really tested for problems like those ones.Sorry Rockstar. I believed you could do it and rise up to the challenge of releasing a game on PC without that many problems. You couldn't. Don't know if you tried hard enought or if it's just not possible considering the platform.
