title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Can't recommend this game to anyone. Reason ? Well I'll tell you.Rockstar Customer Support is the worst ever support I have ever encountered. They can't handle the hackers in Online so they make a automatic anti cheat system and guess what... legitimate players get banned for no reason. I was one of those players. I bought GTA V on 25 December 2016 on PC my Christmas present. Due to my bad internet I had to download the for four nights.Logged on Thursday and started Story Mode and played for maybe 5 6 hours. I read and heard rumors that Online is broken and Rockstar bans legit players. At first I was afraid to join because I thought that I would get a perm ban on the moment. My machine is a laptop and yes it's not very good but handles most games on medium low with good fps which is ok for me. GTA V has a giant world and I used my second GPU which is activated with a High Performance setting (You set the game to a High Performance setting and this lets the game to work with the second GPU the more powerful one) and I had average FPS for my laptop 30 40 FPS which I was really happy about. Here comes the big moment. I wanted to see Online and see the new updates. I played the game previously on Xbox 360 and haven't modded the console so I was clean. I transferred my profile to PC so I could continiue my progress. Last time I remember I had a luxury apartment and cars and was level 55 60 I don't remember about the level. When I joined I was level 26 and had a small garage with one bike. I wasn't mad about that so I thought it would be good idea to start with some setups for heists or some survivals to get money. Played a heist setup and my teammates failed maybe 3 4 times because some of them didn't knew to take cover when being shot at. Anyway I joined some other missions. I had some fps drops during the mission so I thought that if I used Razer Cortex a Game Booster which could give you more FPS no modding or cheating my game would gain 5 to +10 fps. It didn't work. I noticed during Story Mode that the game was eating a lot RAM and caused some drops. I have 8 gigs ram and my game uses up to 7 so I had a RAM Optimizer and used it. It helped a little but it didn't last long. I then relogged to Online without the booster I repeat WITHOUT THE BOOSTER and joined a heist setup. We were about the finish the heist setup and boom Rockstar dropped the bomb. I was suspended for 30 days. I was like ''I ing knew it !! I ing knew it...those bastards ban players for no reason.'' I wrote to the Support and told them everything. 1 day later I recieved an answer that my ban won't be removed and yadda yadda yadda I violated the game terms and EULA. What did I violate ffs ??! I played the Online for maybe 1 hour or maybe more and on my first day boom ban. Tell me how did I violate the game terms by using a game optimizer/high performance setting.The High Performance setting is made by the GPU manufacturer to optimize games and give you more FPS. Tell me why would a cheap automatic anti cheat system detect a game optimizer as a hack ?! I also heard that background programs could get you banned. Probably if my Skype was turned on I guess I would have gotten a perm ban. Ok they don't support third party software but how is a game optimizer or a high performance setting considered a hack or modding ?! Oh yeah forgot to mention I didn't modify my game files or downloaded any mods for the Single Player. They even have an ''Appeal ban'' option. They will never appeal your ban even if you got video evidence. I don't see the point why they made this option when they won't do anything. They won't even tell you what was the reason you are banned or what did you use or do to get banned. Will never buy games made by Rockstar again. Reason why I still haven't refunded the game is to see if I will get banned again when my ban expires. Had such high hopes for this game and bought it for the Online and their support is worse than Black Ops 3 on old gen consoles.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V crashes too often. I can't progress in the story mode because of a mission related crash and before this mission playing the story was only possible for about 30 minutes at a time. I can't play GTA Online for more than 10 30 minutes without a crash. I do not experience frame droping stuttering input lag etc. I only get a sudden crash to desktop. I know people who do not have a single issue playing this game but there are far too many people who have purchased GTA V experiencing technical issues just trying to play the game. Reinstalling does not help community fixes do not help it's all on Rockstar now. This game is not worth a purchase until it's playable.edit 6/7/2015I sent in a ticket to Rockstar Support over a month ago I got about seven responses during this time four of these were fix suggestions. The fixes suggested by Rockstar Support were almost always things I had already tried myself (such as lowering settings changing which DirectX the game was running on). There were also suggested fixes that were completely unrelated to the issue I was having. It doesn't seem like they look at the actual info sent to them and just suggest random fixes that have "worked for other players". It's been almost two weeks since Rockstar Support has last responded to a message of mine. Maybe the issue is just too complicated but I haven't been able to play this game properly since its release so it doesn't seem acceptable.

review: Single player for me personally not worth the price they selling the game for. GTA V single player is really overated. Not saying is bad just saying you should not get it just for the single player for full price. If you however in the market for some GTA online it may be worth getting it. But and A BIG BUT is. U need to make sure u have at least 3 more friend u can play with it. If not GG. Hacker run rampant in server and most players will just kill u on sight. The biggest problem with GTA in general once u done one type of mission or one type of activity u probably wont come back to it. Unless u have friend u can share the experience with and if u come back to it alone will feel like grinding. Difference playing with friend and playing with random people is like day and night. Sure u can have fun with random people sometimes but to get full experience u need friends.Bottom line is Love the game. But Online is must play with friends and single player is not worth the full price.Score 8/10

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I'll try to ignore the Take2 chaos though because of that this might be the last GTA i buy.It was a good journey seeing that i started playing GTA 1 on my first PC when i was a kid. Single Player V is clearly a masterpiece and there's nobody doing games like this at the level that Rockstar does. They basically build on the same game just adding to it so their decades of experience makes it a loosing battle for new starters like Watchdogs(Driver) and all those cash grabs that don't dedicate their life for making the perfect game in a certain genre.With that said i miss the vibrance of GTA2 with the crazy gangs they had and a certain lore. A remake of that with this new engine would be a crazy hit for them in this age of repackaged classics. It wouldn't work to go goofy with a new story cause that's why Saint's Row exists. Speaking of that the Zaibatsu car in GTAV as an easter egg brought a tear to my eye. Thanks Rockstar for that. Multiplayer oh boy oh boy where do i start with this one. I know many kids love it and take two made sure to mess it up really good cause i guess making billions selling the game is not enough. I won't go too much into this cause as a game developer myself i see the pointless nature of it. I've seen the parasites among us that have no respect for what they do and just want all the money. Not just money.....all of it. Micro transactions in a full priced game like this are just simple as that.Last time i've entered the online feature i waited forever to load. I play most games that launch these days and GTA5 online is by far the slowest affair ever. By the time it loads i'm questioning if i was in the mood to play or not. Los Santos is a shadow of it's single player version with just a handful of cars in variety everything seems baren and it's crazy how an online game can look more deserted and feels more lonely than it's single player story. Except the crazy random explostions from you're generic "let's create chaos" kinda player.For me GTA multiplayer was always about the fun of actually having fun in the same city as the campaign but with other players and just roaming around not going into "paralel universes" like the missions at the moment are playable. It's a mixed bag. Some are pretty good but the city is now just a hub for those and it's not the actual game. Long discussion but i feel it lost focus.I bored people enough so in short even if i find the single player as a masterpiece the money they make on the Online component and seeing they have another Online focused expansion coming up all i can say to Rockstar is to be careful. I understand Take2 will make a bunch of money for their corporate overlords while they are still alive but in the long run it damages the brand and people won't have the same feeling and aura around GTA. It worked and made billions cause it was a respectful build up to this point. So as long as the next entry will be as solid and will stay on it's feet not rely on online and as long as Red Dead Redemption will be as focused as all products till now i think we're good. There's a bright future ahead.P.S. Rockstar...speaking of Read Dead....us PC gamers literally made you in the 90's. We were the ones that spread the word of GTA. You already have all the money in the world so don't sign some exclusive contract. Just launch the next game on all platforms. We're here we'll support you don't let us down.Thanks.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Who cares what Take Two or Rockstar are doing. Its still a great game and deserves respect we get FREE content and we don't even need to buy shark cards. Rockstar generously gave us double money event mission AND heists to well prepare ourselves for the update. Its ONE modding tool they took down there are still numerous other software tools to get mods for storymode and more to come I believe since the main one was taken down. Its very pitiful to see people change their recommendation just because of one stinky move. All the good rockstar and take two did outweighs the one bad. Suck it up and move on.I hope others like me keep a positive recommendation.

review: Unlike the majority of the negative reviewers I bought GTA V not GTA Online. The game GTA V is a lot of fun the world is big and colourful the characters are ok (I really didn't care about any of their lives much) and the story is enough to keep me going. The radio is NOT as good as earlier ones (too much stupid music not enough legitimately funny ads shows etc). the TV was ok in this but kind of...bland. I play GTA for the RPG experience of a deeply satirical and sarcastic world view of the one we live in and this one simply didn't deliver as before.Beautiful graphics fun to play.It's worth the price especially on sale to obtain and enjoy GTA V. I can't review GTA Online because I didn't care about it. I tried it didn't really enjoy the mini games and heists...I think it's made for a niche crowd. Probably the kind who get aggressive over nothing hits on someone's sister (coldly rebuffed which he deals with as an emotionally stunted individual) then demands the blunt hurry up and be passed. This person also vows that people on X Box Live will be dealt with in real life because they don't know him. This person is probably also going to rage at me because I don't know how evil Rockstar is for taking his money by making it hard to free play online but that's because I only gave them enough money to play the game I wanted GTA V.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Review December 2017 Game is still fun graphics are fine especially if set on Ultra.Is always hard to find serious players to complete Heists and Missions. We're lucky to have the Story Mode and the Solo Sessions preventing us to deal with hackers and spamming kids of GTA Online that is slowly becoming unplayable due to Rockstar lack of control over cheaters.Still a great game. Amazing how this game can run on a 5 years old pc getting 60fps with medium settings!Rockstar did a good port of this game from the consoles to the PC.There're still some minor bugs to fix especially in GTA Online but the game itself works with no issues )If you're a fan of the GTA series consider buying this game you won't regret it D
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I know about the whole Rockstar being greedy AF. They shouldn't have increased the price just before sales. But I am here to talk about the game itself and not about the marketing. The costs only 40$ here in India so I can't feel the pain of others who are paying 70 80$ on this. IMHO It is worth every penny I have paid!! This game can be summed up in one word ADDICTING!! This game has almost everything to offer and after almost 300 hrs of playing this I am still not bored. I am a type of guy who cannot play one single game for more than 3 hrs I get bored easily. But this game is just so well made that I never get bored!! SO much stuff to do online and offline. I haven't finished the story yet but so far it's very interesting. The online has so much stuff to buy and so much to do!! I love everything about it!! Deathmatches Missions Captures and a lot more!! EARN your money and buy your stuff!!Of course this is no way a perfect game there are so many connectivity problems and not to mention the crashes!! The game's well optimised but these crashes and connectivity issues tend to ruin the gameplay experience. NOT TO MENTION THE HACKERS!! Oh GOD they are sooo annoying!! The sessions are full of Hackers who ruin the entire GAME!!But otherwise as far as the game goes It's Amazing!! If you haven't played it on consoles at some point you have to get this game!! A must buy!!

review: Edit The problems appear to be already fixed for me on the first day Well that was fast.Singleplayer + Graphic could actually be better but still all over the place considering that the world is so big+ Realistic characters They are not "normal" persons for sure but it never feels like Rockstar is forcing the characters to develop their behaviour+ Very interesting stories which are very well integrated into the gameplay and the environment During the missions the player has to interact with the world a lot but i never feels much scripted like in other games also the gameplay has a lot of variety+ A smoothly and naturally acting world that takes place at the east coast of the USA+ Great humour Although the game can be quiet brutal or radical at some point ( see Trevors behaviour ) it actually made me laugh a lot of times and surprised me with creative ideas for missions etc.+ A lot of radio stations presenting nearly all kind of music directions+ A lot of things to do apart the missions Even just the tennis mini game is better than some other games out there + Revised wanted system The police and the whole system now work better although you could also argument that the car chases now take too long and that the police shoots too good but even then I still find the new system better than in older gtas+ New "skills" and such for your character Basically you can have some sort of "bullet time" for shooting but also for driving last thing makes driving so much easier for people like me who shoot better than they drive + More content such as cloths cars etc. than ever before+ Way friendlier placed save points+ A lot of settings to modify the controls etc. However I would like to have the older weapon circle system the new one seems to be not that optimal for pc
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Well well... I will start of to say I was hyped about this new "Saga" series.I'm no longer hyped and I've lost all faith in upcoming titles.The bugs currently make the game close to unplayable. Ai can't declare war on player as it is now... so if you don't get any allies there's no risk of getting attacked.The Ai will just run into your territory stand next to a settlement for 1 3 turns then run back.Next one has to do with the food. For some reason if I count how much I should get from my building tooltips then go to look how much my buildings actually give me in the overview it's a lot less. So magically dissapearing food. I'm well aquainted with the game and its mechanics so far and believe me when I say I haven't overlooked anything when it comes to the food.Another one would be the combat Ai... Their horse generals always stand back to the right of their army. Don't even run away from charging spear units. So.. instant win against ALL horse generals.That's the three most major bugs I've run into so far.Then we got the problem with the cheating Ai... the amount of food they get from nowhere is HUGE. I thought this system was to cancel out some of the zergfest problems. They still run around with 15 20 stacks when they just got 2 settlements. (Mostly played on HARD)Oh another thing would be desyncs on multiplayer. Not as common as in some previous titles but they are still there.I would not recommend this game unless they fix ALL these things I've stated. And I seriously doubt they ever will.This is like a really cheap copy of Atilla. With more gamebreaking bugs.

review: Not worth the hassle not worth full price and most certainly not worth 2 years of additional delay.GTAV Online is a broken poorly planned piece of spaghetti garbage. There are no server broswers instead you have to automatically load lobbies so you can load job setups so yo can load missions. Then something disconnects (happens a LOT) and you get the load a new "world" so you can load a lew setup so you can load anew lobby. Then this missions takes 4 minutes to complete and you get to spend 10 more minutes loading.This game is not well balanced it is ill conceived the netcode is absolutely horrible (unless you like playing with russians with 400 ping)There is nothing good about it. I can't believe I got fooled into buying it twice (once on PS3 when there was no online and now on PC where online is just bad)Avoid this P.O.S game.The best part about the online experience is discover why videogames have introduced over the last 20 years abstract and advanced concepts such as parties lobbies server browsers and not loading the entire game just to pick a gamemodeSeriously this game sucks. It's amazing that it sucks so much considering the unbelievable amount of work put into it's world. There are so many things to see in Los Santos so many places NPCs. It's a beautiful world but playing in it is an absolute drag. If you want gameplay look elsewhere.The is the most beautiful GTA ever made. It's also the worse.AVOID

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: After the sheer disappointment that was Grand Theft Auto 4 this game at least in comparison has been a pleasure to say the least.Without even taking into consideration anything else graphically this is a masterpiece. The models are the most impressive I have seen in any game. The urban areas sadly seem dull in most places however the wilderness is truly breathtaking and an absolute pleasure to behold on ultra settings if not lower. I didn't expect to enjoy playing more than one character throughout the story but it worked out very well overall and I actually enjoyed each of the characters personalities. The non playable characters in the game friends family or foe are also memorable and interesting.The main story was great to playthrough but it seemed to abruptly end. The "Strangers and Freaks" side missions which are new to the series were unusually not boring which is rare for games in general. I probably won't dabble in the Online mode due to the microtransation insanity that I've seen but overall I can imagine with the map size this game provides it would still be a blast regardless though I can't talk from experience.The PC port is overall stable but the first person mode is subpar as the FoV veicule viewpoint placements and weapon positions are just bad to say the least a shame. The weapons and cars at least feel good to use sadly however controlling aircraft still holds true to being a pain to use. As the game is based in Los Santos I wish it was more architecturally similar to that of how it was in San Andreas plus there's also the obvious fact that it seems the other cities from that game have been retconned for no reason which makes me question what the heck is going on in the overall series now it's just confusing. A bit of a spoiler in the rest of this paragraph you do visit Grove Street in the game and it was overran with Ballas ridiculous what a damn shame not to see at least some references to the events in San Andreas though apparently the story from that game doesn't apply here. Some series consistancy would be nice. Oh and of course no Cluckin Bell interiors? Come on now guys.Considering this game is one of the most successful games ever made you don't need me to tell you it's good. The bad factors of the game are minor at best and they are not worth avoiding such a great game for. It triumphs without mercy over the the prior game but I still don't think it tops San Andreas but perhaps that's just the rose tinted goggles for you.

review: When I first saw this game release to PC the next day all of my friends list was playing gta 5. Now almost 5 months later i got a copy. And I must say the game is great! It's becoming one of my most played games on Steam. All the time in the game ive put into online online in the PC version is OK one or two hackers a session can really make a game terrible. But Rockstar has put new bans in place to attemps to cut down on the hackers. There is a lot of things to do in gta online if you are willing to look. Most of the time I am invited to setups for Heists Heists are really rewarding when executed with the right group of people but horrible if one idiot dosent know what he's doing. Singleplayer has just as much things to do with random events murder mysteries Bigfoot Peyote plants and even joining a clut. Performance wise the game is great i have a 750ti and at Nvidia's recommended settings i get 60fps and the game looks great. ONE major complaint is that Rockstar pulled some shady **** at the summer sale to avoid dropping their price something I'd like to see changed at the winter sale. All in all great game 8.5/10

review: I do highly reccomend this game since I do beleive that the 8 month delay may have been worth it for GTA V has been highly optimized to play on lower grade machines. I have a FX4130 R9270x 8GB of ram and this game runs like a dream with 40fps on very high to ultra!I happen to be the one of the lucky ones to not have "Gtav.exe has stopped working everytime I launch and i dont expect rockstar to do much since they have such a low priority in PC gaming and have stripped the game of modding (Which was one of the main points of the game) and banning people for using simple FOV mods etc. This game is very well put together with its brilliant and interactive story line and its fun filled random GTA Online.I have to say that this is one of the most enjoyable games to play alone and even better yet with friends with heists freeroam missions races etc.1) IF you are having problems with your game crashing i would reccomend going to www.systemrequirementslab.com/cyri and search for gta 5 and run the scan. To run the game all you need really is the minimum checked off and you should be good for normal to high settings with a steady fps.2) IF YOU passed the scan and it still doesnt work try updating drivers for GPU and CPU at the makers website.3) IF that didnt work try making sure you have all of your Microsoft Visual C++'s. (If you dont have all of them game can crash or not even load) To aqquire go to https //support.microsoft.com/en us/kb/2977003.4) Make sure you are administrator or RIGHT click gtav and hit "Run as administrator"5) Disable antiviruses. I have AVAST Super Anti Spyware Malwarebytes and they do not cause problems. IF you have others i would try disabling them and trying to launch up the game.6) Check for game updates. As you know upon release a update was put out for gta v which fixed a glitch is story mode. To see if their is and update go to Gta v in your library right click and go to updates. Then make sure it says "Always keep this game up to date and hit "OK". 7) Still staying in properties go to "Local Files" and click "View integrity of game cache". If it finds any issues just let it fill in the missing files.If this hepled you click it as "Helpful"

review: As every single review I've seen has resulted in either not recommending this game because of the rise in price during the summer sale or the hackers in GTA Online I felt A short but PROPER review of the GAME ITSELF was needed.PROS fantastic storyline (including characters setting etc..) great graphical optimisation fun online play (depending on what you do) one of the best if not the best open world video gamesCONS (bearing in mind this only depends on what you do in game) GTA Online is riddled with hackers/cheaters during free mode if you play in a public session (however it is easy just to find a new session or go into a solo session) (GTA Online) GTA$ is obtained mainly through a grindy job system which is based off of the time you spend in the job rather than what the job's objectives are. Even then the money output of the jobs isn't large enough for people not willing to spend hours upon hours grinding out the jobs.Overall the game is fantastic both single player and multiplayer especially if you have friends to play with.10/10

review: From what I experienced in the short time I was actually able to get this game to run(probably around a half hour total) I would rate this game 9/10.Unfortunately this launch was a huge disappointment as 95% of the time the game refuses to even run and the few times it did crashes resulted randomly or even as a result of clicking on a different window and then clicking back on the game screen.I have opened a ticket with Rockstar support and tried all of the "fixes" they and other people have recommended but nothing has worked.Funny how they delayed the release again and again "to ensure that the game is as polished as possible and to make certain that both Heists and the GTA Online experience are ready to roll out on day one for PC."Well guess what Rockstar? The game doesn't even run for a lot of us. I'm sure eventually this problem will be fixed on your end and then I'll be able to forgive you but until then I just want to warn anyone who's thinking about spending their hard earned money on this game that there is a significant chance the game won't even run and so I would recommend waiting until Rockstar has fixed this issue.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This may be the longest review I have ever typed out but here goes nothing!Wow where do I even start with this masterpiece of a Grand Theft Auto game.. well for good measure I will break it out in seperate pieces. STORY After just recently completing the story mode for a fourth time (Two times on PS3 once on PS4 and now on PC) and eventually will complete one last time but with the mouse and keyboard. I am just so in love with the storyline for this game it is so well acted and I wouldn't really say well written since this is just a simple plot but still though it's a really awesome storyline for such a quality Grand Theft Auto game. From the main characters to the secondary and minor characters (Haven't met all of them but met a great bunch of them) all of them are just very loveable characters I love all of them but the one that stays in my heart will always be Michael he's now my number two protagonist in GTA number one will be Niko Bellic from IV don't get me wrong but Niko has a much better storyline that's connected to him. I love this storyline so much.. GAMEPLAY Rockstar really changed up the gameplay from GTA IV alot of nice improvements and changes with the First Person perspective added in with the PS4 and Xbone versions at the time it really does bring in the immersive feel of the beautiful map of this game. With them raising the framerate to 60FPS It is so much more smoother and it brings in the immersive feel of the game so much more than it was on the PS3 and the PS4. I really love all of the weapons but I wish to see some more unique weapons aswell such as the Musket and the Rail Gun and a couple more. All of the types of vehicles in this game there's alot of vehicles.. I wish they brought back the PMP 600 from IV.. That car was beast.. Please Rockstar bring it back? &lt 3 GRAPHICS AND PORT The first time I believe I ever talk about how the game looks.. So of course the game looks abso lutely stunning at all angles (I was playing through the game and playing Online on High eventually will be max settings and will beat the story again.. lol) The draw distance is awesome and it feels much more immersive than ever since it's running at 60FPS.. which brings me down to breaking down the port of this magnificent game. Rockstar I was unsure of what you were going to do for this port at first but then since you guys took extra time to polish it and everything of course I got a little impatient but I was trusting you and look at what you did.. You did an outstanding job with bringing this yet I say again masterpiece to PC. Thank you for upgrading to 60FPS since it is necessary for a GTA PC port which helps to bring in the immersion to playing in a GTA game. Of course it's not perfect I tend to have little drops here and there but it's so much more smoother now.. GTA ONLINE I love playing Online so much it is so much more expanded than GTA IV's of course.. I have to admit I was really impatient for waiting for Heists but I got through it When I saw the trailer I was so ready to play Heists. But let's face it Heists are just ONE big thing to do in GTA Online but honestly there are limitless things you can do in GTA Online and now you can record it with the Rockstar Editor! You can make AWESOME movies! If there's nothing to do.. that what are you thinking about then? Hm? You just have to be creative and think of all of the awesome gameplay features the vehicles everything Rockstar has incorporated into this game.. Like I said before.. limitless things you can do!!! CONCLUSION I believe I have covered everything as possible so here is my last and final statement about this game. Rockstar has done an outstanding job with the game by itself incorporated more amazing stuff in their DLCs bringing us unlimited things to do in GTA Online it looks mind blowingly amazing and feels so much better due to a higher framerate Of course look at this review that's alot of words saying that I love this game but I could go on forever and EVER talking about how great this game is.. Only thing I will say of what you should play on to enjoy it the most on is definitely the PC version Rockstar my last words to you is this Thank you so much for treating this masterpiece right on PC and you have stole my heart for making such an incredible Grand Theft Auto game.. I can't wait to see what you establish in GTA VI here's hoping it's in Vice City!RATING 10/10 I would want to go higher.. screw it.. 999 999 999 999 999/10Last words In regardless of how much it is I would reccomend getting it on a sale if you have played it before but if it is going to be your first time playing it it is worth full price (in my opinion) but do what you want you won't be mistaken. Also I have crashed on this game in the beginning but I have found a solution from someone and solved it if you guys are crashing and don't know what to do check if you have a plsapp64.dll in C Windows System32 get rid of it it solved my crashing and it should solve yours.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V un joc extraordinar super optimizat care este jocul meu preferat din seria Grand Theft Auto . Avand acea grafica si acea structura jocul te leaga de el de la cele mai mici chestii . Te invita intr o lume plina de oameni cu duble personalitati unde gang urile sunt rivale si viata este foarte palpitanta . Acest joc este preferatul meu din seria Grand Theft Auto insa nu pot spune ca jocul este perfect din punct de vedere al fizicii . Jocul este o mina de aur dar fizica este complet batuta distrusa chiar . Grand theft auto IV a fost jocul perfect din punct de vedere al fizicii dar din punct de vedere al optimizarii GTA V a reusit sa triumfe im glorie fiind un joc probabil printre cele mai bun optimizate. Sa vorbim despre GTA V online care te transpune intr un univers cu totul si cu totul diferit . Cu playerii care te vor omori prin cele mai umilitoare moduri care te vor face sa ti smulgi parul din cap sa ti spargi tastatura . Toate aceste lucruri fac parte din joc dar nu este un lucru rau deoarece nu toti playerii din aceasta comunitate sunt asa . Poti gasii playeri cu care sa te intelegi sa faci anumite Team Work uri sa faci misiuni si sa te lupti contra playerii lor care vor sa te omoare . Pe langa oamenii din GTA V Online jocul mai dispune si de mici " intrusi " dar vor sa scape de nevoia de a muncii de a farma pentru banuti . review: Don't waste your time personally i see this as an overhyped scam before this the only other rockstar game i purchased and played was GTA3 here are my opinions based off of observation and gameplay.1. The Graphics are nice but the damage modeling is old as it looks like it acts like 2. Physics are a sick ing joke All points Bulletin is a MUCH older game and has better physics.3. Character customisation may as well not exhist minimal effort was put into this it has some cool concepts but none of them work characters look largely deformed and clothing options are laughably slim.4. Loading times in this game are ing absurd either on or offline it should't take 2 3 even 4 minutes to get into the game.5. Animations/Character movement feel sluggish and clumsy No the game is not ment to feel like Quake 3 arena but it feel's like i am carrying around a backpack weighing 500lbs all the time.6. This game is NOT imaginative at all there is NOTHING in here that i find to be even remotely fun it's pretty much all just tedious the only thing worth doing are heist's and these are extremely geneic not very well thought out or challenging (( and some are just hard not like challenging hard but simply so badly ing designed some of the simplest task's are like trying to climb mount everest with a broken leg. )) &lt Wouldd you try to climb everest with a broken leg? in all seriousness No.7. Rockstar is behind on the times not only do they not support modding (( which extends the life of the game and could fix alot of the issues it has )) apperantly they have started banning people for running mods on their private instances while i myself have not expierienced this it's just a crap deal.8. This game is incredibly unstable i have recently upgraded my system it's nearly top of the line i dumped alot into this it's been long enough now alot of the optimisation issues should have been fixed Well they arn't Atleast not for PC's i cant speak for the XBone or the playsation but for PC's this game is a $60(( when i bought it )) pile of steaming trash.9. This game has Zero replay value it takes forever to get money to progress((unless you buy shark cards)) but truth be told there isn't much to progress into after a few hours offline and online you have pretty much done it all and we are talking ... maybe.. 5 hours of fresh gameplay after that it's all the same time and time again and quickly begins to feel grindy after about lvl 1510. Don't pvp you actually get punished for it even if you're just defending yoruself. It's bad enough i have now tossed rockstar into the same bin as Electronic arts and will no longer be making any purchases with them i'll spend my time and money elsewhere i havent been this dissopointed in a game for a long time i have seen some dissopointing things in my day but this is just a t mass money maker.

review: Let me sum it up they took GTA and turned it to a mobile app. You do missions and don't get paid so you can't spend in game cash on cars and businesses until you pretty much finish the game. If you do get paid it's peanuts and everything costs a sh*tload. Why? To get you to spend some bucks on in game cash (yes that's actually an option I know I was disgusted and ashamed for Rockstar just as much as you were). Everything else isn't an improvement on GTA 4 and unless you play the single player as a very long tutorial for GTA Online (where being a pay2win is allowed because that's what mmos are) you're in for a disappointment (unless you've learnt to love pay2wins in which case my condolences).I know I know it's the new GTA of course you've bought it. Unfortunately so have I. Yes the characters are awesome but this is a game not a film. It's supposed to be fun and rewarding to PLAY. Rockstar used to know this. Oh well.

review: Can't recommend this because it is the very first mediocre GTA game in almost every aspect.Only thing that makes it stand out from the series is that off road driving is finally fun and exciting (I.E it isn't an automatic death sentence to your car)When I saw the first trailers for this game I was ecstatic They are gonna combine the fun of San Andreas and the modern grafics of IV.What we ended up getting was a game with cutting edge graphics and little else.First of all the story is our heroes are Old fat man with family problems.Diet CJ with really annoying friends.And Trevor the insane canadian dude who only looks after himself and damns the consequences of his actions (he is also the red line that connects all the other "characters" "story lines" together).It is really sad when the only interesting character with proper character arc is the dude who that resembles a character from Saints Row Sociopath with questinable ideas of fun (I.E fun to watch horrible to have them as a neighbor).Diet CJ is especially disapointing He starts up as a poor street thug becomes rich criminal and is then sad when his friend Diet Ryder calls him a busta for getting out of the ghetto. At least the Sad fat man had that funny mission where he humiliates Lazlow but only because Trevor told him to do it.There are also "choices" one can make during the story but they all happen in places where the only logical option is to KILL EVERYONE. But when Diet Ryder gets into trouble because yet another one of his stupid plans the option "screw that guy" is nowhere to be seen.There isn't even any memorable side character besides Lester but he has the unfair advantage of being funny and central to the plot. Mechanics are also lacking.There is no point of doing any of the side activities In previous games you would unlock more gameplay by doing them (I.E getting Car bombs from Patrick or becoming fireproof) but now they are just busy work that adds NOTHING to the game.Buying properties is pointless because they barely make any money and they don't unlock any new gameplay (Like recruiting porn stars to work in your porno studio for high profit in Vice City).Money is a constant problem there is never enough of it. Then again there is very little you can spend it on Weapons are dirt cheap as are the ugly clothes (which have extremely small variety in them) odd haircuts and the booring side activities. Tuning your car is fun but REALLY expencive (Except for Diet CJ for he can buy one Los Santos Customs for him self for free mods for him and ONLY for him). Only way to make money is to fiddle around with the stock market which is brain numbingly boring (Exept when you actively manipulate it with Lester but there's only about 7 times you can do that).Oh there is a huge payday at the end of the game but then there is no point of spending it on anything for the story line is finished.The game also punishes you if you want to bring your own car into a mission instead of the character specific vehicle If you are not inside you car when the mission end it gets towed away and you have to pay to get it back. This makes using any other vehicles besides the chracters own pointless because you will just lose money. Who tougth this would be a good idea.The world around you also feels extremely static For example I never saw a police car just patrolling around like in every othe GTA. they only appeared when I had a wanted level which ruined the already feeble immersion the game had.I could go on and on about how mediocre this game is but I'll just quickly summarize If this game would have been just plain bad I would have liked it more but seeing this othervise functioning game getting half like this for the sake of the pointless multiplayer mode which can't do anything that Saints Row 4 hasn't already done better and bigger.

review: Quite possibly the best game of the decade!SummaryYou start off in the single player "Story Mode" by playing one of the 3 main characters Franklin. I won't ruin it but you eventually meet the other two main characters and then you can switch between the 3 of them. There's so much stuff to keep you entertained you won't be pressed to find something that you'll enjoy doing. From playing sports like tennis or golf to completing the story or even heading online to compete in races heists and other activities. There's so much to do in GTA V but the main reason I got GTA and always have in the past is because of the music within the game. It may sound a little cheesey why would you get a game solely based on music alone? Well because they're very good at selecting some of the best tracks and implementing them into their game. I remember purchasing a console a while back just so I could get GTA. I can't remember which console it was but I'm wanting to say it was the PS3 when they had exclusive rights for 1 whole year to GTA. I wanted it so bad that I purchased the console just to get it. Maybe it was the XBOX and San Andreas can't remember exactly.One thing that I myself find entertaining is to watch the T.V. shows and listen to the comercials within GTA V. So many things are funny. Even the radio commecials are worth listening to. They do a very good job of continuity within the game. Some of the commecials advertising things on T.V. and the radio you may see elsewhere plastered on a billboard or hanging on a poster someplace.The graphics are very well made. I think my favorite part of the graphics and environment is the ocean. The waves are so realistic. Also if you dive below the surface you'll find all sorts of goodies. Animal life plants debree and other secrets to be discovered. The environment is great. Even when you are very far away high up in the sky or wherever you are you can still see vehicle headlights off in the distance as well as street lights and buildings. Unlike previous GTAs the vehicles don't disappear on you or reappear from what I can tell. It's all realtime. And you almost wonder how they were able to achieve this and keep the game playable to so many people. GTA V is not nearly as taxing on your comp as most would think they did a very good job of optimizing the game from what I've seen.Another thing that I thought was really surprising is that they actually have another whole story within the multiplayer mode. Of course its more difficult usually unless you have friends that you play with it can sometimes be a pain in the butt. Simply because you have people that will leave if you don't complete the mission or heist for the very first time. It's also difficult to find others to play with sometimes. More people are doing the compitions like races or team based fights rather than missions. I think its because you can make more in game money if you do those within the same amount of time.One more thing that I'd like to mention is the various vehicles that are within GTA V. There are so many different vehicles you can get. From cars to planes ships helicopters and even some that are a little off the wall. It's very enjoyable to try them all.BreakdownCONTENT 10/10There's so much content in GTA V that you won't run out of the fun for a very long time. Also the various things to do in multiplayer mode is a huge plus!ANIMATIONS 10/10The cut scenes and the character switching animations are pretty good. I was hoping to see some more animations to be honest. I also enjoyed how they ran the credits at the end of the game.GRAPHICS/ARTWORK/ILLUSTRATIONS 10/10The graphics are superb. Sometimes they're so nice you just want to sit back and look at the environment. Very good job.GAMEPLAY 10/10The gameplay is second to none. Great interaction with multiple aspects of the game. You can play tennis golf race or do many other things throughout the world. There are all sorts of places to go and things to do.CONTROLS 10/10The controls in GTA V are very straightforward and understandable. You can also quick switch between keyboard and mouse or your controller. Just a neat little addition to the controls.RELIABILITY 8/10While I haven't had many issues with running GTA V there have been some. One in particular prevented me from getting online. I had to do some things to fix it and finally got online again but this is not acceptable especially for a triple A title like this.USER INTERFACE 10/10The user interface is easy to understand and flows with the game well. In single player the game slows down enough for you to switch between the items when you need to. Also the game pauses when you're at the main menu. In multiplayer it is the same interface but without the slowing and pause which is obviously not really possible.MUSIC AND SOUNDS 10/10The music and sounds in GTA V are by far the best job I've ever seen in a video game. The music is by far the best music ever put into a video game. There are also ambient sounds and conversations which will entertain you time and time again.ORIGINALITY/STORY 10/10The story was very good. Of course it was violent at times and could of been better at others but overall it was well rounded and kept you wanting more. The multiplayer aspect of the game is very in depth as well. It's almost as if it's two seperate games in one because the single player and multiplayer have different storylines.COMMUNITY VIBE 10/10People love GTA V and I can see why. It's a very good game all around. From the graphics to the music to the gameplay you really cant go wrong.TOTAL SCORE 98/100ConclusionGrand Theft Auto V is a great video game and may be the best video game of the decade. I remember before I actually bought GTA V I did a little research on the numbers and I think GTA V was #3 on the top grossing video games of all time. Think #1 was Tetris #2 was Minecraft and then GTA V was 3rd. That says a lot especially since its only been out for a short period of time.I really enjoyed playing the single player "Story Mode" of GTA V and also the short time I've put online. The only downside that I've found about GTA V is the seperate DRM that is required to play. Also the couple of reliablity issues but after I've fixed them they havent caused me any problems since.If you like good gameplay good music good art a good story and endless things to do I'd say pick up GTA V and have some fun. If not you're probably missing out on a great Game You Absolutely Must Have and that's a shame. GTA V is worth the purchase from everyone if not for the gameplay for the music alone. Just be aware GTA V can be very bloody and violent at times.Good day )
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Because this game is a two in one I will review it as such especially since I play both GTA V and GTA Online. That means if one fails to meet my expectations I will not recommend it since that's 50/50 right? GTA V is clearly great and is recommended if you're into singleplayer open world games. The story isn't as great as the others though but it's alright. It s fun and that s all that matters. However GTA Online is a whole different story.The best way to put it is as long as I see hackers in my game I will not recommend it. GTA V s high rating is due to its singleplayer but I guarantee people would think differently about its Online version. Both Steam and Rockstar should think about breaking away these two games because it s essentially what they are. Keeping them combined is giving an inaccurate rating. Rockstar needs to know what we really think about the Online version.Back to GTA Online hackers ruin the game entirely. It not only hurts us players who want to play correctly but it also hurts Rockstar's reputation and cash flow. Why would people buy cash when players hack it? They even hack it for others and give them cash without even being asked for it. Progression in this game seems non existent because of hackers making you lose interest in the game very easily. There is nothing to show off nothing making you appear any better to anyone else because most likely everyone got it through the means of hacking. You even go to a deathmatch to show off your shooting skills only to anger a hacker and have him destroy you.You want to report a hacker? Good luck finding out who is hacking because there is nothing telling you who is doing it. But it just gets even better once you do find out who is doing it and submit a report Rockstar seems to threaten you by terminating your account if you re wrong. So whose side are they really on? What is seems to be is that Rockstar has no idea with what they re doing with an online game. There seems to be no hacker prevention because hackers are rampant. I kid you not you will witness one in a very short period of time.Some more few problems with online play is that it s far from userfriendly. You need to go to story mode in order to create an invite only freeroam session. Your gun loadout is also never saved so every startup you need to switch all your guns around all over again. They tell you that you can do this in story mode but why do I need to go to story mode to change something for the online version? Ridiculous. Also the game isn t very fun to play with friends. You do a quick job session with friends and sometimes you get thrown into a job without your friends or some of your friends get left behind seriously? Rockstar please fix and polish your game up before you plan on adding anymore new content. Eliminating hackers should be your top priority
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: At first I thought this was just another GTA. A console port done reasonably well but for all that just a console port.However the more I play the more I like it. No not like it I love it. I am not really all the motivated by the GTA Franchise in the past but I like open world games so they appeal to me on that basis. What has really got me into GTA V is that it is BIG. Not large huge. A really open world which is something I didnt expect from anything that had even sat next to someone that had once looked at someone that once played something on an Xbox. It is massive and open with all sorts of interesting ways to get around.The Graphics.Caveat here. I have unusually powerful machines at my disposal (SLI and TRI SLI Titan X's custom watercooling blah blah blah depending on my latest build.I seek out the most demanding games because I like state of the art. I want to see the potential of today's technology explored and in many respects GTA V Does that. Playing at 2560x1440 and above with all the options enabled these textures look incredible. How many times have I been wizzing along in a car and crashed because I am staring at the city in wonder. This is what I like. Massive open and no compromises on quality. On top of that they are not afraid to have themes which appeal to someone over 14. Not gratuitously nor is it out of place. But it adds something and makes the city feel that little bit more alive. I still have a lot to do in GTA but it is one of those games I know I will be going back to for a long time. The seminal moment of the GTA Series.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTAV has been fun and addicting for many of the same reasons previous titles in the franchise have been it's outrageous it's massive and intriguing. However where it falls short is that it is a very shallow and streamlined experience.This GTA map is ridiculously big and full of fun things to do or cool places to explore. Additions like golf and tennis make for games within a game. But by 2013 standards and playing games like Skyrim it falls a little short. The world is closed off and limited in a lot of ways. Like okay I see you golf and tennis but why can't I go to the beach and play volleyball with some ladies or go to the park and play basketball with some of the homeys. It's situations like this that remind you that you aren't quite in an open world environment. Most of the shops and buildings are inaccessible. So you can see a nice coffee shop and it's front door is a wall. You can't go into cool hotels or even go to a mall and then just decide you wanna try robbing as many stores as you can before having to fight off the police. It would also be nice to not see the same skins used so often. The very first fire fight in the game every single enemy looked the same. And I can't count how many times in 2 blocks I see the same fat black lady yapping on her phone. It would have been nice to see some of these features to have a truly immersive and captivating experience. As it is this is GTAIV with more paint better driving less annoying SIMS add ons like making your friends happy and having to meet up with them or relationships deteriorate.Customization is also very limited partly because every character has a unique story you must follow. And you can't veer off of it at all. There is no element of choice at all here in a generation that usually demands one. You can't even change your default car. If you buy a 250k Lambo you'll still have your ugly Dodge Charger spawn at your house. If you place cars you steal or buy into your garage and take them on a mission they may disappear when the mission makes you use another vehicle. In some cases your car appears at the end of the mission but in many cases it does not. And sure you can buy property but you can't buy homes or condos. You can't invite a bunch of girls over for a pool party. You are often left with the feeling of why do I need to work for money when I can't show it off or do much with it anyway. If I want to feel how a Ferrari drives I can just steal it I don't have to save up and buy it. Then what? Where is the thrill of reaping your rewards and living out the life of one of these criminals in full detail.The iPhone app also falls sadly short. The things to do on it are boring and don't affect the game enough. All of that being said this is still a great GTA experience with hours and hours of fun. And GTA online will be lots of fun. But it is disappointing that in 2013 almost 2014 with the technology that is available today and the rich video game history we have companies with great franchises like this aren't pushing the envelope a little harder to make the game innovative and inventive translating into a thoroughly immersive experience for the end user.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Okay so I haven't played Online for almost a year I don't know anything about the new updates game modes and But this week I decided to give it another shot and now I'm playing it 5+ hours daily. With or without friends there is so much to do I understand why they haven't announced GTA VI yet. GTA Online is just awesome.Hackers are still a huge problem but you can always report them and change session. The only thing that got worse is community why are there so much chinese? Moreover why aren't there regional servers? If you ignore the bad part of community this game is easily the best online game ever.I was very harsh on my original review I just wanted to hate the game for no reason. But to be honest we don't need GTA VI anytime soon.GTA V 7/10 (You know kinda lame story and still not fun after around 40 hours they don't give a about GTA V anymore)GTA Online 8/10 (Hackers no regional servers REALLY hard to earn cash) ORIGINAL REVIEW (4/6 found helpful)More than 200 hours in Xbox 360 and around 390 hours in PC (according to Social Club)Story Mode is fun before you finish Store Mode and side missions it slowly becomes boring after finishing the missions.The online gameplay is ok but after you're level 100 it slowly becomes boring just like the story mode unless you have less than 2 friends to play with. Worst part of the online is character customization all of the characters you can create looks worse than a ghoul. Graphics 8/10Singleplayer Gameplay 9/10Multiplayer Gameplay 4/10Sound Effects 8/10Story 9/10Character Customization 1/10Staff 3/10Level Editor 7/10Community 1/10Simpleness 7/10Optimization 10 Overall Score 6.1 But I give a 1.2 because online is so bad. Overall Score 4.9(I mean their care about hackers by staff)

review: Another rock solid RockStar release .. requires Social Club to play crashes almost immediately on launch .. yeap .. glad I paid for this Update The launch of this game was appalling huge amounts of different causes for crashes and different bugs causing e.g. incredibly sluggish FPS on default settings. The apparently needed mobile app still doesn't support PC a couple of days after launch.The only official answer I've heard is that if you use anything but a z A Z and 0 9 in your user account name they suggest you create a new user account which is ridiculous in itself. Some of the other causes for crashes have been solved by the community and e.g. on reddit you can find a decent list of suggestions. However there still seem to be a lot of people for whom none of the suggested solutions work.I finally managed to get myself into the game the crashes at launch seemed to have been caused by .. my microphone. Disconnecting my Blue Yeti before launch got the game to launch and I could reconnect it once I was in the menu without it causing the game to crash again.After managing to get into the game the gameplay turned out to be very good much more fun than I hoped for but still leaves room for improvement on the controls side.The controls are incredibly complicated pretty much every key on the keyboard has some function assigned to it and the "hints" for using them are briefly flashed at the top left corner the first time you need it thus it's easy to also miss it and get stuck trying to look for what key is for e.g. going into cover.While the game has a lot of promise I cannot with good conscience recommend this to anyone until they fix their .. this might take a month it might never happen. I'll try and remember to update this if that ever happens.

review: I've been playing GTA 5 since 2013 of december. I started playing Online in 2014 on xbox 360. Eventually I made my way to Xbox One. Then PC back in July of 2016. I took a lot of time tons of money to get as far as I wanted too. Playing hours on end. I currently have 1 039.6 hours as of this post was typed. I was banned in June of 2017 for an unknown reason. I'll explain everything that happened. Just to show how stupid rockstars ban system is.I was playing with my friend doing bunker missions in a invite only session. We were doing these missions for hours to gain money because I was saving up for something. I turned off my computer at around 2 A.M because that's usually when I went to bed. I woke up the next day opened up GTA 5 and it tells me I'm banned for 1 month. For what exactly? To this day I don't know. And to be frank I don't think I'll ever know. I got unbanned in July of 2017.In July of 2017 I was an idiot. A complete udder idiot. I didn't understand exactly how the ban system worked and I went ahead and used a ing mod menu in a solo session and only once I opened it up in a session with people and helped this noob out who was getting killed by other high ranks and I gave him weapons. I made a second account on the same social club account that I modded on. I thought MY main account was safe. But because I was an idiot. I didn't know that I had to make a second social club account and then rebuy the game to mod without being banned on my main account. A few hours later. I was banned. Perm banned. It's currently July of 2018. I've been banned for One year. And I'm so regretful for doing that. I had exactly 931 hours of the time of me being banned. I currently have 1039.6 hours as of me typing this. If I didn't get banned for no reason by rockstar in the first place. I know I would of learned and never did that again. I was a rank 133 at the time of my ban. I had so many cars houses bunkers CEO offices planes choppers and a Yacht and so many damn weapons I was so overpowered. And it's all gone. All my time spent wasted for what...? Because I Modded.

review: So i've read some so called reviews here..But after playing some 750 hours both online and Single Player i think it's safe to say that most of the time i enjoy this game alot.Sure it has some bugs and glitches as all other games have some are fun very few are hilarious alot however are infuriating.That being said alot of the latest so called reviews are based purely on the fact that Rockstar finally have made efforts to stop modders screwing up the online part of the game for the rest of us honest players.People tend to believe that game developers open up their hard work for modders. Sure it can be fun i guess but the fact is that the developers ing write when starting up the game that modding is not allowed. So how can you believe that you can mod the out of the game and not expect repercussions?The online part of the game has been time and time again by people who cheat only to mess around with other players. It makes a game (series) that i have always loved terrible!I really appreciate the work by Rockstar making this game and making all these "DLC's" for free!Sure if you don't wan't to work to earn money to buy stuff buy the Shark Cards.Just like in many other games where you can buy weapons to make the game more fun for you. I really can't see the difference and i surely do not see anything wrong with it!I will keep playing and enjoying the game with my friends as long as we find it entertaining. If you don't find it entertaining stop playing and find something else to spend your time on.

review: Graphics Soundtrack (Custom user radio)Story Gameplay Overall It's amazing how far Rockstar had made GTA. I remember playing GTA since GTA2. GTA V is unlike it's past release one of the stunning and realistic game. Of course there are few things that defies physics but overall I enjoy playing it cause it allows me to extend my capabilities of not having to think about responsibilities. People may blame GTA as a victim of violence game but I found it enjoyable and the most I could have without having to go through aggressive consequences in real life. GTA online is on the other hand enjoyable unless you know what's going on. I advise you to watch some of the youtube guides before you start playing online cause online is comparatively different from single player. GTA online focuses on teamwork as you need friends to progress faster. You can undoubtedly progress as a single loner in GTA online but it's considerably slower. The single player story involves multiple character that represents stereotypes in America as they or you interact with each character by doing some campaign missions as well as other events. Story doesn't get me going as much but I enjoyed the freedom most of all. I really enjoyed somewhat the realistic aspects of the gameplay although I'd wish the game had more of a stealth AI then it currently does.I definitely recommend giving this game a try as it helped me reduce stress and anxiety.

review: Do you like loading screens and unskippable cutscenes?If so you will love GTA Online.First there's a loading screen followed by an unskippable cutscene setting you up for the first race. Then a loading screen for entering the lobby then another loading screen for loading the race after the race there is a loading screen and another unskippable cutscene.And if you want even more loading screens try changing your character which induces yet another loading screen. Select your character and get another loading screen.If you like loading screens you definately should buy this game! The only thing missing is a loading screen for the loading screen!

review: If you are a person who wants to get into the game enjoy yourself with your friends then this is not the game for you.Cons 1. Loading screen for GTA Online takes wayyyyy too long There is this issue where apparently I haven't played the prologue yet (which I have 3 times) but when I launch up GTA Online it kicks me back to offline mode due to the prologue not being "played" yet. 2. MODDERS Those who always annoy everyone in the server. Out of 10 sessions 9 of them I've spawned into are with a bunch of modders who likes to spawn things onto you such as a ferris wheel. 3. Other players Those who abuse their modding powers. These are the annoying people who constantly kill you for no apparent reason.4. Heists Everytime where I want to finish my Pacific Standard Finale there is always that ONE guy who leaves when the heist is almost finishPros 1. Annoying players can be solved by spawning into a solo session2. If you only want to play in offline then these issues are irrelevant (mostly). 3. Graphics are superb the detail in this game is insane IMPROVEMENTS FOR ROCKSTAR Please improve the loading times Regularly search and ban annoying players + modders/hackers

review: Grand Theft Auto V... Where to begin? There's so much i would want to say about this game Its honestly one of the best games so far ever when it comes to the usage of DLC's comming and a few ones going after a long while. I've played this game since it was released onto the PS3. And even then i had the thought of this game being better than you'd imagine. But.Yes. The story did suck in my opinion the story wasn't as good as you had hoped for it did reveal some cool features in the game and it was pretty neat at the time but playing it again is not recommended it gets really boring i've already had a game that was 100% completed and after starting a new one cause i was bored is not recommended. But dont get me wrong the story is only a small part of what i want to say cause this game had the best ways of adding things smoothly more and more into updates and forexample when they added the heist everyone thought it'd be so awesome and it was yeah but the thought that Rockstar used the hype the game already had into it was actually pretty smart all DLC's were free and just for the ones that already had paid $50. They used the hype in a way the medias would talk more about them and overall its actually quite smart. I'd like to take a moment to endore what this game really is. And i'd like to say that my steam timer is NOT accurate i've played so much more onto the consoles. 10 / 10 overall for me.

review: So first the positives Story mode is solid aiming is good along with a redone cover system that flows minus a few glitches beautiful graphics good for about 50 60 hours of play offline.The cons once you buy a gun you are stuck with it. Would have been better if they allowed you to take some weapons out of your inventory. online mode is terrible unless you have ADHD..... then it is fun i guess. No direction and it forces you to play with others in order to make money in pre designed missions that are just GTAV versions of team death match and capture the flag with some racing. The missions are fun property the player can buy in story mode and online looks like the devs forgot about it completely then added it in later as a patch for online only. It also is a waste of money.Over all a great game but replay value caps after offline mode.

review: If you want to drop $60+ on a single player game this is an excellent choice as a multiplayer experience it is beyond trash. Servers are often wiped kicking players from them and throwing into 5 10 minute load screens sync between players is more often than not terrible so driving with other people is an experience for how pathetic it is gamemodes are often advertised for x2 $ and XP yet any mode beyond racing is unbalanced and anything that is pre set team based goes into the advantage of a single team &gt team balancing still doesn't work and results in people playing the same side twice and winning the game making 2 3 times more than everyone else in $. Muting the outragous number of people in the community is a chore in itself as it requires going through multiple menu screens to even mute a single player more often than not it's easier to be verbally abused by an underaged player or the even great majority of bigots who slander others with racial and sexual slurrs. Pretty much a cest pool of the worst people on the internet even beating out CounterStrike Global Offense which is know for its toxic communitity.

review: Everything at max 144hz 1070gtx 8gb 16gb ram. i7 AMAZING game. just transfered from ps4 and have had great service so far from rockstar. Beautiful world graphics are perfect. Been playing since the release on 360. people complain about loading screens which i understand but also you need to understand what is being loaded for you. Have had tons of fun online with the MC update. Overall pc is where its at. get this game. If you are worried about the ban issue just becareful of which servers you join. Check the player list and the min you SEE anything that seems off especially with a player find a new session that instant. Always report exploits. Overall dont people off to much.Idk what everyone is complaining about with the community kicks loading screens that take minutes etc. Literally everything as been smooth for me since i started. loading screens are at the longest 30sec. btw if heres a tip. ctrl alt del then task manager click on taskbar icons of gta and it should load faster.

review: Most disappointing game I ever played. I expected it to be a hybrid of GTA IV RDR and Max Payne gameplay wise but we got nothing near that. The world feels so artificial and unalive. NPCS run away and scream for no reason attack you when you are standing a few feet away from them doing nothing their animations are awful and little detail was put into them. NPCS in a game like GTA V should not look like they are from a different gen game. The driving and shooting physics are and unresponsive. AND WHAT THE IS UP WITH EVERY MAIN CHARACTER (besides Franklin and Lamar) HAVING EYES THAT BULDGE OUT OF THEIR HEAD IT LOOKS TERRIBLE. Also the forced microtransactions are the worst. If you want any of the cool new update vehicles and items you'll need a ton of money for them. Overall I would not recommend this game unless it was under 15 dollars which seems very unlikely to happen in the near future or at all.

review: so then was GTA V worth the wait? i'm afraid not not only does this look worse on console but the port needs massive work as i can't excuse the fact that may A 10 APU runs worse than a PS4 memory wise because of this the game looks like the worse i have in my steam libary im being 100% serious my copy of XIII runs better and looks better than this.Now then other than that what is there diffrent? im afraid not enough to justify the cost if you are running an APU like me because apprently the video card only has 724mb and that is a pile of crap not only that but i can't change the graphical options because im already over the limitWhy should i buy this game? i'm afraid at this point in time there is none unless you can stand 3D graphics that look like an awful version than wolfenstien. You think i'm making this up? im being 100% serious a game from the 1990's looks better than this on the lowest settings it can runAnd for that and many other stupid idiotic decisions from rockstar i will no longer be giving them another chance on trying to persuade me to buy any of there lazy games again go ahead rockstar prove me wrong improve your port and i will reconsider this review.however for the time being because this game looks like a game that's one of the first 3D games invented it's a full on no for me if you have an APU don't even think of buying this pile of crap.1/10 the 1 is for finally being on PC

review: So for some reason I came back to this game. I don't know what compelled me to do so but man am I glad I came back. Before yesterday I didn't ever want to pick this game up again. I just felt that the game got really bland and boring after a while and I just didn't see a reason for me to return since I had done pretty much everything to do. However for some reason when I came back I found this game to be extremely fun. Like I don't know why but I found everything in this game to be way more enjoyable than when I first started playing. Even the campaign was fun to me. As if I haven't said it enough this game is EXTREMELY fun and now more than ever I can fully recommend this game. I do however recommend you pick up the GTA 5 Redux mod. It truly does enhance your experience (In my opinion.)

review: GTAO. Worth all the cash. I've played this game on 360(bought around 2014) and decided to buy for the PC one (during the last sale.) and i enjoyed most of the time spent. Pros Masterpiece.This game never fails to surprize me.New things keep coming out.Triple the fun when you play with your friends. The new rocket powered car is damn lit.Stunt RacesAwesome vehicles.I dont think community is going down.Cons There will always have that one guy who speaks alien(but i guess it depends on the area where we play..)&gt 65GB of memory. Ofc it depends on your PC and storages. Conclusion One BIG game. Over 65Gb for one single game and definitely not a cheap game for a game released on 2013. But even so its all worth it. Simply amazing.I dont think r* are legitly banning inno. Player But you'll never know. Maybe they kinda mod the game or sth. But check the discussion. There are a lot of players and you'll never be alone(unless you choose to play solo).Rated 10/10

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game is really boring really All you do is drive places and then do a mission where you drive somewhere race people or ram cars/escape police. Even the heists are mostly driving.All of that is boring since the driving is way to sensitive.The mission checkpoints are also awfull if you got a car you don't like for a race whoops then you're forced to use that car if you retry the mission. You're also forced to finish the mission even if you know you've failed so you gotta kill yourself to retry quicker. Which is a problem lot's of missions have. They waste your time. I've had a gunshop owner kill me 4 times in a row without reason he just started shooting me glad the 5th time he let me live cause the checkpoint was right in the gunshop If you refuse to retry a mission then the game doesn't let you just start over from the beginning you gotta drive away a certain distance first en then drive back to retry. Wtf is this?! That is awful!So what are the shooting controlls like then?Really bad movement is stiff and the animations take really long characters sometimes just ragdoll randomly and you take damage. The shooting is cover shooting which is lazy and boring sit behind wall find enemy shoot them repeat.Are the missions interesting? NoIs the story interesting? To me it isn't it's just a bank robber who goes back into business which is unoriginall.It's about a guy in the hood which is cringy to me with characters walking up to him trying not to be racist and talking to him in his way I cringe to death.And a bald guy in the desert who shoots rednecks and s. Very interesting (slow clap)The game is filled to the brink with all sorts of mechanics but none of them are any good. They are all boring and/or stupid.Then there's the multiplayer a hacker infested horrible matchmakeing mess. People getting banned for no reason all over the place.Also there's terrible micro transactions in a 30 euro game. (was 60 for a long time)What about modding then? This is a pc gta game right?Modding was banned by take2 you guys!!What if I play this game with my friends on a private server?Well than can at least be fun problem is this game is really expensive.The only option I can think of on if you want chaotic sandbox silly coop with friends without each spending 60 euros on a broken game is Saints Row the third sure the game is smaller and sillier but it's way cheaper. Edit I tried to play this game with friends but the ui is so terrible it took us longer to get on the same server then to realise that it doesn't work with lots of disconnects and overblown ui that we don't know what we can do.Summary this game! Boring single player with bad level design every mechanic is boring/stupid. The multiplayer is mess with hackers bans and horrible matchmaking And the game is really expensive

review: Singleplayer 10/10Multiplayer 4/10Worth $60 No. If it's on sale for around 30 yeah.Lots of content and tons of things to do on multiplayer. Missions(around 10+ different styles) events heists (team missions that require teamwork setup missions and a big a$$ reward for the finale). Overall fun but most of the online community are scumbags which made me quit playing pretty fast. A lot like most open world pvp style games good game but a terrible community that ruins it.It's GTA5 so obviously the single player is great action tons of fun amazing story but not much replayability. Everything you would expect from the newest GTA basically.

review: An amazing "port" to pc. It's not a port though Rock star did something that most developers wont and made a properly optimized game for the pc.This game is absolutely gorgeous What's a draw distance? You seem to forget that a limit exists standing on top of a mountain looking down on Los Santos.Controls are intuitive for the most part game play is smooth and new player friendly but at the same time giving more experienced players a fun challenge. Online works 10/10The only two things I do not like about this game No modding support and its 65 gigs of space on your hard drive ouch.

review: Pros++Can run easily on even low end computers/laptops+Very dynamic storyline and never gets boring+Unlike console the online lobbies are bigger and less buggy+Animals in online and have the option for population variety and density!+Compatible with controller wether it's ps3 xbox 360 or even xbox one controller+If you bought this game BEFORE the PC release your character from that console will carry over to this one.+MODSCons Rockstar copped out of the 2015 Summer sale move rockstar) The graphic settings can be a bit over whelming the first time. If you come from console to pc you'll notice that the online doesn't seem to have lock on. ING CITIZENS NEED ING TURN SINGALS First person will make you a little bit dizzy and is a tad bit wonky.OVERALL I reccommend this game even if you already pre ordered it on a console it's worth it and if you have a high end PC I will reccommended even more.This game is MORE fun with friends rather than being by yourself though so be sure to get your buddies to get this one because Its hysterical at times!
