review: I only bought GTA V to play GTA Online with a fellow friend. I definitely haven't seen everything but so far I'm not that happy with this game. Here's why.Likes vast open world lots of toys guns vehicles to play with you can play it online with friends simulates (gangster) life more or less accuratelyDislikes long loading times inaccurate to aim with guns when using a mouse very time consuming. Don't buy this game unless you've got enough time to spend on one game. demanding on older hardware and thus sometimes laggy or not loading everything on time. can't buy online seperately from offline version of the game (I only want to play with friends not alone) consumes about 60 GB of memoryWho I would recommend to buying this game open world and modern gangster fans people with ENOUGH TIME. If not ask your friends if somebody has it and you could try it out for yourself.

review: I love GTA V therefore I recommend it it's fantastic and I could play this game for hours on end without getting bored for a good while though there are quite a few pitfalls that I feel hurt the game a lot.PROS great story great main characters hilarious stuff to do great controls fantastic graphics awesome cars tons of customizability amazing multiplayer online activity terrific audio first person mode consistant updates can run businessesCONS no hunger and food system (gtasa) no gambling or casino system (gtsa) no fuel system (mafia 2) no speeding system (mafia 2) no roadspikes (gtavc) no good big random events (minor ones do exist but they're lame) no bowling alley only a handful of enterainment things to do visiting the fair/carnival is a joke (only a few things work there) no restaurants to visit not enough stores to rob can't rob certain stores like clothing stores (makes no sense) it's not very clear what the symbols are on the map for players in online multiplayer mode tough to find other players for some online multiplayer missions no cross compatability (inexcusable in this day and age) can't hire any npc thugs to fill gaps in online multiplayer mode can only enter certain buildings (not many) why the heck is there oceans and rivers and boats and yet still no ability to go fishing???WARNINGS Even though this game is good and I recommend it do be aware of the following warnings.. modders and hackers abusing and exploiting the game is a constant problem this means you have to change servers to avoid the nonsense which is very annoying it's become clear as day to me that rockstar simply doesn't care and will never fix this issue

review: Многие игроки ждали эту игру с нетерпением так как ее дату выхода неоднократно переносили. Вот она вышла и я тоже не исключение поиграл в нее и от игры остались неплохие впечатления. Конечно же у игры есть свои минусы но плюсов намного больше. Игра "GTA 5" была разработана студией "Rockstar North" а выпущена "Rockstar Games" и поразила не мало игроков.О игре рассказывать можно очень много так как она разнообразная. Сюжет у игры очень интересный и развивается по ходу игры рассказывать о нем нет смысла так как играть потом будет не так интересно. Игра представляет собой открытый мир в котором делать можно все что пожелаете. В управление игроку дается три персонажа за каждого из которых можно играть и выбирать в любой момент игры не считая миссий. По ходу прохождения игры в некоторых миссиях нужно будет играть различными персонажами что очень интересно. Например взяли вашего напарника в плен переключились на другого персонажа и легко спасли его. Очень интересно сделали то что когда переключаешь на другого персонажа он не стоит там где вы закончили играть с ним в последний раз а занимается свои каким нибудь делом.У каждого персонажа будут свои определенные миссии которые вы не сможете пройти другим персонажем. Также будут доступны дополнительные миссии которые также очень интересно проходить. По мимо всех миссий в игре можно развивать каждого персонажа например бегать стрелять в тире и многое многое другое. Заняться в игре по мимо основных миссий есть чем.Очень понравился вид от первого лица в перестрелках можно переключаться и получится как будто играешь в шутер. Там уже на любителя.Графика в игре очень красивая и приятная мне понравилась. Присутствует смена дня и ночи очень красочно смотрится закат.Теперь расскажу немного о минусах игры которые мне не понравились. Когда ездишь на машинах как бы думаешь что можно сносить все подряд но нет бывают попадаются столбы которые без проблем сносишь а есть маленькие столбики которые невозможно снести. Вот эти моменты не очень понравились так как иногда в погонях некоторые предметы которые думаешь снесутся без проблем наоборот тормозят тебя.Также очень неудобно это конечно же что нет русской озвучки без нее очень тяжеловато потому что в основном смотришь только ролики а так когда идет бой или едешь на задании читать просто не успеваешь. Пытался пару раз читать но часто врубаешься и вообще получается неразбериха.Несмотря на эти мелкие минусы мне игра сильно понравилась очень веселая задорная и сильно затягивает своим сюжетом. Рекомендую ознакомиться так как игра достойна своего внимания.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA v Delay after delay after delay on the pc release its coming they said itll be worth it they said and my god it was. Rockstar is one of the devs out there that can still be counted on The graphics are great especially in first person. The story is very well done and multiplayer is fantastic. Heists missions races TDM parachuting and alot more will keep you busy online. There are a few minor negatives however the occasional crash is annoying lots of idiots online sadly but thats in every game these days. There is a pretty good variety of weapons but a few more could be added (and hopefully will be) and a sort of price inflation system could help with the more OP guns as alot of people just run around with a stinger that locks on.... makes aircraft (especially helicopters) pretty much useless against other players which is really upsetting. In the end I give story mode 9/10 and Multiplayer 9/10 This game is easily worth the money and a must own!

review: GTA Single Player Good characters Trevor is funny Michael is fat and old (Like scarce) and Franklin is your average friendly black guy trying to get out of the hood. 10/10GTA Online Made my character in a prison for some reason? Don't know why as I to my knowledge have never committed a crime. Made him have all blue hair and eyes. Immediately bought him a bright blue suit and car to match. Clocked a good amount of game hours earnt myself a good amount of money become rich and wealthy own maze bank. Happy with life. Next thing banned for 2 weeks because I apprently hacked? Then after coming off the ban made some money back by selling my cars and then get it removed again because acroding to R* it was gained in a way not friendly to their EULA (End User Licence Agreement). So complained to them not got my money back and am probably going to purhcase numorous shark cards to build up my funds again. So to sum up Good single player.Good graphics.Bad antihack.Bad cheater detection.Riddled with cheaters and money glitchers.Picks on those who dont cheat rather than those that do and leaves us with not enough money to pay for in my case numorous appartment and a 2million dollar business. 7/10 would not grand theft auto.

A lot I guess. I mean I still do it. Why the hell do I still play this game? I don't know. It's fun to get killed by hackers and modders? I guess I need to rethink this crap. I'm just going to finish and post this review I'm sure I'll get back to it. I'll get back to it after Rockstar fixes their servers and anticheat. I guess I'm keeping this review then. Stop banning random people and ban hackers Rockstar. There's a hacker/modder in (almost) EVERY SINGLE LOBBY. How hard is it to figure out a decent anticheat system? I'm literally asking because I have no idea. Rockstar could do a lot of stuff better but I'm still playing I guess. Overpowered overpriced BS everywhere. I have no idea why I'm still playing. Help me.

review: I enjoy this video gameA lot of the reasons behind peoples poor reviews are Historical inaccuracies which is stupid... if your gameplay experience is let down because there is a female black nazi soldier in your online multiplayer game maybe a history degree is more your idea of fun... or perhaps dino D Day Poor clientside performance I personally havent had an issue but most people seem to agree that DX12 is the main problem behind this Short campaign its COD what did you expect? get Wolfenstein instead Same old COD I didn't like Infinate Warefare and thought BO3 was okay. This game is different enought to define itself and also differs from the old World at War and Black Ops 1 in more than just graphics. Its taken some of the best aspects from recent COD (weapon loadouts system) and worst aspects (I hate lootcrates...) but the game stands on its own feet. Poor servers this one is a fair reason the game has had some issues with matchmaking and server stability I've haed a couple "could not connect to server"'s and some elastic banding but I haven't been kicked out of any games.I like this game The online gunplay is enjoyable The divisions system is interesting I feel like prestige finally matters It runs well for me (i7 4770s GTX 960 16GB DDR3) Zombies seems interesting (so far I've played the prologue) Character customization makes me feel like more than a green blur. Call of Duty's formula is always pretty fun The maps this year have been very enjoyable so far The game encourages you to make a loadout around your own playstyle which helps you not to feel like you're being cucked by snipers 24/7Things I dont quite care for Day 1 DLC is scummy... #Free Carantan Lootboxes frustrate me The 'HeadQuarters' Seems to be there for the sake of it and adds nothing to gameplay Lack of modes at launch bring me gun game!Things I'd like to suggest Bring me gun game We've had Normal/Hardcore/Barebones before I'd like mic only lobbies for strategic players? Miss me with that Esports formula tho If you want a historically accurate game read the extended details for places and events in assassins creed 2 through to revelations you party animalI bought this game in fear after Infinate warfare and I have no regretsPS I'm not even very good at the game and I enjoy it KD 0.67I don't think I'm a 'cod kid ' I didnt enjoy Black ops 2 Modern Warfare 1/2/3 or infinate warfareIf you couldn't tell I dont like infinate warfareDon't post bad reviews on a game because your potato PC cant run it shoutout to ObfuscatedJava and his 883 hours in WarThunderThis is a Call of Duty World War 2 review for a friend i don't own the game... you're welcome GTA5 also... stop making cost alot... fix your game &lt 3

review: I really wish there was a "neutral" option for reviews since there isn't I must vote yes. The PC version is good and fun to play with friends the only bad parts are is that for one you have to be conntected to the internet to sign into social club before it launches GTA 5 even to play single player. I know this is to stop people from pirating the game but it just sucks if I'm somewhere else and have an hour to kill but no internet and can't play GTA 5.The second issue is the online. Don't expect the online to be fun like the PS4 or Xbox One. People use trainers to cheat their money and even just spawn kill players by using an instant kill cheat on all players showing a victim as the killer of all the players in the server. If that's not bad they can set someone on fire and never take it off causing them to burn to death each time they spawn.All in all the game itself is fine just the people with trainers and as stated by others the servers normally just explode on itself and disconnects you from public servers.But the online is fun if you can get three to five friends to play on a private lobby.

review: GTA V is a game I played on both Xbox 360 and on PC. The PC version is so far ahead of the last gen version it's mindblowing considering how GTA V on Xbox 360 was absolutly pushing the systems capabilities to it's max. This is a generation defining game and a definite must play for anyone who enjoys any sort of "fun". This is one of the most graphically pleasing games I have ever played even on medium graphics. The story can be a bit Cliche at times and is definetly not a Bioshock Infinite but certainly contains compatant story telling by Rockstae and has a satisfying ending and alot of hilarious moments. The gameplay is just dumb fun it's hard to explain in words you just have to exeperiance the fun of racing through Los Santos in your pimped out Zentorno at 100mph while drunk high and with Cops on your tail beacause you just murdered a NPC that cut you off on the freeway. Audio wise we are lucky that the Rockstar dev team completly re did the radio with alot of newer hits and a Self Radio function to put your music in the game. GTA does also have it's problems with the main one honestly being the time spent on loading screens. I have immensly enjoyed this game and it was certainly worth the wait for the game to grace us with it's presense on PC. Just look at my hours at the time of writing this review i am at about 91.4 hours and I have enjoyed every minute of it including the 10 of those hours I spent on loading screens. This is a truly masterful display by Rockstar that dosn't leave you much to complain about you will definetly get your moneys worth on this purchase. To sum it all up so I can go back to playing GTA is that its an amazing game that you will sink amazing amounts of your life into. Final Verdict 9.1/10

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: What can I say? It's GTA. It's one of the major titans of the gaming industry. Anyone who's played any game has heard about GTA. Sadly GTA V is crap. Its Single Player is so boring I never finished it. It's major selling point the online part is ruined. If its not hackers or random acts of killings from rockets and bombs its the disappointing money system that drags it down. Or it might just be the hours upon hours of loading time. You boot up the game and then you have to wait atleast 5 minutes before you can control your character.I've played a bit recently (8.7.17) and I havent come across that many hackers anymore but I did meet a few a couple of days ago. There's still people standing on streetcorners with RPGs shooting at you as soon as you try to drive near them. There's no reason they just shoot you. Instantly. and your car. Now the money system is the most corrupt and iest system I've seen in a game in a while. If you spend about one hour doing a full heist you'll earn something between 150 000 300 000. A reasonably good car costs atleast 500 000. And that's just the base car. Then you want to spruce it up a bit oh wait... you gotta be lvl 100 to access the entire upgrade system. Want that cool purple color? lol! nope. lvl 73 plz. Turbo? lvl 100. Engine lvl 4? lvl 70. And ofc you can buy in game money... at a ridicoulus price. If you want a new and awesome car prepare to spend many many many hours grinding or buy several shark cards. Nope this game is just not worth it. They should have drasticly reduced the LVL lock on car upgrades and either increased the money you recieve for heists and other fun stuff or decreased the costs of everything. And also fixed the 5 hour long loading time. You can't even tab out to watch youtube while waiting for the loadingscreen... the game just pauses then. if you want this game please just wait for it to be on sale so you dont have to spend much to get it. Oh and also it runs on PS4.

review: The single player campaign has an excellent storyline with good character development.However the campaign itself is fairly lengthy and you may feel that it drags on at times but overall I was happy with the overall experience.The multiplayer component is also a nice feature where you can do heists play several different mini games or just explore the streets of Los Santos.It can be a bit annoying to find a full lobby for heists though and one person can majorly screw everyone else on the crew so I'd recommend playing with friends instead of randoms.Another issue is that you essentially have to join a new server after every activity (heists racing etc.) which takes an extremely long time to load. You may also be forced to load into a new server if a person leaves halfway through a heist mission. As a result staying on the same public servers may be a bit annoying.Unfortunately I agree with many others that the first person view is completely unusable.Nevertheless I enjoyed my time with this game.TL DR Good single player campaign but netcode for multiplayer isn't that great.Also needs FOV slider.

review: GTAO is one of the least competitive games I've ever invested reasonable time in.Everything is blueshelled to hell. Rockstar seems to release updates with content so expensive you can only get it through either in app purchases or stupid amounts of Heists grinding. With that said there's just something beautiful about this game. Maybe it's the ability to shoot up Groove Street Families from a Green Sabre in glorious HD or maybe it's that hustla dolla dolla bills feeling you can only get while looking at Los Santos from your yacht. I don't know. But I've spent over 500 hours pretty much exclusively in GTAOnline and I don't regret it one bit. While there are alot of annoying things other than that it's just stupid fun.Storymode is definetely worse than the old games like San Andreas yet it's still fine. Frankly I don't care much about it.

review: Played it back on xbox decided to try it out again today. My pvp experience involved Chasing a player with a bounty who almost blew me up with an RPG.Trying to fly a helicopter with the keyboard and getting blown up by a rocket launcher.Going after a player designated as "the beast" and getting blown up with c4.I don't see the point in the wide variety of weapons and vehicles if everything revolves around no skill required explosives. There are no car chases you just blow up. There are no shootouts. You just blow up. How did Rockstar decide that seeing a guy you have to kill and chasing them 10 feet before one of you blows up made for better gameplay than skill based action packed dynamic lengthy car chase/shootout hybrids where the best driver/marksmen will come out on top?Casual Garbage. Wasted Potential. Do Not Buy For Multiplayer.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I've played Grand Theft Auto ever since it first came out on Xbox 360 in 2013. I ve also played it for dozens of hours on the Xbox One and I ve played it for 396 hours on the PC. It s safe to say that I enjoy various parts of this game. Unfortunately I will have to write a critical review of the things which I believe would make me not recommend the game in the hopes that Rockstar will listen and improve these things in GTA 6.I will break down this review into segments to make it easier for people to read Story Mode The GTA 5 Story Mode is fun keeps you busy and there are plenty of things for you to do. The storyline is in my opinion not as great as the previous Grand Theft Auto games but nonetheless it s still good. The character switching makes the story a little more fun as it s not just one storyline but it s each person s individual story coming together which I believe makes it more interesting than on the previous games where you just play as Niko for example.During the game there loads of side missions and there are approximately 60ish main missions to do. The missions take some time to do compared to many other games where I can finish it within a day. There are certain things that I believe Rockstar could have done better on which may make you reconsider buying this for the Story Mode. On Red Dead and San Andreas you felt like you had to work your way up to something. Unfortunately on GTA 5 you get everything there is at the last few missions there is not much of a feeling of achieving something. I feel like they could have expanded the menu where it tells you how much Stamina you have gained to way more things I believe that they rushed this part of the game as you seem to unlock pretty much nearly everything at the end of the game. What you unlock at the end isn t that much special either. You unlock the ability to buy garages and businesses that keep a flow of money through but there seems to be nothing else to do after that. Other than earning money to buy cars what exactly can you do with that money? And aren t there are many more fun ways to make money once you ve done all the missions on GTA Single Player? San Andreas had Casinos. Also you would start off skinny and then become muscly at the end. There was a feeling of achieving something and the money that you gained felt more important. I believe this feeling could have been replicated on both GTA Online and Story Mode. Graphics and basic game functionality The Graphical look of this game is incredible and seems to be more compatible with PC than the previous games. Most of the vehicles feel nice to drive in and there are plenty of options for graphical customization. The framerate is also more stable than GTA 4 which for me was terrible on PC. It also doesn t require Windows LIVE which was an abomination to say the least. Rockstar Social Club s drop down menu isn t too bad but I would prefer a proper in game menu to do all those things which make more sense and would be easily integrated but this isn t much of a big deal to many. GTA Online GTA Online to say the least is a complete mess. It feels like Rockstar has turned this game into a cash cow with GTA Online. The thing that made GTA 4 fun was the ability to mess around and do anything you please even modded sessions and you got to admit were pretty good. GTA 4 sort of felt like you were freer in the things that you want to do. I don t believe a game like this should be so strict on what you can and can t do at least without providing alternative options. The good thing about GTA Online is that they keep updating it to give you more things to do. The sad thing is that everything costs so much. It costs 4 million to get the highest Maze Bank but 10 million+ (approximately) to get all the extensions. To many this may not seem much but because the payouts are so small for the missions that you do this is an absolute joke. Many people will not be able to enjoy fully what GTA Online has to offer and if you have daily responsibilities in your life like School or Work you simply will never be able to get all these things unless you spend hundreds of real life money on Shark Cards. Right now GTA Online sort of feels like a money making machine. Grinding to get money for various apartments cars warehouses offices vehicle warehouses cost so much. After you spend loads on the Maze Bank you have to buy a good vehicle warehouse to be able to store vehicles with yet more in game money. These warehouses cost an extra 1.5 2 million+. When you consider that the average payout for a mission is 20 000 how are you supposed to achieve this exactly? This is not easy to earn and anyone who tells you that it is are lying complete fanboys with more money than sense or are stupid or they are all of the above.Even with the hours I ve spent on this game I still don t have that much to show for it. Minus some of the things that I brought with shark cards which was stupid and since then I ve become angrier and fed up with microtransactions. If you grind for as long as I have you simply won t get anything extra. GTA Online Community Now down to the community. The GTA Online Community both on YouTube and on each platform are completely brain dead and are not very friendly people at all. There have always been griefers (if that s the right word) on GTA since GTA 4 but I thought if Rockstar is going to make it stricter online that they d at least utilise the cheater pool like they said they would. Especially when this game involves in game currency and an attempt to seem realistic compared to previous games.The Grand Theft Auto community is probably the stupidest people I have ever witnessed and most of the time when you re playing GTA grinding hard to get some money there is some retard in jet spending hours upon hours blowing up random people who are grinding for a measly 20k. Rockstar doesn't even put them in the cheater pool and sometimes when your car gets blown up you re the one who has to pay for it as Mors Mutual Insurance messes up.Also the GTA community on the Steam forums acts like cultists. They spend more time on the forums celebrating people being banned (even some falsely which by the way that does happen and is possible with Ai technology which Rockstar uses) than actually giving feedback to Rockstar about their game. They are entirely happy to be completely screwed with microtransactions and they deserve it if they can t criticise a company.http //steamcommunity.com/app/271590/discussions/0/133258593402273075/I decided to test this. They fell for the bait. No I haven t been banned or modded achievements. I do not recommend this game if you re looking for something similar to GTA 4 s online mode. I believe what Rockstar should have done is utilise their cheater pool for people who want to mess around blow up people use mods etc. so they have a GTA 4 sort of feel and then used the primary servers for people who want to do earn money work with people etc.I believe this would have levelled the game out and attracted way more people to stay in the game. I don't recommend this game to people who want to play multiplayer which is probably most of you but I do if you want to play singleplayer and singleplayer mods. I hope this review helps you to make a decision.

review: I was very happy when GTA5 was released on PC. Honestly I had lost all my hopes after a year or so for a PC port. In the end we got it after all.Storywisely the game is focused around 3 people and you can play them all and change between them anytime on the fly. This is quite unique for a open world game of that sort. Also each of the characters is very interesting and charming with additional backstory. Franklin is the typical Carl Johnson. Trevor is the fu**** up crazy hobo redneck kind of guy. And Michael is the lazy and rich family dad. Trever and Michael had a heist backstory where they (or more like Michael only) stole a lot of money. Michael lived a nice life in luxury. Trevor not so much. If it would have been up to Michael he hoped to never meet Trevor again which is also because Trevor believed Michael is dead. Michael had all the money. Michael runs into money problems one day and decides to make another heist to get more money. He meets Franklin which is a total stranger to him until this point and plans with him and another old heist mate a new heist. Well then suddenly Trevor shows up. The rest is for you to find out. All I can say that all have amazingly entertaining quests and the story is crazy as hell.The gameplay is typical for a GTA game. It probably has the biggest amount of content of all the games. Only San Andreas rivals it. You can do all kinds of stuff from walking your dog (even with a smartphone app) to going on a date. At least you don't need to go bowling with Roman anymore. Screw you Roman! One downside is that like pretty much all games of this sort the game is absolutely boring once you did the main story and sidequests. There isn't much to do after it unless you want to meet your friends all the time and do always the same things. Also some of the missions are heavily scripted and leave no real freedom on how to solve them. The flight controls on keyboard and mouse are really terrible. Way too complex couldn't they just take simple controls like in the Just Cause series? With a controller I didn't have many problems. In the end I recommend you to play the game with a controller anyway.The map is pretty much based on San Andreas. Some changes and new places here and there though. Also for the first time you can go fully submerged and explore the depth of the ocean! There is even a quest where you have to collect barels from the ocean. Other environments like the county or forests look absolutely beautiful! The desert is there of course too! Add to this giant lively cities full of citizens. GTA is one of the few games which really manage to create a lively world around you. Most NPCs in such games feel like bots but in GTA they always had the special edge.The graphics and the PC version in general is absolutely top notch! This is the first time where I can really say that Rockstar Games did a good PC version. I was mostly disappointed from the ports of the past. There are even advanced settings to higher the view distance even further. Those settings are only for the absolute highend rigs!GTA5 also comes with a Multiplayer part. I honestly only played it a couple of hours when it came out. What I saw was a MP mostly overrun by trolls hackers and kids. Guess its not avoidable anymore nowadays especially with a game series like GTA. What absolutely killed my fun was getting tons of money from random hackers. I even heard that Rockstar bans people for no reason because of this. Get your sh** together Rockstar! However the MP is pretty good and a lot of fun if you have good friends to play with. Especially the heists are an absolute pinnacle of fun. This moment when some mate fu*** up the heist because he isn't able to press F to exit the motorbike while rushing down a cliff. Sadly the MP also comes with the micro transactions which every dev puts into their games nowadays to make the most of money. It is not that bad with GTA5 though. I can say its pretty acceptable.The game is also moddable but only to some extent like with all GTA games. Also Rockstar doesn't seem to like this in general and there was and still is a lot of controversy about this topic. For some time a primary modding tool was completely banned from being used. From what I am gathering its fine to mod the SP now but not the MP which is totally understandable. Rockstars stance is very anti consumer friendly but honestly I wouldn't expect less from them. Its obvious they mostly care about casual console peasants and not PC gamers. I don't even think that the next Red Dead Redemption will come to PC. Well Rockstars loss but since they only care about money and give a damn about the community. I really dislike them. Not as bad as EA or Activision but still far away from being good.Positive aspects Entertaining story Charming characters Giant world with many interesting places Very good PC port with many graphic settings and good graphics in general Well made weather and day/night system For the first time you can go undersea and explore the ocean floor Entertaining multiplayer with friends No bowling with Roman anymore First person view option! Very good car controls Amazing English localisation Cool radio music Balanced difficultyNeutral aspects Microtransactions which are acceptable and optional but overpriced... I personally think that many of the missions are too heavily scripted no freedom feels like CoD oftenNegative aspects The SP can get quite boring after the main story Multiplayer is overrun by hackers trolls and kids Rockstar has a anti consumer friendly stance and bans people for no reason and has a problem with modding Terrible flight controls with keyboard and mouse took me WAY too long to land the damn chopper in one mission Third party Rockstar Games clubI think that GTA5 is a good game. Hell I paid fullprice for it at launch on PC. I still think it was worth the money and this means something. HOWEVER I think the game is overhyped. Yes it has tons of positive aspects but for someone like me who is less of an casual and wants to have for example more freedom in a game it can be kind of meh just following the map marker to my mission place kill all the hostiles followed by a cutscene and some driving back to another place. Because its mostly always like that. At least the game throws in different gameplay mechanics from time to time such as stealth missions. I personally get bored by casualized gameplay mechanics. Guess I am too old. The story and world alone is worth the money in my book. Especially the characters will forever be memorable for the videogame history. Also the PC version is very well executed. If you have good friends the MP can be a lot of fun. At the same time the MP can be a pain in the *** especially for loners. I often just think that GTA5 lacks a bit of gameplay fun sometimes. I would even go that far and say that certain aspects about other games such as Just Cause or Sleeping Dogs are better. Especially Sleeping Dogs is definitely better for me then GTA5. Maybe not story or persona wisely but the whole package just seems better to me. I definitely have to replay the game once I have some time for it.Rating 8 5/10

You kill this player.You just got turned into a UFO and teleported inside your apartment for disrespecting this scripter. "Have fun restarting your game and waiting another 20 minutes in the loading screen."&gt You responded to the kid spawning Buses in the sky the correct term is a script kiddie not a modder.He doesn't appreciate your tone of text and infinitely kills you tenfold. "Don't disrespect the Gods of this world" Something that bothers me is the fact you need to aggressively spam click the absolute fuc out of your mouse after dying for 5 seconds in order to respawn quicker or you're waiting twice as long to respawn.There's logically no need for this to be a thing. It solely exists as Rockstars way of creating a more competitive PVP environment that creates more stress by breaking your finger by mashing the keyboard after you've just been absolutely destroyed in an intense one sided PVP fight by a scrub who you find out has another 250% health ontop of his current so it appears he's legit and taking damage.Speaking of PVP the Freeroam PVP has turned into a Homing Rocket fest.You cannot counter a Homing Rocket weaponized vehicle with one of your defence less cars with a sub machine gun efficently and because of this nobody uses anything other than Homing Rocket vehicles.1 hit kills everytime you encounter an enemy is really starting to me off.What ever happened to Guns? review: 6/10 Second biggest game letdown to me.I know this game came out a very long time ago but I figured I'd put my two cents in. This game is #2 on my biggest videogame letdown list right behind Fallout 4 for those who care. Now it's not a bad game it's just average. It went backwards on most aspects from GTA 4. A short example of this game is it's called GTA but you have to buy cars pay insurance and buy houses. It's understandable ad comical. My biggest pet peeve is THIS IS NOT RED DEAD REDEMPTION! This game adopted all the aspects of that game to get rid of that iconic GTA feel. From the dumb weapon wheel to the shooting mechanics. For example GTA 4 "cop killer" was a classic thing to do with friends in free roam. In GTA 5 you have no health and the cops are Navy SEALs that's not as fun for most people. Also just doing stupid stuffv around the city and living through it with an unreal amount of health is hilarious. This game doesn't have that as much. Along with poor physics not really amazing graphics and a massive map. With 1 major crafted city and other things you'll never go to because everything relevant is in LS. The reason why GTA 4 was so unique is its pure gameplay. People could get bored but always came back to have a good time with friends. It didn't have microtransactions to force you to grind or pay X amount of money to get Y.I like to think they add all these free DLC's to say sorry.

review: If you're interested in GTA V only for the singleplayer read some reviews and decide for yourself if you want to buy this game. But if you're like me and mostly interested in playing online with your friends then I have to caution you against buying this game in the state it currently is in. Online is... a frustrating experience to say the least. It's almost impossible to stay in the same game session as your friends and joining the same session as your friend after you've been separated can be a sisyphean task as the game lets you look at the map from above for a few minutes before you get told whether you're getting through or not. If it fails you get the pleasure of spending a few more minutes loading an empty session just for yourself and then you can do the same thing over again. Sometimes the game will even send you back into singleplayer without any explanation.But you don't have to be in the same session to play together you might say. You can join a heist and then invite your friends to join assuming it doesn't fill up before they can get in or the same connection issues that plague the rest of the online experience doesn't pop in like a drunken clown at a birthday party. If you want a game you can play together with your friends online my suggestion to you would be to buy another game or wait until Rockstar fixes the online portions of this game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Good
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Product received for free. The PC version of GTA V is definitely the best version. We had to wait really long but the game finally came out in a fantastic state. Rockstar obviously put a lot of time into the PC port/version. I'm usually against pre ordering games but I made one exception this year for GTA and im happy with my decision. I didn't do it for the pre order bonus (because that was frankly just a disappointing money cheat) I did it just so I could preload all GB's in time for launch because the game is ridiculously big. I'm running it at 60 90 fps on 1920x1080 with most things on "high" except for the advanced options which is something you should only use if your running SLI or one really good card. I have a Nvidia gtx 680 which is a few years old now so im very impressed with how good I can get the game to run. You can also use GeForce experience with GTA because Nividia released a update for that day before launch.You can play GTA in first or third person mode and simply change between them on your controller. All cars have different interiors and looks when you are driving in first person. Some textures are a little blurry in first person but that is something to expect in a game of this size. Fighting swimming walking can also be done in first person so you can just pick what you like the best.If you have an SSD drive that is big enough for this game you should probably use that for GTA because the loading screens without it is sometimes very long. It's one of the only complains I have with GTA actually. Thankfully thats just when you are loading into story mode or online because once you are in the big world there is no invisible walls or loading screens.Singleplayer is fun and the 3 main characters are all very well written. You can swap between them in the open world but also in certain quests. Michael Trevor and Franklin are very different from eachother which makes the game more interesting then GTA IV's only character Niko.GTA online is probably what some people will spend a ton of time in. I really just bought it for the single player experience but after playing a few hours with my friends I have to say that GTA online is actually really fun. I think the missions will get kind off repetitive in the long run but to play free roam with friends will never get old. You also unlock heist in level 12 so that might refresh things even more.I play this game with an xbox controller and it seems like all friends I've talked to is doing the same thing. I strongly recommend it at least for the driving. You can enable auto aim on your controller if you think shooting with it is too hard or you can swap between your keyboard+mouse in combat and use controller for driving. When you crash your car and get hit the controll vibrates which I think makes you feel more immersed in the game.I tried the PC controls and I didn't like them at all. For example you have to hit "Z" to see how many players are on your server in online mode. You can however rebind all keys on keyboard mouse and controller so thats really good but the default ones on keyboard are not great im afraid.GTA is a fantastic open world game that will no doubt be played for many years to come. I have already played it a lot and I feel like I have much more leveling to do in GTA online much more to do and explore in singleplayer and many hours of fun with my close friends to come. Singleplayer was all I really needed so I will just see GTA online as a plus.Well done Rockstar! This is the best PC version you have ever made and I can see that you put a lot of effort time and love into creating it. Strongly recommend this title to all my friends whether your the single or multiplayer guy you will have a ton of fun. This will probably be one of the best games released this year.

review: I've played over 200 hours on xbox one and beat the singleplayer twice. Its a great game in the GTA franchise with the flaw of bad multiplayer. If you plan on grinding missions for a couple of hours then get ready for lag low payouts and jerk offs who leave half way through. Free roam is just that.. free roam around a city doing.... well nothing really. In my experience you need friends to even have fun in both free roam and contact missions. Yesterday I attempted to do heist set ups with my friend and we kept failing because of the other teams incompetance. Later on while I was on call solo for heists we got to the end of a real heist and someone left. Boom 20 30 minutes gone.the character customization is impressive but the outcome always ends up with everyone looking "soft". Not even a leather jacket sunglasses and a beard could possibly make your character look tough. The unapealing amount of people wearing skin tight leopard print jeans is in the thousands as every missions/heist I join or make has at least one of these hipster s. Just wear normal clothes already. Unfortunately even with R*'s big anti cheat thing they've recently implemented I still see hackers often. Yesterday AGAIN I was in my garage where out of nowhere Jesus appears hugging my back. I promptly see its a hacker and brush him off. I hop on my motorcycle where suprisingly Jesus decides to ride and send my motorcycle out of my garage. Good bye Jesus. In that same lobby I saw Jesus dropping money bags. I left as soon as I could. Another funny hacker encounter was when this guy turned into a UFO and afkd in the clothing store so if you walked in you couldnt walk out witohut teleporting into the phantom world. He later turned into a wind mill and trapped us all in the store.The "sale" this summer was atrocious. 60 dollars for the base game all ing week. Genius.

review: Once upon a time in a realm called "the internet" not so far away yet so secluded there was a mad king. And the mad king used to be a peasant. That is why he's been discriminating any other monarchs and lords who called themselves "the masterrace". It's been a while and after a lot of pressure the king announced equality amongst ALL his people. All the peasants who laughed at the masterrace shook in fear hearing that the already superior lords would get the only thing that made them unique. But it was only a tease the masterrace prepearing for a feast got destroyed economically by the king who tricked them into paying for equality but denied them the service afterwards.The masterrace in it's glory wasn't fased though they survived the backstab and continued on living waiting for the promised sweet equality to happen. And then after years of anticipation the mad old king once again promised equality. This time it seemed more reasonable and the mad king even offered a reward for every lord that would support the king's campaign into achieving equality. And so it happened thousands upon thousands of members of the masterrace payed the king. Yet the king who managed to decieve the lords postponed equality once again.The masterrace now furious felt exploited like a cheap . Every lord in "the steaming lands of a star made out of rock" prepared for a riot. And after months of preparation days before the attack there it was again. The ultimate tease equality right beneath the masterrace's palm like eve's forbidden fruit. So tempting that riots were called to stop because of the hypnotizing countdown.And there it was. The peasants fear the masterrace's glory. The edict. The only thing that could make countries go to war and declare peace. GTA V the declaration of equality. The mad's kind fetish that used to be a way to play around with lords like lab mice.Equality ...to be honest though console peasants pc masterrace for the win!

Online part is pretty boring unbalanced unorganized. In two years they still couldn't make it full of things to do.The game that costed 120+ millions $ (as I've heard) looks totaly unfinished.It's really awfull. It takes 70 hours to pass single part yes. But it still feels small and toneless. I never liked GTA SA and GTA4 but they are totaly better in a story part. Yes 5th part full of optional things to do. But you won't do them all. Skyfalls and all that internet stuff and etc. will become boring after 3 times Cinemas too. What else? Side missions are good. But they are few 2 3 additional gang members for robberies (you will need them for one affair lol) and some funny stories about 3 4 NPCs with overall timeage 1 2 hours. It's ridiculous.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Let s review Grand Theft Auto V Let s face it this is one of the greatest video game franchise in the world It offers a literal new world of things to do and even if you have beaten the story line trust me it s only the beginning. Pros The game introduces 3 main characters and their story together. Here you are truly greeted with a deep characters development which is a great thing in gaming. You have a huge map and if you would walk from one side to the other you would take maybe a day a real day so make use of the huge arsenal of vehicles the game offers right there for you to take. A large array of missions spread out to all the 3 main characters with each one also offering side quests that make you take a break from the main story but also to have some real fun. After the story you enter the realm of the GTA V online and here is where the world you already knew expands immensely you have to create a new character a personal character and develop it based on your choices. Do jobs race other players this new world is your oyster. And if you just want to kick hookers in the face or just fly around in your private jet you can you have total freedom to do what you want. Many gaming modes from team deathmatchs to survivals from parachuting down a mountain and seeing who s better at it. Races on water land and air or why not all of them in the same race. Raids and the all time favorites Heist where you must plan your heist with your team and execute the stages of it until the ultimate conclusion. A huge gaming community with some offering to help and others not so much but you can always find someone to play with you or to just murder you in plain sight it will be a surprise most of the time. Its open to community built maps so you ll never run out of things to play or do because some gamers also like to build maps for other to enjoy and you ll have fun trying what craziness came from your fellow gamers. Want to run a motorcycle gang? Or buy a Bunker and start your own Gunrunning business hey do you want a Hangar to store your planes and start a smuggling ring? You can. The options are near endless and even you get near that end Rockstar keeps it fresh by introducing something else new and the cycle begins again. Or you can simple jump on your mini sub and explore the ocean and discover some of its secrets or bike to the top of mount Chiliad and maybe spot a wandering UFO. Cons The waiting time in lobby to gather enough players for a game sometimes can take a bit. Final Review GTA V is that special game that almost every gamer must have in their library. Starting in the great and well written storyline to the action packed content in the online mode. You can lose yourself in this game in a good way. And simply have fun. Or just invade a military base and watch for how long can you survive that s always a good challenge. This game deserves a 9 out 10 in my book of reviews and I simply can t wait what Rockstar will introduce next!Enjoy Guys and Girls and if this review helped you in any way please leave me a Thumbs up i would appreciate it immensely. Join me on Curate This A Honest Review at http //store.steampowered.com/curator/31479106/
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Product received for free. Is it a good game? Sure. It does what it has to do. GTA Online is pretty fun once you get past the confusing UI and the painful lack of a good pathing system. It's just not a good Grand Theft Auto game. The singleplayer is lacking and suffers from being forcefully tossed between perspectives two of which only exist to flesh out the remaining and only remotely interesting one. It's the first Grand Theft Auto game where the online features are better than the singleplayer which might work for some people but I'd prefer it the other way around (read the story is bad in my opinion).I'd give it a mixed review if I could but being forced to decide between recommending it or not I choose not to.

You go in and once you reach the vault to grab the cash it bugs out and will not allow you to collect the money thus preventing you from even finishing.This on top of lack of players lack of communication and other various bugs ends up being several hours wasted.Contacting customer support is near impossible leaving forum posts is basically pointless. This bug has been around over 3 months and still has not been fixed. There are at least 4 6 more that I know of.Other things are players cheat and mod their games. Basically if someone wanted to and mod they can make you fall through the world dieing over and over until you restart the game. Nothing gets done about this either.Other than that it is a great game love it be warned though you will encounter these issues and trying to get support will fall on deaf ears.

worst.Another thing i want to mention is the amount of cancerous there is in the GTA ONLINE Community.If you even talk in voice chat in GTA V ONLINE someone whose australian or british will insult you and tell you to shut up while russians will just be friendly to you i met a lot of good russians in GTA Online and i love it Aussies &amp British people are by far the rudest.. they only care about themselves and do not have a self of respect if they were to do this in real life they would have been capped in the butt for being rude as hell.The only downside about GTA Online is the amount of loading time it takes to launch GTA Online They need to make a seperate thing for GTA Online so you can just not have too much loadings and don't force you into Singleplayer i suggest Rockstar to make some sort of lobby system where if you fail to connect online it will send you back to the GTA online lobby instead of singleplayer it will definitely makes things even more easier for everyone.If you precious cars &amp your life blown to pieces because i will be hunting you down the moment you mess with me in my relaxing time in the world of GTA I'm your Assad.I have no Mercy to those who mess with me.Expect Explosions &amp Gas.UPDATE 2017 I don't care about mods or the modders that exists in the game i play GTA V entirely for fun &amp i quite enjoy the vanilla more than the modded versions review: I cannot recommend this game for anyone at all ever!!!Is this game fun? Sure is.Can you get lost in it? Yup.Do you randomly get banned for weeks or months at a time? Oh Yes everytime.This game is pretty great it has alot of potential and I am sad I cannot give it a thumbs up. But when they have a clearly flawed automated banning system I cannot support it at all.I have never modded never hacked never been given money never been given anything. So why is it a legitimate player would be banned for cheating/exploits? Because of a clearly flawed banning system in place.Does rockstar tell you why you were banned? Nah bro they got your money.Can a legitimate player appeal a ban? Nah bro they don't care and give you automated responses.Can you get help from public forums? Nah bro they all think your a hacker because Rockstar says so regardless of profile evidence displaying no crimes commited.In the end this is a great game with a garbage flawed banning system that does not work and will ban even legitimate players from playing.If I could I would get a refund because as of now they stole my money.Now I have been Perm banned after deleting the character that they kept banning and starting all over at level 1 they banned me at level 20 just because. I called Rockstar Support where they did nothing at all and were not helpful in the least. They couldn't tell me what I did wrong or how I could fix it. Thieving company that will NEVER EVER get another dime of my nor anyone I knows money..

review: Multiplayer is bad. Didnt care much about the single player.Multiplayer is a loading screen followed by you having to run towards a checkpoint so that a list of mini games pops up.Once the mini games list pops up you wait for 5 minutes for a bunch of noobs to slowly load in then you start shooting people mindlessly and that's it.There is no true role playing component to this game's multiplayer. Also the first person perspective (PC exclusive) is gimmicky. they only changed the camera position but the texture resolution was not improved for that perspective so it really just feels like a community made mod. It is bad.I can say much about the single player because it was too boring for me to even try finishing the first few missions.

review: This game is amazing! In singleplayer the story and character development.... well.... You couldn't ask for any better. everything is just so well written. You hate the people you're supposed to hate and love those who you are supposed to love. and the graphics. WOW!. car Handling is perfect concidering what you do and how you use vehicles in the game but for a game where you use cars and vehicles all the time it could be better. As for online a solid A+. All the opportunities and stuff you can do makes me want to play this game all the time. Although it is a bit expensive it is worth it. It used to support modding very well so you could make great cinematic videos which you can still do but not as good. The days of modding in GTA is over. That is the reason why people are rating this thumb down. But you should totally buy it. Modding will be back some day.

review: After having over 700+ hours in this game on PS3 PS4 and PC I think its finally time to review this game FIrst I would like to say this games gives FREE DLC. While Shark Cards do cost real money your really don't need it. Rockstar constantly provide new jobs races and other different game modes where you can make tons of money. I suggest players invest in the CEO buissness since it has a stable pay grade with almost little effort. Aside from what they provide in game the game itself looks amazing. GTA5's open world is probably the best open word in any game. There is always something to do in online lobbies. From killing other players to participating in certin events the open world never runs out of things to do. In addition to that the graphics arew amazing. Any graphic card above a 780ti the graphics will look amazing. Althought one tip I can give users is that you should get really good RAM for this game. Its a huge game and the game requires lots of memory if you want smooth performance. My build includes a i5 4670k gtx970 8 gigs of RAM. With everything set to stock speeds I can average the game aroundf 50 50 FPS. If you don't want to read all that Im going to just list pros and cons.Pros FREE DLC OPEN WORLD AMAZING GRAPHICS EASY TO RANK UP ONLINE IN GAME MONEY IS EASY TO OBTAIN GAME DOSEN'T REQUIRE A SUPER COMPUTER TO RUNCons HAVING FASTER AND A LARGER AMOUNTS OF RAM IS NEEDED FOR SMOOTHER GAMEPLAY LOADING TIME IS LONG ONCE YOU HIT LEV EL 150+ YOU NEED TO WAIT FOR DLC TO GET NEW THINGS MODDERS CAN RUIN THE ONLINE EXPIRENCE SOMETIMES (although rockstar is good and taking them out)
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Massive improvement over GTA 4 in many respects. There's still plenty of room for improvement however. Likes + Great variety of vehicles including bikes cars armoured vehicles helis and aircraft+ Some of the vehicles sound pretty decent and engine noise is linked directly to RPM rather than being a looping audio effect (SaintsRow3)+ First person driving is really awesome shame you can't change FOV though+ Mouse/Keyboard commands for driving are actually really good and i've not been using my controller at all+ Vehicle handling is much more fun imo than GTA4Dislikes Total lack of crouch button in exchange for horrible cover system still can't go prone Clunky controls Sluggish and unresponsive movement animations which I guess were created like that deliberately for immersion but suck for gameplay Combat is not the greatest enemies take way too much damage including direct headshots they always zerg rush you and they're super accurate even when you or they are moving at high speed Radio stations are absolute trash imo of course subjective but these ones are of very poor quality unless you like pop music. Vice City is vastly superior in this regard. Lack of custom character in single player lack of female character in single player lack of body customization in either single or online mode Police in this game are horrendous there's far too many of them they have infinite spawns including helicopters they zerg rush you like absolute morons and they home in on you when you're hiding yet should have no idea you were there.In summary this is well worth the money at the sale price. Decent story but you're forced to use the characters they designed and are forced to use specific characters to progress the storyline. Online is fun but kinda low population nowadays it seems.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Everyone downvoted this game because of the OpenIV controversy. I definitely agree that mods are important and shouldnt be shut down in any way but I do have to admit Ive had this game for years and never used any mods. I dont have much total playtime because I also owned it on PS3 before the PS4/Xbone/PC version came out and played the hell out of the story mode already. The story mode seriously is incredible. If there is one gripe I have with this game it is that they pour all their resources into the GTA online(which is no longer an online mode for a GTA game but rather its own entity.) I would love for story DLCs like we got with GTAIV.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I can't find enough words to describe this game. I'm just gonna say some quick and simple words to sum it up I have been playing this game since it was released on PS3 in 2013 and switched to PC in early 2016.Until this day I can't get enough of this game. I never get bored when I'm playing it. I always find something interesting to do and sometimes I even discover new things that I never heard about for the past 3 years.Let me talk about each portion of the game seperately Story Mode The story is insanely amazing! I love the gameplay and the way you can interact with people and objects. A huge variety of weapons and I just love each one of them. The graphics the weather bullet impacts explosions shadows water and all visual graphics are beautiful!GTA Online Massive online open world with tons of activities to do. You can play missions heists races deathmatches adversary modes capture and other awesome activities with up to 29 other persons. You can buy a huge variety of vehicles apartments and garages. You can own a yacht. And you can buy yourself an office and determine yourself as a CEO then you can buy and sell cargo and vehicles with the new import/export business. You can also fulfill your lifelong dream of owning a motorcycle club and then you can rule the streets of Los Santos and also own businesses to make even more money and make yourself the boss. You won't get enough of GTA Online as Rockstar always provide the game with new content that makes this game alive for as long as possible. And Rockstar has been giving us updates for the last 3 years which absolutely changed this game entirely.That's all I have to say for now. You just gotta play this game by yourself and see what it has to offer.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I've only played the single player mode and I think it's great. If you've played a GTA game before you know exactly what to expect. It's pretty similar to previous games only the world is much much bigger the graphics are nicer and you can now do heists! If you are bored of GTA GTA V will not change your mind. It's basically the same formula. I just enjoy driving around listening to the radio and completing some missions every now and then. The game also has plenty of easter eggs and little details to discover if you look hard enough.

review: Ok where do I start.The game is great over I came from the xbox 360 then to xbox one then pc and of course pc is the best.So the thing about gta for consol is its alot harder to get online mods for witch is a good thing.And its alot easyer for more people to run it but i mean you better have a good pc before you go buy it for a pc that cant even run csgo.Now on to pc.The thing I like about pc is that you can download mods really easy.I only use mods in single play though because its not worth getting banned.The bad thing is that its so easy to get mods for online like its not even funny.Another thing is for me the online didnt work.I dont know if they fixed it because i deleted it but im redownloading it.Over all if you get into a private lobby with your friends it a fun open world game.I would recomend it to people who are looking for a open world game to play with there friends.

review: I recommend this game to any PC gamer looking to get their fix on the GTA world in the largest virtual city based on a real life location ever!It's really good besides it's nonstop swearing excessive blood and gore and the urge to kill everything in sight which I think is a compliment. Considering that this is the largest virtual city to date besides No Man's Sky (a game that I've been longing to play) but with that out of the way it's a massive open world game compared to other games out there like Destiny and vice versa but I am no IGN person here... so I will say this in only a few words as possible..."Damn. This is a big game."There is so much to do you'll never have anything to do afterwards its pretty much only fun on PCs because of modding capabilities... and it's extensive modding community is above average at best but there are some pretty useful mods out there that catch your eye like openCamera (by the same people that made OpenIV the best modding solution out there). And there are also some fun ones like the Nuke mod that really caught my eye as soon as I saw it on the IGN fourms. But modding aside let's wrap up this review shall we...This is a very RAM consuming game it works best on high performance PCs while having a large render distance that's always a good thing.Here are the list of Good things about the game Large open world based title Extensive modding community is above average at best VERY addicting story line. Heists in story mode. Online capabilities.And now the cons Performance consuming at high render distances Ambient Occlusion Texture Quality etc. Gets very boring after a while on consoles or if you don't have good internet and can't download mods. GTA Online gets all updates not story mode. Can't play with mods online you'll get banned if you do.Altogether this review is totally based on experience I didn't want to attempt getting bannedfrom using mods but either way. This has more good than bad but I recommend having a very powerful computer on hand otherwise your in for a bumpy ride.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: You should really buy this one on a sale as this game isnt exactly new any longer although it is a very nice game. So lets start with credibility I've finished the game to see all 3 endings and put 90 hours into multiplayer therefore I think I am reliable enough to review this game with high enough credibility.This game's story mode revolves around action in depth story and large final choices. The timing is perfect and the missions are very organised and constructed keeping the game very nice action packed and entertaining. This game features side quests I completed around half of these and can easily say that they are better and more interactive than a good majority of other in game missions from other games.Since I have spoken about single player features so far I'll go onto multiplayer. Your main focus in multiplayer is making money for more personalization and more fun you can also do more of side missions such as racing. Essentially you are having fun for the sake of getting more fun. Although as you can imagine it can get very grind y and frustrating at times so get a buddy to play with you. This game has also been cleaned of hackers so now no one will be destroying your games.I would move onto the problems of the game although none at all can be found in my game so far. I have a very low end PC and can run this game on 30 fps on the very lowest possible settings and to put that into more of perspective I can run evolve on the lowest settings lowest resolution at about 25 fps. So 30fps is very good on my PC. Definitely buy this game whether for online story or just to mess around.

review: If you came here looking for a review you have come to the wrong place but if you want some very ing good brownies you have come to the right place. You're welcome for an actual recipe not a copy and paste pie recipe. Trust me nothing goes wrong with nutella.INGREDIENTS 1 c. unsalted butter2 c. sugar1/2 tsp. salt1 c. flour1 c. cocoa powder4 eggs1 (13 oz.) jar Nutella5 Ferrero Rocher candies unwrapped and crumbledDIRECTIONS 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.2. Melt butter in a medium sized saucepan over medium heat. Add sugar stirring until combined. 3. Remove from heat and add salt flour and cocoa powder stirring to combine. Whisk in eggs stirring just until the mixture is combined into a batter. Set aside.4. Spray an 8" x 8" pan with cooking spray. Pour half of the batter into the pan. Spoon or lightly drizzle most of the Nutella on top of the batter forming an even layer over the brownie batter. 5. 5. Use a spoon or silicone spatula to cover the Nutella with the remaining brownie batter. (If you pour the batter straight on top of the Nutella it will sink into the Nutella and combine into one marbled yet delicious mess.)6. Bake until the top layer of brownies has browned and set 28 to 30 minutes. It shouldn t jiggle when you remove it from the oven. (The toothpick test doesn t work here since the toothpick will hit the Nutella layer making the brownies seem uncooked.)7. Let cool for 15 to 20 minutes then top with a drizzle of Nutella and crumbled Ferrero Rocher chocolates. Cut into squares and serve.Credits Billy

review: Tip Do not buy sharkcards people can mod in money for you just do not be impatient it happened immediatley for me if you want some money in game hmu I know a guy )I really wish you could write a review on steam with an opinion of "Eh" this game has hackers and modders modders can be fun and I call hackers the ones who aren't so fun and are Pros Good storyGood gameplay3rd and first person for the fans of FPSs or realistic shooting/driving.Skills that increase handling of vehicles firearms cardio that lot.Online mode has heists which require money but can be quite fun planning out with friends and make you some money in a reasonably fun way.3 characters in story mode with different special abilities houses clothes and one even has a dog!A very very big choice between guns (you can carry all of them at once).Modifiable guns.Good voice acting (IMO).God like graphics.If you played on console and had a rockstar account you can sync your character and still have everything you had before.Passive in case you hate getting butt focked by other people in game.Cons Shark cards.Bad support *I've heard*Little to no care for modders/hackers part of that can be a good thing depending on how you like your game.Tip to avoid hackers when you find one block him and report him. Reporting doesn't always help but I would. Blocking ensures you're never in another session with them again.

review: This is the best Grand Theft Auto there is. The story is what you come for and is the best story anyone has written for this type of game. The characters are extreamly likeable and Michael is what makes this game. There is stuff to do but not so much and the game gives you free reign right from the start. First person mode makes the game harder and plays sometimes like a FPS which is nice.Alot of cars to drive and planes to fly help you get away from the cops. The poice are handled in a much different way for the first time requireing you to avoid there patrols when you are wanted. There is a stealth aspect and the writing is raunchy and rude and excellent. The best part of the game is the heists which give you multiple ways to do them with multiple characters. The gem heist is still my favorite.Do not buy this if Online is what you want because the community is straight cancer.

review: The fundementals are there for this to be a great installment for GTA. But it falls way short. The story is terrible in single player mode. Seriously I can't shoot the guy who is doing my life? I have to back down from some jerk because he has a buddy with a baseball bat? I get pushed around by corrupt feds and then I have to torture somebody?! The story of this game is just completely awful.Oh well at least I can play multiplayer mode right? Well nope. It's hacked to death. Cheaters pretty much rule the multiplayer mode so you might as well not even bother. This company does not know how to make pc games anymore and I'm done. This game was worth maybe 20 bucks for the time I've gotten out of it. Anyway I'm uninstalling and I doubt I will ever play it again. You suck Rockstar. You really suck!Oh and you rockstar social club. Holy this is the last rockstar game I buy.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: MUST PLAYPROS+First and third person mode gameplay+Brimming with content and attention to detail+Can swap between three main characters+Heist gameplay+High production value+Very optimized+Awesome free roam+GTA OnlineCONS Less interiors Boring characters The story is not on par with previous GTA titles The online community (hackers russians etc.) Loading screensThis game is a blast. I really like the addition of the swappable main characters and the heist gameplay which is an improvement from previous titles. The storyline is not engaging enough for me to go through it but GTA Online can offer tons of fun too. Although I am dissapointed because some of the minor details in GTA IV are not here and annoyed with the hackers that are everywhere on Online mode this game is a must buy.Rate 9/10

review: Love all the sob stories just filter to negative reviews and grab some popcorn. Rockstar has very specific TOS and if you we're "randomly" banned it probably wasn't as random as you think so go ahead and whine away your problems because you aren't as smart as some people. Otherwise the game is quite flawless grinding is not as much a problem as people complain it is so long as you have friends to grind with it's quite fun. Shark Cards is probably the communities most frequently used broken record. Honestly nobody buys Shark Cards except for youtubers to give away (supposedly) to their fans. Onto another broken record modders. They really aren't as prevalent as people say they are as of writing this review I have 800+ hours in the game and I only rarely see modders and when I do see them they usually mind their own business.

review: Its a new GTA nuff saidMany argue about DRM multiplayer problems and so on but guess what Those issues where there in the previous title as well.I bought the game for full price which I admit was a bit high but the fact that I spent over 100 hours on this game makes it worth the money. And it seems like Rockstar knows that as it is still sold for full price ever since the release.Much like on other GTA titles you play again as a psychopath who managed to get a gun even after his 3rd police shoot out followed by near death expirience. I guess 'murica yeah. Not only this but it allows you to do this as three different people. Take your pick it's not like you won't kill indicriminately anyways. But would you rather do it with cars guns or just... brutal I guess?So if you need a timout after your 7th hooker followed by golfcart rampage go and visit GTA Online where you can play with others like yourself and kill these guys instead of NPC's. That is if you're not just getting in game by a russian player who afterwards dropped a billion dollar on you and flew away in his sailboat. Believe it or not this happens OFTEN.All in all the game really made the hilarious mess that is GTA IV even better pushing forward technology and marketing.This title deserves everything it gets. Starting fights and get random people arrested is still as much fun as it was 7 years ago (7 YEARS?! I'm getting too old for this sh*t)

review: Story mode GTA V's story mode offers a great storyline with great characters and lot of very good details. The missions are fun and you really won't get bored playing the story mode. You can do anything you ever wanted the game's graphics are great. Great selections of vehicles (cars planes bikes boats) amazing Director mode and cool customizations. Overall the single player experience is GREAT.GTA Online GTA Online is a huge grind. Super cars facilities weaponized vehicles and other cool stuff you might want to have costs an exorbitant amount of money. Getting this money via grinding heists and missions will take a lot of time especially if you don't have any friends to help you. Hackers are also everywhere in this game. They will constantly troll you and have unlimited money. And for some reason these hackers are never caught. Moreover the anti cheat system oftens bans innocent people for no reason at all. Why waste so much time in this game if you can just hack it and gain infinite money and god mode? The Online mode is basically constant grinding and frustration. All the "new" updates in GTA Online are designed to milk more money off of the players in an already dying game because they only bring more and more cars and weaponized vehicles that are priced very expensively.

review: I definitely am glad that I waited to review this title because had you asked me a year ago or even a few months ago I would have given it flying stars. However the honeymoon period is over folks... And I do have a lot of things that I could say about this title that wouldn't leave the reader too infatuated. However this is not one of those reviews that lumbers on like a yeti on a warm day. Now that being said I would like to tell you that yes this game is probably still worth the $60 that they charge and that I have in fact bought this game three times. Once for 360 once for PC and yet again for XBOX ONE. This game is exciting amusing and rediculous. It is a ton of fun to play with or without friends yes yes I'm sure you've heard this all before. So before I go I would like to tell you the $#!% that I have had to put up with when playing this damn game. #1 The uncertainty of whether or not the servers are up albeit the fact that this was more of an issue in 2013 the issues still persist today.#2 The uncertainty of whether or not Rockstar Social Club is up yup I am currently not able to play this game due to this issue and I have encountered it several times in the past. This one really pisses me off.#3 People are $$holes that's not the game's fault but the game certainly enables them to be terrible if they wish.#4 This game is guaranteed to you off. It will happen whether it be because the game isn't working or because it's inability to work properly in the first place.#5 Do not expect to keep anything you earn in online play.That is my rant enjoy the game because undoubtedly you've already bought it.#6 You can't transfer your multiplayer character to more than two devices... C'mon Rockstar you greedy f# %s...
title: Grand Theft Auto V
