review: GTA V is lacking in a lot of features and rather than improving the game play mechanics of the previous successors they made it worse and more friendly to casuals taking every moment to handhold players rather than having them actually using skills picked up throught the game. I mean I can't tell you how many times I've abused the gun bash attack on other players online and on npcs on single player it can kill them in 1 hit unless they're in a fighting stance with any melee weapon(5 hits but they get stuck in the hit stun animation and can't do jack sh it due to the fact that you can't block at all and can't dodge gun bashing unlike other melee attacks).Melee is literally garbage(can't block attacks only dodge you're character kicks too much fight stances make you like Quasimodo was having an epileptic fit in a bar brawl the animations look like they hired the talentend animators from bad rats even though R* has the shekels for mo cap animations I can go on all day). guns are also horrid since they do jack sh it in damage compared to just smacking them with the gun and lack in a variety of attachments(the ones you do get are flat out upgrades instead of having actual advantages/disadvantages that make the player choose between what he wants for a gun) and the firearm choices themselves are just ether novelty or complete upgrades rather than each weapon feeling unique and having it's own pros/cons. the story is mediocre at best compared to IV(decent good but had it's flaws) the physic's were a set back compared to RDR GTA IV and the "Max Payne" game that was just a copypasta of man on fire just with brazil instead of mexico and max payne replacing gorrlia grodd in human clothing. You can't even buy all the online clothes and hairstyles for single player since we'll gotta have the goyim buy sharkcards for virtual items that won't matter in life. Online character creator is joke since saints row did a much better job with that than GTA online(literally a parent system and a box slider that takes an eternity to make you're character look the way you want him too and limited customization on facial features body mass you know the stuff that saints row's 1 4 got right. Because here at rockstar we choose to hire 3rd worlders who don't know about the existance of toliets to make our game features). lack of things to spend you're money on once you've beaten SP since all the extra content is reserved for online only without mods(YOU CAN SPAWN THE EXTRA CONTENT BUT IT DISSAPPEARS AFTER 5 SECONDS SO MUCH FOR BEING PRO MODDING YOU SLIVER TOUNGED LIARS) just so R* can butt/fu/ck you if you got this game for single player(YOU HAVE TO BE ONLINE ALL THE TIME TO HAVE ACCESS TO SINGLE PLAYER OTHERWISE THE GAME WON'T LOAD. AND NO COCKBLOCKING SOCIAL CLUB FROM UR FIREWALL HASN'T WORKED SINCE 72 MINOR PATCHES AGO) also P2P only on the PC FFS(no dedicated servers since being locked in p2p server host in china or eastern europe at over 300 ping is the only way to play the game). TL DR don't buy this game unless you want to mod it and ((((Rockstar)))) swindled the goyim for they're shekels all wile kvetching at modders making they're games 10 times better as if It was the second shoah(V MP). anyways that's my two cents on this brb I gotta take a sh/it. OH YEAH AND ROCKSTAR SAID "YOU DON'T ANYTHING GOYIM" TO THE PEOPLE WHO MADE OPEN IV FOR IMPROIVNG THEIR SH ITTY GAME R* NUTHUGGERS BLOWN THE FU CK OUT LMAO YOU CAN'T EVEN MOD THIS VILE WRETCH CALLED A GAME ANYMORE SO YOU HAVE TO GIVE EM A BJ FOR SHARKCARDS NOW.EDIT THEY PUT BACK MODDING BUT NO IMPORTING CONTENT(OR REMASTERS AND MP CLIENTS THAT AREN'T SHARKCARD FEST) SINCE YOU'D HAVE TO PLAY FOR THE ONLINE ONLY REMASTERS WITH THOSE SHARK CARDS PROBABLY(BETTING THAT AGREEMENT IS VERY SEMETIC TO THE POINT WHERE MAKING EDITS TO THE GAME'S ANIMATIONS OR CODE COUNTS AGANIST THE NEW POLICY) R* NUTHUGGERS DANCE HARDER THAN VALVES FANBOYS.I'M WAITING FOR THE NUTTHUGGERS TO DANCE EVEN HARDER WHEN I'LL TELL EM' ABOUT ONE OF THE MANY CEASE AND DISSIST'S MODDERS HAVE GOTTEN FOR PUTTING THEIR PASSION INTO THE GAME ONLY TO GET SCREWED BY A BUNCH OF BI POLAR S H IT S THAT "SUPPORT SINGLE PLAYER MODDING"

review: I have played this on xbox 360 in the past but stopped playing it since about December. I got bored of it. I felt like it was just the same thing over and over again. I preordered this hopping for something different. When I started playing it I was amazed by it! I felt like I had never playing this game in my life even though I have. I have played about 11 hours in game now and I have never got bored yet. I have all my settings on high and it is truly breath taking. I love how much detail they put in this game that 1% of people may notice (maybe a ciggerette bud on the ground or some griffiti on the wall.) review: Rockstar has always been known for it's ingenuity pushing the envelope with its spot on social satire and breaking the mold with its unconventional gameplay. The online version seemingly possesses some mechanics issues which effectively penalize new players for defeating their better equipped opponents. Still the much hyped GTA5 continues Rockstar's tradition of excellence introducing unprecedented new gameplay mechanics which make los santos (rockstar's scarily accurate mock up of modern california) feel like a living breathing world. My father insists that mom is still living and breathing but i can no longer smell her I can always smell her. Rockstar delivers on the hype with another top notch release that'll keep you playing in the sandbox long after mom calls you home
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: inb4 butthurt modders get angry at meI don't know why you need an FOV mod or any other mod for that matter. Besides the game has only been out for a few weeks. It would not surprise me to see heightened support for mods in the future. Give it some time you'll get your roflguns.I think I have an issue with the monitor I have GTA5 set to as I have experienced a very minute amount of "screen tearing" in my playtime. (Running on an i5 4690K with 16GB memory and a 3GB GTX 780.)tl dr if you have no plans for modding buy this game. If you do buy it and be patient. Play the story missions or troll online lobbies. Or play another game. Don't hate Rockstar. This game is beautiful and a lot of fun.

review: GTA V like the others gta games it's a great game. Of course it's not a perfect game have some bugs have some thing we want to do and we can't but it's a game not real life...The people are arguing about the 60 dollars they pay and they can't use the game like they want...It's not recommended buy a car and make changes it's not recommended buy something and change like you want. To be perfect the users need to understand the updates are being made the dlc are being set if it's the politic of the company not support mods we need to understand that. Imagine millions of people playing the game and have a system to separate the people using mods in single player or multi player. Imagine what it is having a team doing only that time they spent and they can use that time to make the game better.I agree with the Rockstar politic. Some players know how to use mods but other don't so nobody can use it. Imagine someone create a mod to make some cheat in the multiplayer the fun it will end and it's the rockstar name. Of course i have the opinion maybe they can create some servers only to people want to use mods or cheat but maybe that will happen in the future. Let's wait and see what they are preparing for the futue. Let's play and not arguing let's have fun and not think we are talking about real life...This is a game not a job not your life. Of course it's only my opinion and i respect the other opinions so please respect mine.

review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples peeled cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double crust pie Directions 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter white sugar brown sugar water cinnamon and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10 inch circle. Cut into 8 (1 inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips one at a time into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter sugar mixture over top of pie coating the lattice and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the crust is golden brown the caramel on the top crust is set and the apple filling is bubbling 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

review: Grand Theft Auto V. A really good game at it's core much akin to it's previous releases. It is however not without its shortcomings as with any game. GTAV comes jampacked with many singleplayer features as well as an extensive story driven campaign centered around 3 morons. The first moron is a dad who sucks at being a dad and is just a mid life crisis. The second moron is a crazy rabid son of a who'd snap your neck over a grain of sand. The last moron is your typical hoodrat wanting to make something more of himself only to be shunned by his 'family'.Singleplayer and Multiplayer both have their own forms of exclusive content. This is my biggest gripe right here. Singleplayer for example gives you access to the Dukes muscle car. Now I don't mean the armored one I mean the regular one. Multiplayer on the other hand doesn't let you have it. On the other hand Multiplayer has Benny's. You can make lowriders and two racecars. Singleplayer doesn't let you do that.Singleplayer is safely moddable but should be backed up before modding. Mods really bring out the glory of this game.Multiplayer is completely off limits to modding you mod you get banned. Simple as that. So if you want to play online you'd best make damn sure you have all of your mods uninstalled.Making money in Singleplayer is easier than getting into bed at night.Making money in Multiplayer is more tedious than getting up in the morning after being stoned all day.GTA Online is a pretty entertaining experience... with friends. In public lobbies it's about the dumbest thing imaginable filled with modders/hackers who enjoy tearing the experience apart for regular players like you or me. The problem? You NEED to go into PUBLIC lobbies for certain DLC content to be playable. This is absolute trash and rockstar should be hung by their balls for it literally. Discouraging private lobbies while allowing the option isn't entertaining. It's annoying.Looking past many flaws however there is an amazing game here both in singleplayer and online. You just have to find and make it for yourself. Don't forget to bring friends because otherwise you'll get bored as with any other game. So basically drive cars shoot people get green spend green repeat.

And if i'm faced with the choice of either playing the torture mission or not being able to complete the story then uninstalling the game and writing this review is the result. Cruelty is not satire. And basically forcing the player to do something he absolutely doesn't want to do isn't in any way justifiable.

review: Grand Theft Auto 5 and GTA Onine should be two seperate games. The reason being is that Grand Theft Auto 5 has quite frankly one of the best acted best executed storylines I think I have had the pleasure of experiencing in a computer game. It's funny it's entertaining and the single player gameplay is an absolute blast. The driving physics are fun and allow you to enjoy just cruising around the city and getting from point to point is enjoyable. The gun play is superb and the cover system on the whole works very well.Criticisms I would level against the gameplay would be that first person view really isn't for GTA if you ask me. I've tried it quite a few times and I just think third person works soo much better. Flying... seriously I have been in a light aircraft and there is not that much turbulance in a flipping hurricane! Seriously it does ruin the flying aspect a bit. The turbulance mechanic makes no sense it doesn't happen in clouds over hills it's just random and annoying.But to summarise the graphics are superb the sound is superb the music is superb. Hell as far as I am concerned the whole single player experience is superb! It is a must play 9.5/10 experience.GTA Online however. Multiplayer... I've tried it a few times. In honesty it bored me to death. I tried a few modes I can see how heists would be good fun but with random people on the internet the joy gets sucked right out of that experience pretty quick. Also I found that I got money pretty easily had a house and some cars. Then I just felt like there wasn't anywhere to go from there. Not to mention that only took me maybe 5 hours of gameplay? Had no trouble with bans although I was in one game and someone made it rain bycles and then dropped cash on my head so I left.GTA Online I would personally rate as a thoroughly average gaming experience and if you play the single player first you will definitely be dissappointed IMO. That being said the game is fantastic if you ignore GTA O even exists!

review: Buy game. Go through single player. Can't relate to any of the characters. One is a thug and as stereotypically black as you can get. Another is a complete psychopath. The one I guess you're supposed to relate to is a complete d bag. Everyone in the game is rude to the point you just want to stab a baby. The only time anyone is nice to you is when you return someone's wallet and 90% of the time it's better to just keep it. Even driving around the city other drivers will hit you curse you out and try to kill you. Switching between 3 characters all with their own inventory and cars is a pain in the butt. The most enjoyable thing to do is steal a plane and cruise around at night where it's peaceful and beautiful. Finish story mode. Crap ending. Let's try multiplayer. Die repeatedly to s 100x levels above you with rocket launchers and chainguns. Set yourself in passive mode and then die repeatedly to modders who put campfires on you and throw you in the air so you suicide. Watch as modders duplicate your character 100 times until it crashes the game on you. Wait another 10 minutes to get back in online mode because even installed on two SSDs in RAID0 on a system that can play every game on Ultra the game is so poorly optimized it takes forever to load and connect. Get back online and immediately die due to modders. Have all your ammo and weapons removed and then watch as everyone in the lobby repeatedly explodes. Wait 5 minutes to join a new lobby. Repeat the fun of modders destroying your gameplay and Rockstar not caring. Decide to just join a private invite only lobby and try to join people's heists. A 12 year old throws a fit halfway through the heist because he wanted to be on the Insurgent gun. He leaves. You're kicked from the game and wait 10 minutes to get back into a session. Join another heist and someone gets bored during the opening RP cinematic and you're kicked again and have to wait another 10 minutes. Join another heist and manage to complete it but at the very end you fail for no reason at all and everyone leaves out of frustration. Join a crew in hopes of having better people to play with and realize most of them are trolls. They just run you over with their car and kill you repeatedly and laugh at you. Realize that everyone's bored of the game and just trolling. Need 3 dedicated friends to accomplish anything in the game. Ends with some modder dropping a few million on my head getting me banned 2 weeks for "cheating". Would only recommend if you are a complete sadist and prefer it rough without lube when you're abused.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: As a long time fan of the GTA series and owning the entire series the beginning of the story was fun but halfway through changing characters gets a little annoying. Being a bank robber is different than being a gangster or mobster like the others in the series but was a fun change.over all after beating the game twice I have to say the game was fun but I was wanting a bit more with single player dlc. The online portion was similar to the story. At first it was fun but once you get all of the jobs(CEO making fake money making drugs having a MC etc) it literally becomes the same missions over and over again. Not only that but rockstar made it that you get very little money from doing these jobs forcing you to buy shark cards or play the game like world of Warcraft.which at first sounds fun and resonable but in practice becomes boring and a grind fest(since your doing the same missions over and over). Overall I would get it for single player and mods absolutely fun. But I wouldn't get it JUST for the online even with friends too much of a grind without the fun of being a traditional mmo.

review: If you came here looking for a review you have come to the wrong place but if you want some very ing good brownies you have come to the right place. You're welcome for an actual recipe not a copy and paste pie recipe. Trust me nothing goes wrong with nutella.INGREDIENTS 1 c. unsalted butter2 c. sugar1/2 tsp. salt1 c. flour1 c. cocoa powder4 eggs1 (13 oz.) jar Nutella5 Ferrero Rocher candies unwrapped and crumbledDIRECTIONS 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.2. Melt butter in a medium sized saucepan over medium heat. Add sugar stirring until combined. 3. Remove from heat and add salt flour and cocoa powder stirring to combine. Whisk in eggs stirring just until the mixture is combined into a batter. Set aside.4. Spray an 8" x 8" pan with cooking spray. Pour half of the batter into the pan. Spoon or lightly drizzle most of the Nutella on top of the batter forming an even layer over the brownie batter. 5. 5. Use a spoon or silicone spatula to cover the Nutella with the remaining brownie batter. (If you pour the batter straight on top of the Nutella it will sink into the Nutella and combine into one marbled yet delicious mess.)6. Bake until the top layer of brownies has browned and set 28 to 30 minutes. It shouldn t jiggle when you remove it from the oven. (The toothpick test doesn t work here since the toothpick will hit the Nutella layer making the brownies seem uncooked.)7. Let cool for 15 to 20 minutes then top with a drizzle of Nutella and crumbled Ferrero Rocher chocolates. Cut into squares and serve.

review: Id like to start this revied saying that every other gta iv ever played iv had a blast on. this one on the other hand i think rock star could of done better. pretty much all the missions iv played dont have a pay out. the 3 main heists and the assassination missions are pretty much the only money missions . the most expencive bussness you can get is the golf club which costs around 150 mill. your last heist gets you around 40mil. the only ways to really make money is to nock over armored trucks (around 6k payout) which you almost never find. drive a taxi( which payes out about 200$ a ride) nocking over liquer stores (which payes out about 250$) and the stock market(which seems to crash every time i buy stock) so the only real way to make any cash is to sleep and wait tilll any propertys pay out. online is riddled with hackers and the ai's kill you with 1 hit headshots. every mission is the same thing. drive to location shot a bunch of ai's get away. which you will faill 100 times b4 you finish one.

review: GTA V is unrefined in terms of gameplay. This means that its boring.Want to get in trouble? Have fun losing hordes of super cops who will most of the time kill you unless you use a cheat code or get lucky with an alley. Sometimes I need to wait for long periods of time in an alley before the cops aren't on alert and then they become alerted again as soon as I leave it.So what do you end up doing most of the time? Trying not to off the cops.Want to get into a gunfight? The mechanics aren't refined and as such have enough annoying bits that should have been worked out that its not fun after a couple of them. Between the shooter and the cop dynamics being poor most missions and gamaeplay aren't worth it.All of the bad boy NPC interaction stuff which is vanilla by today's standards isn't worth the time.I like the vehicle variety. I find that the cars handle differently enough to make driving fun. If you like open world driving this game is good for that. Other than that aspect of the game I can't recommend it. I uninstalled it before long.

review: +Cursing nudity sex killing do whatever the hell you feel like doing. What much more could u want out of a fantasy game? Thats why we game in the first place. Awesome game SP was fantastic the level design was amazing and graphics. Voice acting was one of the best out of all the characters I have ever heard. Not sure about mp dont care to play it. Well worth the full price. Only negative to me which is an opinion. playing Trevor. Thank god you only had to play as him a few times. At times hes funny as hell and made me laugh but most of the time he was just plain annoying and I wanted to shoot him. Definatly felt good in the ending which theres 3 different endings you can chose from. Playing as Michael and Franklin however was awesome and had 2 different types of lives to live as. Oh and the major negative if you own a GTX 980 FTW graphics card about once every 2 hrs of playing this game youll get a no signal error to your monitor and only way is to reboot and it comes back on so save your game frequently if you own this card same thing has happened to my friend that has same card and this is the only game it does that too.10/10

review: GTA V as a whole is a great game.For Storymode the storyline in GTA V is one of my favorites in the Grand Theft Auto series I beat the game on Xbox 360 Xbox One and I hope to beat it on PC (and maybe choose different paths). Rockstar nailed it on the head when it came to the characters how the chemistry works between them and how each main character in game is the actual face of the actor in real life.For Online I suggest you download FiveM or GTA Network so that you can play on other servers than on the main Rockstar servers (for the time being). You can you FiveM/GTA Network or you can create a private lobby from the 'Online' tab and just do heist/races in that lobby with your friends. Other than that the base Online game is filled with hackers sadly. For a 3+ year old game you would think they would invest money into making a anti cheat instead of making pointless updates.Warning as of March 2017 you can't transfer your Online character from console to PC or PC to console. So with that being said. You will need to start all over if you planned on merging your PS4/Xbox One character to PC. It's not possible anymore. It's funny how Rockstar can still put GTA V at the $60 price point (not worth it get it on sale (maybe $30)) but yet they can't support a small but great feature.

review: Well I don t know what to say really. I m going to recommend it because it can be very fun especially with friends that have the game. Not saying it s boring alone just more fun with friends. Once you buy something feels really good and satisfying. Many features and things to do that you can pretty much stay occupied all the time or just mess around with cops or just go on a massacre. However if you are one of those people that hate grinding do not buy this game because you re going to have to grind a lot in order to buy something because honestly in my opinion I think that the things in this game are expensive and you need to spend lots of time to get something in game which relates to a pay to win style game. If you want money either buy a shark card from the beginning or be prepared to grind your off. Who knows you might even be one of the lucky ones and find yourself a hacker/modder that is generous and he/she will give you some money. Don t do it though you might get banned. )

review: After putting hundreds of hours into the Xbox 360 version when it was first released the PC version does not dissapoint. With absolutely stunning visuals smooth driving/gun play with mouse and keyboard along with the community producing mods that will only get better and better with time this is definetly worth a second purchase if you have already played it on console. GTA is one of those titles that you know is going to be good because the developer cares about the title and wants the game to be the best it can be. Despite some short comings with the online multiplayer (slow load times difficulties getting a full party etc.) the game is absolutely fantastic if you have had doubts about jumping in to GTA V don't the game will not dissapoint you.

Pros + Stunning visuals &amp graphics+ Almost everything feels real (object detail shadows effects etc)+ Every characters feels unique (great voice actors realistic character details)+ 3 main characters with different personality skills unique vehicles and background+ Even NPC feels real (can call cops at you can chat with you even fight at you if provoked)+ Many kinds of animals that can be threat+ Playing the game with FPS mode feels different+ The land sea and air is exploreable with realistic means+ Huge diversity of vehicles (car (you can pimp most of them) bikes planes boats heli minisub military vehicles)+ Many weapons types variant and modifications to choose for + Great story+ Cops more active and cunning to track you down+ In game money feels precious not easy to earned and can be spend out quickly+ Tons of things to do (side missions collectibles achievements explorations)+ the game is huge improvement from the prequel (more optimized with current hardware and software)+ GTA online and online heist fiture (haven't try it myself yet)Cons 60GB game size is kinda take a lot of time to download In game benchmark tools have some issues (not just me) Long loading time (using SSD or SSHD may improve loading time) Vram hungry games if you want to play it with higher graphics settings antialiasing and resolutions 50 bucks for the game is worth it but not everyone is willing to pay that much (a discount gonna be nice)Conclusions Just buy the game and play it till you bored with it (i'm bored)

review: So this game is an amazing game it has a lot of features that no other GTA has if you like open world sandbox style games here's the one. Yes modding is discontinued for the time being it sucks but that doesn't make the game a bad game. The thing I was most angry about and I think people who want this game on PC from console would be most angry about there is no more character transfer. I had to start fresh and get all my money and stats back. Which sucks but brings replay ability back.Pros Decent storyFun to play with friendsFun to play soloGood unique combat systemFirst and Third personCons No character tranfer for GTA onlineNo mods (For now)Has a lot of modders and hackers in GTA onlineNot worth 60 dollars since it's been out for almost 4 years

review: Really Rock*?Edit2 Rockstar have now sent a cease and desist letter to the main modding program. It disables itself online it has no effects for hackers it's just for modding SP. They are trying to stop it to drive more people to Online and microtransactions. Their reason was that "OpenIV allows users to create malicious mods that allowe harassment of players and interfere with the GTA Online experience". OpenIV does not touch online and immediately disables itself if you try. Why are people still supporting Rockstar?Edit These problems seem to be ocurring less by now but I'm leaving this review up as a warning to the scummy business practices of Rockstar. People are being banned for no reason and Rockstar agrees with them yet they are still refusing to reverse the bans or do anything to help. Using Discord Fraps Any third party Framerate counter or any program that adds an overlay to your games will result in you getting banned and support will not reverse it. Heck if you buy shark cards and they don't work they won't even refund you for that!Do not support awful business practices like this. Their anti cheat is terrible and their support just wants your money.EDIT A lot of people seem to be taking this as "Waaaah! I got banned!" so let me clear things up. I have not been banned I uninstalled the game myself as the hard drive space it took was massive and I didn't play it much. For those who don't believe the large amount of people who have been falsely banned here are a few more reasons why you shouldn't support R*.There is a limitless amount of bugs for Online. Ranging from everyone in your session suddenly leaving the game at once you being booted for no reason connections timing out randomly all of these are punctuated with the worst error screen I have ever seen. Instead of presenting you with a simple "You have timed out" the game instead spends much time loading up Single player puts you into the world and *then* gives you an error message with an option to rejoin. Which how ludicrously long the load times in this game are that's a good 2 5 minutes waiting for an error to appear just so you can start waiting again to get back into the game. It is incredibly easy to fix but rockstar still haven't because they do not care.There is no server browser. This means that with the endless adversary modes they add all are dead within a week. The only options you have when in an adversary mode is to invite people of a similar level (which almost never works) and to invite everyone who was in your previous free roam session. If you are playing free roam would you want to suddenly be pulled into a small mode which likely won't have many players? I thought as much. Thus the modes die off extremely quickly.And finally the Anticheat is still terrible. You can have people flying around the map spawning props locking you in place dropping money bags on everyone (Which in an amusing way can result in *them* getting banned) and just generally causing havoc. Every "attempt" Rockstar has made has resulted in false positives and an extremely intolerant system towards modders. You remember how much Rockstar said they "loved" the PC Audience and their modders? That's amusing considering they're filling the game with dummy code to confuse them and you will be instabanned if you go anywhere near Online with the slightest hint of a modification to your game files.In all do not support a developer who does not care about their audience. They release modes (The recent Further adventures in Finance and Felony update is a great case for this) that require either for you to grind an unreasonable amount of money or buy shark cards to make it all easier. Not to mention the adversary modes they throw out are easy to make and take little to no effort as again they'll be dead within a few weeks.You will be better off supporting another company. Move on.

review: GTA ONLINE I started playing Grand theft auto on my playstation 3 when the game first game out and it was a fun sandbox to play with friends then i switched to ps4 where a good amount of content was enjoyable but since last year this game has turned from a fun sandbox to EA 2.0. The amount of needs for microtransactions just to play with the new things in a dlc is and you can barely make a profit grinding in this game if you have school/job. Thus many people have gotten smart and bought mod menus and accounts on PC just to enjoy a dlc. The major problem comes with the players who just want to play the game legit because the game gets stale after around 6 hours of grinding just to have enough money to buy a ok car. But then the new dlc makes the game even worse if you start the heist and pay around 300k just to startup the heist and you pay your crew a fare amount of money YOU LOSE MONEY! This game is horrible and to be honest don't buy it if you want to keep your sanity.THE STORY MODE It is a blast to play and one of the best in the Grand Theft Auto Series but honestly no one anymore plays the games single player because all the new stuff is in GTA Online.So i believe we should stop playing the game to standup to rockstar and prove we are strong like what we did to EA with battlefront 2

review: Rockstar have really f*cked this game up. They haven't added in any content for single player since release 4 years ago. GTA online however... They add the stupidest unbalanced sh*t making the big 16 30 player servers practically unplayable without getting shot with an EXPLOSIVE sniper or a rocket bike or sprayed with the marksman rifle every time you try to have a sniper battle. What annoys me is they don't nerf/patch anything they just add something to counter the weapon in the next DLC making the game worse and worse with every DLC. By the time GTA 6 comes out I bet Online will be completely unplayable full of noobs with their sh*tty explosive snipers. It really bugs me because this game was a masterpiece stunning graphics huge map great story fun missions etc etc but they ruined it by rewarding and encouraging the noobs and making the actual skilled players suffer. There's no point in having skill just buy the ridiculously OP weapons and you can kill ANYONE (In fact the other day i got my handed to me by a LEVEL 50 300 levels lower than me because of all these stupid weapons.Oh and not to mention R* taking all my completely legit money after not playing for 2 months but all my friends who have modded money were fine. R* is milking GTA O dry then you'll have to buy GTA 6 since 5 will be unplayable just so r* can f*ck 6 up and the cycle goes on.This game is still worth buying there is still fun in it but it's sad because it could be so much better if they didn't encourage noobs/grippers.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The Singleplayer Is fantastic and everything you would look for to entertain yourself for a long time. The only problem is that the game leaves you in a mind where instead of doing heists and interesting missions you just follow orders from FIB clowns whom you had many MANY chances to just shoot and end it. The Multiplayer This is where the issues lay. Might as well call this loading simulator 2015. The matchmaking is absolutely terrible it takes you 20 seconds to join a match (which is likely empty as well) and then 30 seconds to reload free roam because you are unable to hop from match to match.The community is another issue. Most people are wandering psychopaths just looking to blow your car up for the jollies. When attempting to start a heist setup you usually have to wait 5 minutes minimum for players which tend to be low level mute idiots who CAN'T follow orders CAN'T shoot straight CAN'T not hit the ing rotors on the plane ending the heist CAN'T communicate in the slightest. The only thing they CAN do is die and then ragequit which makes playing heists with friends almost mandatory.To give you a bit of background Last night I spend 8 ing hours looking for decent players who wouldn't die on the Series A Coke setup.This is a personal gripe of mine When you load up the heist lobby why the can't you turn the dubstep off? It's bad enough I have to sit here seeing randoms be mentally disabled when SOMEONE ANYONE finally joins but then I have to listen to (crappily thrown together) dubshit for 8 hours? Rockstar you trying to put me into rage induced acoma? Overall I find the singleplayer quite pleasing but the multiplayer well don't touch that with a 10 foot pole (unless you just plan on ing around).(this review is primarily only for multiplayer and such it is rated for multiplayer)

review: Firstly I'd like to thank PS3 &amp Xbox360 for alpha testing PS4 &amp Xbox One For the Beta well done guys and thank you.Secondly (besides the fact that NEVER HAVE TO GO BOWLING WITH ROMAN again EVER!! )Grand Theft Auto V is an outrageous exhilarating sometimes troubling crime epic that pushes open world game design forward in amazing ways.GTA V remains a benchmark game and its graphicalimprovements are hugely impressive but it's the additionof a first person mode that transforms it into a very different beast.The New additions really add something special to the game the car modding gives a slight NFS feel and the gun mods and skins in addition to the first person touches on a COD/ Battlefield game.My only issue is that Rockstar disregards the non online players i.e no new additions the game is updated but for only online. 9/10

review: Coming from GTAIV which I ing hated this was really good. Finished it in about 33 hours and the PC port was fantastic ran butter smooth with max settings. Same old GTA formula which I think I am growing a little bored of. I had some problems with mission objectives before and during missions where I didn t know what the hell I was supposed to do. I feel like this game did not take advantage of the world it s in. So many missed opportunities to make even more kick heists or epic main story missions. I loved the soundtrack not the music but the actual scoring during the missions kicked It had a badass 80s tone similar to Dying Light or Dead Rising 4 loved it. Story was decent even though I felt there were missing cut scenes or lack of explanation in some parts and the 3 main characters were awesome. There is plenty more to do and explore but I doubt I will revisit anytime soon. A lot of people trashed Mafia 2 for its closed open world but to be honest I loved the more tightly focused story and atmosphere since 60 percent of my time playing GTAV was driving from one point to another pointless filler after a while. Like I said I must be getting bored of this formula.It s worth it for a sale price so snag it if your curious.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: My computer did not seem to like the game even though I was running with an Intel Core i5 4460 14GB of RAM and a GTX 1050Ti more than enough power to run the game. The game had constant stuttering issues with framedrops no matter what quality settings I chose. VSync on or off did not seem to help the issue. If you're thinking about buying the game ask a friend that has the game to login with their Steam account on your PC first so you can try it out before you waste your money. Not recommended.

review: We did it. After almost 77k signatures and 30k thumbs up Take Two felt the flame and revoked the cease &amp desist. OpenIV is back in development and it will be available for download from the official site soon. Thanks to the supporters for the help and the haters who's comments gave me a good laugh. I will recommend this game to anyone who would like to buy it because of its modding capability which makes it an amazing experience. I'll make this review as recommended once I feel enough people have heard about this. &lt 3I will also be giving away GTAV for the summer sale in my Discord soon so stay tuned for that.https //discord.gg/G5bgPvc )
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Firstly I love this game because you can drive all over Europe. You have to manage your money and make sure that when you get out a loan from the bank you have enough money to pay it back or are at least making enough daily profit to pay it back.You also manage a business. You can hire drivers to work for you and they will complete jobs for you but you have to pay them a wage plus some for every journey they complete. You level up they skills that make them be better at certian things like you can make them earn more money for going over a set distance or you can make them carry high value or fragile cargo. They can also carry ADR materials so things that could be dangourous. But you get paid more for that.You can always do 'Quick Jobs' and these are when the employer provides the truck and you just go where they tell you. This is fun but it starts to get boring only doing short deliverys so you can buy a truck so that you can go further distances and get more money.To conclude I feel that anybody who likes games like Farm Simulator or any simulator game should give this game a try because it is a great way to unwind after a long day and I have found it to be so much fun and very calming. Some people say that this is a boring game I happen to disagree.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V is one of those games I feel weird about even after dropping near 200 hours on my original game when I picked it up for the Xbox 360 only to realize I'm a over a year down the road when the PC release game about. Luckily enough Rockstart had the foresight to allow people to fix their deadly error of buying this shiny game on a dying console. So first off that's one huge beautiful point in Rockstar's court so I wouldn't have to grind up my online character again just to get my shiny penthouse that I haven't visited in so long I almost forgot where it was in spite of it being marked on the map.Anyways. GTA V's single player feels like a strong fleshed out GTA game running well in the same vein each of the previous installments have but much more shiny and smooth with so much to do stealing some poor bastards car may actually end up falling off the top ten to do list after a few rounds of golf mucking about on an arcade machine holding up a virtual 7 11 and the now almost absurd amount of other activities which have been added as Rockstar pumps out free content. Problem is none of the free content pours into the single player experience and we're stuck with a vanilla game that hasn't gone anywhere. Not that I miss it much as the online offers far more to do than the single player with something of a reward if not at least a sense that your actually building yourself up for something.But in the single player you will be met with three seperate characters who you will play as who all have their unique abilities which all don't mean much for other than their main special ability so long as your a competent human being capable of understanding basic controls. Which arises my single and only problem in the GTA games. Difficulty curve. Now I'm not saying it's not there but GTA V almost feels like it holds your hand a bit too tight over the course of the single player and never really punishes you if you muck up. Not that this is a bad thing but the sense of risk and reward in single player leaves something to be desired. Otherwise the experience is still exceptional in just about every other way. Beautiful and pretty damned big city to roam about and cry havoc and release the hogs of war. Or dogs. Whichever.As for the online it's essentially the single player experience but partially populated with the stew of the gaming community. Most people are there just to play and have a fun time running people over selling drugs stealing drugs blowing drugs up and just about every other major crime under the sun. Problem is as is the fault with all online games you will consistantly run into people who feel it necessary to cheat in the online. You'll suddenly see another player spawn twenty feet from you blow you up with some kind of Iranian superweapon and you suddenly realize they've Harry Pottered their way across the the entire map and over the course of the next five minutes have killed every single player in the lobby while uttering less than acceptable phrases. Rockstar makes it easy enough to report and kick players problem is I've found a sad amount of people don't even know how to access the player list to report or kick which confuses me but then again I'm the type of nimrod who gladly stares at menus early on for ten minutes to know where everythings at.In the end in this poorly written review Grand Theft Auto V is a remarkable game worth your time and money if you have an immense amount of time to devote to a single game as if you were in some kind of digital monogomy and you accidentally knocked up Grand Theft Auto and it's father is keeping a shotgun pressed firmly against your buttocks until you've ground up enough money to afford a penthouse so you can continue onto bigger and better heists and other various missions.Pros Excellent single player Beautiful graphics Expansive radio selection Fleshed out gameplay Almost MMO like multi player without too many of the typical MMO tropes New content releases regularly giving plenty to do in the onlineCons Huge file size you better make sure you've partitioned some disk space or free some up You'll find a hacker/modder in almost every online lobby Single player doesn't feel like it has much post game content other than typical activitiesI'm sure I could give much better pros and cons but honestly they wouldn't have enough gravity to mention. Well. Maybe. Probably could find more but Grand Theft Auto V is a damn good game and in spite of any other flaws I guarentee you'll have tons of fun with it.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game had so much potential you'll only ever see in the modding communities. The singleplayer story is garbage so I'm not even going to talk about it. Didn't even hold me long enough to finish it and thats coming from someone who's beat San Andreas and GTA 4 on every console and platform there is more than once.So we're talking about the online here. Still garbage. With all the updates they've pumped out its military t simulator everywhere we're talking about Grand theft AUTO. And they skipped right the over it. Pretty much the only vehicle you need is one of the flying bikes cause of how busted their movement is. I'm pretty sure the Oppressor 2.0 speed glitch is still in the game even though they patched out the Deluxo Reverso negative acceleration bug even though it wasn't broken cause you had to do it backwards. I miss the good ol days of blasting the Cucaracha car horn as you flew past a plane at mach speeds and sound very silly because of the Doppler Effect.But the AUTO part the most important part of the entire game the cars. They didn't give a flying about balancing any of the car classes. Theres a sports car thats faster than most of the super cars in the game. Thats ballistically dumb. Every sports car race theres absolutely no way to even compete unless you're in that car with custom vehicles on or off its just busted entirely. Most classes are somewhat like this with only 2 or 3 vehicles being remotely usable in a race with how upgrades work on cars. When you also get into a race if you don't have a custom car you basically lost. I do not know why Rockstar thought putting in a racing option the ability to put custom performance parts on your car and then be able to race other people in cars with no upgrades. Its entirely unbalanced in every sense of the word. Every car in a race should be upgraded automatically to max keeping separate your vanity upgrades as what you get in racing from owning the vehicle.The by far most important part of the game the cars they ed up ENTIRELY to just badger money out of you. And guess what it worked. Rockstar released this game once on consoles in 2013 and then 2 years later released it on PC because they knew that when they did this everyone was going to buy it a second time at full price so they could play it on an actual competent platform. And guess what they're doing with Red Dead Redemption 2?Most of these days lobbies consist of people grinding for cash one level 1 shows up messes with it so they get beaten up and then whine and complain about it. That or you'll get your beat by cheaters using invincibility and then they talk which is hilarious I to this day cant imagine how small their are to cheat in a game so obviously and then lie and brag about it. Something that I always take away from that is how overly ridiculously obsessively sweaty some people are in this game. The new flying bike is fast yes but it cannot for the life of it keep up with someone remotely competent in a good sports car around tight city streets. Most of the time when I hop on its just cruising around dodging death itself and laughing at its face as it whines about needing more vehicles with lock on homing rockets.I recomend looking into FiveM Project Homecoming or GTAWiseGuys' mods if you already own this game as they are some of the most fun and interesting parts of this game that I've played. As a matter of fact I think more people play the modded GTA V Roleplay than they do the online official multiplayer because of how poorly implemented it is and how great and in depth the mods are.TL DR Dont buy. Poor balancing issues bad story horrible online cruel and manipulative marketing strategies and an absolute lack of care for its community. Rockstar purely at its base core of business doesn't care about the consumer only the money that they get shoveled into their pockets from all the blind fan boys that weep whenever Rockstar down their throat with their new lies. Did I mention them trying to take away modded content because they knew mods would be more fun than the game they made themselves?

review: Where to start off? So i was really looking forward into this game after playing it for more than 300 hours on my xbox 360. After i seen no more updates were coming into the PS3 and X360 i decided to get it on PC. I cannot say anything bad about the optimization probably the best game out there when we talk about optimization.The game itself is amazing. Amazing details in all the aspects of the game amazing story sound gameplay(even tho gta v isn't trying to be realistic like gta 4) but we are going into the multiplayer part. Boy it's a mess. On the consoles i didn't have any problems because on the consoles you rarely meet any hacker or modder so it was an amazing experience as for multiplayer but on PC it's just bad. You thought that Valve's anti cheat is slow and sometimes useless? Ohh boy you didn't see Rock$tar's. With some luck i didn't get banned because of hackers or modders because they didnt throw money on me or something but they were ruining the game. Killing everybody spawning the most ridiculous and gigantic things and so on. I won't talk about the customer support because it's even more useless than the anti cheat. Also GTA Online became from a while a money maker for R*. The content is free in some way but is overpriced up to hell so you need to buy shark cards (ingame money) to gain those items. At this point R* are worse than EA.And we all know that Rock$tars scammed a lot of people in the Summer Sale of 2015 when they bundeled the game with shark cards so they can raise the price up to 80$/Euros so they can add a 25% of promotion just to sell the game at the normal full price of 60$/euros. Really silly move Rock$tar. Shame on you!At the current state i can recommend the game only for the story mode because it is amazing. But the online component is disease on the PC right now. I would suggest geting the game on consoles (PS4/XBONE) just because you won't get any hackers/modders and if you get you will get them VERY RARELY!EDIT Got banned for absolute no reason and my online account was reseted. Lost more than 400 hours (plus my time on consoles) of gameplay in online and lost an acocunt with lvl 200 and a lot of expensive stuff. Rockstars i just give you 10 out of 10 for banning me one person who did nothing wrong in online but all those cancerous hackers are still out there and you don't give a flying fu ck. This game is done for me i will never touch an online game from you ever again.

review: Grand Theft Auto V what can you say about it?The single player story is captivating with a lively cast that feel real that make you laugh that make you go WTF!Even if that's the only reason you pick it up it's worth the ride.. There's also side missions and some extra stuff to keep you busy.Multiplayer is another beast in it's own right customizing cars your characters buying homes and even a few more things with the additions of Motorcycle Clubs and Big Businesses.Even if you don't feel like doing all that GTAV and GTA O has to offer you can still run about and destroy the world until you're content.BUT WAIT! THERE'S MORE!MODS! Yes MODS!While Rockstar may not officially support or endorse their use they're still available for public consumption.This game is worth the retail price of $60USD you'll get what you spent on it very quickly.Be wary of the GTA Online community though..Most people suck and exist solely to ruin everything you've spent your in game cash on and delight in nothing more than watching you fail at everything you do..And some people actually help you teach you or just want to play a game with someone who's not on of the above.Either way.. Solid 10/10 for replayability content included and the Free LCs..

review: Since I'm very optemistic about this game owning this on PC is now my 4th purchase coming from console (X360/ PS3/ XONE) and now to this. My experience with this game has been really fun so far so very little to complain about. I wished I hadn't missed my opportunity to transfer my progress from the One to PC but unfortunately I did. I'm actually really content in starting over again knowing exactly what to do again and how fast it can be done. Can't speak too much about the bad and the ugly considering I've never been banned or suspended for any reason. I guess me sticking to my roots with playing with friends only despite me being anti social (most of the time players are not so kind so it's every reason I need to avoid them) I'd rather just focus on my own.Coming from console to my PC which is almost 4 years old I'm flabbergasted how well everything performs. Can't quite reach Ultra (2K 4K) settings but I can set it to high and achieve 30 60fps most times. My current specs are as follows Processor AMD A10 Quad Core 3.80GHz (4.20GHz Turbo Core) w/ AMD HD Dual GraphicsRAM 12GBVideo Card Nvidia GTX 750Ti 2GBHDD 1TBI'm really enjoying the smooth game play that is other wise really hard to control on console (not easy to aim and shoot from 1st person in car and on foot) so this is really a treat for me. As for mods I haven't tested it out yet (kind of burned out from doing the story mode twice) I'm kind of terrified my system will crash and burn lmao. Other than what I've already shared I understand why some may not recommend this game but from my sheer enjoyment I'll recommend it to myself lmao!

review: After playing through I can confidently say that this game is in my favorite Top 10 games of all time. Pros+ ( Story )+Great Characters+Good Personality+Big Map+Great Graphics+Solid Story+Funny Jokes/Easter Eggs+Great MissionsPros+ ( Online )+Tons of options to have fun+More Missions ( Heist CEO Motorcycle Club etc )+Very fun and hostile community+Can show your personality through your character+Tons of cars/houses+New content every few weeks will never make you feel that there is nothing to doCons ( Story ) SOME repetitive missions that get annoying ( this is only one or two missions ) Nothing ElseCons ( Online ) A hostile community can be a bad and good thing Hackers can ruin your experience time to timeConclusionGrand Theft Auto 5 was one of the first single player stories that I finished start to end. I loved this game so much that I've replayed the single player story over 3x. Great graphics great community and a overall great game!10/10 Would Recommend to any Gamer!

review: I have about 60 hours on steam and over 700 hours on console and I must say that i dont recommand you buy this gamePros You're able to play gta online with matesCons The campain is Bad compaired to the other gta games Travor is a quite annoying character Franklin is a generic gang banger that doesnt wanna live in the hood anymore or as he says it dont wanna live in da hood no more and micheal who is the only remotely interesting character is put off by having a disfunctional familyThe ending of the game is also awful you can either choose to kill travor micheal or happy happy ending. why is there no option to kill franklin is it because oh he is a black guy we cant kill the black guy. GTA online is an awful cashgrab Back when it was released it actually wasnt that bad cars werent that expensive and neither were the places to store your Cars But the longer the game went on the more expensive anything became You have the yachts that are absolutely useless and very expensive and the worst reality to realise is that in gta IV for 40 quid you could get 2 single player DLCs that gave you way over 20 hours of content to play through and in gta V for 40 quid you can get the T20 which is a single car in gta online. The recent updates have only ruined the game when looking at balance the updates are clearly designed to make the overpowered high level players more overpowered content (the explosive sniper shotgun and leaked explosive minigun). How are new players supposed to do anything when some could blow up anything they're driving in within a couple of shots from over a mile away. The best "recent" update imo still is the biker update it wasnt that expensive added a lot of fun bikes and gave you a way to make money and was accessible for both low and high level players. Rockstar itself is also a very scummy company when it comes to GTA V apperently Rockstar removes accounts of people that have been inactive for a long time. The microtransactions found in gtao are also awful for about 80 quid you can get 8 million ingame and anyone who has played this knows 8 million is all.

review: Despite its predecessor being a port of a console game this game has fared very well. If you don t know yet Grand Theft Auto V is pretty much the best game for any person (with friends) to have fun either online or not. Single player Grand Theft Auto V s single player has its flaws but I still though that it was a lot better than Grand Theft Auto IVs story. Unfortunately Rockstar doesn t update it as much as it does on Online so this game is more centered towards those who enjoy online. Despite that the single player is infinitely fun and definitely a time waster that coupled with mods is an amazing combination. Online Now obviously every online game has its hackers and its cancerous players so playing online with random players is going to be very hard. Seeing as many of the online players are either trollers or 12 year olds it s pretty hard to have any fun or make any friends online. The online portion gives you a lot of opportunity and a lot of jobs to do but then again you must have friends. You could own a company so you could be your very own Fatcat you can also own an MC and be your own president and with that comes many other jobs and missions. Heists are very fun but hard to play with randoms because I m pretty sure there s some quantum physics law that says one of the randoms has to be either or with a bad internet connection because it s absolutely impossible to be stable while on random. It s impossible to play more than one heist even if you re lucky to play one with randoms. So unless you have dedicated friends it ll be very hard for you to enjoy this game. Conclusion Amazing game to play with friends. I recommend this to anyone with some extra cash and a semi beefy computer.P.S. If you re cool you re invited to add me and play if you want!

Basic Scenario outside of GTA Online is fantastic and one of the most fun stories! Def recommend for Singleplayer or Multiplayer! In Online don't be too trusting. . xD And sometimes there ARE Modders that seem to get away with some exploits. It's usually not enough to be bothersome.

review: This is Rockstar's most ambitious title yet costing hundreds of millions in development and hundreds more in marketing. It delivers solidly on every aspect of it's promise and will go down in history as one of the finest games ever made as every previous edition of GTA has. Again amongst thousands of reviews there's little I can say here but to support and endorse the most positive opinions.The technical performance of this game is excellent.One critical note GTA Online is not compatible with mods and Rockstar have made it difficult to use mods and keep your account they ban anyone who uses any kind of mod from GTAV which is a negative consumer outcome they must address in future.Lack of support for Steam Workshop also makes modding the game difficult not that it even needs it but if you have a great game why not make it better?

review: Odlicna igra! Grafika je poboljsana u odnosu na proslu generaciju konzola ali nemojte se prevariti igrica na low settingu ne izgleda bolje od xbox 360 verzije. Vrhunski je optimizirana cak i na slabijim kompjuterima ocekujte da ce se vrtiti od 25 do 30 FPS a. Jedina nova stvar je prvo lice ali vrlo je tesko igrati u tom prvom licu kada se situacija "zakuha". Online je odlican ali po meni je podjednako zabavan kao i na xbox 360 ili ps3. Ako slucajno vec imate gta 5 na prosloj generaciji konzola i zelite kupiti i za pc a kompjuter vam nije "zvijer" onda vam toplo preporucujem da je ne kupite i da nastavite je igrati na vasim konzolama jer vjerujte da necete primjetiti ogromne razlike a ako vam je odlican pc i ako ste u mogucnosti da igru igrate na maksimalnim postavkama i da se vrti na 60+ FPS onda je svakako trebate kupiti.

review: This game we've been waiting a very long time but it had its sense. To be objective is not easy because everything has its pros and cons. First write a brief description and then reasons why you should buy the game or not. This game is very carefully created up to the smallest detail. The sophistication of the main menu settings audio graphics controlled the cameras aiming the weapons. The story is fun for dozens of hours. Furthermore are activities such as tennis golf darts racing in cars motorbikes boats collectibles mysteries and their solutions the maintenance of the purchased assets in the operation. People who don't play the game at all thought that I watch the film.Other studios currently look like small children before Mrs. teacher.The online part is huge which has a lifetime into the next part of GTA VI. PROS + Even Map editor worth that money+ Very well optimized game but can't recommend this game if you haven't min 1x 3GB VRAM for High settings+ Support the high resolution but the maximum settings Very High/Ultra 8xMSAA in 4K and +100 frames you will be able to enjoy up to with the next Pascal arch. of Nvidia graphic cards+ Almost perfect graphics their care very well act as cosiness household the architecture of the houses+ Finally the long story and the online part almost endless.+ Rockstar once again with the quality of its mockery of any current and future title and pushes the boundaries of possibility very far+ For your money you are buying a action game racing game flight simulator tennis simulator a golf simulator and a many others+ No DLC in addition to the On line Cash if you like+ I didn't notice any bugsCONS For three weeks I didn't sleep at all Currently the high price but the quality is paid Maybe High hardware requirements for some people because recommended specs are lies Many mysteries around the problem with the BAN system so don't mod the game with any FOV mod menu or another stuff while you playing on line The Difficulty of missions is too easy Cheaters but what could you expect I don't know any game with no cheaters.I wasn't a fan of the series GTA up until this part.I recommend just to buy. This game will retain a high price and so the wait is not worth it.

review: I REALLY would not recommend this game if you are playing it on a laptop. Unless you are willing to put in copious amounts of time into finding a fix that is temporary I would absolutely advise NOT to buy it. I've had trouble with Rockstar in the past. I spent roughly 5 hours trying to get GTA IV to run and it was so poorly optimized that it barely ran after the hours of trying to fix it. This will most likely be the last time I buy a Rockstar game. They had plenty of time to test their PC products and they still made it extremely tough to run. This is coming from a guy with a beast of a gaming laptop. Just do not buy this game.

review: Might be one of the best games ever made it doesn't hide the fact that it lives off it's past Glories.I still play it frequenly whenever a money grab update is in or a new free dlc comes up (or my wifi sucks and I'm force to play the singleplayer campaign for the 6th time now) but the grind is even worse than the price tags of everything in the game! you could buy an ugly bunker that looks like a pre carved penal drug den for 1mill but you could also spend your cash on a top secret militarry facility that looks awesome provides an entire questline can store a crapton of vehicles and looks like something out of an Avengers film. Also I could list off a few more downsides to the game like The community of 12 year olds and ugly cancerous "grown men" The gap between the poor and the rich the struggle to do something important without some jackass in a Hydra ruining you're efforts and the lack of content other than "Making money is the real gameplay" which is a pretty good title ruined by REWARDS AND EVEN IER PRICE TAGS.I actually like the game tbh but the way money works is dragging the poor to hell and driving the rich to hentai haven. I would give it a dislike for it's system and it's flaws but I cannot force myself to hate on something you worked hard for

review: GTA V the single player campaign is great while it lasts. GTA Online is also fun as long as you can deal with the cheaters and modders. I actually just stopped playing for a while out of frustration because there was a point when just about every other populated session I joined had a modder. Taking into account the high stakes risks you take for rewards on delivery missions it is no fun spending time loading your warehouse with $200 000+ worth of goods and starting the delivery mission to sell those goods just to have a hacker blow up your delivery vehicle(s) remotely just for the heck of it. Once I heard of the recent bans I started back playing and can say for the past 2 days maybe 6 hours or so of total play time I haven't come across anyone modding. I'm feeling safe for now. So as far as all of this recent negative backlash goes just keep in mind that at this point I find it unlikely in my opinion that Rockstar made a legitimate mistake. These people didn't get banned for no reason. Sessions are still very well populated. However I do wish Rockstar could be a little more transparent about how their banning system is working and why those people were banned.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: My most played game on my account 1.7K hours in it like wow I always was a GTA fan and I'm pretty sure this game is the superior version of everything I played before I can't tell you how much excited I was when I played firstly on my 360 but the was a long time ago and I'm happy that Rockstar relased this game for PC because it's not just optimized really well but feel upgraded now in 2018 it's just a little bit outdated but still this is the only game what holds this genre so well Rockstar really did made an awesome job with this the story the whole engine physics map atmosphere and game lenght and so much to play with the online is also revolutionary and also updated (even tho R* wants us to buy some Sharkcards) but I can't tell you how much I was shocked when modding are arrived and because of the popularity of the game there were so much things to mess around I loved it. Now I guess GTA just fell short on content but I'm not suprised it's 5 years after the original relase that's a long time to keep a game alive and there are still a lot of people playing and making videon about it on Youtube so if you can get it under 20 bucks I would say give it a go if you never tried it I'm just gonna give it a 10/10 not because it's perfect by any means but because it's got sooo much content to play bring and get in it that you will have a blast!

review: I'm Getting mad on bad reviews with low hour count on the game add mine with 2 600 from outside of steam. Anyway the game is great and has been since release something made me drop it for a while but its stil good. The singleplayer is great and the online mode works as you did expect. You will have lots of fun even if you play solo but with friends will make it much better. anyway the value of the ingame currency is low and you need to play alot or know how to earn money without cheating to get what you want anyway. I recommend people to play all the heist cause its an easyway to earn the money you need and by playing the event modes like (deadline) when it were active. Anyway the event modes will grant you twice as much money and rp. GTA Online do have some problems with modders/hackers which ruins the fun in most seasons. +Gameplay+entertaining+early/midgame+fun stuff+low learning curve+multiple modes+No need to buy DLC's or expanstions+Great graphics bad anti cheat system Some what expensive ingame items long time in loading screens somewhat bad optimized in town (often cause of high activity and high graphics)anyway in general its a most buy for the ones who want some fun with friends or solo if you want and it's great untli someone with mods explodes you up to the sky multiple times until you join another season.

review: Grand Theft Auto 5 is a really fun experience with tons to do. Story Mode has an amazing thrilling action and comedy filled plot set in a beautiful city. There are lots of characters to interact with and a big city to explore! You can do almsot anything. Rob Banks Steal Cars Kill Peeps. You can even steal aircrafts from the airport. Even though Story Mode is veryfun it doesn't end there. Their is also GTA Online. Online Mode is this huge mode where you are still in the big city of Los Santos but there are tons of players with you. You can do LOTS more in Online. Take place in theft missions with other players rule in deathmatches race cars. And you can even start a business and be a CEO fully dedicated to theft and makin' dem moneyz. But there are some stuff holding Grand Theft Auto 5 back. First the community is the definition of cancer. Hackers are raoming the streets all over the place trolls are getting ready to turn people mad and just straight up annoying people are just being F***ING ANNOYING AS SH**. Sorry if you take those as cuss words. I'm trying my best not to cuss too much. Getting off topic that community has come straight out of HELL. I've heard of bullies and squeakers. I'm starting to believe that their are even real criminals on that game. Oh I'm scared of that. I mean grand Theft Auto 5 is a game about Lying Stealing Killing and much more of that fun stuff but that's the virtual side of it. The community is the real side. Overall it's a really fun game with lots of potential. Also has a pretty good amount of depth. You can never get too much depth in a game. There is a good amount of cutomization in that game. Now I'm that type of guy that LOVES and I mean LOVES customization. I would even have sexual contact with customization. I just LOVE it!!! Now this is less of a complaint and more of a suggestion of some sort but APB Reloaded really makes me wish this game had that same customization. One thing I love about APB Reloaded is the customization. Oh so GOOD! Can't get enough of customization. Bujt Grand Theft Auto seemes like a good game to have a lot more customization. Just my personnal thoughts no hate no hate. Overall it an awesome game that deserves A LOT more love and support. But this is the reason why I wrote this review in the first place. I've seen lots of people with problems with the game. Story Mode not working no triggering of missions and all that. Lots of problems in the game. So here goes nothing. So I made serious progress in Grand Theft Auto 5 in about only a couple of hours and had a blast. I had autosave on and had all those missions saved. I quit Grand Theft Auto 5 to go to bed and the next morning I opened up GTA5 and all of my progress from yersterday was gone. The latest completed mission I had was the Daddy's Little Girl Mission but that was nowhere near yesterday's latest completed mission. I am SO off right now. WTH JUST HAPPENED???? I swear I had autosave on. I did!!! This is not cool and when I hound out that progress was gone I was SO TRIGGERED!!! Whoever is here please give me as much help as you can. I do NOT want to redo that progress. It's just too much. All the blood sweat and tears released to reach that point all wasted. Please help me!!! I still recommend this game IF you don't have the same problem as me. This is just NOT cool!!!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA Online s technical issues have finally fallen away to reveal a game that has its quirks but that offers an experience like nothing else out there right now harnessing the potential of open world multiplayer. The actual missions though get repetitive once you break rank 20 or so and there needs to be more here to keep people playing. Basic things like matchmaking and the in game economy meanwhile are now running smoothly but there s still room for improvement.GTA Online is good then properly great even when everything comes together but not as good as I suspect it s one day going to be.

review: I've waited a long time to try GTA V mainly because I was really disappointed with GTA 4 and I am disappointed again. Considering that GTA V cost like half a billion to make and a huge number of people love the online GTA V I'm shocked by my conclusion.Rockstar have gone back to the old San Andreas RPG style character stat improvement which is a plus in my book and at first I thought I was getting a story driven RPG like experience. The effort Rockstar have put into this is mindblowing with staggering attention to detail. The gameplay sucks in my opinion though. My thoughts over the first few hours were 'The combat is worse than Crackdown and even Saint's Row.''I like the driving especially in this car.''No daughter of mine is telling me what to do...oh WTH mission failed because I have to listen to this spoilt brat.''Why is this mission insisting I drive an ATV when I've got a perfectly good off road car already.''Ha Ha Ha Rockstar is taking the mickey out of Facebook for whoring out folks data.''Wait Rockstar want me to have a data slurping app on my phone just so I can train a dog...Hypocritical or what!.''I had a full arsenal but for this mission I can only use this pea shooter lame.''I am not having fun.''The controller is mapped really unique fashion 'B' for reload I've never come across that before.''I am bored.''I am out.'The story seems strong but it isn't enough to keep me interested when I'm not enjoying the combat at all. That said if you enjoyed GTA 4 then you'll probably enjoy GTA V and I wouldn't fault anyone for that I just got bored of cover based shooting like ten years ago. I've not tried the GTA V online wasn't interested in it anyway.

The people that you see whining about the ban system are the kind of people who are 12 and get salty when rockstar punishes them for cheating or taking handouts from cheaters (money drops etc.) but if you want to know a quick little secret even though this shouldnt be a secret don't cheat and dont ask for handouts from cheaters. Rockstar's cheat detection isn't perfect but it's better than VAC (CSGO specifically) at a minimum and you can always join a different lobby if someone is being a same goes for if you find yourself in a modded lobby. Primaraly though use common sense and you should be fine.

review: The game is 10/10 in my book... but the community gets like 6/10 cuz there are modders everywhere giving money to people... Im here trying to get stuff legit but everyone else are getting modders money... I sometimes just feel like just stopping and get modders money (but I don't want to be banned) everything that involves getting money require either 4 friends that are online and a friendly lobby and like 4 hours of time. If u want to make money not insanly slow. And the game is getting ridiculus cars now. A motorcycle that can fly and shoot rockets a car with a machine gun on top (that the driver can control) and a fkn truck that has 3 or 4 turrets that other players in the back control (explosive bullets ofc) and it has a 1 car garage. no new appartments or features.. this game would get a much higher rating if they just lower the prices on the cars and the good stuff or atleast lower cooldowns and production on the various buisnesses that you can own and manage. But despite all of this I give the game a good rating because its a really great place to find new friends and I think its alot funnier to play with friends cuz u always have something to do and in a good game you should always have something to do. But getting money in the start is slow. some tips ) Get 200k by doing jobs and heistsetups which u can find in the job list in your phone ) buy a HIGH END apartment for 200k Do heists in your heist room in your apartment. (host them) u get paid alot more then Get 1 mil doing heists buy the cheapest office for 1 mil Do vip work and heists and get 1 5mil buy the cheapest VEHICLE werehouse (only sell top range cars) you will know what I mean when you get the werehouse. If you sell 1 top range car u will get 100k Get 200k and buy a mc club clubhouse get 1mil and get a cocain lockup then you should be set... Do alot of car selling ( the best income btw ) buy more lockups (you can only have 1 lockup per product) for extra income.have a nice day )
