review: Product received for free. ShortlySit down as I tell you a story about GTAO my first session.My first session was full of little children hurling playground insults at each other and killing each other. Already in the plane screen there were kids who couldn't even write properly. My ears are still bleeding from their voices. I got caught in the crossfire because I just waltzed through with some stolen car.They had stuff like a gun with explosive bullets a goddamn MINIGUN? RPGs and stuff. This is ridiculous. So this is my first session it's supposed to be a legendary experience.But no it's just children hurling playground insults at each other and running to mommy because other players don't play by THEIR rules. Then they go pick on lowlevel players because mommy was speaking on phone with this mysterious "Matthew" even though she's married to Jonathan. Then some guy dressed as a clown came to me and gave me money. I think it's a cheater or something.I ran away someone killed me and someone else came and started killing him and told me to run away. Okay.GTAO is truly a playground full of toxic children.GraphicsThey look good I guess when you don't have CONSTANT STUTTERING and low quality PS1 era textures everywhere.GameplayPlease do not play GTA Online. I looked at the prices for the many cars ingame and they had like way too high prices. I did a google and apparently you don't get much money from like anything. Now Story Mode is a different matter. I googled that thing and it's apparently great and has received praise.UpdatesLook I just googled all of this since I don't want to waste my time with this "game".The game is getting updates but I'm not sure about their quality.I'm gonna lean on the Bad Quality side since I hate this game already.CommunityAs described in Shortly GTA Online is a playground full of children hurling insults at each other and picking on each other.The children that've been playing on the playground for longer have better stuff the newcomers are defenseless unless there's a guardian angel guarding people and telling them to run away.This community is awfully and WORRYINGLY toxic. COD is nothing when compared to this "game" on the toxicity scale.CheatersIf I ever play this game I am most likely either 1. playing singleplayer or 2. playing casually with a mod menu.Again a quick google resulted in thousands of threads complaining about cheaters.SoundtrackI listened to some of the music and some of it was actually great.GTA V gets a pass on that.In a NutshellThere won't be no nutshell because you shouldn't buy this "game" and if I'd make a nutshell of this game I'd go insane! insane laughingRating Final Conclusion0/10. If you buy it buy it only for the singleplayer and even then you should not. Online is a big no no.I've been wanting to play this game for years but now that I finally have played it...it sucks. I never thought I'd say this but CS GO is better than this "game".Knowing that there is corporate greed worse than EA makes me want to cancel my 7 day trial to breathe oxygen.GTA V is my eventual descent to insanity.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Rockstar really hit the mark with this release. We all know it's a good game from the previous releases but the performance and optomization are excellent from the PC release. Game runs like butter with every setting maxed on a 770 4Gb. That's pretty damn impressive for a game that looks this good.What surprised me more is that Online worked (nearly) flawlessly from the moment of release. As soon as the game onlocked myself and 6 friends jumped on and played for several hours with zero connectivety problems. There was an issue of traffic spawning inside of eachother and making the game lag a little bit it was minor and we only encountered it a few times.9/10 release. Would recommend.

review: The most dissapointing game I've ever played. Wow this is ing terrible. Remember when we all thought GTA 4 took itself to seriously? Remember when we thought it's story was overblown it's gameplay was janky it's characters lackluster and it's lack of fun? Well rockstar has done it again. And this time it's WORSE.So let's start with free roam.You can't free roam.Why? here's why. Because the player is weak.In GTA 5 the ammount of bullets it takes to blow out a car's tires is decreased and the duribility of the cars is decreased. It's also harder to obtain cars. So if you like me wanted to walk out side cap some dumb prick steal his ride and go on a 20 minute joyride with sirens and gunshots as your soundtrack you can't because the cops will shoot out your tires and your car will become worthless quite fast.The cops themselves have also had a major ( ) buff increasing their dammage and accuracy. A cop will now be able to headshot you (And it is ALLWAYS a headshot) for an instant kill from any range at any speed within their car. You can be doing 70 on the highway in a stollen NOOSE van and be instantly felled by a default first responderYour player is weak in terms of duribility too. You have half the health you had in GTA 4 which was half that it was in GTA 3... If this keeps up by GTA 6 a fart will kill us. And as mentioned before the cops are DEADLY accurate so you can literally walk outside steal a car and be dead within 6 seconds. I'm serious. Your weapons are largely useless. Ammo is less plentiful has a lower cap is more expensive and your guns are weaker than they used to be... So while that cop will insta kill you you'll be hosing down his cruiser with a machine gun and not score any hits.Also if you decide to go with a motorcycle you will fall off. And once you fall off your character takes about 2 millenia to get up. So you get zerg rushed by 60 cops and killed within 4 seconds.Now for story.The story is... Bad. Trevor is completely unlikeable Franklin is bacically a cardboard cutout and michael while the best of the characters is a sucker of the finest degree. You'll play througout the entire story constantly thinking "why can't I just ing shoot this guy/why can't I just ing do this job/ why can't my character do anything except swallow police ." The reason is because rockstar can't ing write well. The story is a complete mess and I will NOT write any further about it because it makes my head hurt...Which isn't even getting into the glitches.In short this game can only be saved by the modding communtiy. The only way which I could EVER reccomend this game is if rockstar were to seriously buff the player put the game on sale and provide regenerating health. Then it would finally become fun. Until then all I can say is Nexus community GTA garage the guys who did the SA multiplayer mod ing SOMEONE save this t I paid 60 bucks and got NOTHING for it.

review: Doesn't really add anything new to GTA4 other than a different location and characters the actual underlying game engine is arguably worse.You can't set the view distance anymore. (huge plus on GTA4 with a decent PC)Turn around for a moment and everything you've destroyed is gone and fixed back up again.Still doesn't have proper support for add on mods.Police don't care if you blaze past them at 1000mph.My saitek game controller didn't work with it seems to want an xbox controller and you can't really customise the layout.Why are the rockets from the RPG so unrealistically slow.Helicopters are never ending I you not they come in pairs and as soon as you've downed them 2 more come along I must have shot down 50 in a row. I like to cheat offline I'm not much of a online gamer so I can't comment on it's online gameplay but offline I just like to destroy stuff and go on a rampage in general that you can do but the constant helicopters kinda ruins it.You can't get inside many buildings I mean less than in GTA4. Even the hospitals and clucking bells are inaccessible now.In all I'll say this is a lazy console port that should have come a lot sooner.If you haven't bought it yet don't bother get GTA 4 and some of the various mods.

review: Worth it for the story mode. Really fun and immersive.But dear holy good lord god almighty above the ONLINE. IS. TERRIBLE.Ungodly load times. Ungodly lobby waiting times. Confusing controls and crappy UI. SO MUCH ! #$% on the minimap so many text messages and popups but literally NO explanation for any of it. Why should I buy a property? Who is inviting me to a motorcycle club and why would I join one? Where the F do I find a "capture hold mission"? Where is the interaction menu? What does a CEO do? Is the office worth it? Or the clubhouse? What are these random red events flying around the map?You have to rely on the wiki for everything.Survive the load times and miraculously find players to join the game you want to play? 99% chance two of them will drop out (they probably left their computer 20 minutes ago) leaving you to play 8 ten minute rounds of a 3v1 or leave and suffer a "bad sport" penalty (again no explanation what that is or how I can view it)... So I choose the penalty and wait an hour to load into open word mode and instantly get run over by a guy in a car will never be able to afford.I just want to make money and buy cool and around in the city why is that so hard?DO NOT BUY FOR ONLINE

review: &gt Buys GTA V&gt Waits about 5 hours to install &amp download&gt Joins a lobby on GTA Online&gt Gets killed by 5 guys for no reason&gt Destroyes their car by mistake&gt Gets put into bad sport lobby&gt Meets 3 cheaters every game and atleast half the server is screaming to him for free money&gt Cheater explodes every car on the server&gt Everyone dies and loses their un insured cars&gt Leaves bad sport after a few hours&gt Joins a clean lobby&gt 7 year olds screaming at eachother how they eachother's mum&gt Cheater joins and gives everyone every weapon in the game + spawns money on everyone on the server&gt Cheater leaves10/10 would play again.But seriously. Rockstar NEEDS to do something about the anti cheat because literally EVERY server i join with more than 10 people has atleast a cheater and half the server screaming for free money.The game is awesome and i love. I'd play it all day. But DON'T buy it unless you have friends to play with because everytime you'll join a new sessions there will be atleast 1 cheater spawning things on you. Well unless you like having 10000mil money in the first 10 minutes of the game and have every weapon even those you barely get 10 bullets for in a the singleplayer campaign and you can't even buy it in multiplayer.IF rockstar will solve the cheater issue i'll modify this review.I'd give this game a 9.5/10 for gameplay........and a 1.5/10 for the community which plays this gameOverall review 6/10 (barely reccomendable if you don't have friends to play with very much recommended if you have someone to play with or just want the singleplayer)

Its a good story has several plot twists great character development.. But the multiplayer has gotten worse. Not enough nice people play this game anymore so now its a lot of overpopulated servers filled with mexicans that try to kill everybody.. Usually they are about rank 300. I got in today and instantly got spawnkilled for about 5 minutes until i was able to escape.. I then got killed more and more so it wasnt fun.. If you were to get this game you need at least 3 or 4 friends to play in private lobbies. Otherwise get the game for the singleplayer.. dont bother with multiplayer.

review: The most outrageous game in so many ways! Forget politically correct this game is the exact opposite and if you are a SJW or easily triggered individual I would stay away. GTA5 is equally offensive to races religions ethnicities and most everyone who plays. That is what makes it such a great immensely funny game to play. The game itself is stunning if your PC can handle it. I dare say the world map of SA is the greatest multiplay map ever created. It is so intricate that after 500+ hours I find new places and things everytime I play. The level of detail is truly epic. I cannot even really describe all the stuff you can do. tennis golf darts parachuting bike motorcycle car racing stunts own apartments garages business space airplanes jets helicopters boats jetski's atv's shooting ranges and we are not even discussing missions heists crates resupplys and literally a 100 other activities. Did I mention you can steal cars too? It is a daunting game to learn to play. Just the keymapping for PC players will keep you busy for awhile tweaking and finding your style and needs. I suggest playing the single player mode to get a feel for the game. The voice acting plot and gameplay are the gold standard in RPG 1st/3rd person gaming. This is not some little slap together game. Rockstar had GTA4 to build upon and even it stands the test of time. So if you are not easily offended and want to play arguably the best most famous game franchise in the world you cannnot miss GTA5.

review: If you want GTA for the online features just buy it on console. I was going into story mode to mess about with a Flash mod but as soon as Franklin appeared on the screen the loading circle appeared in the bottom right and "Loading Online" appeared. About 2 seconds later Rockstar's trigger happy ban bot detects the mod and the menu that is used to control it and suspends my online account and deletes my character. When I finally get back online I start doing free roam missions and other things to get cash and level up. I go back on to check out the After Hours DLC two days later (25 July) and a message pops up "You have been banned from playing GTA Online permenantly please return to Story Mode". Untill this everything was going well apart from the very unstable servers. I would recommend this game... on console.

review: So i've been playing this game for a while now not just 50 hours like it says on my profile i've been playing since the launch on Xbox 360. The game has a great story best one so far if you ask me I have not completed the story on pc barely touched it but I did complete it on Xbox 360 and it was great. On pc there has been some additions I believe like the ability to become an animal by drinking an unknown formula and also some known bugs has been fixed I believe. Aside from the story there's the online mode which allows you to experience Gta 5 with your friends this is not the storymode tho here you are free to take whatever path you desire. When I returned from Xbox 360 to PC rockstar had removed the funtion to sync characters 1 month before I got it for pc so I had to start over in gta online if you are a returning player I advice you to concider if you really want to start over before buying it for pc.Gta online is very pay to win if you ask me but not nearly as pay to win as it used to be back on xbox 360 you earned very small amounts of money so u had no other choice than to pay to win. Example you want a car that costs $2000000 but you only earn $16000 per mission. These days you can either pay or play the game. Example You still want that car that costs $2000000 but now on pc you can do heists (which you could at the end of xbox 360 to but not at the start) and earn up to $300000 per heist but you can also do ceo missions and collect stock up to $1000000 per full stock. Gta online is extremelly fun and I recommend trying it out alot!

review: This man speaks the truth XxAarchangeLxXAvatar 0 https //support.rockstargames.com/hc/en us/community/posts/115008468388 GTA V Online Is DEAD GTA V Online Is DEAD.As we all are greatly aware of this game has a bunch of problems. From simple clothing pieces not working to full blown bull crap about the overly armored APC and Homing Launcher being garbage we still expect Rockstar to fix this game. I'm here to outline that this will NOT happen.I'm sure they will do some maintenance to things that are relatively easy for them usually fixing irrelevant issues or blatantly fixing things that we SHOULD be able to do such as wearing a mask with a helmet. But we now live in the time where GTA V as a game has run its course. I'll be outlining reasons why. FUNDING The first thing putting the nails in the coffin for GTA is finding. They have to pay people to fix the issues that arise and this budget is getting smaller every day. Thus only the absolute most game breaking issues and more importantly (to them) any issue where GTA$ is too easy to obtain will be snuffed out. Anything else thats an issue is moot.PRICES/ SHARK CARDS The price for Shark Cards has gone up as Rockstar is seemingly planning to milk its player base for every penny they can until the coffin is buried. As such they have greatly increased the cost of any new items in the game. The new Gun Runners APC costs around $4 000 000 GTA$ the equivalent to literally $80 USD. The conversion rate is $1 USD / 50 000 GTA$. Yes every MC or CEO mission getting you 20 000 GTA$ is Rockstar giving you $0.33 for wasting 15 minuets of your time. We are nothing but stupid cattle to milk to them it seems.HORRIBLE TECH SUPPORT If you have an issue with the game be wary about weather you choose to contact Rockstar. If it is even remotely related to GTA$ they will make sure you don't break even if anything at all. If your car disappears from your garage though it has literally no legit reason to be gone you'll receive HALF of its worth. Because it's not worth their time to see if your telling the truth they assume you're lying and give you what you'd get at LS Customs. If you want an in game purchase refunded no. NO. NEVER. You'll never get it.NOTHING GOOD TO OFFER Every week or two Rockstar will pull some new game mode and some new items out of a hat (full of modes and items already developed long ago stockpiled and released on an as needed basis mind you) and slap it with the "X2 GTA$ &amp XP" label. This is only to keep the player base moderately interested. But its always the same. A new car. A couple new cars for two months then maybe a decent wallet sucking update that you need to have or everyone else will roll over you in Freemode. (APCs and explosive rounds anyone?)REFUSING TO LISTEN TO PLAYERS Easily one of the #1 things that makes a good developer is one who can watch some videos and read some forums and say "Hmm. People would like THIS or they want THAT fixed." But Rockstar is run my idiots in suits who care about nothing but profit so its "Here's your deadline to slap something moderately acceptable together to make money off of." And to hell with effort.RED DEAD REDEMPTION 2 The biggest main reason. Not to say the game itself won't be good but it is what is taking most of Rockstar's funding team and interest right now. Within the next year support and updates for GTA V Online will become stagnant and will halt. The game will be placed into an "As Is" state for players to play in. But don't worry! Rockstar will still gladly ram their Shark Card ads up your until they shut down the servers upon the release of GTA 6.MODDED ACCOUNTS Because of the terrible declining and inevitable end of Rockstar's support of GTA V Online the Modded Accounts will take over. Find a website pay $20 and get a new PSN With a level 8000 character with 900 000 000 GTA$ to spend that is completely undetectable by the "top notch well trained" members of the Rockstar Support Team. I know of several Modded Account users who have been around since the first month of release on PS3 who Rockstar still hasn't banned. But it doesn't end there.HACKERS The hackers are next. The ones who re write the code to give themselves abilities to become God's in GTA V. Most of witch are Trolls who will abuse everyone in a lobby or lure idiots with "cash drops" and make them do stupid nonsense only to get blown up and disconnected from the game. Then when a normal player does advance all it takes is to off the wrong Hacker and you get reset to lvl 1. Maybe forever. Go play some GTA 4 on any console if you want to see what this looks like. So there you have it. If you have any issues with GTA V your best bet is to submit it to your nearest toilet then go sit by a window to see if you can catch the flying *** Rockstar sends your way. But don't forget to spend all your GTA$ then grind for hours in X2 GTA$ modes only to get annoyed with wasting your time and either buying a Shark Card or a Modded Account so that you can actually enjoy the game.Or just a thought find a game with a developer who's not an incompetent money vampire.

review: Grand Theft Auto VSo how do i start with this. After playing this game on a Playstation 3 and now PC i can tell it one of the must have games for console and PC players. The game is just wonderful in all sorts of things but my absolute favourite thing about this game is "GTA Online" Sure it can be abit grindy getting cash but atleast its fun in the end and if you got friends to play with even better.The CampaignThe campaign is one of the best written campaign in a very long time. You start of in the middle of a heist in a introduction only zone which involved three characters pullling of a heist. Theese are the three main characters you will be able to switch between later in the game.We first got Lamarr which is the more "hood" character of the three he lives in a very getto like place and loves sportcars Then we got Michael probably the most normal of the three he has a family of a single wife and two kids. And the third character "Trevor" is the most crazy of the three i won't spoil him to much since he is quite the interesting character. I won't tell much more i don't want to spoil this game to much for anyone thinking about picking it up.GTA OnlineThis is quite along thing to write about but i will try to keep it short. So basically when starting of GTA Online you will be granted a character customization menu where you can change gender face hair and starting clothes. Keep in mind to change your appearance only face wise not gender wise it will set you back 100 000 in game dollars. So make your character good. As soon as this is done you will be prompted into a few tutorials about GTA Online. But it is really simple you do jobs such as races or heists to get more money with this money you can then buy lots of things such as but not limited to Clothes Cars Houses Heist Setups Weapons Modify vehicles and much more. But some of theese things such as modifying cars will set you back alot of in game dollars depending on the upgrades. But then the second thing about GTA Online is the level system. After completing a job or an activity in game you will get "RP" which is basically XP. With each few levels you will unlock new things for purchase such as weapon skins clothes vehicle modifications and a bunch more.I'll round this review off here hope you found this useful and get this game if you are thinking about it you will not regret it.

review: Do not buy this game. It has reached a point where it just milks more and more money out of you for useless content. well it's useful. but what would you rather have? 40$ in hand or a flying motorbike in gta?Another thing is that Sucks with the game is that both Rockstar and Take 2 (publisher/R* owner) has time and time again been proved to be VERY lazy with content and straight up anti consumer. "oh you wanted a veichle all along? well have a car with a gun".Point two of lazyness and anti consumer. Open IV a program that came into existanceat the time of GTA 4 as a tool for modding singleplayer content in GTA 5 it has since been modified to work on GTA 5 and Max Payne 3. Take 2 saw that Open IV which is the primary modding tool of GTA 5 which had been around since GTA 4 were cutting into their profits through making it so people could have more fun in singleplayer mods based in open IV has been publicy promoted by rockstar btw. Take 2 saw that and didn't llike that so they sent a Cease and desist to the devs to kill open IV They argued that open IV could be used to mod multiplayer despite it hindering you from doing so. TLDR Take 2 took down a modding tool which was used be everyone to mod their offline game controversy they let it go.If you just want to play it I'm not going to stop you but GTA5 isn't worth even 30$ anymore you're essentially buying a mobile game (online mode) with plenty of rip off microtransactions which just happens to have a story mode attached. The story mode (offline) is definitely worth something more then a mobile game but the online mode is an endless grind unless you buy a shark (scam) card. seriously 100$ for 8 million in game and you barely get anything for it. If you only want to play the Story mode which I add is really good just pirate it. no extra content has been released for the story mode since the Ill gotten gains update in 2015 so most likely wherever you torrent it you will get the full experience.

review: GTA 5 is a game I have to say is the most bought game in the history of me video gaming. I can easily say I bought this game probably 8 times tops. Most was from buying and selling the PS3 version. The PC version is the same as the console versions but a little bit better. My review will be broken into two sections the single player storyline mode and and GTA Online the multiplayer mode that should be the landscape for American open world games like this.Single player story mode It's the same as the console version so I basically didn't bother to play the PC version. The story is decent as you can take the role of 3 different characters and jump into that character at anytime. There are plenty of missions and lot to do and you will enjoy hours trying to complete everything even after the main story ends.GTA Online This mode is in a league of it's own and with some more time and patience GTA Online can be even greater. Once you get your rank up and start completing heists you will have a garage full of luxury cars motorcycles private jets boats and a high end apartment fairly quickly. The thing is once you complete all the heists either in a crew or as the leader the game gets boring fast. I mean sure you got other modes like Deathmatch Survival Races and other missions but it doesn't feel the same after the heists are done and you bought everything you wanted. You can replay heists but I mean who wants to do that? Yeah it gets boring and repetitive after the heists are done because it seems you're not making any progress other then getting RP to rank up. In conclusion for what it's worth it's definitely a game worth investing your money into and Rockstar should definatly give GTA Online an expansion. More heists and better cribs not just high end apartments. Mansions lofts houses and condos would be nice. Also it would be cool if you had the option to decorate your crib instead of having everything pre made by Rockstar. Also having options to invest your money online instead of offline would be cool but I guess GTA 6 will have all that.Overall 8 out of 10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: A fastistic game that is truly the pinnacle acheivement for the GTA franchise! 60 80 hours of gameplay for the single player game at a normal pace.It's sad that the reviews are so mixed right now... The awesomeness of the single player campaign is being clouded by too many people getting all pissy because of the multiplayer issues. From what I read there's lots of issues with cheaters and unfair banning in the multiplayer scene.But you know this is Grand Theft Auto a game that has never been one for being associated as being a multiplayer title. This franchise has always stood out as a fantastic single player experiance and I think that's how you have to go into this game.If you're looking for a multiplayer GTA? Wait for 6 this was their first real attempt at it and they have a lot to learn from it. They've completly nailed single player at this point so the next frontier is really improving their MP campaignBottom line GET THIS GAME! It's totally worth the full retail price considering how amazing the game is and the massive amount of hours of gameplay you can get. But get it for the single player campaign ONLY and consider the MP a bonus for a few hours of extra entertainment when you're done. If you do that you'll be happy with this purchase.

review: Thoroughly enjoyable not without it's bugs and problems such as texture pop in and the less than often jagged mouse control. Runs well at maximum settings on my 3770k+16gb+GTX670 OC'd. Multiplayer is addictive and very enjoyable with the right people. I've found more fun out of carrying a friend on a BMX on my hydra as far as possible. However I have had repeated issues with singleplayer data glitching and progress being reset in order to allow the game to remember settings. If you're looking for an enjoyable experience in an open world both singleplayer and multiplayer and enjoy grinding for luxuries it would be well worth taking a look at GTA V.

review: The online experience is bad. This game had the biggest budget of any onther game it has one of the largest dev team has been out for six years and STILL has a lot of flaws. The menu system is horrible you waste a ton of time waiting and there are too much avoidable loading screens (clouds). Chrashes are still frequent too. It is the little things that make this game objectively BAD. examples When one person does chrash playing anything co op all the other players are ed too all progress gets wiped from that mission. When finishing a setup for a heist you cant directly continue (which you'd want ofc) but everyone gets kicked into freeroam (another 2 min loading) the leader has to go back to his apartment and then as icing on the cake you risk not getting a spot in the lobby as a member. There are more examples but ill stop.All of this is stupid and unavoidable and RS has no excuse for any of this or for regular chrashes. And i didnt even talk about how screwed up the economy is.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So its about the time I give one of the best games of all time (in my opinion) a PROPER review for the game I have the most hours in. It beaten GMod in terms of hours. JeSus christ i have 500+ hours on this game. That's half a thousand hours.I am a level 131 with alot of things. I own every single gun and I own the best cars fully tuned. I own all properties (apart from the yacht). I REALLY enjoy this game.Scroll down for TL DR!Grand Theft Auto V (abreviated as GTA 5) is a game where you're a criminal you have a gun you kill people killing people feels good you rob a store it goes wrong end up at a hospital types of game essentially what I called a open world crime shooter.But this series has always been the grand father of this kind of series so it exels at it making a normally boring situation in real life like driving at slow speeds in heavy trafic funny as hell with funny dialogue from the people in the car and the ads on the radio. And sometimes a random firefight will start out because a random NPC got bored.So lets talk about the driving and I got a slight point to make about the driving.GTA has always had arcady driving but GTA IV (GTA 4) ruined that by making the cars feel heavy which is a nice thing but it seems to have made everyone forget the original driving of GTA. Fast and arcady.So with the arcade mind style the driving is great its not too hard to control but not too easy.However the vehiculs have weight and it still reminds you that a truck isnt gonna turn instantly theres still some bits of realistic driving that rarely kick in but those are usually when you wanna play the game as a normal person not a psycopath that can carry a minigun and a rocket launcher in his backpocket like it was nothing.The shooting is awesome Its like Max Payne 3 but less gory.Also unlike previous GTA games theres this infinite pocket system to re iterate once you buy a gun from the same type (i.e 2 assault rifles) you keep both instead of dropping the one you had. Its a nice touch and allows you to switch playstyles quickly.There's a nice selection of weapons and there are many guns of the same type. If I remember correctly there are (Counting the online only weapons)14 pistols12 SMGS / LMGS8 ARs / Assault Rifles5 Sniper Rifles18 Melee Weapons7 Heavy Weapons7 Explosives Next up the world.In my opinion this IS the best part of Grand Theft Auto exploring the open world.GTA 5 is located in the fictionnal city of Los Santos a parody of Los Angles in the fictionnal state of San Andreas which is the name of a previous GTA game and a parody of California.Now what makes this world so fun to be in is that it feels alive. If you go in the forest you can hear the sound of distant bikes and the sounds of the local wildlife like wolves and deers.Or if your in the city you're gonna hear the noises of the people around you drinking a coffee maybe talking about that one time where they hit a dog or talking to a female hoping they can get in the girls pants but miserably failing.And did I say the world is HUGE? There's a ocean lakes forests a desert villages. a city abandonned buildings etc. A few days ago I even found locations I didn't even know they were there. There's alot of locations that can make a unscripted police chase feel like a scripted police chase (in a good way). When running from the cops there are so many locations to drive through to lose them or places to hide in. Did I mention there's an entire sewer system under Los Santos?And for the last few things for single player there are mods. I don't really know how to mod the game as I think the game is fantastic as it is already but all I know is that you need a program called OpenIV and a thing called scripthook. And pretty sure you gotta backup your files and stuff incase there's an update. If you don't enjoy a broken scripthookAnd now for a part of GTA where some people enjoy like me myths.GTA pleases original bigfoot hunters from the san andreas days but I wont talk much on it.And now for the infamous Online mode.To be honest its not as bad as everyone thinks well in my opinion.You start off as a person who just arrived in Los Santos (your own character mind you but hes silent so....) and talking to Lamar another resident in Los Santos as he picks you up at the airport he gives you a gun and you get the option to do the tutorial or not.From here you make your own story.From being a hobo on the street to being a criminal mastermind owning illegal buisnesses there's alot of stuff to do in GTA Online.And there are where the issues kick in.To do buisnesses and stuff you need money alot of money we're talking about a million dollars here.You need money to stuff.The missions get a little repetive when you done them all.But luckily for you there's heists which were introduced in the Heists DLC where you need money to host them as you need a high end apartment to start one and one apartment like that costs 215000$. Making that kind of money at level 15 will take a while.But another thing ya need money to make money and that money you lose but that lost money makes you profit. Yeah its pretty weird.It's essentially a GTA MMO.But even from that I still enjoy it it still fun. Well I enjoy ALOT. More playtime is in the online mode then in the single player. It's not the single player is bad its great. Its just that I don't enjoy collecting stuff for too long so 100% this game will be pretty hard for me.EDIT I forgot there's 2 challenges that a new player can do to earn 250k each. Again if you really can't do money that well go on the GTA Online discord and go on #lfg pc and look for someone hosting Act 2 of Doomsday.But really you should think of the online as a bonus thing to do you should not buy the game for JUST the online the fun can be endless yes but thats depending on you. Spend your 30$ expecting a great single player with multi player as a side mode not as a thing your forced to do. Think of the online as a bonus game.But depending on your likes Online is fun as hell. about 450 hours of this game is online.TL DR Freaking awesome game online rough around the edges but its still awesome. Buy it for the single player not the online. Think of the online as a bonus game. Just buy it already its 30$ and 15$ on sale Single player 10/10Online 8.7/10

Their recently update to remove single player modding took a huge backlash I never used single player mods so I dont have any say in that. But I do believe players should have the opputunity to mod their single player games as long as it dont affect others in online. Ignore the negative views as those are people over this single player modding thing.

review: 10/10 BEST GAME BEST GAMEThis is not a game for 12 year olds so parents don't give your child access to your credit card and steam because they'll ruin another community (that is if this one isn't ruined already P)But aside from that this game is pretty fun! Me and my friends play together on online and we recently did some of the heists. In fact We're almost done with completing all of them. Plus Rockstar recently added stunt races so those have been fun as well. Note though that this game isn't for the feint hearted due to mass robberies and murder and manslaughter that happens in the game ) Graphics are pretty legit but you need a good machine to run it at reasonable speed. I have a decent gaming computer (Custom built) and i run it at 30 60 fps. So if you're wanting to run it off your mom's laptop unless she has an alienware or somethin Don't count on playing it at a good speed.All in all this is a pretty fun game that me and my friends like to play a LOTI give this 10 committed in game crimes out of 10.

review: Gta 5 easily lives up to the franchise's legacy of story rich immersive sandbox single player and improves upon its predecessors in an way we should almost expect from Rockstar forever. I have only two negative things to say. context I played through story on ps4 years ago recently bought for PC 1. I didn't enjoy EVERY mission in the story mode but there was certainly one I can single out for being my least favorite the yoga mission. Yep spoiler no alerts because this mission is painstaking unavoidable and impossible to play with the standard game audio because of the yoga instructor and the frequent robotic new age comments over and over. I "get it" but I hate playing it. On the other hand Rockstar gave us mission replay. 2. Online banwaves and cheaters I played for a full 15 hours of GTA Online PC before I was given a 1 month ban for no reason. I'm sure people reading this will say "cheater deserves ban" but my suspension was rescinded 4 5 days after submitting a Rockstar Support ticket and the contents of my account were not reset. I am still able to play unhindered by bans at this very moment but I was very frustrated because I witnessed alot of cheaters was killed by them and had large objects like a UFO attached to my player forcing me to relog yet somehow the anti cheat selected me. I am now finding Youtube videos popping up about Massive Banwave that caused similar experiences for many other legitimate players. I did some research during my suspension to try to figure out how I triggered the mindless anti cheat and found that I had services running for many programs which were not allowed along side gta online such as Skype Bandicam TS/Discord etc. I feel like Rockstar has missed the mark with their vague TOS which prohibits "...anything that interferes with player experience" which arguably could be any of the content we all enjoy and purchased the game for. I clearly understand the cheating is a problem but GTA Online has been out for years now and its still experiencing technical and support issues not even having allowed more than the original 32 players per lobby. Its not THAT bad you can "Find New Session" if your lobby is boring. 3. Months later UPDATE* I am still unbanned and playing GTA online on a near daily basis even after purchasing all of the in game properties I wished to own. There's still cheaters galore just like any other game with an economy or guns ... Still extremely satisfied to own I can't think of a single better all around PC game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Zero innovation!GTA 5 ... What an awful game it is! The gameplay offers nothing new compared to former GTA titles. You still cannot drive to random houses and be able to enter them. In fact you still aren't able to enter most buildings. You cannot even take NPCs hostage. Most of the gameplay freedom in this so called sandbox game is related to vehicles but we already know all that from former games of the series. Don't expect any new gameplay in this game! A game like for instance Skyrim offers far more freedom.When I played GTA 5 I felt like my IQ is decreasing by one every minute. You start the game playing this black guy and during the first parts of the game you will hear nothing but f*ck motherf*cker n*gger sh*t talk. This gets annoying pretty fast! Not everyone is into this childish adolescent level of dialogue but I'm afraid that is what Rockstar intentionally caters to.The only part that obviously has improved is the graphics. But then again I've seen certainly better graphics in other games and the one in GTA 5 doesn't warrant 60Gb of game data. Talking about the game data volume ... Nearly 60Gb ... Gasp! I wonder what warrants the game needing that much data! It can't be the graphics it can't be the audio either. What is it used for??But my biggest complaint is the lack of gameplay innovation. Looking realistically at it the game offers very few freedom. It wants to be the original crime simulator but you cannot even satisfy your inner sadist and do things like taking hostages raiding family homes torture victims... The game looks tame compared to what my mind can come up with.All you can do is steal cars kill people and cause mayhem until you have a five star wanted rating and the national guard is on your heels. But we had that all already in all the former GTA games. Don't expect anything new here! You will be disappointed!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA 5 is great for single player. The online is horrible unless you do a private session with friends. It is an endless grindfest like everyone says customer support is god awful and modders still exist. Rockstar has finally made the drop money mod disappear but you will still run into people that can blow up a tank with 15 shots from a smg and take no dmg when you shoot them 100 times in the head with the .50 sniper. Luckily I received over 200 million in game currency from modders during the 2 year mod fest that was GTA online and now I don't care about the grind because I have everything I would want to buy. However the game still sucks online because the community just shoots each other and shouts random obscenities all game long. The servers lag horribly at times whole lobbies can drop. But at least you can't get free money to buy things and enjoy the game right? Atleast someone can walk through 5000+ shots from a gatling gun and stab you to death right? Atleast you can buy 8 million in in game funds for $100 right? If you buy a $100 sharkcard for 8 million in game money then you are mentally disabled. If you play this game online long enough you will feel mentally disabled. If you were responsible for the creation of GTA online you are probably mentally disabled. 10/10 online says the newly mentally disabled.

review: Great game and has given me many hours of entertainment. However GTA Online is becoming boring. Everything you buy costs millions of ingame dollars and to get this you have to grind ingame for many hours. Or you buy shark cards like Rockstar wants. They are no longer trying to make the game good and are now just trying to make more and more money. If they implemented a faster way for players to make money ingame then the game might just be fun again. The bunker air shipment etc. aren't helping players efficiently make money. These strategies almost never help at all because of hackers or normal players who want to ruin your experience by destroying your shipments. As a whole there is no good way to buy new things in this game anymore. However if you don't mind the hours on top of hours of grinding to buy one thing then the game is great.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So i read alot of the reviews for this game. I mainly played on the Xbox 360 and ran into my fair share of modders on that console. Converting over to the PC there is ALOT more modders but with that said 8 out of the 10 modders i have met have been friendly and non toxic at all. The others that i have met will simply kill everyone in the lobby and either leave or do it until you leave so sure you will have a few toxic ones here and there.As far as the game itself it is a solid game. The online portion of it is very interesting and there is never a lack of things to do. With all the DLC you will have "dailies" that will keep you busy resupplying your bunker and other factories and on top of that selling supplies to get money..Doing heists and other missions are another story you will waste alot of time finding a good group of players that will either not dive head first into a fire fight and instantly get killed or just leave before the missions starts. With heists i would strongly recommend finding a group to play with instead of doing randoms. All in all i love this game there is so much to do and if you feel like flying a attack helicopter and blowing up just about anything then you will have loads of fun. One last thing money....it is hard to grind for if you dont have a entire day to dedicate or a great group of people that wont leave mid heist on you...missions need to give more cash as well as other minor tasks need to give more cash just my opinion but as a player that solos it is hard to get any kind of money that will give the ability to buy cars houses etc without purchasing the GTA shark cards.

review: GTAV is card based action RPG with real time graphic and resolution controls. I genuinly enjoyed the graphics in the game because it made me feel like a hero. everyone has their own definition of hero for me my hero is my uncle Lewis. Uncle lewis goes to work everyday in the salt mines to earn enough money for his family. he is kind and loving if he is sober. sometimes he comes back from work and drink his Big Boy juice and gets violent. one time he slapped me so hard my head ripped a hole in space time. I saw the light and it saw me. the light spoke to me and told me many things. i learnt everything there is to know including that which is unknown. i am have become a god. jesus is my home doggy. after reaching nirvana I kicked Uncle lewis in the groin and he cried. as he cried the holy spirit took over me and in a heavly voice spoke"Hero siege is a pretty good game i enjoyed it". at that point uncle lewis burned up leaving behind ashes and teeth.

review: I would generally recommend this game but with reservation. As such I will start with the cons.Cons Storybook approach means players control characters but only superficially which means lame choices are forced on players and naturally I use the word choice quite liberally as there aren't any. Books are better for stories because you aren't forced to act out the ridiculous choices of others but maybe that's just me. I want more option to change the story and there isn't any.Helicopters have WAY to much wobble.Cars steer from the center and worse they are too light by far. Even the incredibly slow garbage truck bounces around like it's made of tin foil.Not keyboard friendly in general. This reduces functionality beyond the above issues.Vehicles are tethered. Enter a street race as a simple way to see this and don't boost. You do well the others accelerate phenominally. You do poorly they slow down.Related but seperate from the above the AI(not every single one but a steady small stream) actively antagonize you. It's a little to transparent that cars swerve into you and obstruct you for no better reason than because you are there. A simple example of this is where a reg citizen blocks you and drives slowly. The second you pass they speed up. Crash and they gas into you. They speed change to be in the intersection when you will arrive as well. There is plenty more but you get the idea and it is easy enough to compensate but it is transparent and annoying.Pros The story line is fairly entertaining.The controls are good enough to enjoy the game.It remains relatively true to the franchise. Summary It could be a lot better but frankly the gaming industry has forgotten games are for fun first and profit second. If the competition were where it could be this would not be recommended but compared to what IS available it is.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: San Andreas is back in this fantastic installment to the Grand Theft Auto series. I was actually surprised how realistic and beautiful the game turned out to be. First person mode makes GTA V feel like a completely different but immersive game. NPC artificial intelligence and interaction had improved dramatically but still not up to par with other games that have better AI. The plenty of graphical options will make any PC enthusist cream in their pants as Tessellation Advanced Shadows TXAA 4K Textures and a lot more are available with supreme hardware optimization. Animals bikes aircraft side missions immersive atmosphere and ambient enviornments make Story Mode surreal as GTA Online provides the most in depth experience ever seen within the series. Aside from disappearing cars/people even with extended distances maxed out some lengthy loading screens especially in multiplayer some hacker invasions in multiplayer and uninteresting/dull main character personalities Rockstar has definitely redeemed themselves within the PC community. This game does have Nexus mod support but installing mods will render multiplayer unavailable for obvious reasons. Multiplayer does have a lot of content but the community is often bad and is riddled with hackers so it may just pay to play Campaign with mods.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is not only a preposterously enjoyable video game but also an intelligent and sharp tongued satire of contemporary America. It represents a refinement of everything that GTA IV brought to the table five years ago. It s technically more accomplished in every conceivable way but it s also tremendously ambitious in its own right. No other world in video games comes close to this in size or scope and there is sharp intelligence behind its sense of humour and gift for mayhem. It tells a compelling unpredictable and provocative story without ever letting it get in the way of your own self directed adventures through San Andreas.It is one of the very best video games ever made.

review: I have an Nvidia GeForce GTX 760 4GB of ram Intel Quad Core i7 and a good monitor. It's a relativelyt cheap gaming PC cost about $1 000 but most other games run almost impeccably on it such as Cities Skylines PAYDAY The Heist and Call of Duty Black Ops 2. However this game uses just about half my ram and while it looks magnificent it runs like dung. During the first police chase of the story mode the game droppped to 10 15 fps and the game almost froze. Horrendous.At that point I thought I might find some salvation in Online but NOPE still tons of lag and even a few server overloads. Also the races were incredibly laggy and games of Last Team Standing are fun when you can actually see your opponent. I realize that some people especially people with high end gaming PCs might disagree and say that I just have little RAM. However I shouldn't have to pay $200 or more for 8 or more GB of RAM or more than $1 500 for a high end PC just to play a good looking game. 3/10

review: Here's the thing. The method currently being used to mod isn't really what most people think of as modding.ScriptHook is an example of DLL Assembly Code Injection which sneaks foreign code into the process in order to provide a method for an additional payload of code to hook/modify the game process in memory.The problem with this is that there is no way to tell what the payload is. Nor is there anyway to prevent the payload from working in only some areas of the game.That's the point a lot of people don't understand here we're not talking addons. We're talking DLL files that have been modified to allow a user to run ANY additional code they want and have the game accept it and execute it. There are no limits to what can be run with this and the trainer that comes as the included demonstration of scripthook is a very benign usage of the potential.To give you an example of the dangers of allowing DLL Injected clients to connect to multiplayer servers or any other client for that matter until recently in Reign of Kings hackers using the same method that scripthook uses were using injected assembly code into DLLs to modify files on the computers of other players on the servers they connected to and in many cases even the files on the servers themselves.When we're talking about DLL Injection there is no such thing as singleplayer mod or multiplayer mod. It's just foreign code being run anywhere the user wants. The only way to prevent it is to check the integrity of the DLLs of any client on connection and cutting the connection as soon as a disprecency is found. It may seem like overkill but the alternative is a complete loss of security for anyone using gta online.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: If you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place. Ingredients To Make the Dough375 grams (3 cups) plain flour1/2 teaspoon salt2 eggs1/4 cup (50 ml / 3½ tablespoons) olive oil1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) waterExtra flour for dusting To Make Cheese Filling15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan Romano &amp Asiago)Note grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.1/2 cup cheddar cheese2 eggs lightly beaten1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper ExtrasYour favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)Parmesan cheeseBasilFried vegetablesShrimpFish slicesChicken pieces Make the Ravioli filling. In a small mixing bowl add the ricotta and mash with a fork. Add in the 3 cheese blend Cheddar cheese eggs salt and pepper. Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth paste like consistency. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. Make the Ravioli dough. Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water oil and salt. Mix. Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs water oil and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed. Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough. Take the dough out of the mixing bowl shape it into a ball and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic. Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters. With a cookie cutter or upside down water glass cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15 20 dough circles). Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. Fill the Ravioli shells. Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough. Fill a small bowl with water dip your fingers in and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle. Fold the dough in half over the filling making a half moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a homemade touch as well. Repeat this process for all your dough circles. Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker. Roll the dough into two sheets Place one sheet on the ravioli maker and form the filling cups. Fill with the ravioli mixture. Lay the second sheet of dough on top and roll it out. This will seal in the filling. Remove and separate the finished raviolis.Cook the Ravioli. Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil. Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5 6 minutes or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test. If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time you can freeze the rest Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed platesServe it up.Top with your favorite sauce grate some fresh cheese over it and enjoy!

review: GTA V's Los Santos is the most fully realized open world I've ever had the pleasure of spending time in as a gamer. Cheers to Rockstar for taking the time and devoting development resources to do right by the PC version of this game. These days a "port" means offering the game to the PC market while doing the bare minimum to allow the game to play on WIndows. That means ports without custom graphics settings ports that still have tooltips and references to console controls and ports plagued by bugs.Rockstar did't go that route. Instead they spent a year and a half working on a true PC version of the game with higher res textures more detailed models better weather effects more cars more songs on the radio higher traffic density spectacular lighting effects etc. In other words all the fun stuff us PC players like the stuff we often lament because other devs can't be bothered to customize the experience for the PC crowd's more powerful hardware.I gladly paid full price for this game and I'll gladly support any developer who takes the PC market seriously.

review: Jack of all trades master of none.Singleplayer "Grand Theft Auto" indeed almost every mission is simply stealing and/or driving a vehicle from point A to point B. Pathetic customization each of the 3 premade characters has only a single preset vehicle and chooses their outfits at random even if you dress them. Aside from 3 heists a couple of air missions and one single car chase (of which there are many) no story missions are even remotely interesting. Remember those missions in Assassin's Creed where you walk next to somebody while they exposition at you? That's what 98.7% of the missions in GTA5 are except you're driving a car instead of walking. There is no sense of progression there is nothing to do in the world you aren't conquering districts or building an empire or moving to bigger and better pads not even upgrading your characters or doing anything at all. Its basically just one long cutscene with hours and hours of boring driving. Multiplayer ( if they ever make it functional)Fixes my complaints about singleplayer. Offers a wide variety of activities as well as the ability to create your own as well as detailed character customization. Unfortunately the multiplayer is literally unplayable because of the godawful lobby system and long loading screens. The multiplayer experience in this game unless you're just messing around in a private session with friends is the equivalent of waiting for an MMO Dungeon Finder that then kicks you out of the dungeon before you can ever complete it. * Because Singleplayer and Multiplayer modes are so different certain features are marked with (SP) or (MP) if the feature only applies to one mode. + Ocean Waves+ Ingame iPhone+ Fast travel taxis+ Headlight toggles+ Custom waypoints+ (MP) Passive mode+ (SP) Loads once ever+ Detailed environments+ (SP) Slowmo weapon wheel+ Interesting looking lights at night+ (MP) Tools for user created content+ (MP) Rewarding progression system+ (SP) Randomized storymode dialogue+ Voiced and acted/animated cutscenes+ (SP) 30+ hour storymode though a lot of it is drive time padding+ (SP) Slowmo toggles but only for specific characters in specific situations+ (SP) The 3 character system is such a bad gimmick. 90% of the time you can't even freely switch between them. And even though there are 3 of them there's no coop. + FPS mode is just another gimmick and not a viable gameplay option.+ (SP) The story ending while satisfying feels like it was forced in when the devs got tired of adding missions to drive back and forth. The characters are given no motivation to finally end things. Awful checkpoints (MP) Laggy desync System resource hog No preset graphic options (MP) Awful mission lobbies (MP) Can't tell whose talking Clunky controls and movement (MP) Insta fail mission objectives (MP) No vote to skip cutscenes host can do it Radio stations all suck and can't be customized (MP) Many long loading screens for every mission (MP) If any player dies in a mission the mission fails (SP) Bonus objectives not displayed until after the missions Most buildings don't have interiors even the few you can purchase Cop agro isn't a meaningful or interesting distraction just an annoyance Regularly drops controller input don't have this problem with any other game (SP) Purchasing properties seems pointless they don't even come close to RoI (MP) Unlock popups repeatedly popup if you die not sure if this is a bug or what (SP) Empty city no collectibles no activities very few side quests nothing to do 'Extended Shadows' puts a weird shadowless box on the ground around the player Falling 20 feet or hopping out of a car will insta kill you. Realistic maybe. Fun no. (SP) Endgame psychiatric report every single thing in it was insulting my playstyle? (MP) If any player leaves during a mission the mission fails which can happen before it even starts (MP) Lamar who I hated more than most of the villains in SP is the main character in the multiplayer story Boring driving vehicles feel slow handbrake turns aren't possible collisions feel weak and annoying. This is no Burnout Paradise City. (MP) Broken lobby system. Interrupts gameplay. Takes forever to find players. Seemingly launches countless versions of similar game modes with 2 players instead of filling ones that already exist. (SP) The ridiculous amount of money from heist missions makes all other actives in the world pointless not that there are many anyway Being an HD port of a last gen console game the graphics won't blow you away. They also don't perform especially well considering. Waypoints don't show in world and don't show distance or a minimap path unless you're in a vehicle Mindless combat. Take cover behind object peek out to auto lock onto anything in front of you spray for half a second until it dies repeat. This worked much better in RDR with 1shot1kill weapons the deadeye system and rewards for headshots. Missions fail because friendly NPCs die because objectives aren't clear because there's no way to restore health because of insta deaths because of split second timing because your vehicle got stuck Austin Power style and/or because of many more ridiculous reasons* For all the QQ about hackers I haven't seen a single one in 8 hours of online play.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V is truly a phenomenal game and quite possibly the best game of our time. I've played GTAV on both XBOX 360 and PC version.Its very being is satire of contemporary America which accounts to its brilliant sense of humour. The graphics are gorgeous and its options are plentiful even more so with modding community. The storyline is compelling and never gets in the way of your own independent exploring of Los Santos and San Andreas. The gameplay is smooth and enjoyable beyond comparison. The online feature of GTA V expands the game even further with more content and updates let alone ride with your friends wrecking havoc across the beauty of Los Santos.The online feature does get more attention than the singleplayer and recent events regarding OpenIV ban have made modding obsolete for the time being. Regardless GTA V remains a masterpiece.

review: Okay you look at my thumbs down and get mad but just hear me outI got GTA V on my xbox 360 the day it came out I played on my 360 for probably a year or so.(almost all online)I worked my online character all that time i never did any cheats/exploits just an all around fun thing to do. The next thing I knew i had built a computer and downloaded steam the first game I thought of was GTA V.I buy it and spend 2 days downloading it (sh***y download speeds) and I start up the game.I had not signed into Social Club once in the past few years so I was getting scared I wouldnt remember my password I put in the info and who it signed me in as was my brothers RS social club account I thought I couldnt go back before binding my RS account to my steam account because the fu**ing "back" button was gray (thanks to whoever thought that was a good idea)As a result I lost my entire profile and cant recover it or play with it on my PC I complained to rockstar but they did nothingAll they did was waste 3 weeks of my life (they didn't respond for 3 weeks) and get my hopes up.F*ck you rockstar

review: Hello im gonna tell you about my experience in Grand Theft Auto VI finished the story mode and decided to try out a few of the mods (Not the mod menus i mean like watch dogs)I installed watch dogs mod and played for about 2 hours making cars crash into eachother by hacking the traffic lights it was pretty fun.I decide i had enough and go to the online game Not realising i still had the mod on.I get banned for a month"I can deal with it its only a month" I started playing watch dogs mod again and dont play for about 2 weeksThe ban is over and i play some watch dogs mod because it was still installed.Had a lot of fun hacking cars.Goes to online because i remembered i should be unbannedYet again i didnt realise i had the mod on but it seemed to just crash my gameI start it again and im permanently banned and all my stuff is gone for good and i can never get it backive tried signing out but i cantIve played watch dogs mod today and i get signed out for no reason so i try to make a new account.The banned account is linked to my steam and i cant unlink it what a F"!%KING waste also i forgot my account password and it is locked because of their impossible capatchaI will not be buying any future rockstar games even if tempted too because of their SH!%TTY anti cheatI hope this review was helpful and if you are thinking of buying the game for online just stick to consoleStory Mode 9/10 Gets a little boring in some missions but thats just meOnline 2/10 Gameplay is pretty fun but the players are cancer and the anti cheat is garbageGraphics 7/10

review: Look the game is fantastic. It's just what i always wanted. It's great the graphics are nice too. But if you are buying it just for online then i will not recommend it for you. Alot of the missions are forcing you to join in a public lobby which it doesn't sound bad. But if you really want it then you will face Hackers Griefers and Try Hards. Let me explain why that will be big problem for you 1.Hackers The hackers will probably use God mod Infinity Ammo (I think) Seeing you thru walls and the most deadly one dropping money for you. Why Dropping money for you is bad well it can get you banned PERMANENTLY. But i've heard for friends that there are some money that they can drop you that can't ban you (i am not 100% sure if that is real)?2.Griefers Well they will grief. I haven't seen a grief in game but if you want to see one before buying the game then go watch a video what they do.And Finally Try Hards These guys will just ruin your experience. If you are doing a mission they will kill you and you have to start the mission again (and probably lose money). If you just want to buy the game for online and roleplay then download FiveM.

review: &gt I was only 9 years old&gt I loved GTA V so much I had all the dlcs and completed all the heists&gt I pray to rockstar every night before bed thanking the life I've been given&gt "GTA V is love" I say "GTA V is life"&gt Volition hears me and calls me a &gt I knew they were just jealous of my devotion to GTA V&gt I called them a br&gt &gt They slap me hard and send me to go to sleep&gt I'm crying now and my face hurts&gt I lay in bed and it's really cold&gt A warmth is moving towards me&gt I feel something touch me&gt It's GTA V&gt I am so happy&gt Rockstar whispers into my ear "this is my game"&gt They grab me with their powerful programmer hands and put me on my hands and knees&gt I'm ready&gt I hold the keyboard&gt They make me play the game&gt It hurts so much but I do it for Rockstar&gt I can feel my social life leaving as my eyes water&gt I want to please Rockstar&gt I spend more time on GTA V&gt They roar a mighty roar as I complete my 1000th heist&gt Volition walks in&gt Rockstar looks them straight in the eye and says "the heist is over now"&gt ROckstar leaves through the escape van&gt GTA V is love GTA V is lifeFirst one of these I've ever made pls no h8erino

review: Before I start I have a little message for all the negative reviews. Just because Rockstar had some shady marketing schemes on the summer sale does NOT mean the game is bad. Reviews are so that you can be informed on how good a game is not complaining about sales schemes. You aren't helping anyone by doing it.Anyways this is a very very fun game. You will need a decent computer but you probably already know that. It seems like many people get this game for GTA Online and while it IS fun the singleplayer is so much better. The story has lots of jokes and its overall very enjoyable. Gunplay and driving is also smooth but I would reccomend a controller. As far as online goes be wary of hackers. Also don't expect to make friends. Everyone on online wants to kill eachother. Public lobbies are practically deathmatch on the entire map.

After attempting to download a mod manager because of the crappy modding support I attempted to join the game again and it worked. But the next I came on and it said I was banned without telling me any information on why I was banned or how to get unbanned. So that is why I think the game sucks.

review: Good game but in online the loading screens are fookin brutal! Completely ruins the game. 5 minutes of game play equals 15 minutes of loading screens. Not a matter of my hardware or connection the servers are GTA online is nice idea but there really isn't much to do except screwing around killing other people random events or trolling. You can do missions but they don't feel like part of the world when you have to go always go through 10 minutes of loading (and often 5 minutes of cutscene which you cannot skip even when you play through the same mission 10th time) breaks the immersion. Also the coin you make is way too few considering how expensive everything is (even the bullets you used cost a fortune). Doing missions with others with everyone having to do their own part was really exciting at first but when I hit level 15 I was already starting to get bored of it. It had turned into a grind and the god AWFUL LOADING TIMES make it even WORSE!! You also have to grind to get level because all the cool stuff has level requirement.Not to mention some of the missions are hard as hell enemies are bulletspongies and they are crawling out of your butt I think I'd do more damage slapping them with my
title: Grand Theft Auto V

The problem is that if stutters and crashes very frequently making online missions especially longer ones such as heists impossible to complete. Not everyone has problems but many many people do and you will find them on every forum that talks about gta 5. I've done everything I can from update drivers to a total malware purge (and yes I meet the recommended specs). Rockstar's support team has been neglecting and rockstar doesn't acknowledge that there's a problem on their end. I would absolutely not recommend buying this until the crashing issues are patched. If you do I pray you're one of the lucky ones.

review: Superb game with astounding system resource managment allowing for my mid level laptop to play on crisp high level graphics settings. I've played only the online portion of the game and find it to be essentially perfect leaving me with only one comment to make on online matchmaking and session loading the online sessions understandably have difficulty finding populated sessions for me when I decide to play in the middle of the night. This results in me being placed in foreign populated sessions typically with Russians. The issue here is that everyone's ping is through the roof and lag is abundant. So far as I can think of this is my fault and Rockstar manages this state of affairs just fine. With one exception...foreign servers tend to have hackers abound! Anyway I play with an Xbox 360 controller and the heists provide (truly) endless hours of entertainment cooperative enjoyment rewards achievements and plenty of laughs to boot. ALWAYS play with a headset or microphone. The online portion of this game is so tactically enhanced when teamwork via live audio communication is allowed. Honestly this game provides more cooperative satisfaction than mainstream FPS's. The verdict is in ladies and gentlemen 5/5. A perfect installment to the dazzling franchise!

review: Hours of fun.After playing GTA V for a relatively small length of time (Trust me in this game 21 hours is basically nothing) I've come to the safe conclusion that this game is one of the best purchases I've made in a long time.The campaign is long and fun I've not played a lick of multiplayer and I've fallen in love with the game already I'm still not done with it so I have no idea how long I have to go!Lots of guns lots of upgrades lots of attachments.Lots of cars lots of upgrades.Graphics are well designed the game runs smooth as hell and I love it. There's a billion things to do that don't even have anything to do with the campaign and they're all great fun I don't buy games often because I never know whether they're going to be any good which puts me off even with GTA V it took me til now to get this game but the spend was more than worthwhile I can't recommend a game any higher than this!

review: Let me start this off by saying I did not buy this game to play online and based on reviews I don't want to.The game is gorgeous voice acting superb writing is great until near the end vehicles are varied spawning is more random and the environments generally feel alive. All keys are rebindable ( you Fallout 4)!The let down comes when you realize the economy has been simplified down to one element the stock market. You'll do countless missions where you get "screwed over" or generally find that the payout is very near zero. If you want to customize your car you're crippling yourself because you need capital for the stupid stock market to have any type of progression end game. To make matters worse if you complete certain quests before building up a ton of capital you might as well start over. Give me cash for crimes I didn't pay to play day trader simulator.It's pretty clear to me that the singleplayer end game was intentionally gimped to push you into online play. I enjoyed what was there of the single player game but I quickly lost interest when I realized I'd done some quests "out of order." Screw that.My thumbs down isn't so much that it's a bad single player game not worth $40 (on sale). It's totally worth that. My thumbs down is my own way of telling publishers that these money grabbing tactics are t to those of us that see it for what it is.

review: I hate Take two interactive. That's not the only reason for a thumbs down though. Since OpenIV is shutdown mod support and deving will wither and die (EDIT okay so they changed their minds but they deserve to eat anyway them). For this reason alone I cannot recomment purchasing GTAV. The story is good I admit but for the price the game is asking I don't think it's enough.Then you have the online game that is riddled with insanely grindy gameplay yielding very little cash while having you sit around waiting for literally hours looking at slow slow loading screens. Probably 20% of my online time has been spend looking at loading screen or wasted waiting forever in a lobby to get populated only to see some kind of matchmaking error in the middle of the mission which results in everyone getting booted back to freeroam (going back to freeroam also has a looong loading screen). There have been too many occations where I had 30 min or so to play and thought "hey lets do a few missions to get some cash and rp" only to spend all 30 min on loading screens broken matchmaking waiting in lobby.....Then you have the insane prices of items in online. It's despicaple really. To get the large apartments motorcycleclub businesses gunrunning bunker cool cars and military vehicles/helicopter weapons and ammo etc you would have to grind mindlessly for many thousands of hours. Yes MANY THOUSANDS of hours of boring repetetive extremely grindy gameplay.Also at the normal price on Steam the prices for both the game and the shark cards are ludicrously high. Let me tell you the price is insanely high especially if you want to purchase shark cards (other vendors out there sell them for 10% of the price on Steam. It simply cannot be recommended to buy them on Steam for this fact alone). I wouldn't recommend buying shark cards anyway though... TLDR Stay away from this humongous stinking pile of cashcow turd. Though if you are getting it anyway I recommend purchasing it from a vendor that for sells a bundle that has both the game + 8mill gta$ for around 30$ (half the price and with an added 8mill gta$. compare that to the 60$ Steam price with 0 gta$). That way you may be able to easily buy enough stuff in online to have a somewhat enjoyable time for a somewhat reasonable price. If you live in EU buying such a 30$ deal is even better since the Steam price is 60EUR and the euro being more valuable than the dollar.
